addbackpackcargo.name: addBackpackCargo
addbackpackcargo.description:
Add backpack(s) to the cargo space of vehicle. Classname list of available backpacks is [here](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_2_OA:_Backpacks).
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)In Arma 3, arguments for this command are local ([LALocal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Locality)). For global variant see [addBackpackCargoGlobal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addBackpackCargoGlobal)

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle to add the backpack to
[backpackClassName, count]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
backpackClassName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - backpack classname
count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - number of backpacks to add.

addcamshake.name: addCamShake
addcamshake.description: Creates the camera shaking effect, like when you are near an explosion

syntaxArray.Params:
power: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Strength of shake (camera movement), practical range is 0 to 20
duration: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Duration in seconds
frequency: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Frequency of shake, practical range is 0 to 100

addbinocularitem.name: addBinocularItem
addbinocularitem.description: Adds weapon item, including magazine, directly to the [binocular](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/binocular) weapon. This is used for infantry weapons.

addaction.name: addAction
addaction.description: Adds an entry to the action menu of an object. The action can only be activated when in proximity to the object **and** looking at it. Adding an action to the player makes that action available to the player at all times. For event handling of user interaction see [inGameUISetEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/inGameUISetEventHandler).

syntaxArray.Syntax: object **addAction** [title, script, arguments, priority, showWindow, hideOnUse, shortcut, condition]
syntaxArray.Params:
**object**: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) -  Unit, vehicle or static object. **No [agents](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createAgent)!**
**title**: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - The action name which is displayed in the action menu, may contain [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text). Because of that **<** and **>** symbols will be interpreted as opening and closing XML tags. To avoid this use < for **<** and > for **>**. The title text appearance can be changed with [setUserActionText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setUserActionText)
**script**: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - Either path to the script file, relative to the mission folder or string with code or the actual script code. If the string is a path to script file, the script file **must** have extension .[SQS](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQS_Syntax) or .[SQF](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQF_Syntax). The script, whether it is a file or a code, will run in [scheduled environment](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler#Scheduled_Environment), i.e. it is ok to use [sleep](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sleep). Parameters array passed to the script upon activation in *[_this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this)* variable is:
params ["_target", "_caller", "_actionId", "_arguments"];


* **target**: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the object which the action is assigned to

* **caller**: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the unit that activated the action

* **actionID**: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - activated action's ID (same as addAction's return value)

* **arguments**: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - arguments given to the script if you are using the extended syntax
**arguments**: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - (Optional, default [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil)) arguments to pass to the script. Accessible with 
```sqf
_this [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 3
```
 inside the script. If [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) is used as an argument for example, its first element reference would be 
```sqf
_this [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 3 [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 0
```

**priority**: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1.5) Priority value of the action. Actions will be arranged in descending order according to this value. Every game action has a preset priority value. Value can be negative or decimal fraction. Actions with same values will be arranged in order which they were made, newest at the bottom. The bigger the number the higher the action will be positioned on the menu. Typical range is 0 to 6
**showWindow**: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) If set to [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), players see "Titletext" at mid-lower screen, as they approach the object. Only the title text for the action with highest priority and *showWindow* set to [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) will be shown.
**hideOnUse**: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) If set to [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), it will hide the action menu after selecting it. If set to [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), it will leave the action menu open and visible after selecting the action, leaving the same action highlighted, for the purpose of allowing you to re-select that same action quickly, or to select another action
**shortcut**: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") One of the [key names](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Key_Actions) defined in bin.pbo (e.g. "moveForward"). Adding available shortcut will bind corresponding keyboard key to this action. Shortcut availability can be tested with [inputAction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/inputAction) command
**condition**: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "true") Expression that must return [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) for the action to be shown. **Special variables** passed to the script code are:

* *_target*: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - The object to which action is attached or, if the object is a unit inside of vehicle, the vehicle

* *_this*: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Caller person to whom the action is shown (or not shown if *condition* returns [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false))

* *_originalTarget*: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - The original object to which the action is attached, regardless if the object/unit is in a vehicle or not
> ⚠
> 
> * *condition* is evaluated on each frame in [non-scheduled environment](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler#Unscheduled_Environment).
> 
> * *condition* is **not** evaluated if a dialog is open.
> 
> * If action is added to an object and not to [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), the *condition* will only get evaluated if player is closer than ~50m to the object surface and is looking at the object.
> 
> * If action is added to [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), *condition* is evaluated all the time.
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The added action's ID. Action can be removed with [removeAction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/removeAction) (see also [removeAllActions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/removeAllActions)). IDs are incrementing, the first given action to each unit has the ID 0, the second the ID 1, etc. IDs are also passed to the called script (see [*script* parameter](https://community.bistudio.com#Syntax))

asin.name: asin
asin.description: Arcsine of a number, result in [Degrees](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number#Degrees).

addcuratoreditingarea.name: addCuratorEditingArea
addcuratoreditingarea.description: Adds or changes curator edit area (depends on if ID is already used).

syntaxArray.Params:
[editAreaID,position,radius]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

agent.name: agent
agent.description: Return a person for a given agent.

addbackpackcargoglobal.name: addBackpackCargoGlobal
addbackpackcargoglobal.description: Add backpack(s) to the cargo space of vehicle. MP synchronized. Classname list of available backpacks is [here](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_2_OA:_Backpacks)

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) to add the Backpack to
packClassName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String),  See the topic [Category:Weapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Weapons) for reference about possible values.
count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

addweaponpool.name: addWeaponPool
addweaponpool.description: Add weapons to the weapon pool, of which the player may choose in the following mission. Available in campaigns only.

syntaxArray.Params:
weaponName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Weapon name. See the topic [Category:Weapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Weapons) for reference about possible values.
count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Number of weapons to add

additempool.name: addItemPool
additempool.description: Adds count items of type name into the weapon pool (used in the campaign to transfer items to the next mission)

syntaxArray.Params:
[itemName, count]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
itemName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Item name
count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Number of items to add

addweaponwithattachmentscargoglobal.name: addWeaponWithAttachmentsCargoGlobal
addweaponwithattachmentscargoglobal.description: Adds a weapon into cargo space of a vehicle / box with given attachments / magazines. Ignores available cargo space. If the weapon class has any pre-attached items (LinkedItems), they are removed and new items, supplied via command arguments, are added. This command has a global effect.

syntaxArray.Syntax: container addWeaponWithAttachmentsCargoGlobal [[weapon, muzzle, flashlight, optics, [primaryMuzzleMagazine, ammoCount], [secondaryMuzzleMagazine, ammoCount], bipod], weaponsCount]
syntaxArray.Params:
container: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Container to add the weapon to, might be backpack, ammobox or vehicle
[[weapon, muzzle, flashlight, optics, [primaryMuzzleMagazine, ammoCount], [secondaryMuzzleMagazine, ammoCount], bipod], weaponsCount]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
[weapon, muzzle, flashlight, optics, [primaryMuzzleMagazine, ammoCount], [secondaryMuzzleMagazine, ammoCount], bipod]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [weaponsItems](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/weaponsItems)
weapon: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Weapon class name. See the topic [Category:Weapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Weapons) for reference about possible values
muzzle: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Muzzle attachment class name or "" if not needed
flashlight: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Side rail attachment class name or "" if not needed
optics: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Top rail attachment class name or "" if not needed
[primaryMuzzleMagazine, ammoCount]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Primary muzzle magazine info or [] if not needed
primaryMuzzleMagazine: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Magazine class name
ammoCount: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Ammo count in magazine (will be clipped in 0 and max mag capacity range)
[secondaryMuzzleMagazine, ammoCount]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Secondary muzzle magazine info or [] if not needed
secondaryMuzzleMagazine: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Magazine class name
ammoCount: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Ammo count in magazine (will be clipped in 0 and max mag capacity range)
bipod: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Underbarrel rail attachment class name or "" if not needed
weaponsCount: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Number of weapons to add

examples:
```sqf
[cursorObject](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cursorObject) addWeaponWithAttachmentsCargoGlobal [["arifle_MX_GL_F", "muzzle_snds_H", "", "optic_aco", ["30Rnd_65x39_caseless_mag", 15], ["3Rnd_HE_Grenade_shell", 2], ""], 2];

```
Add five MX GL rifles with flashlight side attachment and a full 30 round magazine loaded into the gun, and full 3Rnd HE grenade magazine loaded into the grenade launcher: 
```sqf
[cursorObject](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cursorObject) addWeaponWithAttachmentsCargoGlobal [["arifle_MX_GL_F", "", "acc_flashlight", "", ["30Rnd_65x39_caseless_mag", 30], ["3Rnd_HE_Grenade_shell", 2], ""], 5]
```
Add one MX rifle without any attachments or magazines event though the class has linked items: 
```sqf
[cursorObject](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cursorObject) addWeaponWithAttachmentsCargoGlobal [["arifle_MX_Holo_pointer_F", "", "", "", [], [], ""], 1];
```
Add all weapons on player with attachments: 
```sqf
{ [cursorObject](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cursorObject) addWeaponWithAttachmentsCargoGlobal [_x, 1] } [forEach](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forEach) [weaponsItems](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/weaponsItems) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player);
```

apply.name: apply
apply.description: Applies given code to each element of the array and returns resulting array. The value of the current array element, to which the code will be applied, is stored in variable [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x).

syntaxArray.Params:
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array of [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything)
code: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - code to be executed on each element of the array. Current element value is stored in variable [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x)

addrating.name: addRating
addrating.description:
Add a number to the [rating](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/rating) of a unit - negative values can be used to reduce the rating.
This command is usually used to reward for completed mission objectives. The rating is given at the end of the mission and is automatically adjusted when killing enemies or friendlies. 

When the rating gets below -2000, the unit's side switches to "ENEMY" ([sideEnemy](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideEnemy)) and the unit is attacked by everyone.(see [Rating Values](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ArmA:_Rating_Values))

See also: [Arma_3:_Event_Handlers#HandleRating](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers#HandleRating)

assignascargoindex.name: assignAsCargoIndex
assignascargoindex.description: Assigns the character to a specific cargo / passenger index of the given vehicle.

syntaxArray.Params:
character: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - character to assign
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle to assign to
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - cargo / passenger index

addmenuitem.name: addMenuItem
addmenuitem.description:
Creates a new menu item. Menu can be "file" or "view",index is index,as returned from addMenu command. priority is optional and determines,where in the menu the item will reside (higher priority items first). 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

addonfiles.name: addonFiles
addonfiles.description:
Returns a list of files present in the addon.
> ⓘQuerying protected .ebo addons returns empty array [].

syntaxArray.Params:
[pboPrefix, fileExtension] - [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
pboPrefix: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - addon prefix available from [allAddonsInfo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/allAddonsInfo)
fileExtension (Optional): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - file extension to filter results, for example ".paa"

assignascargo.name: assignAsCargo
assignascargo.description: Assign a unit as cargo of a vehicle. Used together with [orderGetIn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/orderGetIn) to order a unit to get in as cargo into a specific vehicle. Before usage of this command a subordinate unit has not got the option to get into the cargo space of the vehicle.

addplayerscores.name: addPlayerScores
addplayerscores.description: MP server only: Adds player score.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
values: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - killsInfantry , killsSoft, killsArmor, killsAir, killed

campaignconfigfile.name: campaignConfigFile
campaignconfigfile.description: Returns root of campaign description.ext entries hierarchy.

addpublicvariableeventhandler.name: addPublicVariableEventHandler
addpublicvariableeventhandler.description:
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)This command is deprecated since the introduction of [remoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExec) and [remoteExecCall](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExecCall).
This event handler will detect if a [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace) variable (it is attached to) has been broadcast over network with [publicVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/publicVariable), [publicVariableClient](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/publicVariableClient) or [publicVariableServer](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/publicVariableServer) commands and will execute EH code upon detection. Arguments passed to the code in *_this* array are:

_this select 0: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - broadcast variable name (same variable name EH is attached to)
_this select 1: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - broadcast variable value 
_this select 2: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - target the variable got set on with [setVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVariable)  (see: alternative syntax)


> ⓘ
> 
> * This EH works **only** in Multiplayer environment
> 
> * There is **no way to remove** this EH
> 
> * This EH will not fire on the machine that executed broadcast with [publicVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/publicVariable) command, only on the machines that receive the broadcast
> 
> * The value of broadcast variable can be exactly the same, it is the actual broadcast that triggers EH not the change in variable

syntaxArray.Params:
varName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace) variable name
code: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - By default, the code is executed in [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace)

varName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the variable set on target with [setVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVariable)
[target, code]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Team Member](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Member)
code: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code)

addresources.name: addResources
addresources.description: Adds resources to a team member.

cameraview.name: cameraView
cameraview.description:
Returns mode of active camera view. Mode is one of: 

* "INTERNAL" (1st person)

* "EXTERNAL" (3rd person)

* "GUNNER" (optics / sights)

* "GROUP" (commander view)

campreloaded.name: camPreloaded
campreloaded.description: Checks whether the camera has finished preloading.

cameraon.name: cameraOn
cameraon.description: Returns the vehicle to which the camera is attached.

allowsprint.name: allowSprint
allowsprint.description: Force player to run/jog if set to false.

campreparebank.name: camPrepareBank
campreparebank.description:
Prepares the camera bank angle.
> ⚠This command is **non-functional**!

allowcuratorlogicignoreareas.name: allowCuratorLogicIgnoreAreas
allowcuratorlogicignoreareas.description: Allows curator placing and working with modules outside of edit areas.

campreload.name: camPreload
campreload.description: Preloads the scene for the prepared camera with given timeout after which preloading is aborted. Max timeout is 30 seconds. Timeout of 0 means max timeout of 30 seconds as well. > ⓘThis command will read prepared params set with [camPrepareFOV](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camPrepareFOV), [camPreparePos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camPreparePos) and [camPrepareTarget](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camPrepareTarget), so no [camCommitPrepared](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCommitPrepared) is necessary. If [camPrepareFOV](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camPrepareFOV) is not set, the default value is 1. If [camPrepareTarget](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camPrepareTarget) (for direction) and [camPreparePos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camPreparePos) (for position) are not set, current [direction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/direction) and [position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/position) of the camera are used. The prepared camera preload will preload main camera as well. [cameraEffect](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cameraEffect) is not necessary

campreparetarget.name: camPrepareTarget
campreparetarget.description: Prepares the camera target to a position or to a target. Needs the call of [camCommitPrepared](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCommitPrepared) to be conducted.

syntaxArray.Params:
camera: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object of type "camera"
position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) - target location

commandwatch.name: commandWatch
commandwatch.description: Orders the unit(s) to watch the given position or target (via the radio). Use [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) as the target to order a unit to stop watching a position/target.

buttonaction.name: buttonAction
buttonaction.description: Returns the action assigned to a control of the currently active user dialog. Can be used for buttons and active texts. Read [Arma: GUI Configuration](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma:_GUI_Configuration) for more information about user dialogs and controls.

assert.name: assert
assert.description:
Tests a condition and if the condition is false, displays error on screen (if -showscripterrors enabled) and logs error into .rpt file. It does not interrupt the script execution.

If script was pre-processed with [preprocessFileLineNumbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/preprocessFileLineNumbers), it will also show/log the error line number and the file name.

completedfsm.name: completedFSM
completedfsm.description: Checks whether the given FSM is completed. The FSM handle is the number returned by the [execFSM](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/execFSM) command.

compilefinal.name: compileFinal
compilefinal.description:
Compile expression and makes it final, preventing it from:

* repeated [compile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/compile) or compileFinal

* removal by [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil)

* remote rewrite using [publicVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/publicVariable), [publicVariableClient](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/publicVariableClient) and [publicVariableServer](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/publicVariableServer)
> ⓘThis feature is only available in retail version of Arma 3

buldozer_loadnewroads.name: buldozer_LoadNewRoads
buldozer_loadnewroads.description: Generates new roads. Working only in [buldozer](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Oxygen_Viewer).

allplayers.name: allPlayers
allplayers.description:
Returns a list of all units controlled by *connected clients* - human players including dead players, but also [Headless Clients](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Headless_Client).
Use [BIS_fnc_listPlayers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_listPlayers) or see **[Example 1](https://community.bistudio.com#Examples)** to get human players only.

allairports.name: allAirports
allairports.description: Returns all map airports, both static and dynamic

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - in format [staticAirports, dynamicAirports], where:

* staticAirports [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - static airports IDs

* dynamicAirports [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - dynamic airports objects (such as "DynamicAirport_01_F" found on aircraft carrier)

composetext.name: composeText
composetext.description: Creates a [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) by joining the given [ structured](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) or [ plain](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) text arguments.

syntaxArray.Params:
[argument1, argument2, ...]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
argument: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) - use [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) where necessary (see [Example 2](https://community.bistudio.com#Examples))

examples:
```sqf [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) composeText ["Image: ", [image](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/image) "\a3\Data_f\Flags\flag_Altis_co.paa"]; ``` ```sqf [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) composeText ["line1", "
", "line2"]; *// result displayed in one line* [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) composeText ["line1", [lineBreak](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lineBreak), "line2"]; *// result displayed in two lines* ```

ctrlsetpixelprecision.name: ctrlSetPixelPrecision
ctrlsetpixelprecision.description: Switches mode of pixel precision (rounding) in a given control interface.

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
mode: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - can be one of the following:

* 0 / "AUTO" - control position (x, y, w, h) is always rounded to whole pixels (game default)

* 1 / "ON" - control position (x, y, w, h) is rounded to whole pixels only when not animating

* 2 / "OFF" - control position (x, y, w, h) is always precise, no pixel rounding applies here

examples:
```sqf
_control ctrlSetPixelPrecision 2; *// Enables pixel precision of the given control*
```

customchat.name: customChat
customchat.description: Sends the chat message to the custom radio channel. The radio channel needs to be created on the server before hand, with [radioChannelCreate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/radioChannelCreate) command.

customChannelID: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - [Custom channel ID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Channel_IDs) returned by [radioChannelCreate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/radioChannelCreate) command

countenemy.name: countEnemy

cutfadeout.name: cutFadeOut
cutfadeout.description:
Terminates the effect in the given layer by fading it out according to the given duration. If named layer is used and it doesn't exist, it will be allocated. For title layer see [titleFadeOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/titleFadeOut).
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)For greater efficiency and ease of moddability, it is recommended to use named layers.

syntaxArray.Params:
layerName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - effect layer name. Layer names are CaSe SeNsItIvE
duration: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - fade out time

ctrlsetforegroundcolor.name: ctrlSetForegroundColor
ctrlsetforegroundcolor.description: Sets foreground color of given control. Color is in format [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color).

cansuspend.name: canSuspend
cansuspend.description:
Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if [sleep](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sleep), [uiSleep](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/uiSleep) or [waitUntil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/waitUntil) commands can be used in current scope. Usually when suspension is not allowed but used, for example when code is executed in [unscheduled environment](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler#Unscheduled_Environment), the script engine would ignore any suspension command and throw error: "Suspending not allowed in this context". Using canSuspend command allows to detect the correct environment for the code.

> ⓘThe definition of [scheduled](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler#Scheduled_Environment) and [unscheduled environment](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler#Unscheduled_Environment) is not the same as whether or not the script execution can or cannot be suspended. For example while .*sqs* and .*fsm* scripts are [scheduled](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler#Scheduled_Environment) (i.e. added to the [scheduler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler): [diag_activeSQSScripts](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_activeSQSScripts), [diag_activeMissionFSMs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_activeMissionFSMs)), they cannot use [sleep](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sleep) or be suspended like [execVM](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/execVM) or [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) scripts can, therefore canSuspend for these types of scripts will return [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false).

assignedcommander.name: assignedCommander
assignedcommander.description: Returns the soldier assigned to the given vehicle as a commander.

customradio.name: customRadio
customradio.description: Sends the message to the custom radio channel. The message is defined in the [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext) file or radio protocol.

message: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

* [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)

* [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task)

* [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location)

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - array of variable names. All names are in lower case (see [toLower](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/toLower))

disableconversation.description: Disable the ability to talk to other people.

ctrlautoscrolldelay.name: ctrlAutoScrollDelay
ctrlautoscrolldelay.description:
Returns number of seconds auto-scroll will wait before scroll and/or rewind. -2 if scrollbar not present. 

Autorscroll is available for [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DialogControls-ListBoxes) and [CT_CONTROLS_GROUP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CONTROLS_GROUP) types of controls only. Autoscroll will wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds (must be  > 0) and then will scroll the scroll bar down to the bottom. [ctrlAutoScrollSpeed](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollSpeed) defines the speed with which scrollbar is scrolled. If [ctrlAutoScrollRewind](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollRewind) is [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), the control will fade out, immediately rewind to the top, then fade in, wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds and then repeat the scrolling in a loop. If user focuses on the control, autoscrolling is interrupted.

ctrlcommitted.name: ctrlCommitted
ctrlcommitted.description: Check if the control animation is finished.

ctrlautoscrollspeed.name: ctrlAutoScrollSpeed
ctrlautoscrollspeed.description:
Returns number of seconds to auto-scroll one line. -1 if auto-scroll is disabled. -2 if scrollbar not present. 

Autorscroll is available for [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DialogControls-ListBoxes) and [CT_CONTROLS_GROUP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CONTROLS_GROUP) types of controls only. Autoscroll will wait [ctrlAutoScrollDelay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollDelay) seconds (must be  > 0) and then will scroll the scroll bar down to the bottom. ctrlAutoScrollSpeed defines the speed with which scrollbar is scrolled. If [ctrlAutoScrollRewind](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollRewind) is [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), the control will fade out, immediately rewind to the top, then fade in, wait [ctrlAutoScrollDelay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollDelay) seconds and then repeat the scrolling in a loop. If user focuses on the control, autoscrolling is interrupted.

ctrlsettooltipcolorbox.name: ctrlSetTooltipColorBox
ctrlsettooltipcolorbox.description: Sets tooltip border color of given control.

syntaxArray.Params:

commander.name: commander
commander.description: In Operation Flashpoint it returns the commander of a vehicle. Since Armed Assault it returns the primary observer. The commander of a vehicle can be found with [effectiveCommander](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/effectiveCommander).

syntaxArray.Return: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - The unit sitting in the commander place is returned. If vehicle is not a vehicle but a person, the person is returned.

examples:
```sqf
[moveOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveOut) commander _tank;
```
Detect if player is in commander turret of a vehicle:
```sqf
_isVehicleCommander = [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) commander [objectParent](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objectParent) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player);
```

Commits control animation to last specified duration.


disablenvgequipment.name: disableNVGEquipment
disablenvgequipment.description: Enables or disables transport NV (Night Vision). To disable TI (Thermal Imaging) use [disableTIEquipment](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/disableTIEquipment).

ctrlseturl.name: ctrlSetURL
ctrlseturl.description:
Sets URL property of the given control subject to allowedHTMLLoadURIs[] whitelisting in [CfgCommands](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgCommands) config. Supported controls are:

* CT_BUTTON

* CT_SHORTCUTBUTTON

* CT_ACTIVETEXT
> ⚠URL should be written in lower case including address prefix. For example HTTP://ARMA3.COM/ will not pass allowed filter validation but http://arma3.com/ will.
examples:
```sqf
_control ctrlSetURL "http://arma3.com/"; // note the forward slash / at the end
```

disableremotesensors.name: disableRemoteSensors
disableremotesensors.description:
This command will halt raycasting calculations (on the local machine only) for all groups which don't contain *any* local entities. Units, that are not in a group with at least one local member, will not check visibility of other units. This will cause, that remote units will not have updated knowsAbout and it will save some CPU time. If a group contains a single local entity then calculations will still be performed for the entire group.

These raycasts are used to determine what other entities an entity can see, and they take a lot of CPU time. This is of course a bit of a trick, because rather than a true optimization, it disables part of the simulation. However, there are certainly types of scenarios where these raycasts are not needed. An example is a fully Player-versus-Player scenario, where the visibility between every combination of player entity is not needed. So why not disable this by default? There are cases where you do require these raycasts, for example in stealth scenarios. Without them, commands like [knowsAbout](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/knowsAbout), [nearTargets](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nearTargets) and [targetKnowledge](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/targetKnowledge) will only function for local units! The commands themselves are local, can be used on servers and clients, and the state is reset when the scenario ends. So, carefully consider whether your scenario can benefit from this method.

ctrlcreate.name: ctrlCreate
ctrlcreate.description:
Creates a new control in the given display.
The control class could be an existing class from the [ main config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) or a custom class defined in the [ mission config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionConfigFile). The main config is searched first, if the class does not exist there, the mission config is searched. Some of the common controls defined in the main config that can be used with this command:
[Show list](https://community.bistudio.com#)



Class
Description
Available since


RscText
simple text box



RscStructuredText
text box which supports [structured text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text)



RscTextMulti
simple multiline text box



RscPicture
simple picture box



RscPictureKeepAspect
picture box that doesn't stretch picture



RscEdit
input box



RscEditMulti
multiline input box



RscEditReadOnly
input box with [ canModify = false;](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DialogControls-EditBox)
v1.98


RscEditMultiReadOnly
multiline input box with [ canModify = false;](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DialogControls-EditBox)
v1.98


RscTree
tree view control



RscTreeMulti
multi-select tree view
v2.02


RscTreeSearch
searchable tree view control (see Example 4)



RscVideo
picture control with autostart for video texture (see [BIS_fnc_playVideo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_playVideo))



RscVideoKeepAspect
picture control for video to keep original video aspect ratio



RscButtonMenuBIKI
shortcut button with url pointing to "[https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://community.bistudio.com/wiki/)"
v1.98


RscControlsGroup
default controls group



RscControlsGroupNoScrollbars
controls group without scrollbars



RscControlsGroupNoHScrollbars
controls group without horizontal scrollbar



RscControlsGroupNoVScrollbars
controls group without vertical scrollbar








> ⓘThis list contains controls which are guaranteed to work with this command. However, controls not listed here should work as well - as long as they are properly defined.

syntaxArray.Params:
display: [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display) - Display in which control will be created
class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Existing classname (see [ctrlCreate/classnames](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlCreate/classnames)) of the new control. Since Arma 3 v1.70 it is possible to use classes defined in mission config
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - IDC of the new control. Use -1 if not needed
> ⚠Be careful when setting the IDC to 
> ```sqf
> -1
> ```
>  if the GUI also contains a [CT_LISTNBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTNBOX) since 
> ```sqf
> idcLeft
> ```
>  and 
> ```sqf
> idcRight
> ```
>  by default have 
> ```sqf
> idc = -1;
> ```
> .
controlsGroup (Optional): [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - Creates controls in existing controls group

ctrlsettextselection.name: ctrlSetTextSelection
ctrlsettextselection.description:
Selects length characters of edit control from the start position and places cursor at the end of selection.
> ⓘTo move cursor only, set length to 0. To select text from right to left, use negative length (See [ctrlTextSelection](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlTextSelection) for more info)

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
[start, length]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
start: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - selection start position
length: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - length of characters to select (0 to only move the cursor). Negative length will select text from right to left (see example 3)

getammocargo.name: getAmmoCargo
getammocargo.description:
Returns the amount (1 is full) of ammo resources in the cargo space of a rearm vehicle. 
> ⓘSince Arma 3 v1.96 the return value for vehicles that are not configured to have ability to rearm other vehicles is -1. (Prior to that the value was negative infinity)

syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - ammo cargo value, -1 if ammo cargo is not supported, 0 if the vehicle is ![alive](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/alive) or [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull)

disabletiequipment.name: disableTIEquipment
disabletiequipment.description:
Disables TI (Thermal Imaging) equipment for given vehicle.
> ⓘIn older versions of Arma this command would also disable NV (Night Vision), but since Arma 3 v1.54 this command disables only TI. Use [disableNVGEquipment](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/disableNVGEquipment) to disable NV.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
state: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true to turn TI off, false to turn TI on

currenttasks.name: currentTasks
currenttasks.description:
Returns array with all [ uncompleted](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/taskCompleted) tasks for the given agent. [getVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getVariable) could be used on [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task) to get the following special local variables from the task:


* "_this" [Team Member](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Member) - the [teamMember](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/teamMember) [agent](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/agent) the task is assigned to

* "_taskType" [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - the name of the task (see [registeredTasks](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/registeredTasks))

* "_thisCreated" [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 1 or 0

* "_thisRunning" [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 1 or 0

* "_totalCreated" [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - total number of tasks

* "_totalRunning" [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - total number of running tasks

* "_task"[Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task) - often null

ctrlsettooltipcolorshade.name: ctrlSetTooltipColorShade
ctrlsettooltipcolorshade.description: Sets tooltip background color of given control. Color is in format [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color).

currenttask.name: currentTask
currenttask.description: Return current task of given person.

delete3denentities.name: delete3DENEntities
delete3denentities.description: Delete given entities in [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor), including anything that can be placed in editor.

[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format:

displayremoveeventhandler.description: Remove a given event handler from the given display.

finite.name: finite
finite.description:
Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if the provided number is finite (not infinite and a valid number). 
> ⓘ
> 
> * Maximum finite [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) : 3.40282e+38
> 
> * Minimum finite [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) : -3.40282e+38
examples:
```sqf
finite 123; *// returns true*
```

```sqf
finite [log](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/log) -1; *// returns false*
```

```sqf
[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) ([not](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/not) finite [log](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/log) -1) [then](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/then) { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "Infinite" };
```

finishmissioninit.name: finishMissionInit
finishmissioninit.description: Finish world initialization before mission is launched.

fire.name: fire
fire.description:
Forces a unit to fire the given weapon. See also: [BIS_fnc_fire](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_fire).
> ⓘJust like with [forceWeaponFire](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forceWeaponFire) it is possible to pass remote unit as argument, but this could be unreliable. Considering this command might need to be used in combination with [selectWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/selectWeapon), which takes only [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) arguments, it would make sense to execute fire command where unit is also [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local).

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit that is supposed to fire
muzzle: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the muzzle to be fired

unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[muzzle, mode, magazine]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
muzzle: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
magazine: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) (Optional)

flyinheight.name: flyInHeight
flyinheight.description: Sets the flying altitude for aircraft relatively to the ground surface. Avoid too low altitudes, as helicopters and planes won't evade trees and obstacles on the ground. The default flying altitude is 100 meters.

syntaxArray.Params:
aircraft: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
altitude: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - flying altitude in meters

dofire.name: doFire
dofire.description:
Order the given unit(s) to fire on the given target (without radio messages).

The target is set with [doTarget](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/doTarget) or [commandTarget](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/commandTarget).

The target can be a unit or a vehicle, but not an object.

addweaponturret.name: addWeaponTurret
addweaponturret.description: Adds a weapon to the turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

additemtovest.name: addItemToVest
additemtovest.description: Create new item and store it to soldier's vest. The item can also be a weapon or a magazine.

addweaponglobal.name: addWeaponGlobal
addweaponglobal.description:
Add a weapon to a unit. Infantry units can only carry weapons in their respective slots (primary, secondary and handgun), the addWeaponGlobal command will replace the weapon currently in a slot with the added weapon if it shares the same slot. This command can link items to respective slots as well, in which case the functionality is identical to [linkItem](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/linkItem).

To make sure the added weapon is loaded and ready, add the magazine first.
> ⚠This command is broken when used on dedicated server

syntaxArray.Params:
object : [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit or vehicle to add the weapon to
weapon: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Weapon class name

additemtouniform.name: addItemToUniform
additemtouniform.description: Create new item and store it to soldier's uniform. The item can also be a weapon or a magazine.

groupiconselectable.name: groupIconSelectable
groupiconselectable.description: Returns whether or not group icons raise [onGroupIconClick](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onGroupIconClick), [onGroupIconOverEnter](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onGroupIconOverEnter) and [onGroupIconOverLeave](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onGroupIconOverLeave) events.

actionids.name: actionIDs
actionids.description: Returns [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number), where numbers are IDs of all user actions added to given entity with [addAction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addAction) command.

syntaxArray.Params: entity: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - entity with added user actions

isaimprecisionenabled.name: isAimPrecisionEnabled
isaimprecisionenabled.description: Returns true if procedural aiming precision affects weapon sway.

syntaxArray.Params: unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit which should be checked
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - True if affected, false if not

kbadddatabase.name: kbAddDatabase
kbadddatabase.description:
Register knowledge base database to given person. See [Conversations](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Conversations) for more details.
> ⚠This command is no longer available in Arma 2 and Arma 3.

action.name: action
action.description:
Make a unit perform an action. See [Category:Actions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Actions) for action names and syntaxes.

> ⚠The argument's [locality](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Locality) is *usually* local, but some actions can take a global argument (e.g "Eject", "GetOut", "GetInXXXX", "MoveToXXXX"). See [Category:Actions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Actions) for more details.
> ⓘIn Singleplayer, when user Alt-Tabs the simulation is paused and so the action will also halt until user returns to the game. For example, 
> ```sqf
> [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) action ["GetInDriver", car];
> ```
>  executed while user is Alt-Tabbed will result in the user seeing the action happening when he returns to the game screen. This doesn't happen in Multiplayer.

lock.name: lock
lock.description:
Lock vehicle (disable mounting / dismounting) for player.
This command will remove user get in/get out actions but will not stop player getting into or out of vehicle via script commands (e.g [moveInCargo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveInCargo)).
> ⓘAlternative syntax is similar to [setVehicleLock](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVehicleLock) but with numbers.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicleName: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
locked: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to lock, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to unlock

vehicleName: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
lockstate: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Can be one of the following:
0 - Unlocked
1 - Default (player subordinate cannot enter until his leader says so)
2 - Locked
3 - Locked for player

groupowner.name: groupOwner
groupowner.description: Returns the [ machine network ID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Machine_network_ID) of the client to which the group is local. This command only works when called from the server. When called from a client, it always returns 0.

isautostartupenabledrtd.name: isAutoStartUpEnabledRTD
isautostartupenabledrtd.description: Returns state of automatic start up action. > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if automatic start up action is enabled.

lockcamerato.name: lockCameraTo
lockcamerato.description: Lock/Unlock stabilized camera (in vanilla used currently only for UAVs) to target.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - UAV
target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) - use [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) for unlocking
turretPath: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - path to the turret with required camera

examples:
```sqf
uav lockCameraTo [vehicle, [0,0]];
```

```sqf
uav lockCameraTo [[objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull), [0,0]]; *// unlocks the turret*
```

acos.name: acos
acos.description: ArcCosine of a number, result in [Degrees](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number#Degrees)

menusetaction.name: menuSetAction
menusetaction.description: Sets new action into menu entry on given path.

syntaxArray.Params:
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
action: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Expression that should be executed when entry is clicked

control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
action: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Expression that should be executed when entry is clicked

selectionposition.name: selectionPosition
selectionposition.description:
Returns position in model space and returns its relative position. Searches first in memory level, then in geometry [LODs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/LOD).
In Arma it returns the initial position of the selection, in Arma 2/Arma 3 position of the selection (e.g. when it is animated) in render time scope. If a selection does not exist [0,0,0] is returned.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - relative position in model space. If selection does not exist, 
```sqf
[0, 0, 0]
```
 is returned.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[selectionName, LODName]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
selectionName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
LODName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - LOD name, one of the following:

* "Memory"

* "Geometry"

* "FireGeometry"

* "LandContact"

* "HitPoints"
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - relative position in model space. If selection does not exist, 
```sqf
[0, 0, 0]
```
 is returned.

kbaddtopic.name: kbAddTopic
kbaddtopic.description:
Register conversation topic to given person. See [Conversations](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Conversations) for more details.
> ⓘOnly the speaker(s) need to have the topic added.

syntaxArray.Params:
person: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
topicName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - the topic id for further reference
conversationFile: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - .bikb file path
fsmFile: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional) .fsm file path. Receives the following parameters:

* **_sentenceId:** the sentence as defined in the .bikb file

* **_topic:** TopicName registered via kbAddTopic

* **_this:** the person that was talked to (receiver)

* **_from:** the person that talked to the receiver and triggered the script
eventHandler: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional) code to execute - given String will be [compiled](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/compile). This is **not** an sqf file path.
Parameters: identical to *fsmFile* - see above.

getobjectdlc.name: getObjectDLC
getobjectdlc.description: Returns appID of the DLC the object belongs to or [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil) if object is vanilla.

waypointtimeoutcurrent.name: waypointTimeoutCurrent
waypointtimeoutcurrent.description: Gets the current timeout for [currentWaypoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/currentWaypoint) of a [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) or -1 if countdown is not in progress.

loadfile.name: loadFile
loadfile.description:
Returns the content of given files. If you plan to [compile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/compile) said string, be aware that the file should not contain comments or [compile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/compile) will throw an error. If there are comments, use [preprocessFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/preprocessFile)/[preprocessFileLineNumbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/preprocessFileLineNumbers) instead.
> ⚠If the file is not prepared using UTF-8 encoding and contains some characters [with codes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/toArray) > 127, they might convert incorrectly.
examples:
```sqf
_contents = loadFile "wantedString.txt";
```

```sqf
_contents = [compile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/compile) loadFile "myFunction.sqf"; *// will compile string into code*
```

selectmax.name: selectMax
selectmax.description:
Returns the array element with [maximum](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/max) numerical value. Engine solution to [BIS_fnc_greatestNum](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_greatestNum) and [BIS_fnc_findExtreme](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_findExtreme). Therefore it is expected that supplied array consists of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) only. [Booleans](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) however are also supported and will be evaluated as [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number): [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) - 1, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) - 0.  [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil) value treated as 0. 
> ⚠Other non [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) elements (not recommended) will be evaluated as 0 and **Bad conversion: scalar** message will be logged into .[rpt](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/rpt).

syntaxArray.Params:
time: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Transition time in seconds. 
```sqf
0
```
 will cause the change to be immediate
value: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Azimuth
direction: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Flat wind direction and strength in format [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D)

teammember.name: teamMember
teammember.description: Return an agent for given person.

teamswitchenabled.name: teamSwitchEnabled
teamswitchenabled.description:
Check if [Team Switch](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Switch) is currently enabled.

Team Switch is enabled by default.

ppeffectadjust.name: ppEffectAdjust
ppeffectadjust.description:
Set [post process effect](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Post_process_effects) parameters.

> ⓘThe two syntaxes differ in what format of the params they accept. The syntax with PP name expects colors to be packed into arrays within main array, while the syntax with PP handle can handle both flat and packed array. Therefore it is recommended to use the universal packed format, such as shown in the examples.

syntaxArray.Params:
effect: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) effect name
settings: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array of effect params

handle: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - effect handle
settings: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array of effect params

joinstring.name: joinString
joinstring.description: Joins *array* into [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) with provided *separator*. Array can be of mixed types, all elements will be converted to [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) prior to joining, but the fastest operation is on the array of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Strings).

syntaxArray.Params:
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array of [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything)
separator: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - separator used to join array elements.

examples:
```sqf
_str = "- This, is a sample string." [splitString](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/splitString) "-,. "; // ["This","is","a","sample","string"]
_str joinString " "; // "This is a sample string"
```

```sqf
["This","is","sparta"] joinString " ~ "; // "This ~ is ~ sparta"
```

```sqf
["1",2,[text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/text) "3"] joinString ""; // "123"
```

```sqf
"Japa is the best!" [splitString](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/splitString) "" joinString " "; // "J a p a   i s   t h e   b e s t !"
```
Remove all \r\n from file:
```sqf
[loadFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/loadFile) "somefile.txt" [splitString](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/splitString) [toString](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/toString) [13,10] joinString " "
```

setwindforce.name: setWindForce
setwindforce.description: Set max. wind overall wind changes in time. A time of zero means there will be an immediate change. A wind level of zero is minimal changes and a wind level of one means that wind can change rapidly.

tvsortbyvalue.name: tvSortByValue
tvsortbyvalue.description: Sorts all children of given path. Value of [Tree View](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_TREE) entries is used for sorting.

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
[path, reversed]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [Tree View Path](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Tree_View_Path) of the parent item to sort
reversed (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to reverse sort it. Default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)

[idc, path, reversed]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - control idc
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [Tree View Path](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Tree_View_Path) of the parent item to sort
reversed (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to reverse sort it. Default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)

addeditorobject.name: addEditorObject
addeditorobject.description:
Add an object to the editor and assign arguments. Create script is,called with _new equal to true. Returns the ID of the new EditorObject.,Subtype class is optional. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

modeltoworld.name: modelToWorld
modeltoworld.description:
Translates relative position from object model space into world position.
This command will take into account [vectorUp](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorUp) of the object when calculating relative coordinates.
For ASL version see [modelToWorldWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/modelToWorldWorld)

syntaxArray.Params:
model: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) - [x,y,z] offset relative to the model centre, format [PositionRelative](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionRelative)

addmpeventhandler.name: addMPEventHandler
addmpeventhandler.description:
Adds a multiplayer event handler (EH) to the given object and returns EH handle. 

> ⓘFor more information, see [Event Handlers/addMPEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers#Multiplayer_Event_Handlers).

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Object to monitor
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Event handler name
expression: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - Expression to execute.If EH has some data to return upon event (e.g. the "MPKilled" EH will return an array with 2 elements: the killed unit, and the killer), it is passed in _this variable.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Since Arma 3 v.1.64 the EH handle is also stored in _thisEventHandler variable and is available during EH code execution.

getbackpackcargo.name: getBackpackCargo
getbackpackcargo.description: Returns all backpack types and count from the cargo space.

additem.name: addItem
additem.description: Creates new item and tries to add it into inventory. Inventory must have enough space to accomodate new item or command will fail.The item can also be a weapon or a magazine.

cutrsc.name: cutRsc
cutrsc.description:
Display a resource defined in RscTitles of the mission's [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext), the campaign's description.ext or the global config.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)For greater efficiency and ease of modability, it is recommended to use named layers available with alternative syntax since Arma 3 v1.58.
> ⚠To avoid conflicts with existing layers it is recommended to register a layer with **BIS_fnc_rscLayer** and to start the name with a TAG:
> 
> ```sqf
> ("TAG_myLayer" [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) [BIS_fnc_rscLayer](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_rscLayer)) cutRsc ["myRsc","PLAIN"];
> ```
> 
> 
> 
> ```sqf
> "TAG_myLayer" cutRsc ["myRsc","PLAIN"];
> ```
>

syntaxArray.Params:
[class, effect, speed, showInMap]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - the class name of the resource. ("Default" will remove the current resource.)
effect: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [Title Effect Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Title_Effect_Type) for more information about these values.
speed (Optional, default -1): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Time in seconds to fade in resource.
showInMap (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to hide the text when the map is opened.

layer: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - layer number on which the effect is shown, where 0 is the back most. Layer number is rounded to the nearest integer and also cannot be negative. Layer 99.5 will be treated as layer 100

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - layer name on which the effect is shown. Layer names are **CaSe SeNsItIvE**.
[class, effect, speed, showInMap]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - the class name of the resource. ("Default" will remove the current resource.)
effect: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [Title Effect Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Title_Effect_Type) for more information about these values.
speed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default -1) Time in seconds to fade in resource.
showInMap: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to hide the text when the map is opened.

isburning.name: isBurning
isburning.description:
Returns whether the unit is burning.
This returns true only if unit is damaged by nearby fire, it does **not** check whether a fireplace is burning, use [inflamed](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/inflamed) command for that.

addtorque.name: addTorque
addtorque.description:
Applies torque (rotation momentum) to the [ center of mass](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getCenterOfMass) of the given object. Torque force is defined as vector [x, y, z] applied in world space. If you need to define torque in model space, convert the torque vector first by [vectorModelToWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorModelToWorld) or [vectorModelToWorldVisual](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorModelToWorldVisual) command. The torque applied as impulse. Diagram below explain which way the object would rotate.  For more information see [NVIDIA docs](https://community.bistudio.comhttp://docs.nvidia.com/gameworks/content/gameworkslibrary/physx/apireference/files/classPxRigidBody.html#acb04ffc816d45afff2d04e93d7446e79) 
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:addTorque_correct.jpg)
> ⓘA single application of torque would produce one impulse, which may not be enough. In this case consider applying a series of continuous impulses, for example to make a quad bike to roll forward:
> 
> ```sqf
> [onEachFrame](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onEachFrame) { quad addTorque (quad [vectorModelToWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorModelToWorld) [100,0,0]) }
> ```
> 
> ⚠This command doesn't follow convention for torque direction, which obeys right-hand rule. To comply, negate all values in the vector.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - PhysX object
torque: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - world vector in format [x,y,z]

examples:
Apply torque [1000,0,0] to object not factoring object positioning:

```sqf
_wheel addTorque [1000,0,0];
```
Apply torque [1000,0,0] relative to object:

```sqf
_wheel addTorque (_wheel [vectorModelToWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorModelToWorld) [1000,0,0]);
```

getweaponsway.name: getWeaponSway
getweaponsway.description: Returns current size of weapon sway of a given unit, in [radians](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/rad).

commandtarget.name: commandTarget
commandtarget.description: Order the given unit(s) to target the given target (via the radio). Command given to the player, puts a red square with words Target and Distance on player's HUD at target location. If player in vehicle and has radar facilities, it also adds target marker to the radar.

speechvolume.name: speechVolume
speechvolume.description: Returns the current speech volume (set by [fadeSpeech](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/fadeSpeech))

spawn.name: spawn
spawn.description:
Adds given set of compiled instructions to the [scheduler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler). Exactly when the code will be executed is unknown, it depends on how busy is the engine and how filled up is the [scheduler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler). Therefore spawn does not wait for the supplied code to finish, instead, spawn returns a [Script](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Script_(Handle)) handle to the [scheduler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler) task. [scriptDone](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/scriptDone) command can be used to check the code completion. Additional arguments are passed to the code in local variable [_this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this). Since Arma 3 v1.55 the script handle also exists inside the code in _thisScript variable. To see what spawned scripts are currently in the scheduler, use [diag_activeSQFScripts](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_activeSQFScripts) command.
> ⚠When multiple [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) is spawned in an order, there is no guarantee that the spawned [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) will also execute in the same order. If you need such guarantee, use [BIS_fnc_spawnOrdered](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_spawnOrdered) function

syntaxArray.Params:
arguments: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - arguments passed to the script, which later available in _this variable inside the script.
code: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code)
syntaxArray.Return: [Script Handle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Script_(Handle)) - can be used to determine (via [scriptDone](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/scriptDone) (also via [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) in Arma 3)) when the spawned script has finished. In Arma 3, the handle is also available inside the spawned script in _thisScript variable.

displaynull.name: displayNull
displaynull.description:
A non-existing [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display). To compare non-existent displays use [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) or [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo):

* displayNull == displayNull; // false

* [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) displayNull; // true

* displayNull  [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) displayNull; // true

is3den.name: is3DEN
is3den.description: Returns true if the [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor) is currently being used. [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) when inside editor environment, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) when outside of editor environment. (see also [is3DENMultiplayer](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/is3DENMultiplayer), [is3DENPreview](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/is3DENPreview))

isautotrimonrtd.name: isAutoTrimOnRTD
isautotrimonrtd.description: Returns state of auto trim functionality. > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if auto trim is enabled

hintsilent.name: hintSilent
hintsilent.description: Same as [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint), but without a sound.

commandradio.name: commandRadio
commandradio.description:
Sends the audio message to the command radio channel. Must have assigned "ItemRadio" to send or receive the transmission. The message is defined in CfgRadio in the [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext) file or config radio protocol. The transmission will play only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the transmission to play on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see [remoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExec)).
Note:  When transmitting unit gets killed, transmission will be interrupted, however when receiving unit gets killed, the transmission continues to play.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit to transmit
radioName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class name from CfgRadio

[side, identity]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
side: [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) - side to which the transmission will be played
identity: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class name of one of the identities in CfgHQIdentities. Possible identities in Arma 3 are:

* "Base"

* "HQ"

* "PAPA_BEAR"

* "AirBase"

* "BLU"

* "OPF"

* "IND"

* "IND_G"
radioName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class name from CfgRadio

benchmark.name: benchmark
benchmark.description: Returns the value of "3D Performance" in OFP Preferences (flashpoint.cfg). This can be used to estimate the computer performance to adapt CPU and GPU demanding settings like view distance dynamically in missions.

logentities.name: logEntities
logentities.description:
Creates a log file containing the list of all game entities in scene. 
File is created in the same directory as [.rpt file](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Crash_Files). 
Special: BattlEye's RCON variant of this command is #logEntities (see also [Multiplayer_Server_Commands](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Server_Commands))

deletecollection.name: deleteCollection
deletecollection.description:
Delete a collection. As example, used with a soldier, it'll hide the ingame model.

*When targetting Arma 2 1.06 or newer, use [hideObject](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hideObject) instead. This function is a relic from dynamic building destruction development. It is left only for compatibility with scripts created before Arma 2 1.06, and its functionality may be changed or removed in the future.*

ropedetach.name: ropeDetach
ropedetach.description: Detaches attached object from rope (i.e. detaches rope end from attached to it entity). See [ropeAttachTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ropeAttachTo) for attach operation.

syntaxArray.Params:
attachedObject: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - entity attached to the end of rope
rope: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - rope object to which entity is attached

setdiaryrecordtext.description: Set text of a log record.

currentmagazineturret.description: Returns the name of the type of the currently using magazine on specified turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret. Note that a turret is not loaded until unit enters it, so this command will return "".
