limitspeed.name: limitSpeed
limitspeed.description: Limit speed of given vehicle or person to given value (in km/h).

seteditorobjectscope.name: setEditorObjectScope
seteditorobjectscope.description:
This command defines the level of access a user has to editor objects.

"objects" is an array of either [Editor Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Editor_Object) (eg ["_unit_0"]) or actual [Game Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) (eg [player]). If the array is empty then the command will automatically parse all editor objects.

"editorType" is the editor type to effect (eg "unit", "vehicle", "center") or "" for all types.

"condition" is an executable string that must evaluate to true or false. If true, the scope of the evaluated editor object will be modified. "_x" can be used in the string as reference to the ingame representation of the currently processed array member.

"scope" is one of "HIDE", "VIEW", "SELECT", "LINKTO", "LINKFROM", "ALLNODRAG", "ALLNOTREE", "ALLNOCOPY", "ALLNOSELECT" or "ALL".

"subordinatesAlso" is a boolean value. If true then subordinates in the editor will be assigned the same scope as the parent.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

syntaxArray.Syntax: map setEditorObjectScope [objects, editorType, condition, scope, subordinatesAlso]
syntaxArray.Params:
map: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) -
[objects, editorType, condition, scope, subordinatesAlso]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) -
objects: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) and/or [Editor Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Editor_Object)
editorType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
condition: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
scope: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
subordinatesAlso: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

examples:
```sqf
_map setEditorObjectScope [ [],"vehicle", "side effectiveCommander _x != side player", "HIDE", false]
```

```sqf
((findDisplay 128) displayCtrl 51) setEditorObjectScope [ ["_unit_0"], "", "true", "ALLNODRAG", false]
```

Returns the control text height. Supported control [types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlType) are:

show3dicons.name: show3DIcons
show3dicons.description:
Toggle the drawing of 3D icons.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

finddisplay.name: findDisplay
finddisplay.description:
Finds a display by its IDD which can either be defined in [missionConfigFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionConfigFile) ([description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext)) or [configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) ([config.cpp](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/config.cpp))
If the specified display can't be found [displayNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/displayNull) ("No display") is returned, which can be tested with the [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) command.

> ⚠Dedicated servers and [headless clients](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Headless_Client) don't have a primary display (e.g 
> ```sqf
> findDisplay 46
> ```
>  will return [displayNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/displayNull)).
> Detect both with the [hasInterface](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hasInterface) command.
A list of common displays can be found in the notes below; for a full list, see [findDisplay/Arma 3 IDD list](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findDisplay/Arma_3_IDD_list).

sendudpmessage.name: sendUDPMessage
sendudpmessage.description:
Send message to given address using UDP protocol. Returns false if the message has not been delivered 

Note: Not implemented (see talk page for more info).

removeallhandgunitems.description: Removes all items from [handgunWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/handgunWeapon), except magazine.

copytoclipboard.name: copyToClipboard
copytoclipboard.description: Copies ANSI text string to the clipboard. If Unicode support is desired, see [forceUnicode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forceUnicode).

menuexpand.name: menuExpand
menuexpand.description: Expands given menu entry on given path and all its parents so entry is visible.

setsoundeffect.name: setSoundEffect
setsoundeffect.description:
Defines the different sound effects. 


* Sound - plays a 2D sound as if [playSound](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playSound) was used from CfgSounds (mission or main config)

* Voice - attaches a 3D sound from CfgSounds (mission or main config) to the object that activated the trigger and plays it as if [say3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/say3D) was used

* SoundEnv - [Triggers only] plays an environmental sound from CfgEnvSounds (mission or main config)

* SoundDet - [Triggers only] creates a dynamic sound object attached to a trigger defined in [CfgSFX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgSFX) (mission or main config)

To stop any sound, deactivate the trigger (might take up to 0.5 sec to stop) or delete the trigger (immediate). 

Also use "$NONE$" to skip the sound (1st item), when there is none to be used (Example 3, 4, 5).
> 🚧**TODO:**  Remove the note above in Arma3 v2.04, and remove this from examples as simple "" will work then instead ("$NONE$" still supported)

syntaxArray.Params:
trigger: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[sound, voice, soundEnv, soundDet]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of strings, see description

waypoint: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [Waypoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Waypoint)
[sound, voice]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of strings, see description

Set one of entity [attributes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Entity_Attributes). For the list of all attributes with their properties, see [Setting Attributes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Setting_Attributes#Attributes).
> ⚠Attributes are available only within the Eden Editor workspace. You cannot access them in scenario preview or exported scenario!

isweaponrested.description: Returns true if weapon is currently rested.

A getter for [setWaypointVisible](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setWaypointVisible) command.

> ⚠Returns **0** ([Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)) instead of [Booleanean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) for an invalid waypoint

setvelocitytransformation.name: setVelocityTransformation
setvelocitytransformation.description:
Interpolates and applies [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL), [velocity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/velocity), [vectorDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorDir) and [vectorUp](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorUp) to the given object based on the interval value. 
When interval is 0 the "fromXXX" values are used for the beginning of the interpolation. When interval is 1, the "toXXX" values are used for the end of interpolation. When interval value is in between, interpolated values are used (see diagram below). The interpolation is linear and along straight line between "from" and "to" positions. If curve is needed, then it should be constructed from multiple straight sections or by dynamically changing value of position params during the interpolation cycle, similar to [Quadratic Curve animation](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B%C3%A9zier_curve#Quadratic_curves) (see Example 3).
The [velocity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/velocity) param doesn't do much in SP, but in MP, provided the velocity component is set correctly, it helps the engine to figure out what the next position of the moving object should be on other clients.

The actual approximate interpolation formula for this command is:

```sqf
_vecCurrent = _vecFrom [vectorAdd](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorAdd) (_vecTo [vectorDiff](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorDiff) _vecFrom [vectorMultiply](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorMultiply) _interval);
```

[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:setVelocityTransformation.jpg)

> ⓘFor continuous movement this command should be executed each frame while changing interval value. For example to apply interpolation for 10 seconds one could use the following command to translate 10 seconds into 0...1 interval:
> 
> ```sqf
> t1 = [time](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/time); 
> t2 = [time](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/time) + 10;
> ```
>  
> Later inside some on frame event...
> 
> 
> ```sqf
> _interval = [linearConversion](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/linearConversion) [t1, t2, [time](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/time), 0, 1];
> ```
> 
> ⚠In multiplayer, this command should be applied where object is [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local)

syntaxArray.Syntax: object **setVelocityTransformation** [fromPosASL, toPosASL, fromVelocity, toVelocity, fromVectorDir, toVectorDir, fromVectorUp, toVectorUp, interval]
syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object to be interpolated
[fromPosASL, toPosASL, fromVelocity, toVelocity, fromVectorDir, toVectorDir, fromVectorUp, toVectorUp, interval] : [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
fromPosASL: [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) - starting [getPosASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPosASL) of the object
toPosASL: [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) - ending [getPosASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPosASL) of the object
fromVelocity: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - starting [velocity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/velocity) of the object
toVelocity: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - ending [velocity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/velocity)  of the object
fromVectorDir: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - starting [vectorDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorDir)  of the object
toVectorDir: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - ending [vectorDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorDir)  of the object
fromVectorUp: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - starting [vectorUp](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorUp)  of the object
toVectorUp: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - ending [vectorUp](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorUp)  of the object
interval: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - interpolation interval (variable value, normally between 0 and 1)

setmarkershapelocal.name: setMarkerShapeLocal
setmarkershapelocal.description: Selects shape (actual type) of the local marker.

syntaxArray.Params:
markerName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
shape: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - The shape, can be one of:

* "ICON"

* "RECTANGLE"

* "ELLIPSE"

* "POLYLINE"

weaponsitemscargo.name: weaponsItemsCargo
weaponsitemscargo.description:
Returns an array with subarrays contains class names and also names of connected items of all the vehicle's cargo weapons in [weaponsItems](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/weaponsItems) format. If weapon has no magazine, an empty array [] is returned instead of magazine info. If the argument is a vehicle with weapons, vehicles cargo is searched, unlike with [weaponsItems](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/weaponsItems) command, which will return vehicle's weapons instead. 

* Since Arma 3 v1.96 the returned array always contains secondary muzzle magazine info and consistent with [getUnitLoadout](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getUnitLoadout) format for weapon items.

forcedmap.name: forcedMap
forcedmap.description: Returns if map was forced by using [forceMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forceMap) command or [openMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/openMap) command with force option

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - in format [forceMapForced, openMapForced] where:

* forceMapForced: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if map was forced with [forceMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forceMap) command

* openMapForced: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if map was forced with [openMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/openMap) command.

leaderboardgetrows.name: leaderboardGetRows
leaderboardgetrows.description: Returns an array with values for the given leaderboard, the array is in format: [[player1Name, score, rank], [player2Name, score, rank], [player3Name, score, rank] ... ]; This can be called after the one of the row request function has been called and successfully finished!

loadstatus.name: loadStatus
loadstatus.description: Loads object's properties from [Objects.sav](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Objects.sav) file in campaign directory (from entry name).

attachedto.name: attachedTo
attachedto.description: Returns object the given object is attached to or [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) if the given object is not attached to anything.

syntaxArray.Return: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object the given object is attached to

unitaimposition.name: unitAimPosition
unitaimposition.description: Returns the position on the unit other units can aim at. Same as [aimPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/aimPos) only returns position in [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) format and has render scope alternative [unitAimPositionVisual](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/unitAimPositionVisual).

unitaimpositionvisual.name: unitAimPositionVisual
unitaimpositionvisual.description: Returns the position on the unit other units can aim at in render scope. See also [aimPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/aimPos), [unitAimPosition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/unitAimPosition).

closedisplay.name: closeDisplay
closedisplay.description:
Closes given display with exit code. It does not instantly close the display but does it on next simulation cycle. Most common exit codes are:
#define IDC_OK		1 // emulate "OK" button
#define IDC_CANCEL	2 // emulate "Cancel" button

> ⚠Sometimes when one display is opened on top of another display, previous display may not close properly, i.e. some display EHs such as "onUnload" may never fire. Use this command to manually handle such displays.

armorypoints.name: armoryPoints
armorypoints.description: Returns, stored in [USERNAME].ArmaXProfile, value of *armoryPoints* entry. If the entry doesn't exist, it returns 0.

addprimaryweaponitem.name: addPrimaryWeaponItem
addprimaryweaponitem.description: Adds weapon item, including magazine, directly to the [primaryWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/primaryWeapon). This is used for infantry weapons.

syntaxArray.Return: [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) or [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - **false** is returned if **item** can not be added

deactivatekey.name: deActivateKey
deactivatekey.description:
Deactivates the given keyname for the current user profile. The keys are used to unlock missions or campaigns.

See keys, keysLimit and doneKeys in the [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#keys) file of the missions.

getburningvalue.name: getBurningValue
getburningvalue.description: Returns how much the unit is exposed to fire damage.

bezierinterpolation.name: bezierInterpolation
bezierinterpolation.description:
Gets interpolated value based on [Bézier curve](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bézier_curve) with given control points (progress value is 0...1 for a curve that starts at pos0 and finishes at posN) 
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:bezierInterpolation2.jpg)

syntaxArray.Params:
progress: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - interpolation value
[pos0, pos1,... posN]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
pos: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D)
syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - a single point position in format [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) based on progress value

group.name: group
group.description: Returns the group a unit is assigned to.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) -  
For dead units, the returned group equals [grpNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/grpNull).

getdirvisual.name: getDirVisual
getdirvisual.description: Returns object's heading in the range from 0 to 360 in render time scope.

enableaudiofeature.name: enableAudioFeature
enableaudiofeature.description: Enable/disable an audio feature, features are: "lowpass", "building_interior".

ctremoverows.name: ctRemoveRows
ctremoverows.description: Takes array of row indices as a parameter and removes rows with those indices. Indices of remaining rows will be recomputed.

missionconfigfile.name: missionConfigFile
missionconfigfile.description:
Return root of mission [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext) entries hierarchy.
> ⚠Since introduction of the [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor), scenario attributes can be configured in the editor itself, not only in the external Description.ext file. To access desired value independently on where it is stored, use the following commands instead:
> 
> * [getMissionConfigValue](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getMissionConfigValue)
> 
> * [getMissionConfig](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getMissionConfig)
> ⚠If your [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext) file is empty, [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) missionConfigFile may report an empty string instead of the path to the file. You have to put at least one entry into your config.

menuseturl.name: menuSetURL
menuseturl.description: Sets weblink (URL) of given menu strip entry.

removeallweapons.name: removeAllWeapons

tvsetpicturerightcolor.name: tvSetPictureRightColor
tvsetpicturerightcolor.description: Sets color of the right picture on the tree view item defined by path

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
[path, color]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - path to tree view item
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [r,g,b,a]

unregistertask.name: unregisterTask
unregistertask.description: Unregisters a task type from given agent. The task type is the name given in CfgTasks classes in name property. Also available from [registeredTasks](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/registeredTasks) array.

syntaxArray.Params:
teamMember: [Team Member](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Member) - [teamMember](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/teamMember) [agent](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/agent)
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the task

deletesite.name: deleteSite
deletesite.description:
Removes the site.
> ⚠This command is considered deprecated and is no longer supported

curatorregisteredobjects.name: curatorRegisteredObjects
curatorregisteredobjects.description: Returns array with all objects that has curator registered and their settings.

isuniformallowed.name: isUniformAllowed
isuniformallowed.description: Check whether given uniform can be dressed by target soldier.

actionkeysimages.name: actionKeysImages
actionkeysimages.description: Returns a list of button images or names assigned to the given user action. A maximum of maxKeys keys is listed. You can find the action names in config class ControllerSchemes or [user action names](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Key_Actions).

inpolygon.name: inPolygon
inpolygon.description: Checks whether position is inside given polygon

syntaxArray.Params:
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D)
polygon: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array of [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) positions in format: [position1, position2...., positionN]

to.name: to
to.description: Continue sequence of [for](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/for) construct. It sets the end value of the index variable

getmarkercolor.name: getMarkerColor
getmarkercolor.description:
Returns marker color for given marker.
> ⓘThis command is identical to [markerColor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/markerColor).

preprocessfile.name: preprocessFile
preprocessfile.description:
Reads and processes the content of the specified file. Preprocessor is C-like, supports comments using // or /* and */ and [PreProcessor Commands](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PreProcessor_Commands). Due to the hard-drive access this command executes and the lack of caching this command should not be used in time-critical script loops.
> ⚠If the file you are loading is not prepared using UTF-8 encoding and contains some characters [ with codes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/toArray) > 127, they might convert incorrectly.

syntaxArray.Params: fileName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Path to the file and name of the file

scudstate.name: scudState
scudstate.description:
Current state of given Scud launcher. Following states are recognized: 


* 0 - No activity

* 1 - Launch preparation,

* 2 - Launch prepared

* 3 - Ignition

* 4 - Launched.

keyname.name: keyName
keyname.description: Returns the name of a button (on the keyboard, mouse or joystick) with the given code.

weapondirection.name: weaponDirection
weapondirection.description:
Returns the direction that the vehicle weapon is aiming in. For addons the weapon name must be an entry in CfgWeapons.

> ⓘAlternatively, you can get turret and gun angle in degrees using [animationSourcePhase](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animationSourcePhase) or [animationPhase](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animationPhase) commands

camsetfocus.name: camSetFocus
camsetfocus.description: Sets camera focus range in format [distance, blur]. blur param - sets the camera focus blur. It does not automatically commit changes (see [camCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCommit)). Use [-1, -1] to disable focus completely.

addteammember.name: addTeamMember
addteammember.description:
Add given member to given team. Effect is local, unless both member and team are local to PC on which command is executed, then effect is global.

 The same [Team Member](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Member) can be member of several different [teams](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/teams) at the same time.

updatemenuitem.name: updateMenuItem
updatemenuitem.description:
Sets the text and command for the menu item. index is index as returned from addMenuItem command. command is optional.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

waypointforcebehaviour.name: waypointForceBehaviour
waypointforcebehaviour.description: Returns true if the waypoint behavior is forced.

getplayerscores.name: getPlayerScores
getplayerscores.description:
* In MP: Returns the unit's table of scores (infantry kills, soft vehicle kills, armor kills, air kills, deaths, total score).

* In SP: Empty array []

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - the score of the given player in format [infantry kills, soft vehicle kills, armor kills, air kills, deaths, total score]

getstamina.name: getStamina
getstamina.description: Get current stamina (~ seconds until depletion)

lbsetselected.name: lbSetSelected
lbsetselected.description: Sets the selection state of the given row of the given listbox of style LB_MULTI. The command has to be called for every row which is needed to be selected in multi-selection listbox. For single selection listbox use [lbSetCurSel](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lbSetCurSel) instead.

getcustomaimcoef.name: getCustomAimCoef
getcustomaimcoef.description: Returns aimPrecision from animation state with custom value that will directly affects weapon sway size and speed.

ctrlsetautoscrolldelay.name: ctrlSetAutoScrollDelay
ctrlsetautoscrolldelay.description:
Sets number of second before auto-scroll starts/rewinds. Setter for [ctrlAutoScrollDelay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollDelay).

Autorscroll is available for [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DialogControls-ListBoxes) and [CT_CONTROLS_GROUP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CONTROLS_GROUP) types of controls only. Autoscroll will wait [ctrlAutoScrollDelay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollDelay) seconds (must be  > 0) and then will scroll the scroll bar down to the bottom. [ctrlAutoScrollSpeed](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollSpeed) defines the speed with which scrollbar is scrolled. If [ctrlAutoScrollRewind](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollRewind) is [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), the control will fade out, immediately rewind to the top, then fade in, wait [ctrlAutoScrollDelay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollDelay) seconds and then repeat the scrolling in a loop. If user focuses on the control, autoscrolling is interrupted.

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DialogControls-ListBoxes) or [CT_CONTROLS_GROUP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CONTROLS_GROUP)
delay: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - seconds to wait before scroll and/or rewind

setspeedmode.name: setSpeedMode
setspeedmode.description:
Sets group speed mode. If unit is passed as param, unit's group is used. Mode may be one of: 

* **"UNCHANGED"** (unchanged)

* **"LIMITED"** (half speed)

* **"NORMAL"** (full speed, maintain formation)

* **"FULL"** (do not wait for any other units in formation)

ropeattachedobjects.name: ropeAttachedObjects
ropeattachedobjects.description:
Returns an array of all entities that are attached to the transport with [ropes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ropes). This command is the opposite of [ropeAttachedTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ropeAttachedTo).
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:ropeAttachedObjects.jpg)

syntaxArray.Params: ropesOwner: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - transport from which a single or multiple ropes are originating
syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array of attached entities on ropes

getwppos.name: getWPPos
getwppos.description: Returns the position of a selected waypoint of a given group. Waypoints include only those which were placed in the mission editor.

syntaxArray.Params:
[group, index]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - the group/unit, of which you want to select a waypoint
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 0 equals the starting position of the group.
The number used in this and other waypoint commands is *one more* than the one displayed in the waypoint window in the editor. (i.e. if the editor labeled a WP "0:MOVE" the you would have to use getWPPos [grp,1] to access this particular WP)
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D). 
The returned position equals [0,0,0], if the selected waypoint doesn't exist.

setmarkerpos.name: setMarkerPos
setmarkerpos.description:
Moves the marker. If position is given in 3D format, z coordinate is stored with the marker and will be used when marker is passed to commands like [createVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createVehicle), [createUnit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createUnit), [createAgent](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createAgent), [createMine](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createMine), [setVehiclePosition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVehiclePosition) for example. When [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) is used for position, [PositionWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionWorld) of the object is used.
> ⓘ**Multiplayer optimisation:** Global marker commands always broadcast the *entire* marker state over the network. As such, the number of network messages exchanged when creating or editing a marker can be reduced by performing all but the last operation using local marker commands, then using a global marker command for the last change (and subsequent global broadcast of all changes applied to the marker).

syntaxArray.Params:
markerName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
pos: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) (since Arma 3 v1.94)

exp.name: exp
exp.description: Let **x** be a number, then **exp (x)** is equal to **e to the power of x** (or e^x)

getterrainheightasl.name: getTerrainHeightASL
getterrainheightasl.description: Returns the terrain height above the sea for the given position.
examples:
```sqf
_height = getTerrainHeightASL ([position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/position) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player));
```

```sqf
_height = getTerrainHeightASL [5213,3245];
```

```sqf
_seadepth = [abs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/abs) (getTerrainHeightASL [getPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPos) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)); *// sea depth at players position;*
```

setcombatmode.name: setCombatMode
setcombatmode.description:
Sets AI [ group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) combat mode (engagement rules). For individual unit's combat mode see [setUnitCombatMode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setUnitCombatMode). Mode may be one of the following: 

* "BLUE" : Never fire, keep formation

* "GREEN" : Hold fire, keep formation

* "WHITE" : Hold fire, engage at will/loose formation

* "YELLOW" : Fire at will, keep formation

* "RED" : Fire at will, engage at will/loose formation
See [Combat Modes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Combat_Modes) for more information on combat modes.

syntaxArray.Params:
group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object). If the argument is unit [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), unit's current group is used.
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - See description

enginesisonrtd.name: enginesIsOnRTD
enginesisonrtd.description: Returns which engines are producing some work.> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

removebinocularitem.name: removeBinocularItem
removebinocularitem.description: Removes given weapon item, including magazine, from the [binocular](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/binocular) weapon.

getassetdlcinfo.name: getAssetDLCInfo
getassetdlcinfo.description: Returns DLC information about given object or model.

syntaxArray.Params: asset: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - object reference or path to the model
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array in format: [isDlc, isOwned, isInstalled, isAvailable, appID, DLCName], where:

* isDlc: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - the asset belongs to a DLC

* isOwned: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

* isInstalled: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

* isAvailable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

* appID: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - actual steam item ID or "0" for none or "-1" for unknown

* DLCName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - actual DLC name or ""

syntaxArray.Params:
[class, config]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class name of the asset
config (Optional): [Config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config) - config to search in, default: [configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "CfgVehicles"
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array in format: [isDlc, isOwned, isInstalled, isAvailable, appID, DLCName], where:

* isDlc: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - the asset belongs to a DLC

* isOwned: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

* isInstalled: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

* isAvailable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

* appID: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - actual steam item ID or "0" for none or "-1" for unknown

* DLCName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - actual DLC name or ""

syntaxArray.Params:
effect: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the effect
commit: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - duration

handle: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - handle of the effect
commit: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - duration

handles: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - list of handles
commit: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - duration

all3denentities.name: all3DENEntities
all3denentities.description:
Returns an array of all currently placed [Eden Editor entities](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Entity), including groups, waypoints, and markers in following format:
 [objects, groups, triggers, systems, waypoints, markers, layers, comments]

* objects: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

* groups: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Groups](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)

* triggers: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

* systems: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

* waypoints: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Arrays](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in [Waypoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Waypoint) format

* markers: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* layers: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* comments: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

isuicontext.name: isUIContext
isuicontext.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if the script originated from some UI control event, for example from "onButtonDown" EH. Exists within parent scope and immediate child scopes.
examples:
```sqf
[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) (isUIContext) [then](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/then) {[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "UI control event"};
```

```sqf
_button [ctrlSetEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlSetEventHandler) ['ButtonDown',"[call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) {[diag_log](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_log) isUIContext}"]; // Outputs true
```

```sqf
_button [ctrlSetEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlSetEventHandler) ['ButtonDown',"[] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) {[diag_log](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_log) isUIContext}"]; // Outputs false
```

and.name: and
and.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) only if both conditions are [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true). In case of the alternative syntax, [lazy evaluation](https://community.bistudio.comhttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lazy_evaluation#Control_structures) is used (if left operand is [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), evaluation of the right side is skipped completely).

syntaxArray.Params:
a: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Test condition or variable that returns [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean).
b: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Test condition or variable that returns [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean).

syntaxArray.Syntax: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) = a **and** b (*Only available since Arma 2:OA v1.62.*)
syntaxArray.Params:
a: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Test condition or variable that returns [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean).
b: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - Code that returns [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean). It is not evaluated if **a** returns as [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false).

addgoggles.name: addGoggles
addgoggles.description: Create a new item and try to link it into goggles slot. This command doesn't add NVGoggles. Use [addItem](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addItem) and [assignItem](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/assignItem) or just [linkItem](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/linkItem) for latter.

diag_scope.name: diag_scope
diag_scope.description: Returns script scope depth. When script is directly executed by the engine or a new script is added to the scheduler, the scope depth is 0. The examples of such execution are event handlers, [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn), etc. [isNil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNil) [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) will also create a parent scope. Any use of [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) and such will stack execution creating child scopes and increasing scope depth.

exec.name: exec
exec.description:
Execute a script using (the deprecated but still available) [SQS Syntax](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQS_Syntax). [SQF Syntax](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQF_Syntax) (and [execVM](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/execVM)) is the most recent scripting language.
The magic variable [_time](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#time) used within the script contains the elapsed time in seconds since the script started.
> ⓘTo see the active SQS scripts currently in the scheduler, use [diag_activeSQSScripts](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_activeSQSScripts) command.

syntaxArray.Params:
argument: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - the argument passed to the script through the [_this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this) variable. To pass multiple arguments, use an [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array).
script: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - the file path to the script. It should be given relatively to the mission folder, campaign scripts subfolder or global scripts folder and is searched there in the same order.If you refer to a script packed together with an addon, the path should look like this: "\ADDON_PBO_NAME\script.sqs" where ADDON_PBO_NAME is the name of the addon's [PBO](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PBO) file without extension.

enableweapondisassembly.name: enableWeaponDisassembly
enableweapondisassembly.description: Enables or disables disassembly of static weapons. Could be applied to local [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), to another unit or to static weapon directly.

syntaxArray.Params: enable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to prevent local [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) from being able to disassemble static weapons

entity: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit or static weapon
enable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)  - [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to prevent a unit from being able to disassemble static weapons, or to prevent a static weapon from being disassembled by anyone

ctrlparentcontrolsgroup.name: ctrlParentControlsGroup
ctrlparentcontrolsgroup.description: Returns the parent control of a given child control. If the control is not part of a [CT_CONTROLS_GROUP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CONTROLS_GROUP) control then [controlNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/controlNull) is returned. To return parent [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display) of the control use [ctrlParent](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlParent).

boundingboxreal.name: boundingBoxReal
boundingboxreal.description:
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:Boundingbox.jpg) Returns a raw bounding box of given object in model coordinates space. This command is similar to [boundingBox](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/boundingBox) but gives more precise measurements.
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.92](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.92) An alternative syntax was introduced allowing to specify clipping type to be used, which in some cases could make bounding boxes even more precise. The output of both syntaxes was also extended to include bounding sphere diameter, identical to [sizeOf](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sizeOf) return value.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - the extreme points of the model in format [PositionRelative](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionRelative), as well as bounding box sphere diameter, to format [[xmin, ymin, zmin],[xmax, ymax, zmax], boundingSphereDiameter].

syntaxArray.Params:
clippingType: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - can be one of:

* 0 - ClipVisual (could significantly reduce the size of bounding boxes on buildings)

* 1 - ClipShadow

* 2 - ClipGeometry

* 3 - ClipGeneral (same type that is used in main syntax)
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - the extreme points of the model in format [PositionRelative](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionRelative), as well as bounding box sphere diameter, to format [[xmin, ymin, zmin],[xmax, ymax, zmax], boundingSphereDiameter].

addlivestats.name: addLiveStats
addlivestats.description: Adds score to the Xbox Live Statistics score for the given unit (or the commander unit of the given vehicle). (Also available in OFPE & VBS2)

endloadingscreen.name: endLoadingScreen
endloadingscreen.description:
Finishes loading screen started by [startLoadingScreen](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/startLoadingScreen).

> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Use [BIS_fnc_endLoadingScreen](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_endLoadingScreen) to prevent potential usage conflicts.

modeltoworldvisualworld.name: modelToWorldVisualWorld
modeltoworldvisualworld.description: Converts position from object model space to world space in render time.

setnamesound.name: setNameSound
setnamesound.description:
Sets the [nameSound](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nameSound) of a person. By default, when giving orders, the units are addressed by their number. When nameSound is set, it will be used instead to address the unit. For example: "Two, hold fire!", one can have: "Miller, hold fire!".

> ⓘSee [CfgIdentities - NameSounds](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgIdentities#NameSounds) for common values.
> Note that any word from [configfile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configfile) >> "RadioProtocolENG" >> "Words" is accepted (e.g "veh_infantry_Sniper_s").

setposition.name: setPosition
setposition.description: Sets the position of a location.

handshit.name: handsHit
handshit.description: Checks if a soldier's hands are hit, which results in inaccurate aiming.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) -  
If the hands are not damaged, the returned value is 0. If the hands are hit or the unit is dead, the returned value is 1.

examples:
```sqf
? (handsHit [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) == 1) : [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [globalChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/globalChat) "Ouch! Don't shoot at my hands dammit!"
```

setwaves.name: setWaves
setwaves.description:
Changes the waves value smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.
**NOTE**: This command will have no effect (even though the value of [waves](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/waves) changes) unless Manual Override option is selected in the editor in the Intel, which is normally off.
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:setWaves.jpg)

namedproperties.name: namedProperties
namedproperties.description: Returns a list of named properties on Geometry LOD.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Arrays](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String), in format: [[namedProperty1, propertyValue1], [namedProperty2, propertyValue2], ...]

assigntoairport.name: assignToAirport
assigntoairport.description: Assigns a plane to an airport ID or object.

syntaxArray.Params:
plane: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Plane
target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Airport object. For example an aircraft carrier, see [Arma 3: Dynamic Airport Configuration](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Dynamic_Airport_Configuration)

unitaddons.name: unitAddons
unitaddons.description: Returns list with addons the unit belongs to.

syntaxArray.Params: className: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class name of a unit/vehicle or object

roadat.name: roadAt
roadat.description: Returns a road segment containing given position, [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) otherwise. Same as [isOnRoad](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isOnRoad) only returns the actual road object instead of boolean.

syntaxArray.Params: position: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or  [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) (especially on bridges) or (since Arma 3 v2.00) [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), in which case Z will be automatically deduced as the height of the road surface

examples:
```sqf
_road = roadAt [ASLToAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ASLToAGL) [getPosASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPosASL) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player);
```

```sqf
_isOnRoad = ![isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) roadAt [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player);
```
For detecting bridges, for example
```sqf
[getModelInfo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getModelInfo) (roadAt [ASLToAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ASLToAGL) [getPosASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPosASL) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)); *// ["bridgesea_01_f.p3d","a3\structures_f_exp\infrastructure\bridges\bridgesea_01_f.p3d",true]*
```

linearconversion.name: linearConversion
linearconversion.description: Converts given value from given "from" range to wanted "to" range. If clipping is set to [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), the resulting value is guaranteed to be within "to" range no matter what. > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Faster alternative to [BIS_fnc_linearConversion](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_linearConversion).

syntaxArray.Params:
minFrom: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - start "from" range
maxFrom: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - end "from" range
value: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - given value from "from" range
minTo: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - start "to" range
maxTo: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)  - end "to" range
clip (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - if [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), resulting value cannot leave "to" range

roadsconnectedto.name: roadsConnectedTo
roadsconnectedto.description:
Find the road segments connected to the given road segment.
> ⚠Pedestrian roads such as "TRAIL"s are missing connection information by design, therefore basic command will return empty array for those. Use the alternative syntax to return pedestrian roads.

syntaxArray.Params:
roadSegment: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Road segment
extended: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) When [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), performs a more thorough search on top of base behaviour, slower but returns pedestrian and other missing road segments

arrayintersect.name: arrayIntersect
arrayintersect.description: Intersects array1 with array2 returning array of unique common elements. Additionally, using the same array for array1 and array2 will simply return array of unique elements. Intersects only 1st dimension of an array.
examples:
```sqf
_arr1 = [1,2,3,4,5,2,3,4];
_arr2 = [4,5,6,1,2,3,5,6];
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) (_arr1 arrayIntersect _arr2); // [4,5,1,2,3]
```

```sqf
_arr = [1,2,3,1,2,3,1,2,3,4,5];
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) (_arr arrayIntersect _arr); // [1,2,3,4,5]
```
Remove [nils](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil):
```sqf
 [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) ([1,2,[nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil),3] arrayIntersect [1,2,[nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil),3]); // [1,2,3]
```
Also works with array elements which are [equal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo):
```sqf
 [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) ([[1],[2],[3]] arrayIntersect [[2],[3],[4]]); // [[2],[3]]
```
This command is case sensitive:
```sqf
["cAse"] arrayIntersect ["cAse"]; *// ["cAse"]*
["cAse"] arrayIntersect ["casE"]; *// []*
```

showgps.name: showGPS
showgps.description: Shows or hides the GPS receiver on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item. (default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)). > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)This command does nothing in Arma 3. Use the command [openGPS](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/openGPS) that is available since v2.04.

setmarkercolorlocal.name: setMarkerColorLocal
setmarkercolorlocal.description: Sets marker color for the given marker locally. Marker color names and their corresponding RGBA values for Arma 3 could be found in here: [CfgMarkerColors_Arma_3](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgMarkerColors_Arma_3)

setvehiclevarname.name: setVehicleVarName
setvehiclevarname.description:
Sets string representation of an object to a custom string. For example it is possible to return "MyFerrari" instead of default "ce06b00# 164274: offroad_01_unarmed_f.p3d" when querying object as string: 

```sqf
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) _offroad; //MyFerrari
```

When a vehicle is created and named in the editor, the name becomes both the variable containing the vehicle object and the string representation of the vehicle object. In scripts an extra step is needed to achieve the same effect. See [Example 1](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVehicleVarName#Example_1).

> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)This does not work with [Arma 3: Simple Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Simple_Objects).
examples:
```sqf
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) setVehicleVarName "aP";*// Change the string representation and assign it to a variable to work with*
aP = [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player);
```

```sqf
_offroad setVehicleVarName ""; *// Reset string representation to the default value*
```

allunitsuav.name: allUnitsUAV
allunitsuav.description: Return a list of all UAV vehicles.

setmarkertype.name: setMarkerType
setmarkertype.description:
Sets marker type. Marker type is a class name from [CfgMarkers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgMarkers).
> ⓘ**Multiplayer optimisation:** Global marker commands always broadcast the *entire* marker state over the network. As such, the number of network messages exchanged when creating or editing a marker can be reduced by performing all but the last operation using local marker commands, then using a global marker command for the last change (and subsequent global broadcast of all changes applied to the marker).

getelevationoffset.name: getElevationOffset
getelevationoffset.description:
Returns the map elevation offset from [map]/config.cpp.

Returns 0 if there's no elevationOffset defined in the config of the current world.

namesound.name: nameSound
namesound.description: Returns the nameSound of a person.

menuaction.name: menuAction
menuaction.description: Returns action stored in item on given path in [CT_MENU_STRIP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_MENU_STRIP) control.

waypointloiterradius.name: waypointLoiterRadius
waypointloiterradius.description: Gets the waypoint loiter radius. Waypoint uses format [Waypoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Waypoint).

profilenamespace.name: profileNamespace
profilenamespace.description:
Returns the global namespace attached to the active user profile. Use [setVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVariable) and [getVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getVariable) to save and load data to and from this [Namespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace). A variable can be deleted by setting its value to [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil). By default the variables set in this namespace will exist while the game is running and variables are saved persistently when the game is closed. Saving can also be forced by using [saveProfileNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/saveProfileNamespace).
The variables are stored next to the user profile in a file named myUsername.vars.GAMENAME.

syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (or, prior to Arma 3 v1.94, [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) if the turret is non-existent)

creatempcampaigndisplay.name: createMPCampaignDisplay
creatempcampaigndisplay.description:
Create a MP campaign display. The class name must be a mission collection declared in the configs; for example, 
```sqf
[configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "CfgMissions" >> "MPMissions" >> "Apex"
```

If the class doesn't exist or isn't a mission collection, the display will be created empty.

createdialog.name: createDialog
createdialog.description: Creates a dialog which is defined either in the mission's [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext), in the campaign's description.ext or in the global [resource.cpp](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Resource.cpp/bin). The given name has to be the class name used in one of these files. If another dialog is already opened, the desired dialog is created as a child dialog of the one already opened.

syntaxArray.Params: dialogName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Class name used in the description.ext, resource.cpp or config.cpp
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) -  [True](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) when the dialog was created successfully

controlnull.name: controlNull
controlnull.description: A non-existing [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control). To compare non-existent objects use [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) or [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) (see examples).
examples:
```sqf
[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) (_myCtrl [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) [controllNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki?title=controllNull&action=edit&redlink=1)) [then](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/then) { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "_myCtrl is null!"; };
```

```sqf
controlNull == controlNull;			*// returns [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)*
[isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) controlNull;						*// returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)*
controlNull [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) controlNull;		*// returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)*
```

```sqf
[str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) controlNull; *// No control*
```

commitoverlay.name: commitOverlay
commitoverlay.description:
Commit the current overlay. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

floor.name: floor
floor.description: Returns the next **lowest** integer in relation to the provided number.
examples:
```sqf
floor 5.1;		*// result is  5*
floor 5.999;	*// result is  5*
floor -2.01;	*// result is -3*
floor -2.99;	*// result is -3*
```

vehiclevarname.name: vehicleVarName
vehiclevarname.description: Returns the variable name that contains a primary editor reference to this object. This is the variable given in the *Insert Unit dialog / name field* in the editor. It can be changed using [setVehicleVarName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVehicleVarName).

syntaxArray.Return:
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Variable name, if none was set, 
```sqf
""
```
 is returned

markershape.name: markerShape
markershape.description: Returns the shape of given marker.

syntaxArray.Return:
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Shape of given marker. Can be return:

* "ICON"

* "RECTANGLE"

* "ELLIPSE"

* "POLYLINE" (Hand drawn markers, *since Arma 3*)

* "ERROR"

missionstart.name: missionStart
missionstart.description:
Returns date and time when mission started. Because this command returns the time of the actual start of the mission, it might not be available in *pre-init* or *init*, but is guaranteed to be available in *post-init* when 
```sqf
[time](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/time) > 0
```
.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [year, month, day, hour, minute, second] in multiplayer, which differs from [date](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/date) format only by seconds. In SP returns [0,0,0,0,0,0]

selectbestplaces.name: selectBestPlaces
selectbestplaces.description: Find the places with the maximum value of *expression* in the given area. Places can be on water. Results are sorted by value. Search pattern is randomised every command execution.

syntaxArray.Params:
position: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) or [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D)
radius: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
expression: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Arithmetic expression. Simple expression var names containing values from 0 to 1 depending on location (see also [Ambient Parameters](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Ambient_Parameters)):

* forest

* trees

* meadow

* hills

* houses

* sea

* night

* rain

* windy

* deadBody

* waterDepth

* camDepth
precision: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
sourcesCount: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - max results to return. **maximum 50**

difficultyoption.name: difficultyOption
difficultyoption.description:
Checks specific difficulty settings of the current user. Difficulty flag names can be found in the CfgDifficultyPresets config class or in 
[ArmA profile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/server.armaprofile) file under class DifficultyPresets/xxx/Options (xxx being Recruit, Regular or Veteran). This command replaces [difficultyEnabled](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabled) as many options have multiple values and former command only provided [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) return.

backpack.name: backpack
backpack.description: Returns a class of a backpack.

publicvariableclient.name: publicVariableClient
publicvariableclient.description:
Send the variable value to the client computer - same limitations regarding variable type as [publicVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/publicVariable#Description).

The Client ID is the temporary ID given to a connected client for that session. You can find out this ID with the [owner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/owner) command (using it on a player's character, for example, will give you that players client ID).

> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)In Arma 3 it is possible to broadcast [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil) value

remove3denconnection.name: remove3DENConnection

syntaxArray.Params:
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - connection class from *Cfg3DEN >> Connections*
from: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Eden Entities](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Entity) - entities which has a connection
to: [Eden Entity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Entity) - connection target

examples:
```sqf
remove3DENConnection ["RandomStart",[get3DENSelected](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/get3DENSelected) "Object","marker_0"]
```

Remove random start on marker "marker_0" from all selected objects.

set3denattributes.name: set3DENAttributes
set3denattributes.description:
Set entity [attributes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Entity_Attributes).

An attribute is identified by its property (data when it is engine-drive attribute) value in config. For the list of all attributes with their properties, see [Setting Attributes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Setting_Attributes#Attributes).

> ⚠Attributes are available only within the Eden Editor workspace. You cannot access them in scenario preview or exported scenario!

syntaxArray.Params:
entities: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of types [Eden Entity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Entity) or [Eden ID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_ID)
class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - attribute name
value: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - new attribute value

examples:
```sqf
set3DENAttributes [[[get3DENSelected](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/get3DENSelected) "Object","ControlMP",[true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) ]];
```

Set all selected objects as playable

syntaxArray.Params: layerID : [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - layer ID as returned by [add3DENLayer](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/add3DENLayer) command
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if the layer was removed successfully (i.e., correct layer ID was used)

removeweapon.name: removeWeapon
removeweapon.description:
Remove weapon from a unit. The unit must be [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) to the computer where command is executed. For a global version of this command see [removeWeaponGlobal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/removeWeaponGlobal).

**Note**: It is possible to create invalid combinations with this command (ie, attempting to remove a weapon that a unit does not possess). When doing so, application behaviour is undefined.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit or vehicle
weapon: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - weapon class name

startloadingscreen.name: startLoadingScreen

do3denaction.name: do3DENAction
do3denaction.description:
Performs given [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor) action.

See the [list of all actions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Actions).

setcenterofmass.name: setCenterOfMass
setcenterofmass.description: Changes the center of mass of an object smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero (or using the alternative syntax) means an immediate change.

syntaxArray.Params:
myObject: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[centerOfMass, time]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
centerOfMass: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [x,y,z] offset relative to the model centre
time: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - transition time, 0 for instant center of mass transfer

myObject: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
centerOfMass: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [x,y,z] offset relative to the model centre

say3d.name: say3D
say3d.description:
Unit or object will say given sound in 3D Space.
This allows broadcasting of positional music or sound from a source, without having to script a fade sound or music command.
Compare this with [say2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/say2D) which will always play a sound at the location of the player after he has been in the vicinity of a broadcasting sound.
Sound is defined in ["CfgSounds"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgSounds) of the [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext) or main config.

> ⓘYou can stop say3D sound currently playing in 2 ways:
> 
> * delete the source of the sound (from) with [deleteVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/deleteVehicle), or
> 
> * kill the source with e.g [setDamage](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setDamage).

syntaxArray.Params:
from: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - origin of the sound
sound: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - classname of the sound to be played. Defined in [CfgSounds](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgSounds) including [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext)
syntaxArray.Return: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the sound source (was [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) before Arma 3 v2.00)

syntaxArray.Syntax: from say3D [sound, maxDistance, pitch, isSpeech, offset]
syntaxArray.Params:
from: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - origin of the sound
sound: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - classname of the sound to be played. Defined in CfgSounds including [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext)
maxDistance: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 100) max distance in meter at which the sound can be heard.
pitch: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) pitch of the sound.
isSpeech: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true): play as speech, [fadeSpeech](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/fadeSpeech) applies; [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false): play as sound, [fadeSound](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/fadeSound) applies.
If [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), filters are not applied to it (i.e. house or vehicle interior one). Available since 1.91.145286
offset: [Scalar](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scalar) - (Optional, default 0) Offset in seconds. Same with [playMusic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playMusic). *Since Arma 3 v1.99.146480*
syntaxArray.Return: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the sound source (was [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) before Arma 3 v2.00)

syntaxArray.Params:
from: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - origin of the sound
to: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - target
sound: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - classname of the sound to be played. Defined in CfgSounds including [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext)
syntaxArray.Return: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the sound source (was [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) before Arma 3 v2.00)

syntaxArray.Syntax: [from, to] say3D [sound, maxDistance, pitch, isSpeech, offset]
syntaxArray.Params:
from: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - origin of the sound
to: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - target
sound: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - classname of the sound to be played. Defined in CfgSounds including [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext)
maxDistance: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 100) max distance in meter at which the sound can be heard.
pitch: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) pitch of the sound.
isSpeech: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) = play as speech ([fadeSpeech](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/fadeSpeech) applies), [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) = play as sound, [fadeSound](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/fadeSound) applies.
If [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), filters are not applied to it (i.e. house or vehicle interior one). *Since Arma 3 v1.99.145286*
offset: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) Offset in seconds. Same with [playMusic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playMusic). *Since Arma 3 v1.99.146480*
syntaxArray.Return: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the sound source (was [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) before Arma 3 v2.00)

leaderboardstate.name: leaderboardState
leaderboardstate.description: returns state of the board with given name. 0: Busy (async. operation in progress); 1: Async. operation ended with success; 2: Async. operation ended with error; 3: Invalid board (bad board name, not initialized etc.).

enabletraffic.name: enableTraffic
enabletraffic.description: Enable ambient traffic. > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)This command does nothing in Arma 3.

setformation.name: setFormation
setformation.description:
Set group formation.
Formation is one of: 

* **"COLUMN"**

* **"STAG COLUMN"**

* **"WEDGE"**

* **"ECH LEFT"**

* **"ECH RIGHT"**

* **"VEE"**

* **"LINE"**

* **"FILE"** (ArmA)

* **"DIAMOND"** (ArmA)

aimpos.name: aimPos
aimpos.description: Returns the position of the object other units can aim to.

getpilotcameradirection.name: getPilotCameraDirection
getpilotcameradirection.description: Returns model space vector of the object airplane or helicopter [pilotCamera](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/A3_Targeting_config_reference#class_pilotCamera) .

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [x,y,z] - format [Vector3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Vector3D) relative to the model centre (In a similar fashion to [PositionRelative](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionRelative)). Returns [0,0,0] if object has no [pilotCamera](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/A3_Targeting_config_reference#class_pilotCamera).

hideselection.name: hideSelection
hideselection.description: Hides or enables the given selection for the [ simple object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createSimpleObject)

syntaxArray.Params:
selection: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - simple object
[selection, hidden]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
selection: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - selection name
hidden: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to hide, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to show

isvehicleradaron.name: isVehicleRadarOn
isvehicleradaron.description: Returns true if vehicle has active sensors on.

syntaxArray.Params: vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle on which check is performed

examples:
```sqf
isVehicleRadarOn  [vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player); *// returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if radar is turned on*
```

triggerattachedvehicle.name: triggerAttachedVehicle
triggerattachedvehicle.description:
Returns vehicle attached to the trigger (for example using [triggerAttachVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/triggerAttachVehicle)).

> ⚠The trigger could be [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) or remote but the result returned by this command will be for the vehicle attached locally on the client that executed the command. See [createTrigger](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createTrigger) for more info.

tvsettooltip.name: tvSetTooltip
tvsettooltip.description: Sets the tooltip text associated with the specified tree view path.

syntaxArray.Params:
[idc, path, text]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - IDC of the tree view control.
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array containing path numbers.
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

ctrl: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
[path, text]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) -
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array containing path numbers.
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

getgroupiconparams.name: getGroupIconParams
getgroupiconparams.description: Returns group icons params used for command bar drawing such as color, text, scale, visibility, waypoint visibility, waypoint color.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [color, text, scale, visibility, WPvisibility WPcolor], where:

* color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - icon color in format [r,g,b,a]

* text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - icon text

* scale: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - icon scale

* visibility: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - icon visibility

* WPvisibility: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - waypoint visibility

* WPcolor: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - waypoint color in format [r,g,b,a]

addcuratoreditableobjects.name: addCuratorEditableObjects
addcuratoreditableobjects.description: Register objects which can be edited by a curator.

hasweapon.name: hasWeapon
hasweapon.description: Checks if a unit has the given weapon in hands or on back/in holster. Weapons inside unit containers such as vest and backpack are not counted.

syntaxArray.Params:
unitName: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
weaponName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - the name of the weapon to check for.
syntaxArray.Return:
[Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) -  
Returns true if the unit has the weapon, false if not.

vectoradd.name: vectorAdd

syntaxArray.Params:
vector1: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)
vector2: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

examples:
```sqf
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) ([velocity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/velocity) unit1 vectorAdd [velocity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/velocity) unit2);
```

```sqf
[5,10,5] vectorAdd [5,5,10]; *// returns [10,15,15]*
```

```sqf
[0,0] vectorAdd [1,-2]; *// returns [1,-2,0]*
```

isclass.name: isClass
isclass.description: Check if config entry represents config class.

objnull.name: objNull
objnull.description:
A non-existent [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object). To compare non-existent objects use [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) or [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo):

* objNull == objNull; // false

* [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) objNull; // true

* objNull [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) objNull; // true
examples:
```sqf
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) == [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player); // false if player is null
```

```sqf
[isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player); // true if player is null
```

```sqf
[str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) objNull // <NULL-object>
```

```sqf
[position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/position) objNull // [0,0,0]
```

actionkeysnamesarray.name: actionKeysNamesArray
actionkeysnamesarray.description: Returns a list of button names assigned to the given user action. You can find the action names in config class ControllerSchemes or [user action names](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Key_Actions).

syntaxArray.Params:
userAction: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Name of the action
maxKeys: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Maximum number of keys to return
inputDevicePriority: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Result sorted by inputDevicePriority with values: *Since Arma 3 v1.36*

* "Mouse"

* "Keyboard"

* "Stick"

* "Gamepad"

* "Tracker"

* "Combo" (mouse and keyboard combinations)

* "Controler"[sic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Template:sic) (any controller other than mouse or keyboard)
Other values are considered as: 

* "Unsorted"

haspilotcamera.name: hasPilotCamera
haspilotcamera.description: Returns true if the object airplane or helicopter has a [pilotCamera](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/A3_Targeting_config_reference#class_pilotCamera).

menupicture.name: menuPicture
menupicture.description: Returns picture set into item on given path.

edit3denmissionattributes.name: edit3DENMissionAttributes
