edit3denmissionattributes.description: Open a window with [scenario attribute](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Scenario_Atttributes) in given section.

addvest.name: addVest
addvest.description: Create a new vest and try to link it into vest slot.

forceatpositionrtd.name: forceAtPositionRTD
forceatpositionrtd.description:
Adds force generator to world.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

syntaxArray.Params: position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Position where to force generator is created.

posscreentoworld.name: posScreenToWorld
posscreentoworld.description: Converts map screen coordinates into world coordinates. Unlike [ctrlMapScreenToWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlMapScreenToWorld), this command returns world position is format [x, y, 0], otherwise it is identical to [ctrlMapScreenToWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlMapScreenToWorld).

syntaxArray.Params:
map : [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - map control
[x, y]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
x: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - screen X
y: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - screen Y

addmissioneventhandler.name: addMissionEventHandler
addmissioneventhandler.description:
Adds event handler (EH) attached to the current mission and returns EH handle. If EH has some data to return upon event, it is passed in _this variable. For the list of available mission event handlers see: [Arma 3: Event Handlers/addMissionEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers/addMissionEventHandler)
> ⓘSince Arma 3 v1.64 the EH handle is also stored in _thisEventHandler variable and is available during EH code execution.
> Since Arma 3 v2.03.147276 it is possible to pass additional arguments to the EH code via optional param. The arguments are stored in _thisArgs variable

syntaxArray.Params:
[event, expression, args]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
event: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - event name
expression: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - expression that will be executed in [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace) when EH fires.
args (Optional): [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - additional arguments to be passed to the EH code. Available during code execution via _thisArgs variable. *Since Arma 3 v2.03.147276*
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The index of the currently added mission event handler is returned.

getmagazinecargo.name: getMagazineCargo
getmagazinecargo.description: Returns all magazines types and count from the cargo space

actionparams.name: actionParams
actionparams.description:
Returns [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) with params for given user action id (similar to [addAction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addAction) param array). The output array is of the following format: 
[title, script, arguments, priority, showWindow, hideOnUse, shortcut, condition, radius, unconscious, textWindowBackground, textWindowForeground, selection, memoryPoint],  where:

* title: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - action title text

* script: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - script file or script expression assigned to the action

* arguments: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) or [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil) - arguments passed to the action

* priority: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - action priority on the action menu

* showWindow: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - whether the action is shown in the center of the screen too

* hideOnUse: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - whether the action menu should close after selecting the action

* shortcut: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - action bindings to some existing engine action if any

* condition: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - expression returning [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) or [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil) for action to appear on the action menu

* radius: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - max distance to entity at which action becomes available. -1 means it is engine default (~15m)

* unconscious: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - whether the action is available to [unconscious](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setUnconscious) person

* textWindowBackground: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - same as textWindowBackground in [setUserActionText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setUserActionText)

* textWindowForeground: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - same as textWindowForeground in [setUserActionText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setUserActionText)

* selection: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - named selection in Geometry LOD to which the action is attached

* memoryPoint: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - memory point on the object to which the action is attached

Since Arma 3 v1.94 if object is null or the action doesn't exist, default array of params is returned:
["","",<null>,1.5,true,true,"","",50,false,"","","",""]

syntaxArray.Params:
entity: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - entity with added user actions
id: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - id of existing user action (returned by [addAction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addAction) or [actionIDs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/actionIDs))
syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) (or, prior to Arma 3 v1.94, [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) if action doesn't exist)

cameraeffect.name: cameraEffect
cameraeffect.description:
Sets the given effect on the given camera. If you want to switch the screen directly to the first-person, aiming, third-person or group view of an object, use [switchCamera](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/switchCamera) instead. The effect type "Terminate" is used to exit the current camera view and switch back to the player's view. Does not need [camCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCommit).

Since Arma 3 v1.74, it is possible to terminate individual r2t source. For example: 
```sqf
cam cameraEffect ["terminate", "back", "rtt1"]; // would terminate "rtt1" r2t source
cam cameraEffect ["terminate", "back"]; // would terminate all r2t sources
```

> ⚠One cannot mix and match cameraEffect and can either have multiple [r2t](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/r2t) cameras or a single camera for the whole screen. If one needs a background stream overlayed with [r2t](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/r2t) streams, this could be achieved by creating an object and using [switchCamera](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/switchCamera) to switch to it for background image, while using cameraEffect for [r2t](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/r2t) overlay (see Example 4)

syntaxArray.Params:
camera: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object of type "camera"
[effectName, effectPosition, r2tName]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
effectName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - the effect type (defined in main config or [CfgCameraEffects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgCameraEffects) >> Array). Defaults are: "Internal", "External", "Fixed", "FixedWithZoom", "Terminate"
effectPosition: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - position of the effect. One of: "TOP", "LEFT", "RIGHT", "FRONT", "BACK", "LEFT FRONT", "RIGHT FRONT", "LEFT BACK", "RIGHT BACK", "LEFT TOP", "RIGHT TOP", "FRONT TOP", "BACK TOP", "BOTTOM". These are usually used with "Fixed" and "FixedWithZoom" effect types. If not sure which position to use, set it to "BACK";
r2tName (Optional): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [Render To Texture](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Procedural_Textures#Render_To_Texture) surface reference

camcreate.name: camCreate
camcreate.description:
Create a camera or a seagull object on the given position. The creation happens immediately and doesn't wait for [camCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCommit).
Among other commands, [cameraEffect](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cameraEffect) must be used to enter the camera's view and [camDestroy](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camDestroy) to delete the created camera. See also [Camera Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Command_Group:_Camera_Control).
> ⚠
> 
> * Other objects can be created this way, but vehicles created with camCreate cannot be entered
> 
> * Any unit created with camCreate will remain static
> 
> * Unlike [createVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createVehicle), objects are created exactly at the given position, without consideration of the surrounding objects

syntaxArray.Params:
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - camera type, one of the following:

* "camera"

* "seagull" (a crow in Arma 2)

* "camconstruct"

* "camcurator" (Since Arma 3 Zeus)

* "crowe" (crow - Arma 3)

* or any vehicle class suitable to be spawned with cam
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) - position to create the object at

getresolution.name: getResolution
getresolution.description:
Returns an array containing all information about current client screen resolution.

> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)**Render resolution** is not returned by this command.
> A sampling setting of **50%** means half of native width *and* half of native height, resulting in a render resolution of ***25%*** the original resolution.
> ⚠The engine default value for fovTop is **0.75** in case it is needed to calculate difference with custom FOV.
> ⓘThe aspectRatio is calculated as fovLeft / fovTop and should be the same as screenW / screenH for undistorted image if the FOV is custom. Some of the common values:
> 
> 
> 16/9
> 16/10
> 5/4
> 4/3
> 16/9 triple screen
> 
> 
> 1.777777(…)
> 1.6
> 1.25
> 1.333333(…)
> 5.333333(…)
>

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [screenW, screenH, viewPortW, viewPortH, aspectRatio, uiScale, fovTop, fovLeft, tripleHead]

* screenW: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - width of the screen in pixels

* screenH: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - height of the screen in pixels

* viewPortW: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - width of the **4:3** view port in pixels

* viewPortH: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - height of the **4:3** view port in pixels

* aspectRatio: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - screen aspect ratio

* uiScale: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - the scale of the UI, which affects view port size:

Arma 3


Very Small
Small
Normal
Large
Very Large


0.47
0.55
0.7
0.85
1


* fovTop: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - vertical FOV in [ radians](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/rad), the same as fovTop value from the user profile (*since Arma 3 v1.94.145947*)

* fovLeft: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - horizontal FOV in [ radians](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/rad), the same asfovLeft value from the user profile (*since Arma 3 v1.94.145947*)

* tripleHead: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if user has triple head screen (see also [safeZoneXAbs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/safeZoneXAbs), [safeZoneWAbs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/safeZoneWAbs)) (*since Arma 3 v1.94.145947*)

examples:
```sqf
_res = getResolution; *// a 16/9 single monitor setup*
```


```sqf
[
	1360,		*// width*
	768,		*// height*
	867,		*// 2D viewport width*
	653,		*// 2D viewport height*
	1.77778,	*// aspect ratio*
	0.85		*// UI scale*
]
```

```sqf
_res = getResolution;  *// dedicated server*
```


```sqf
[
	160,		*// width*
	120,		*// height*
	136,		*// 2D viewport width*
	102,		*// 2D viewport height*
	1.33333,	*// aspect ratio*
	0.85		*// UI scale*
]
```

```sqf
_res = getResolution; *// a triple 16/9 monitor setup*
```


```sqf
[
	5760,		*// width*
	1080,		*// height*
	792,		*// 2D viewport width*
	594,		*// 2D viewport height*
	5.33333,	*// aspect ratio*
	0.55		*// UI scale*
]
```
*since Arma 3 v1.94.145947*:
```sqf
_res = getResolution; *// 16/9 monitor setup*
```


```sqf
[
	1920,		*// width*
	1080,		*// height*
	792,		*// 2D viewport width*
	594,		*// 2D viewport height*
	1.77778,	*// aspect ratio*
	0.55,		*// UI scale*
	0.75,		*// fovTop*
	1.33333,	*// fovLeft*
	false		*// tripleHead*
]
```

terrainintersectatasl.name: terrainIntersectAtASL
terrainintersectatasl.description: Checks for intersection of terrain between two ASL positions. Same as [terrainIntersectASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/terrainIntersectASL), only returns intersect position instead of [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

syntaxArray.Params:
[pos1, pos2]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
pos1: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - start position in format [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL)
pos2: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - end position in format [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL)

removehandgunitem.name: removeHandgunItem
removehandgunitem.description: Removes given weapon item, including magazine, from the [handgunWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/handgunWeapon)

priority.name: priority
priority.description: Return the priority of the task.

tvsetcolor.name: tvSetColor
tvsetcolor.description: Sets text color on given Tree View Item

syntaxArray.Params:
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [Tree View Path](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Tree_View_Path) of the item
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Item text color

control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [Tree View Path](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Tree_View_Path) of the item
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - item text color in format [r,g,b,a]

findemptypositionready.name: findEmptyPositionReady
findemptypositionready.description:
Preloads area to be used with [findEmptyPosition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findEmptyPosition) command and returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) when area is ready. The size of the area preloaded is from center - radius - maxDistance to center + radius + maxDistance
> ⚠Preloading large areas may take a long time, we are talking minutes. However once preloaded, it stays preloaded even after mission restart

syntaxArray.Params:
center: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Search area center position in format [x,y] or [x,y,z] in which case z is ignored. Accepts [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) or [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D)
[radius, maxDistance]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) -
radius: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - distance from the center
maxDistance: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - distance from the end of radius

taskhint.name: taskHint
taskhint.description:
Shows info about new, changed or failed task. The text can contain several lines. \n is used to set a line return.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)It is recommended to use [BIS_fnc_showNotification](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_showNotification) in order to maintain Arma 3's visual style.

syntaxArray.Params:
[text, colour, icon]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
colour: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color)
icon: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - one of:

* "taskNew"

* "taskCurrent"

* "taskDone"

* "taskFailed"

getposasl.name: getPosASL
getposasl.description: Returns the object position height above sea level.

setwaypointhouseposition.name: setWaypointHousePosition
setwaypointhouseposition.description: For waypoints attached to a house, this defines the target [buildingPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/buildingPos) index.

ctrlsetscale.name: ctrlSetScale
ctrlsetscale.description: Sets scale of a control. Top left corner remains same. This command requires [ctrlCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlCommit).

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
scale: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Scale e.g. 2 = 200% in size

didjip.name: didJIP
didjip.description: Checks if the current client Joined In Progress.

unitcombatmode.name: unitCombatMode
unitcombatmode.description: Gets individual unit's [combat mode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Combat_Modes). For more information see [setUnitCombatMode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setUnitCombatMode).

getterraingrid.name: getTerrainGrid
getterraingrid.description: A getter for [setTerrainGrid](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setTerrainGrid), returns the current terrain grid.

unitready.name: unitReady
unitready.description: Check if the unit is ready. Unit is busy when it is given some command like [move](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/move), until the command is finished.

vectorup.name: vectorUp
vectorup.description: Returns up vector of the given object in format [Vector3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Vector3D).

allturrets.name: allTurrets
allturrets.description:
Returns array of available turret paths from vehicle object.

> ⓘ
> 
> * to look up turrets from config, use [BIS_fnc_allTurrets](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_allTurrets)
> 
> * to get config from turret path use [BIS_fnc_turretConfig](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_turretConfig)

syntaxArray.Params:
[vehicle, includeFFV]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
includeFFV: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to include FFV (Firing From Vehicle) positions, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to exclude them

examples:
```sqf
_turretPaths = allTurrets _mySlammerUP;				*// [[0],[0,0]]*
_turretPaths = allTurrets [_mySlammerUP, [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)];		*// [[0],[0,0]] <- Commander turret is also an FFV turret*
_turretPaths = allTurrets [_mySlammerUP, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)];	*// [[0]]*
```
Return FFV turrets only:

```sqf
_FFVTurrets = allTurrets [tank, [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)] - allTurrets [tank, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)]; 
```

counttype.name: countType
counttype.description: Count how many objects in the array are of given type. This command also works with parent classes like "Air", "Tank", and "Car". For a full class reference see [Classes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgVehicles).

syntaxArray.Params:
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class type
objects: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array of [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

lbcolorright.name: lbColorRight
lbcolorright.description:
Returns the text color of the item (right) with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user [dialog](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/dialog).

The color is returned in format [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color).

allcontrols.name: allControls
allcontrols.description: Returns a list of all controls for desired existing display. Returned controls also include controls from [CT_CONTROLS_GROUPs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CONTROLS_GROUP).

buildingexit.name: buildingExit
buildingexit.description: Returns the given indexed exit in a building. The returned value is in format Position.

vehicles.name: vehicles
vehicles.description: Returns an array of all vehicles available to current client. This command returns both empty and crewed vehicles but not soldiers. It will also return "WeaponHolderSimulated" of dead bodies (weapon on the ground). Vehicles created with [createVehicleLocal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createVehicleLocal) will only be returned on the client that created them.

admin.name: admin
admin.description:
This is dedicated server command, which queries the admin state of any client on the network by their client ([owner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/owner)) id. Possible results are:

* 1 - client is admin that is [voted in](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/server.cfg#Voted_In_Admin)

* 2 - client is admin that is [logged in](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/server.cfg#Logged_In_Admin)
In all other cases it returns 0. To self check the admin state of a local client, use [BIS_fnc_admin](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_admin).

syntaxArray.Return:
[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - admin state of given client:

* 0 - client is not an admin

* 1 - client is admin that is voted in

* 2 - client is admin that is logged in

setwppos.name: setWPPos
setwppos.description:
Sets waypoint position 
> ⓘThis command is identical to [setWaypointPosition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setWaypointPosition) [pos, -1] (see command description for more info)

setunitrank.name: setUnitRank
setunitrank.description:
Sets rank of given unit.

Possible rank values, and the associated [rating](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/rating) that is automatically given:


Rank
Ratings


ArmA 1
Arma 2
Arma 3


PRIVATE
0
?
0


CORPORAL
500
?
0


SERGEANT
1500
?
0


LIEUTENANT
2500
?
0


CAPTAIN
3500
?
0


MAJOR
5000
?
0


COLONEL
7500
?
0

> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Since Arma 3 v1.67 this command is [GAGlobal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Locality) [GEGlobal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Locality)

commandartilleryfire.name: commandArtilleryFire
commandartilleryfire.description: Orders an artillery unit to fire a burst on the given position (via the radio).

getobjectfov.name: getObjectFOV
getobjectfov.description:
Returns Field of View of the given object in [radians](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/rad). Static objects return default value, which is 1. FOV of [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) is 0. Object FOV is indirectly connected with optics magnification or player view zoom, the narrower the angle the greater the zoom.
> ⓘThe FOV returned by this command doesn't change if user has custom FOV set in profile. Use it in combination with [getResolution](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getResolution) to adjust for the difference if required.

syntaxArray.Params: object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - for units it queries unit weapon optics/zoom, for vehicles - vehicle optics/zoom

throw.name: throw
throw.description:
Throws an exception. The exception is processed by first [catch](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/catch) block. This command will terminate further execution of the code.

> ⚠Avoid using alternative shorthand syntax if you are planning on preparing your exception information dynamically, as it will have to be generated first regardless of the condition of the [if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) statement before it, as shown in Example 3.

syntaxArray.Params:
if (condition): [If Type](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/If_Type)  - if (condition) returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), "exception" is thrown
exception: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - value that will be put into *_exception* variable inside [catch](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/catch) block

create3dencomposition.name: create3DENComposition
create3dencomposition.description: Create new [Composition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Composition). To create individual entities, use [create3DENEntity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/create3DENEntity).

syntaxArray.Params:
configPath: [Config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config) - path to *CfgGroups* class of a composition
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position)

createmissiondisplay.name: createMissionDisplay
createmissiondisplay.description: Create single missions display as a child of given display. The mission dialog will be set to the directory given as an argument "root".

syntaxArray.Params:
display : [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display)
missionRootDirectoryString: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - root direction from \Arma 3\Missions\ROOT
cfgMissionsClass: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - cfgMissions class to use

collectivertd.name: collectiveRTD
collectivertd.description:
Returns the current position of a helicopter's collective pitch control.

* 0: fully lowered

* 1: fully raised
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

getmissionconfig.name: getMissionConfig
getmissionconfig.description:
Returns [Config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config) entry for the given scenario attribute from the 1st tier. The attribute can be config class or config property. If it is defined in multiple places, the command checks them in the following order:

* External *[Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext)* file

* [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Scenario_Atttributes) scenario attribute
So if attribute exists in both places, attribute from [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext) is used. Previously, scenario attributes were extracted from *Description.ext* using [missionConfigFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionConfigFile). That still works, but it ignores attributes set directly in the editor and it should not be used anymore.
examples:
```sqf
_header = getMissionConfig "Header"
```

Returns scenario header config. Replaces the previous approach which would scan only the external *Description.ext* file, but ignore the value set in the Eden Editor:

```sqf
_header = [missionConfigFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionConfigFile) >> "Header"; // Old approach
```

disabledebriefingstats.name: disableDebriefingStats
disabledebriefingstats.description:
Disable debriefing score table.
> ⚠This command is broken.

getsteamfriendsservers.name: getSteamFriendsServers
getsteamfriendsservers.description: Returns servers information of Steam friends currently playing the game.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) if *preserveElevation* is [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) or [x, y, **0**] if *preserveElevation* is [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)

vehiclereceiveremotetargets.name: vehicleReceiveRemoteTargets
vehiclereceiveremotetargets.description: Gets whether the vehicle can acquire targets via datalink from the [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) center.

ceil.name: ceil
examples:
```sqf
ceil 5.25; *// Result is 6*
```

```sqf
ceil [-](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/-)5.25; *// Result is -5*
```

ctrlsetstructuredtext.name: ctrlSetStructuredText
ctrlsetstructuredtext.description: Set the [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) which will be displayed in [structured text control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DialogControls-Text#CT_STRUCTURED_TEXT.3D13).

addtoremainscollector.name: addToRemainsCollector
addtoremainscollector.description: Adds an array of vehicles/units to disposal manager for automatic wreck/body removal. The disposal manager follows wreck/body removal values set in [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext)

vectordiff.name: vectorDiff
vectordiff.description: Subtracts one 3D vector from another. (vector1 - vector2)

syntaxArray.Params:
vector1: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)
vector2: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

getfieldmanualstartpage.name: getFieldManualStartPage
getfieldmanualstartpage.description: Returns array of the starting topic and hint the given field manual should display.

assignasdriver.name: assignAsDriver
assignasdriver.description: Assign a unit as driver of a vehicle. Used together with [orderGetIn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/orderGetIn) to order subordinate units to get in as driver of a specific vehicle. Before usage of this command a subordinate unit has not got the option to get into the driver place of the vehicle.

addbackpackglobal.name: addBackpackGlobal
addbackpackglobal.description:
Adds a backpack to a unit (even non-local).
> ⚠Beware, the backpack added with this command will be created on the PC [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) to the unit you are adding it to, even if executed on the server. Because of this, if non-local unit is the target and one tries to immediately access added backpack, the backpack returned will be [ Null](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull). When adding backpack dynamically to a remote unit, wait until backpack is added (See Example 2)

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - soldier
backpack: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - backpack class name

allsimpleobjects.name: allSimpleObjects
allsimpleobjects.description:
Returns array of all simple objects that belong to the listed class names. If the array of types is empty [], all simple objects are returned including those without class name.
> ⓘ
> 
> * There is no inheritance in simple objects, so only exact class match is allowed.
> 
> * *className* is not case sensitive.

syntaxArray.Params: classes: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - classnames array. Use [] to return all simple objects

add3deneventhandler.name: add3DENEventHandler
add3deneventhandler.description:
Add code to be run when a [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor) event is triggered.

See the list of all [Eden Editor Event Handlers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers:_Eden_Editor).

ctrlsetfocus.name: ctrlSetFocus
ctrlsetfocus.description: Sets the input focus on given control.

ctrlsetfade.name: ctrlSetFade
ctrlsetfade.description: Sets wanted transparency for control animation. Requires [ctrlCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlCommit) to commit changes. To hide or show a control instantly, use [ctrlShow](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlShow).

lnbcolor.name: lnbColor
lnbcolor.description: Returns the text color of the item with the given position of the 2D listbox. The color is returned in format [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color).

removefromremainscollector.name: removeFromRemainsCollector
removefromremainscollector.description: Removes vehicles/units from the garbage collector, so they do not get deleted automatically; added earlier with [addToRemainsCollector](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addToRemainsCollector)

ctrlsetfonth5.name: ctrlSetFontH5
ctrlsetfonth5.description: Sets H5 font of given HTML control.

ctrlsetbackgroundcolor.name: ctrlSetBackgroundColor
ctrlsetbackgroundcolor.description:
Sets background color of given control. Only affects:

* [CT_COMBO](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_COMBO)

* [CT_STATIC](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_STATIC)

* [CT_STRUCTURED_TEXT](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_STRUCTURED_TEXT)

* [CT_MAP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_MAP)

* [CT_MAP_MAIN](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_MAP_MAIN)

* [CT_BUTTON](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_BUTTON) *since Arma 3 v2.01*

* [CT_SHORTCUTBUTTON](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_SHORTCUTBUTTON) *since Arma 3 v2.01*

* [CT_ACTIVETEXT](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_ACTIVETEXT) *since Arma 3 v2.01*

missionname.name: missionName
missionname.description: Return currently loaded mission file (path to mission.pbo, relative to game exe).

setcamerainterest.name: setCameraInterest
setcamerainterest.description: Set camera interest for given entity. Camera interest is by default 0. Any unit which is speaking has its camera interest raised to 50. Camera interest is used to focus camera to control depth of field in cutscenes. Combination of camera interest, unit position of the screen, unit movement, unit type, and some other properties is used to determine which unit to focus at. Higher camera interest increases the chance of the unit being focused.

secondaryweaponitems.name: secondaryWeaponItems
secondaryweaponitems.description: Returns array with all items assigned to the [secondaryWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/secondaryWeapon) except magazines. Use [secondaryWeaponMagazine](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/secondaryWeaponMagazine) command for the latter. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

sethitpointdamage.name: setHitPointDamage
sethitpointdamage.description:
Set the current level of damage for a specific Hit Point (specified by its config class).

* 0: no damage

* 1: full damage
See also [BIS_fnc_setHitPointDamage](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_setHitPointDamage) for setting hit with dependency

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle : [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle to be damaged
[hitPointName, damage]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
hitPointName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the Hit Point class
damage: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - level of damage
useEffects (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to skip destruction effects *Since Arma 3 v1.67*

primaryweaponmagazine.name: primaryWeaponMagazine
primaryweaponmagazine.description: Collects all loaded [magazines](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/magazines) from all [primaryWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/primaryWeapon) muzzles and returns them in [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), otherwise it returns []. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

primaryweapon.name: primaryWeapon
primaryweapon.description: Returns name of unit's primary weapon. This command will also return a weapon class name if the weapon is not used by the player, for example, it is on the unit's back. Use [currentWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/currentWeapon) to get the weapon the unit is using.

syntaxArray.Return:
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Weapon class name or 
```sqf
""
```
 if no primary weapon

addgroupicon.name: addGroupIcon
addgroupicon.description: Adds icon to a group leader. Returns icon ID, Control icons visibility with [setGroupIconsVisible](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setGroupIconsVisible).

syntaxArray.Params:
group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - group to add icon to
[iconClass, offset] - [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
iconClass: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class name of an icon from CfgGroupIcons
offset (Optional): [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - X and Y offsets of the icon in form [offsetX, offsetY]

oncommandmodechanged.name: onCommandModeChanged
oncommandmodechanged.description:
Defines code performed when hc command mode changes either because of (Left Ctrl + Space) shortcut or [hcShowBar](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hcShowBar) scripting command. Groups hc mode must contain at least one group for this command to work (see [High Command](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/High_Command)). Attached code receives *_isHighCommand* boolean. 
> ⓘSince **Arma 3** *v1.57* a stackable version of this EH is available: [CommandModeChanged](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers/addMissionEventHandler#CommandModeChanged)

airportside.name: airportSide
airportside.description:
Gets the side of an airport, set by [setAirportSide](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setAirportSide). Default side is [sideUnknown](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideUnknown).
> ⓘSee [Arma: Airport IDs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma:_Airport_IDs) for a list of airport ids.

difficulty.name: difficulty
difficulty.description:
Returns high-level selected difficulty mode.   

Returned value will be: 0 (Recruit), 1 (Regular), 2 (Veteran) or 3 (Elite)
examples:
```sqf
value = difficulty;
```
The command returns the index of selected difficulty as they appear in *CfgDifficulties*
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:Difficulty.jpg)

```sqf
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) difficulty; //Result: 4
```

isbleeding.name: isBleeding
isbleeding.description: Returns whether the unit is bleeding.

servercommand.name: serverCommand
servercommand.description:
Executes the given [server command](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Server_Commands).

* Available commands for execution can be found with [serverCommandAvailable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/serverCommandAvailable).

* Commands that can be executed can be found with [serverCommandExecutable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/serverCommandExecutable).

syntaxArray.Params:
password : [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - password defined in [server.cfg](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/server.cfg) with serverCommandPassword param
command : [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - server command

setcuratoreditingareatype.name: setCuratorEditingAreaType
setcuratoreditingareatype.description: Set whether curator can edit in all editing areas (true) or outside of them (false).

showradio.name: showRadio
showradio.description:
Shows or hides the radio on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item. (default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)).
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)This command exists in Arma 3 but doesn't do much!

setcuratorwaypointcost.name: setCuratorWaypointCost
setcuratorwaypointcost.description: Sets cost of waypoints (used for placing, editing and deleting).

syntaxArray.Params:
group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)
[id, icon, offset] : [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
id: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The icon ID returned by [addGroupIcon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addGroupIcon)
icon: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Class name of desired icon from CfgGroupIcons
offset: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) (Optional) - X and Y offsets of the icon in form [offsetX, offsetY]

setdir.name: setDir
setdir.description: Sets object heading. Angles are measured in degrees clockwise from north; the regular range goes from 0 to 360 (0° = N, 90° = E, 180° = S, 270° = W). Negative angles represent counter-clockwise angles.
examples:
```sqf
MyUnit setDir 45; *// Will set MyUnit to face North-East*
```

```sqf
MyUnit setDir -675; *// Will also set MyUnit to face North-East (= 45-360-360)*
```

```sqf
MyUnit setDir 30;
MyUnit [setFormDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setFormDir) 30; *// Needed for AI to keep the given direction*
```

setbehaviourstrong.name: setBehaviourStrong
setbehaviourstrong.description:
Sets individual unit behaviour on every unit in a group and additionally tries to force this behaviour to the unit's group. Alternatively see [setCombatBehaviour](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setCombatBehaviour). Behaviour is one of: 

* "CARELESS"

* "SAFE"

* "AWARE"

* "COMBAT"

* "STEALTH".
> ⓘSee [AI Behaviour](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/AI_Behaviour) for details of the effect of this command on AI units.

syntaxArray.Params:
groupName: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit from the group
behaviour: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

setidentity.name: setIdentity
setidentity.description:
Sets identity of a person. The identities could be defined in a custom config in [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgIdentities) or in the main config. For a list of available main config values see [CfgIdentities](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgIdentities).
 
This command is an aggregate of the following commands: [setName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setName), [setFace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setFace), [setSpeaker](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setSpeaker), [setNameSound](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setNameSound), [setPitch](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPitch), only the values are loaded from the given config. It also includes value for glasses for which currently there is no direct command, instead there is an inventory command [addGoggles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addGoggles).

syntaxArray.Params:
person: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit to which the identity will be applied
identity: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the subclass in [CfgIdentities](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgIdentities)

alive.name: alive
alive.description:
Check if given vehicle/person/building is alive (i.e. not dead or destroyed).
> ⓘ
> ```sqf
> alive [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) *// returns [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)*
> ```
>

isabletobreathe.name: isAbleToBreathe
isabletobreathe.description: If unit is diving and doesn't have a re-breather, it returns [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false). Diving means the unit's head is underwater. If unit is underwater and has a re-breather, the command returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true).

localnamespace.name: localNamespace
localnamespace.description: Returns local [Namespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace) attached to the mission. Has the same lifetime as [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace) but variables **cannot be broadcasted** out of or into this namespace in multiplayer and will not be serialized when game is saved. UI variables can be safely stored in this namespace. Use [allVariables](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/allVariables) command to save the variables elsewhere if required.

settitleeffect.name: setTitleEffect
settitleeffect.description:
Defines the title effect to show on activation via [Type, Effect, Text] where

'Type' can be 

* "NONE"

* "OBJECT"

* 'Text' defines the shown object , a subclass of CfgTitles (see [cutObj](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cutObj))

* 'Effect' defines [Title Effect Type](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Title_Effect_Type)

* "RES"

* 'Text' defines a resource class, a subclass of RscTitles (see [cutRsc](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cutRsc))

* 'Effect' defines [Title Effect Type](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Title_Effect_Type)

* "TEXT"

* 'Text' defines text string to show (see [cutText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cutText))

* 'Effect' defines [Title Effect Type](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Title_Effect_Type)

The title effect does not disappear on deactivation, this should be done manually if required.

syntaxArray.Params:
trigger: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[type, effect, text]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of strings. See above

waypoint: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [Waypoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Waypoint)
[type, effect, text]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of strings. See above

failmission.name: failMission
failmission.description:
Finish the mission. If the server is set to run persistent mission, failMission will not end the mission when last player gets kicked to the lobby. Use [endMission](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/endMission) to end the mission.

The end type can be:

* "CONTINUE"

* "KILLED"

* "LOSER"

* "END1"

* "END2"

* "END3"

* "END4"

* "END5"

* "END6"

**Mission saves won't be deleted**.

> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)To maintain Arma 3 visual style, it is recommended to use [BIS_fnc_endMission](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_endMission) instead.

ctrlangle.name: ctrlAngle
ctrlangle.description: Gets rotation info of an ST_PICTURE control.

setvehicletipars.name: setVehicleTIPars
setvehicletipars.description:
Sets the "heat" state of different vehicle parts for Thermal Imaging detection. This allows simulation of heated up parts of a vehicle without it actually having to utilize them - on a range from 0 to 1, 0 being cold, 1 being hot.
> ⓘThis command does not work on infantry weapons.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Vehicle whose components are manipulated
[engine, wheels, weapon]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
engine: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - engine and body's heat
wheels: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - tracks/wheels' heat
weapon: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - main weapon's heat

examples:
```sqf
[vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) setVehicleTIPars [1, 1, 1];			*// set all parts hot*
[vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) setVehicleTIPars [0, 0, 0];			*// set all parts cold*
[vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) setVehicleTIPars [0.5, 0.5, 0.5];	*// set all parts warm*

```

```sqf
[vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) setVehicleTIPars [1, 0, 0]; *// set the engine warm, perfect for winter*
```

fog.name: fog
fog.description: A getter for [setFog](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setFog). Returns the current value of the fog in range 0...1.

getwingsorientationrtd.name: getWingsOrientationRTD
getwingsorientationrtd.description: Returns orientation of horizontal stabilizers.> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

weaponaccessoriescargo.name: weaponAccessoriesCargo
weaponaccessoriescargo.description:
Returns array with all items assigned to the given weapon in given cargo container.
> ⚠This is unofficial documentation. All Information here is as it exists in the Engine. It might not reflect the reality.

syntaxArray.Params:
container: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - cargo container
[weaponId, creatorId]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
weaponId: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
creatorId: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

lineintersectssurfaces.name: lineIntersectsSurfaces
lineintersectssurfaces.description:
Returns list of intersections with surfaces from *begPosASL* to *endPosASL*. If there is ground intersection, it is also included. Works on units. Works underwater. Doesn't return intersection with sea surface. Hardcoded max distance: 5000m. By default, for speed purposes, command will return only 1st intersection with unique objects. Since Arma 3 v1.70, this could be tweaked with an optional param. 
> ⓘIf *begPosASL* is under the ground and *endPosASL* is above it, the command will only return intersection with the ground, this is engine limitation and none of the intersectXXX commands will work when initiated from under the ground.
Since Arma v1.52 it is possible to indicate primary and secondary [LOD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/LOD) to look for intersection. Available options are:


* "FIRE"

* "VIEW"

* "GEOM"

* "IFIRE" - ("I" stands for Indirect, practically the same as FIRE)

* "NONE"

* "PHYSX" - PhysX geometry LOD (since Arma 3 v2.01.146666)
Default [LODs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/LOD) are "VIEW" and "FIRE"

> ⚠Only a single LOD is checked for intersection. LOD1 is Primary LOD and will be checked first. LOD2 is Secondary LOD. If LOD1 is not possible to check, LOD2 will be used.

syntaxArray.Syntax: **lineIntersectsSurfaces** [begPosASL, endPosASL, ignoreObj1, ignoreObj2, sortMode, maxResults, LOD1, LOD2, returnUnique]
syntaxArray.Params:
[begPosASL, endPosASL, ignoreObj1, ignoreObj2, sortMode, maxResults, LOD1, LOD2]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
begPosASL: [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) - virtual line start
endPosASL: [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) - virtual line end
ignoreObj1 (Optional): [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - first object to ignore or [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull): Default: [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull)
ignoreObj2 (Optional): [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - second object to ignore or [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull): Default: [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull)
sortMode (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true): closest to furthest, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false): furthest to closest. Default: [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)
maxResults (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Max results to return. -1 to return every result. Default: 1
LOD1 (Optional): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) (added in v1.52) - Primary [LOD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/LOD) to look for intersection. Default: "VIEW"
LOD2 (Optional): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) (added in v1.52) - Secondary [LOD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/LOD) to look for intersection. Default: "FIRE"
returnUnique (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (added in v1.70) - When [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), all intersections in the same object are included not just the 1st one. Default: [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of intersections in format [[intersectPosASL, surfaceNormal, intersectObj, parentObject],...] where:

* intersectPosASL - the actual position where line intersects surface

* [surfaceNormal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/surfaceNormal) - a normal to the intersected surface

* intersectObject - the object the surface belongs to (could be proxy object) - [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) if terrain

* parentObject - the object proxy object belongs to (not always the same as intersect object) - objNull if terrain

position.name: position
position.description: Returns position of an object (alias of [getPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPos)) or location (alias of [locationPosition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/locationPosition)).

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [x,y,z], where z is -1 * [getTerrainHeightASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getTerrainHeightASL) at the location

assignitem.name: assignItem
assignitem.description: Assigns existing item from inventory (uniform, vest, backpack) to a correct slot. If the slot is occupied by another item, it gets replaced.

setflagowner.name: setFlagOwner
setflagowner.description: Sets flag owner. When owner is set to [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) or any object other than a unit of class [man](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Models_%26_Classnames:_CfgVehicles_-_Class_Man) or [logic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Game_Logic), flag is returned to the flagpole. A flag owned by a logic has no visual representation.

vectorlinearconversion.name: vectorLinearConversion
vectorlinearconversion.description: Interpolates vector between the given "vectorFrom" and "vectorTo" value according to the given range value

syntaxArray.Syntax: vectorLinearConversion [rangeFrom, rangeTo, rangeValue, vectorFrom, vectorTo, clip]
syntaxArray.Params:
[rangeFrom, rangeTo, rangeValue, vectorFrom, vectorTo, clip]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
rangeFrom: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - start "from" range
rangeTo: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - end "to" range
rangeValue: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - variable range value
vectorFrom: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - start "from" vector
vectorTo: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - end "to" vector
clip (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - if [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), range value will be clipped to stay within "from" - "to" range. Default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)

setsuppression.name: setSuppression
setsuppression.description:
Sets the given suppression value for the given unit. The value range is from 0 to 1.   
> ⚠The unit must not be [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull), must be [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) and [alive](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/alive)

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
value: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - suppression value from 0 to 1

useaudiotimeformoves.name: useAudioTimeForMoves
useaudiotimeformoves.description: Switch between elapsed game time and audio time being used as animation timer. Used for audio/animation synchronization.

setstatvalue.name: setStatValue
setstatvalue.description:
Sets a value to a given stat. 
A list of possible StatNames can be found here: [Arma 3: Stat Names](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Stat_Names)
Its important to note that most Stats are restricted to scripts and missions in certain paths.
For example "ExpWarlockDown" is restricted to scripts in any subdirectory of "a3\Missions_F_Exp\Campaign\Missions\"
examples:
```sqf
setStatValue ["ExpWarlockDown", 1]; *// Unlocks the "Warlock Down" Steam achivement*
```

getrepaircargo.name: getRepairCargo
getrepaircargo.description:
Returns the amount (1 is full) of repair resources in the cargo space of a repair vehicle. 
> ⓘSince Arma 3 v1.96 the return value for vehicles that are not configured to have ability to repair other vehicles is -1. (Prior to that the value was negative infinity)

syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - repair cargo value, -1 if repair cargo is not supported, 0 if the vehicle is ![alive](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/alive) or [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull)

join.name: join
join.description:
Maximum number ofunits per group


Operation Flashpoint
12


Armed Assault
144


Arma 2
?


Arma 3
3000+

Join all units in the array to given group. 

To have a group member leave a group, join him with the [grpNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/grpNull) group (e.g. [guy1] join [grpNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/grpNull)), but **beware**, as brand new group is created for the leaving unit and this could result in the number of groups in a mission growing out of control.

syntaxArray.Params:
unitArray: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - units to join group
group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

skillfinal.name: skillFinal
skillfinal.description: Returns final, recalculated sub skill value of given unit. (with regard to AI Level coefficient (Difficulty settings)).

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
skillName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - See [sub-skill](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/AI_Sub-skills). Possible values are:

* "aimingAccuracy"

* "aimingShake"

* "aimingSpeed"

* "endurance" (Has no effect in Arma 3)

* "spotDistance"

* "spotTime"

* "courage"

* "reloadSpeed"

* "commanding"

* "general"

setcurrenttask.name: setCurrentTask
setcurrenttask.description: Set the task as a current task of the person.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the unit having the task
task: [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task) - the task you want to select

setsimpletaskdestination.name: setSimpleTaskDestination
setsimpletaskdestination.description: Attach a destination to the simple task.Overrides [setSimpleTaskTarget](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setSimpleTaskTarget)

addhandgunitem.name: addHandgunItem
addhandgunitem.description: Adds weapon item, including magazine, directly to the [handgunWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/handgunWeapon). This is used for infantry weapons.

isweapondeployed.name: isWeaponDeployed
isweapondeployed.description: Returns true if weapon is currently deployed.

skill.name: skill
skill.description: Returns current skill of a unit, in range between 0 to 1, 1 being the highest level of skill.

syntaxArray.Syntax: unitName skill skillName *Since Armed Assault v1.00*

selectnoplayer.name: selectNoPlayer
selectnoplayer.description: Switches player to no unit, makes [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) return [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull). SP only, the command is completely ignored in MP.
examples:
Single player:

```sqf
selectNoPlayer;
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player); //<NULL-object>
```

Rough multiplayer emulation:

```sqf
_noPlayer = [createGroup](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createGroup) [sideLogic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideLogic) [createUnit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createUnit) [
	"Logic",
	[0,0,1000],
	[],
	0,
	"NONE"
];
[selectPlayer](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/selectPlayer) _noPlayer;
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player); //L Charlie 4-3:1 (KK)
```

menucollapse.name: menuCollapse
menucollapse.description: Collapses item on given path and all its children.

setmissiletargetpos.name: setMissileTargetPos
setmissiletargetpos.description:
Sets a guided munition target position. The munition must have 
```sqf
manualControl
```
 config to use this command. The target position has to be inside configured missile targeting cone for command to work.

setusermfdtext.name: setUserMFDText
setusermfdtext.description: Stored user text value in MFD, limit is 50, user0...user49

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle with MFD
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
value: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

setvelocity.name: setVelocity
setvelocity.description: Sets [velocity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/velocity) vector of an object in m/s.

difficultyenabled.name: difficultyEnabled

attachedobjects.name: attachedObjects
attachedobjects.description: Returns a list of objects attached to the given object.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) attached to the given object

getunittrait.name: getUnitTrait
getunittrait.description:
Gets the current value of a trait of the given unit.
> ⓘFor the default values please visit [setUnitTrait](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setUnitTrait).

syntaxArray.Params:
Unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
skillName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Name of the skill
syntaxArray.Return:
* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) or [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - trait's value

* [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) - if *unit* is invalid, e.g an empty vehicle

setfriend.name: setFriend
setfriend.description:
Sets how friendly side1 is with side2. For a value smaller than 0.6 it results in being enemy, otherwise it is friendly.

Intended to be used on mission start. Changing value during mission can cause unexpected errors in AI behavior. See also [Side relations](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side_relations).

local.name: local
local.description:
Check if given unit is local on the computer in Multiplayer games - see [Multiplayer Scripting - Locality](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Locality).
This can be used to determine on which computer some code must be run. In Single player all objects are local.

syntaxArray.Syntax: local variable = value From Arma 2 until Arma 3 v1.54 - see **[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private)** for later versions

canadditemtovest.name: canAddItemToVest
canadditemtovest.description: Checks if given object can be stored into soldier's vest.

addcuratorpoints.name: addCuratorPoints
addcuratorpoints.description: Adds or removes curator points. Points can be only in range from 0 to 1.

backpackcargo.name: backpackCargo
backpackcargo.description: Get array with backpacks from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

allowdammage.name: allowDammage
allowdammage.description: Allow or prevent an object being damaged (or injured, or killed). The command does not prevent object from taking scripted damage such as [setDamage](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setDamage) or [setHit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setHit).

ctrlmapscale.name: ctrlMapScale
ctrlmapscale.description: Returns the current scale of given map control.

ctrlsettextsecondary.name: ctrlSetTextSecondary
ctrlsettextsecondary.description: Sets the secondary text of a text control.

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - Text control
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Secondary text

vectorcos.name: vectorCos
vectorcos.description: Cosine of angle between two 3D vectors.

syntaxArray.Params:
vector1: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)
vector2: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

loadbackpack.name: loadBackpack
loadbackpack.description:
Returns current percentage of mass from items stored in a backpack relative to the maximum capacity of the backpack.
It is equivalent to this formula:

```sqf
_loadBackpack = massOfAllItemsInBackpack / [getContainerMaxLoad](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getContainerMaxLoad) [backpack](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/backpack) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player);
```

geteditorcamera.name: getEditorCamera
geteditorcamera.description:
Fetches a reference to the mission editor camera.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

tvsetdata.name: tvSetData
tvsetdata.description: Sets string data to item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

getcursorobjectparams.name: getCursorObjectParams
getcursorobjectparams.description: Returns object and named selections under cursor and distance to object's surface (to the point cursor points at). If object surface is further away than 50 meters, selections are always an empty array and distance is 1e10 (10^10).

settrafficdensity.name: setTrafficDensity
settrafficdensity.description: Set the density of ambient cars in a rectangle (in cars per kilometer). > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)This command does nothing in Arma 3.

syntaxArray.Params:
density: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - density (in cars per kilometer)
xMin: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - western border of the affected rectangle
xMax: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - eastern border of the affected rectangle
zMin: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - southern border of the affected rectangle
zMax: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - northern border of the affected rectangle

curatormouseover.name: curatorMouseOver
curatormouseover.description: Returns [Curator Editable Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/curatorEditableObjects) under curator mouse pointer.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

* [] - when not in curator mode

* [""] - if no curator editable object under the pointer in curator mode

* [[typeName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/typeName), [Curator Editable Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/curatorEditableObjects)] - if there is curator editable object under the pointer in curator mode

curatorcameraareaceiling.name: curatorCameraAreaCeiling
curatorcameraareaceiling.description: Returns ceiling height for curator camera.

objstatus.name: objStatus
objstatus.description:
Sets the status of an objective that was defined in [briefing.html](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Briefing.html).

Status may be one of:

* "ACTIVE"

* "FAILED"

* "DONE"

* "HIDDEN"

To refer to an objective that is named "OBJ_1", for example, use only the index number in this command (i.e. "1" objStatus "HIDDEN").
examples:
```sqf
"1" objStatus "DONE"
```
 
Marks the objective named "OBJ_1" as completed.

setwaypointcompletionradius.name: setWaypointCompletionRadius
setwaypointcompletionradius.description: The completion radius allows units to call the waypoint completed once they are inside of the given circle.

vestitems.name: vestItems
vestitems.description: Get array with all items (of any kind, even weapons) from vest.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [x,y,z] offset relative to the model centre

getplayeruid.name: getPlayerUID
getplayeruid.description:
Return a UniqueID of the given unit (player).

> ⚠Prior to [Arma 2: Operation Arrowhead](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_2:_Operation_Arrowhead) v1.60, the result always consisted of a [stringified](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) number (see [getPlayerUIDOld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPlayerUIDOld)), but always had to be considered and processed as a [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String). Converting it to a [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) could cause precision problems, as [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) cannot accurately represent integers above 16777216 (224). Moreover, games since [Arma 2: Operation Arrowhead](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_2:_Operation_Arrowhead) v1.61 provide a value that is not all-numeric.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)The returned string is the player's steamID64: 
> ```sqf
> [private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _steamProfileUrl = "http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/" + (getPlayerUID [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player));
> ```
>

syntaxArray.Return:
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Can be "_SP_AI_" or "_SP_PLAYER_" in SP, "" or UID in MP

* The unique ID may be up to 100 characters long and may contain numbers, uppercase letters and underscores

* The value can be used to construct a valid variable name by appending to another valid variable name. 
```sqf
[missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace) [setVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVariable) ["TAG_player" + _uid, _unit];
```

typeof.name: typeOf
typeof.description:
Returns the config class name of given object or 
```sqf
""
```
 if object does not have a config class.

setanimspeedcoef.name: setAnimSpeedCoef
setanimspeedcoef.description:
Sets a coefficient for animation speed (0.5 will play animations half the speed, 2 twice the speed).
Doesn't affect upper body animations (reloading, etc.)

skiptime.name: skipTime
skiptime.description: Jumps the specified number of hours forward or backward.The time of day and tides are adjusted, but no changes are made to any units. If present, the lower level of clouds instantly jump to the position they would be in if time had passed normally.

syntaxArray.Params:
duration: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Hours to skip.A positive value will create a forward time jump, a negative value will jump backwards.One second is roughly 0.00026 hours.
Any calculations must be enclosed in parentheses, e.g. skipTime (_seconds/3600)

requiredversion.name: requiredVersion
requiredversion.description:
Check if version of application is available. If the current version is older than the required one, a warning message is shown and [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) is returned. 

Version of format **Major.Minor**, e.g. **1.30**

removeallsecondaryweaponitems.name: removeAllSecondaryWeaponItems
removeallsecondaryweaponitems.description: Removes all items from [secondaryWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/secondaryWeapon), except magazine.

opencuratorinterface.name: openCuratorInterface

unitisuav.name: unitIsUAV
unitisuav.description: Returns whether or not the given object is an UAV, UGV (drone). Command will also return [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) for empty drones. Corresponding to transport parameter isUAV.

removesimpletask.name: removeSimpleTask
removesimpletask.description:
Remove a simple task from the list of simple tasks.
> ⓘIf the [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task) to be removed is a child to some parent task and at the same time the parent to some child task, the child of this task gets orphaned and is listed in the root of Tasks tree (Tasks menu), retaining tree structure of its children.

drawrectangle.name: drawRectangle
drawrectangle.description: Draws a rectangle on the map. [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:drawRectangle.jpg)

syntaxArray.Syntax: map **drawRectangle** [c, a, b, angle, color, fill]
syntaxArray.Params:
map: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
c: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Center of rectangle in format: [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
a: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 1/2 width of rectangle in meters
b: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 1/2 height of rectangle in meters
angle: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Angle of rotation in degrees
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Line color in format [Color RGBA](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color)
fill: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Fill texture file or [Procedural Textures](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Procedural_Textures). Note that the file texture will not rotate with rectangle, use [drawIcon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/drawIcon) for that. If fill texture is not empty, set line color to white 
```sqf
[1,1,1,1]
```

menudelete.name: menuDelete
menudelete.description: Deletes menu entry on given path.
examples:
```sqf
([findDisplay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findDisplay) 313 [displayCtrl](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/displayCtrl) 120) menuDelete [1]; *// Removes second entry from [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor) menu strip. Restart [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor) to reset the menu.*
```

ctrlsetposition.name: ctrlSetPosition
ctrlsetposition.description: Sets wanted position and size for 2D control animation. Width and height are optional. [ctrlCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlCommit) is required to complete the operation. For 3D control, param is relative [x, y, z] and no [ctrlCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlCommit) is required as it cannot be animated. If target control is inside a [CT_CONTROLS_GROUP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CONTROLS_GROUP), the position needs to be relative to it.

syntaxArray.Params:
controlName: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - 2D control
x: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Position in x
y: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Position in y

controlName: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - 2D control
x: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Position in x
y: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Position in y
w: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Width of the control
h: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Height of the control

controlName: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - 3D control
x: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Position in x
y: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Position in y (Distance from the screen)
z: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Position in z

enablegunlights.name: enableGunLights
enablegunlights.description: Toggles the target group's gun light(s).

syntaxArray.Params:
target: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - The group forced to use gun lights. If unit is supplied as argument, unit's group is used
state: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to enable, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to disable

playmusic.name: playMusic
playmusic.description:
Plays music defined in [Description.ext's CfgMusic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgMusic) or config.cpp. If the *musicName* could not be found a message is logged into the .rpt file: Music <*musicName*> not found.

* [Arma 3 CfgMusic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgMusic)

* [Arma 2: CfgMusic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_2:_CfgMusic)

* [ArmA: CfgMusic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ArmA:_CfgMusic)

> ⓘTo stop the music, use 
> ```sqf
> playMusic ""
> ```
> .
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)See [Arma 3 CfgMusic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgMusic) for possible vanilla values. Since Arma 3 v1.67 one can use the [Jukebox Utility](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Utilities#Jukebox) to preview in-game music.

syntaxArray.Params:
musicName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - music classname
start: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - start, in seconds. Can be negative.

setsimpletasktarget.name: setSimpleTaskTarget
setsimpletasktarget.description: Attach a target to the simple task.Overrides [setSimpleTaskDestination](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setSimpleTaskDestination).

syntaxArray.Params:
task: [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task)
target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
precisePosition: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - use exact position of the target for map marker / HUD indicator instead of the position known to the owner of the task (depending on the knowledge about the target)

setwaypointdescription.name: setWaypointDescription
setwaypointdescription.description: Sets the description shown in the HUD while the waypoint is active.

getobjectmaterials.name: getObjectMaterials
getobjectmaterials.description: Gets all custom materials associated with the object.

setobjectmaterialglobal.name: setObjectMaterialGlobal
setobjectmaterialglobal.description: Set the material of the given selection on all computers in a network session.

importallgroups.name: importAllGroups
importallgroups.description:
Imports all groups into the RTE. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

isautohoveron.name: isAutoHoverOn
isautohoveron.description: Return [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if vehicle has enabled auto hover. (always returns false if the vehicle can't set auto hover)

markersize.name: markerSize
markersize.description: Returns marker size. This command is identical to [getMarkerSize](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getMarkerSize).

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - in format [a-axis, b-axis], where:

* a-axis: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 1/2 width of marker

* b-axis: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 1/2 height of marker

allmapmarkers.name: allMapMarkers
allmapmarkers.description:
Returns all markers in map including user placed markers (_USER_DEFINED #). 
Since Arma 3 v1.58 User defined markers have the following name format: _USER_DEFINED #<PlayerID>/<MarkerID>/<ChannelID> where:

* <PlayerID> - unique network id of the player in [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) format, also available as [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) in the 6th param in [ "PlayerConnected"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers/addMissionEventHandler#PlayerConnected) and ["PlayerDisconnected"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers/addMissionEventHandler#PlayerDisconnected) EHs

* <MarkerID> - a marker counter id
