worldsize.description: Returns the engine calculated size (terrain side length) of the current world ([BIS_fnc_mapSize](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_mapSize) may return the same value, but is just a simple look up in [ config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile)).

reveal.name: reveal
reveal.description:
Reveals a target to a [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group). If *toWhom* is a unit, unit's group is considered. If *toWhom* is a vehicle, vehicle commander's group is considered.  The [knowledge value](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/knowsAbout) will be set to the highest level any unit of the revealing side has about the revealed target. If the revealing side has *no* knowledge about the revealed target, the value will be set to 1.

Since ARMA 2 OA 1.60 the alternative syntax is available. Values greater than or equal 1.5 reveal the side of the target, too. The knowledge level can only be increased, not decreased by this command. Use [forgetTarget](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forgetTarget) first if you need to decrease value.

> ⓘIn multiplayer, [targetKnowledge](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/targetKnowledge) and [knowsAbout](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/knowsAbout) infos get updated only on the PC where command was executed.

syntaxArray.Params:
toWhom: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)  which receives revealing information
target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)  which is revealed

toWhom: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)  which receives revealing information
target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)  which is revealed
accuracy: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - knowledge value, clamped to 0..4 range

examples:
```sqf
_soldierOne reveal _soldierTwo; *// soldierOne [knowsAbout](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/knowsAbout) information about soldierTwo is updated*
```

```sqf
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) reveal [cursorObject](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cursorObject); *// player [knowsAbout](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/knowsAbout) information about object under cursor is updated*
```

```sqf
_soldierOne reveal [_soldierTwo, 1.5];
```

putweaponpool.name: putWeaponPool

magazinesammo.name: magazinesAmmo
magazinesammo.description: Returns all vehicle's magazines and their ammo count (also works on supply boxes). When applied to a unit (soldier), the command behaves differently and will omit magazines already loaded into unit's weapons. Use [magazinesAmmoFull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/magazinesAmmoFull) to return all magazines.

syntaxArray.Params: vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit or vehicle or container. When transport is supplied, the command returns vehicle's magazines not the cargo. When container is supplied, the command behaves identically to [magazinesAmmoCargo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/magazinesAmmoCargo)
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Arrays](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format:

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String): magazine class name

* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number): magazine ammo count

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit or vehicle.
includeEmpty: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to include empty magazines
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Arrays](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format:

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String): magazine class name

* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number): magazine ammo count

sleep.name: sleep
sleep.description:
Suspends code execution for given time in seconds. The sleep precision is given by a framerate, the delay given is the minimal delay expected. Must be called inside of a context which is interruptible, i.e. a [script](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Script_(Handle)) executed by [execVM](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/execVM) or [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn).
> ⓘ
> 
> * this command will suspend the code for ***at least*** the given amount of time, and can be way more if the [script scheduler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler) is busy.
> 
> * this command will suspend the script as the game gets paused in single player (and will resume with it). To avoid this, use [uiSleep](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/uiSleep).

syntaxArray.Params: delay: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - in seconds. Negative values will not be considered.

showlegend.name: showLegend
showlegend.description:
Show/hide map legend. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

setwaypointtype.name: setWaypointType
setwaypointtype.description:
Sets the waypoint type of given waypoint. 



More details at [Waypoints](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Waypoints).

syntaxArray.Params:
waypoint: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [Waypoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Waypoint)
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Waypoint type. Can be:

* "MOVE"

* "DESTROY"

* "GETIN"

* "SAD" *(Seek And Destroy)*

* "JOIN"

* "LEADER"

* "GETOUT"

* "CYCLE"

* "LOAD"

* "UNLOAD"

* "TR UNLOAD"

* "HOLD"

* "SENTRY"

* "GUARD" *(for use with GUARDED BY trigger or [createGuardedPoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createGuardedPoint))*

* "TALK"

* "SCRIPTED"

* "SUPPORT"

* "GETIN NEAREST"

* "DISMISS"

* "LOITER" *(new in Arma 3)*

* "HOOK" *(new in Arma 3)* - slingload object

* "UNHOOK" *(new in Arma 3)* - drop slingload

* "AND" *(only for game logics)*

* "OR" *(only for game logics)*

targets.name: targets
targets.description: Retrives list of given unit targets matching specified filter. If the filter is not specified, all targets are returned.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit which target knowledge is retrieved
[enemyOnly, maxDistance, sides, maxAge, alternateCenter]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
enemyOnly (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to include only enemy targets, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to include all targets
maxDistance (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - max. distance based on target's expected position *(distance is measured in 2D)*; use 0 to ignore the maxDistance filter
sides (Optional): [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array of accepted sides; use [] to ignore the side filter
maxAge (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - max. target age, targets that are known to unit for longer then maxAge are ignored; use 0 to ignore the maxAge filter
alternateCenter (Optional): [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - alternate (2D or 3D) position used for distance check *(distance is measured in 2D)*; if not specified unit position is being used

examples:
```sqf
_targets = _unit targets [false, 300, [east,sideEnemy]]; //all targets of east or renegade side in 300m
```

```sqf
_targets = _unit targets [true, 300]; //enemy targets in 300m
```

```sqf
_targets = _unit targets []; //all targets
```

tasktype.name: taskType

weaponstate.name: weaponState
weaponstate.description:
Returns the currently selected weapon state for unit or vehicle.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Since Arma 3 v1.70 this command has been improved and extended:
> 
> * A vehicle's weapon query doesn't need a weapon operator provided the weapon or muzzle is specified in optional param.(keep in mind that by default a vehicle has no weapons selected)
> 
> * Driver turret can now be accessed as well with turret path [-1].
> 
> * Muzzle name is supported as well as weapon name. The command searches for weapon first, then if not found, muzzle is searched for.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - in format [weapon, muzzle, firemode, magazine, ammoCount], where:

* weapon: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* muzzle: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* firemode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* magazine: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* ammoCount: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

syntaxArray.Params:

vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
turretPath: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
weapon (Optional): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) (since Arma 3 v1.70) - weapon or muzzle name
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - in format [weapon, muzzle, firemode, magazine, ammoCount], where:

* weapon: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* muzzle: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* firemode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* magazine: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* ammoCount: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

assignedvehicle.name: assignedVehicle
assignedvehicle.description:
Returns the vehicle an unit is assigned to. If no vehicle is assigned [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) is returned.

Notes:

* The assignment happens via the various assignAsXXX/moveInXXX commands, or player/AI GL getIn radio commands, getIn waypoint, or when units start in vehicles or get moved in to a vehicle by Zeus/via Eden.

* [addVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addVehicle) indirectly may also add the vehicle, however only if an AI GL assigns [vehicle roles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/assignedVehicleRole) (which depends on various things).

* [vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) returns the current vehicles an AI is in, while with assignedVehicle the AI may not (yet) be in the said vehicle (still in transit or held of by waypoints or other SQF commands).

* To make AI under AI GL enter a vehicle, use [orderGetIn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/orderGetIn) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true).

* While [unassignVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/unassignVehicle) works, if the group is under AI command, the AI GL may re-assign the vehicle immediately. To stop the AI from re-entering at least, use [orderGetIn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/orderGetIn) or [allowGetIn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/allowGetIn) [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), or permanently remove the assignment vi a [leaveVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/leaveVehicle).

* For player GL lead AI assignedVehicle seems not to be really reliable/behaves strange. Disembark radio command seems to [unassign](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/unassignVehicle) though.

toupperansi.name: toUpperANSI
toupperansi.description: [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:ISO-8859-1.jpg)  [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:ISO-8859-1.jpg)ISO-8859-1Converts the supplied string to all upper case characters fast (could be 3x faster than [toUpper](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/toUpper)). [ANSI](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://stackoverflow.com/questions/701882/what-is-ansi-format/701920) in this case refers to [ISO-8859-1](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO/IEC_8859-1) code page. The command is primary designed to convert characters with [ codes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/toArray) 0...127 however will also convert other characters in 128...255 range as long as they are present in ISO-8859-1 codepage. For Unicode alternative see [toUpper](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/toUpper).

then.name: then
then.description:
First or second element of array is executed depending on result of [if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) condition. Result of the expression executed is returned as a result. > ⓘVariables declared inside the **code** block are private to that block. If you need to use the variables outside of the block, declare them **before** the 
> ```sqf
> [if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) (condition) then {code};
> ```
>  statement.

syntaxArray.Params:
if: [If Type](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/If_Type)
else: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Can either be a [code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) block or an array with two [code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) elements. See **Example 3**

triggertimeoutcurrent.name: triggerTimeoutCurrent
triggertimeoutcurrent.description:
Returns current timeout of the given trigger or -1 if countdown is not in progress. 

> ⚠The trigger could be [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) or remote but the result returned by this command will be for the current trigger timeout local to the client that executed the command. See [createTrigger](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createTrigger) for more info.

sendsimplecommand.name: sendSimpleCommand
sendsimplecommand.description:
Sends a simple command to the vehicle's driver / gunner (air vehicles ignore it). See also [vehicleMoveInfo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicleMoveInfo).
> ⚠Doesn't seem to work if AI driver is alone, needs another unit in the vehicle (could be another AI or player) that is set as [setEffectiveCommander](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setEffectiveCommander). If driver is [effectiveCommander](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/effectiveCommander) it will refuse any drive commands.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Due to some sort of a bug when vehicle is ordered turning ("LEFT" or "RIGHT"), it locks vehicle ability to respond to any other commands properly. Always use "STOPTURNING" to cancel turning before issuing other move commands 
*Gunner commands*


* "FIRE"

* "CEASE FIRE"

* "MANUAL FIRE"

* "CANCEL MANUAL FIRE"

* "KEY FIRE"
*Driver move commands*


* "FORWARD" - move forward

* "FAST" - move forward, fast

* "SLOW" - move forward, slow

* "STOP" - stop moving forward or backward

* "BACK" - move backward

* "KEY UP"

* "KEY DOWN"

* "KEY FAST"

* "KEY SLOW"
*Driver turn commands*


* "LEFT" - turn left, while moving or not

* "RIGHT" - turn right, while moving or not

* "STOPTURNING" - cancel turning  (special case, normally would be called by the engine when LEFT or RIGHT turn key is released by the player) *Since Arma 3 v1.77*

Similar to [animationPhase](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animationPhase) or [doorPhase](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/doorPhase) but designed to complement [animateSource](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animateSource). setpipeffect.description:
Sets Render Target's visual effect (Picture-in-Picture). 

* 0: Normal - [0]

* 1: Night Vision - [1]

* 2: Thermal - [2]

* 3: [Color Correction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Post_process_effects#ColorCorrections) - [3, enabled, brightness, contrast, offset, blend [r,g,b,a], lerp [r,g,b,a], rgb [r,g,b,a]]

* 4: Mirror - [4] **<currently not working>**

* 5: [Chromatic Aberration](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Post_process_effects#ChromAberration) - [5, enabled, powerx, powery, (bool) aspectCorrection] **<currently not working>**

* 6: [ Film Grain](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Post_process_effects#FilmGrain) - [6, enabled, intensity, sharpness, grainsize, intensityx1, intensityx2, (bool) monochromatic] **<currently not working>**

* 7: Thermal Inverted [7]

* 8: Green Thermal [8]

syntaxArray.Params:
name : [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Render surface reference from [Render To Texture](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Procedural_Textures#Render_To_Texture)
[effect, optionalParam1, ..., optionalParamN] : [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
effect : [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - effect type
optionalParam1: Parameters based on selected effect

toarray.name: toArray
toarray.description:
Converts the supplied [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) into an [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number). The numbers in the created array are the decimal [Unicode](https://community.bistudio.comhttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unicode) representations of characters.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Since v2.04 this command can also handle [HashMaps](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/HashMap). See alternative syntax.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array in either one of the following formats:

* splitArrays: [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) - 
```sqf
[[key1, key2, ...], [value1, value2, ...]]
```


* splitArrays: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) - 
```sqf
[[key1, value1], [key2, value2], ...]
```
 This is **very inefficient** since the engine has to create many small arrays

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[vehicle, turretPath]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[turretPath]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array of numbers.

cos.name: cos
cos.description: Cosine of a number, argument in degrees.

safezoney.name: safeZoneY
safezoney.description:
Returns the Y of the top border of the screen, which is also a distance in screen measurement units from top left corner of the default viewport (0,0) of the screen to the top border of the screen. Since it is going in opposite way of the Y axis, the value is negative. The measurement units depend on the current screen resolution [getResolution](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getResolution). See also [SafeZone](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SafeZone).
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:safezone.jpg)

execvm.name: execVM
execvm.description:
Compiles and adds [SQF](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQF_Syntax) [Script](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Script) to the [scheduler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler) queue and returns script handle. The script is first searched for in the mission folder, then in the campaign scripts folder and finally in the global scripts folder. The script does not execute immediately upon running execVM command, but with some delay. How much delay is unknown as it largely depends on how many other scripts there are in the queue and how busy is VM. The optional argument is passed to the script in [private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) variable _this. In Arma 3 the script handle is also passed to the script in _thisScript variable.
In order to understand execVM consider the following comparison:

```sqf
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _handle = _args execVM "someFile.sqf";
*// is practically identical to*
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _handle = _args [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) [compile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/compile) [preprocessFileLineNumbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/preprocessFileLineNumbers) "someFile.sqf";
```

So if you need multiple execution of the same file, you might want to store it in a function ([Functions Library](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Functions_Library_(Arma_3))), otherwise, for a single execution, execVM is a good choice.

To see what VM scripts are currently in the scheduler, use [diag_activeSQFScripts](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_activeSQFScripts) command.
> ⚠If the file you are executing is not prepared using UTF-8 encoding and contains some characters [ with codes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/toArray) > 127, they might convert incorrectly

syntaxArray.Params:
arguments: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - arguments accessible as [_this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this) in the script
filename: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - file with sqf code (doesn't have to have .sqf extension, but not using standard extensions may cause problems later during binarisation)
syntaxArray.Return: [Script](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Script) - script handle, can be used to determine (via [scriptDone](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/scriptDone) (also via [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) in Arma 3)) when the execVMed script has finished. In Arma 3, the handle is also available inside the execVMed script in _thisScript variable.

syntaxArray.Params: filename: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - file with sqf code (doesn't have to have .sqf extension, but not using standard extensions may cause problems later, during binarisation)
syntaxArray.Return: [Script](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Script) - script handle, can be used to determine (via [scriptDone](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/scriptDone) (also via [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) in Arma 3)) when the execVMed script has finished. In Arma 3, the handle is also available inside the execVMed script in _thisScript variable.

sendtask.name: sendTask
sendtask.description: Create a new AI task (subtask of parentTask). Type is name of registered task type.

setairplanethrottle.name: setAirplaneThrottle
setairplanethrottle.description: Sets a wanted throttle position, works only on player's vehicle.

ctrlmapscreentoworld.name: ctrlMapScreenToWorld
ctrlmapscreentoworld.description: Converts map screen coordinates into world coordinates. Unlike [posScreenToWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/posScreenToWorld), this command returns world position is format [x, y], otherwise it is identical to [posScreenToWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/posScreenToWorld).

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - map control
[x, y]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
x: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - screen X
y: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - screen Y

pixelgridbase.name: pixelGridBase
pixelgridbase.description: Returns grid size based on screen resolution.

inputaction.name: inputAction
inputaction.description:
Return the state of input devices mapped to given input action.

For Arma 3 inputActions and its bindings see: [inputAction/actions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/inputAction/actions).

For earlier Arma editions  see [Category:Key Actions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Key_Actions).
examples:
```sqf
inputAction "leanLeft"
```
 Returns 1 if the button mapped to "leanLeft" is pressed currently else 0.

enginespowerrtd.name: enginesPowerRTD
enginespowerrtd.description:
Returns power produced by engines in Watts.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

syntaxArray.Params: RTD_helicopter: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Helicopter with advanced flight model enabled
syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Watts produced by the engines, to format [engine1, engine2]. Returns an empty array if [Advanced Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model_in_Arma3) is disabled.

kbwassaid.name: kbWasSaid
kbwassaid.description: Check if given item was said by person to someone. See [Conversations](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Conversations) for more details.

syntaxArray.Params:
person: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - who said the item
[receiver, topic, sentenceID, maxAge]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
receiver: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - receiver of the sentence
topic: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the topic used in [kbAddTopic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/kbAddTopic)
sentenceID: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - id of sentence that we want to check
maxAge: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - time in seconds. kbWasSaid will check whether the sentence was said in last **max. age** seconds

sunormoon.name: sunOrMoon
sunormoon.description:
```sqf
12:00 - 1
(...) - 1
18:39 - 0.911201
18:42 - 0.576303
18:45 - 0.240862
18:48 - 0
(...) - 0
06:00 - 0.0695308
06:03 - 0.404731
06:06 - 0.739519
06:09 - 1
(...) - 1
```

Returns the sun to moon transition state in range 0..1.
The return value is either 0 or 1 most of the time, the in-between values only returned during a few minutes in the morning and in the evening, depending on the [date](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/date), and could be similar to shown here:


[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:sunOrMoon_VR_up.png)  [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:sunOrMoon_VR_up.png)Sunrise in Arma 3 VR
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:sunOrMoon_VR_down.png)  [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:sunOrMoon_VR_down.png)Sunset in Arma 3 VR

clear3denattribute.name: clear3DENAttribute
clear3denattribute.description:
Clears the value of the given entity's [attribute](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Entity_Attributes) in [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor).

An attribute is identified by its property (data when it is engine-drive attribute) value in config. For the list of all attributes with their properties, see [Setting Attributes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Setting_Attributes#Attributes).

> ⚠Attributes are available only within the Eden Editor workspace. You cannot access them in scenario preview or exported scenario!

breakto.name: breakTo
breakto.description:
Breaks block to scope named **name**. Nil is returned.

Scope name can be assigned using [scopeName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/scopeName) command.

ropelength.name: ropeLength
ropelength.description:
Return rope length in meters (set by [ropeCreate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ropeCreate), [ropeCut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ropeCut), [ropeUnwind](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ropeUnwind)).
> ⓘReturned rope length will remain the same, even if the rope is stretched.

boundingbox.name: boundingBox
boundingbox.description:
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:Boundingbox.jpg) Returns a bounding box of given object in model coordinate space, adjusted according to destruction/animation of an object. This command is rather generous on the size estimation, for more precise coordinates use [boundingBoxReal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/boundingBoxReal).
> ⓘIn [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.92](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.92) The output of both syntaxes got extended to include bounding sphere diameter. See also [sizeOf](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sizeOf).

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - An array with the extreme points of the model in format [PositionRelative](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionRelative), as well as bounding box sphere diameter.Format [[xmin, ymin, zmin], [xmax, ymax, zmax], boundingSphereDiameter].

syntaxArray.Params:
clippingType: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Clipping type could be:

* 0 - ClipVisual (could significantly reduce the size of bounding boxes on buildings)

* 1 - ClipShadow

* 2 - ClipGeometry

* 3 - ClipGeneral (Default, the same type that is used in main syntax)
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - An array with the extreme points of the model bounding box in format [PositionRelative](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionRelative), as well as bounding box sphere diameter.Format [[xmin, ymin, zmin], [xmax, ymax, zmax], boundingSphereDiameter].

menusetvalue.name: menuSetValue
menusetvalue.description: Sets new value into menu entry on given path.

binocularitems.name: binocularItems
binocularitems.description: Returns array with all items assigned to the [binocular](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/binocular) weapon except magazines. Use [binocularMagazine](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/binocularMagazine) command for the latter. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

ctrldelete.name: ctrlDelete
ctrldelete.description: Deletes given control. The control has to be created either by script with [ctrlCreate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlCreate) or to have deletable property in config set to [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true). Use [ctrlShow](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlShow) [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) and [ctrlEnable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlEnable) [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to disable controls that cannot be deleted. Returns [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) indicating  whether the deletion was successful.

setvehicleammodef.name: setVehicleAmmoDef
setvehicleammodef.description: Sets how much ammunition (compared to the configuration of magazines defined in the vehicle's class) the vehicle has. Note that the ammo will only be added to [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) turrets. To check the locality of turret use [turretLocal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/turretLocal).

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit or vehicle.
value: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - From 0 (no ammo) to 1 (fully loaded).

terrainintersect.name: terrainIntersect
terrainintersect.description: Checks for intersection of terrain between two AGL positions. Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if intersects with terrain. For ASL variant see [terrainIntersectASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/terrainIntersectASL)

syntaxArray.Params:
[pos1, pos2]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
pos1: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - start position in format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL)
pos2: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - end position in format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL)

inserteditorobject.name: insertEditorObject
inserteditorobject.description:
Insert an object to the editor and assign arguments. Create script is,not called. Returns the ID of the new EditorObject. Subtype class is,optional.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

forceend.name: forceEnd
forceend.description: Forces mission ending (set with [endMission](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/endMission)) even if a camera effect or any another condition delays the endMission (mostly in [Operation Flashpoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Operation_Flashpoint)).
examples:
```sqf
forceEnd;*// in an ending trigger to ensure no camera is delaying mission ending*
```

sethudmovementlevels.name: setHUDMovementLevels
sethudmovementlevels.description: Set min/max movement borders displayed in HUD gauges. Use -1 to skip some value.

syntaxArray.Syntax: **setHUDMovementLevels** [minSpeed, maxSpeed, minAlt, maxAlt, minDir, maxDir, targetOrPosition]
syntaxArray.Params:
[minSpeed, maxSpeed, minAlt, maxAlt, minDir, maxDir, position]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
minSpeed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Units: m/s
maxSpeed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Units: m/s
minAlt: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Units: m
maxAlt: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Units: m
minDir: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Units: deg
maxDir: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Units: deg
targetOrPosition: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position)

formationleader.name: formationLeader
examples:
? (formationLeader player != leader player) :
 hint "Formation leader is not the group leader."

setmagazineturretammo.name: setMagazineTurretAmmo
setmagazineturretammo.description:
Sets ammo count to given amount for given turret.
> ⚠Broken when vehicle has multiple magazines of the same type

max.name: max
max.description: The greater value between a and b

continue.name: continue
continue.description: Skips current loop iteration and continues with the next one.

confirmsensortarget.name: confirmSensorTarget
confirmsensortarget.description: Sets for which [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) the entity becomes a "confirmed hostile" target - a target that becomes highlighted red on the sensors display.

setflagside.name: setFlagSide
setflagside.description: Sets flag [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side). A flag may be taken by any unit that is enemy to the side that owns the flag. Just like with [setFlagTexture](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setFlagTexture), if the command executed where unit is [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) effect of the command will be global and [JIP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Join_In_Progress) compatible.

simulsethumidity.name: simulSetHumidity
simulsethumidity.description: Sets simul cloud cover. This command does not affect overcast value. > ⚠This command is no longer available.

syntaxArray.Params: humidity: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 0 (min): clear sky, 1 (max): heavy cloud cover

isvehiclecargo.name: isVehicleCargo
isvehiclecargo.description: Despite a misleading name, returns the vehicle that is transporting given vehicle in cargo. If the given vehicle is not in vehicle cargo, [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) is returned.
examples:
Blackfish with given variable name blackfish, with a vehicle inside called quad

```sqf
_transportingVehicle = isVehicleCargo quad; //returns blackfish
```
Vehicle called quad that is not being transported as cargo

```sqf
_transportingVehicle = isVehicleCargo quad; //returns [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull)

```

currentvisionmode.name: currentVisionMode
currentvisionmode.description:
Returns current vision mode of unit's weapon.


* 0 - daytime

* 1 - night vision

* 2 - thermal vision

getartillerycomputersettings.name: getArtilleryComputerSettings
getartillerycomputersettings.description: Returns settings from artillery computer currently opened by player.

remoteexec.name: remoteExec
remoteexec.description:
Asks the server to execute the given function or script command on the given target machine(s).

* Functions are executed in the [scheduled environment](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler#Scheduled_Environment); suspension is allowed.

* Script commands are executed in the [unscheduled environment](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler#Unscheduled_Environment); suspension is not allowed.
Read [Arma 3: Remote Execution](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Remote_Execution) for more information about remote execution, security features and JIP techniques.

> ⓘJust like [remoteExecCall](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExecCall), remoteExec can be used in SP; the behaviour is the same as in MP.
> ⓘThe direct execution of [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) or [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) via remoteExec (or [remoteExecCall](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExecCall)) should be avoided to prevent issues in cases where the remote execution of [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) or [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) is blocked by [CfgRemoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_CfgRemoteExec). Instead it is recommended to create a function which is then excecuted by remoteExec (or [remoteExecCall](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExecCall)).

syntaxArray.Params:
**params**: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - The parameter(s) for the function / command specified in the **functionName** parameter.
**functionName**: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Function or command name.
While any function or command can be used here, only those allowed by [CfgRemoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_CfgRemoteExec) will actually be executed.
**targets** (Optional, default: 0):

* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (See also [Machine network ID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Machine_network_ID)) -

* **0:** The function / command will be executed globally, i.e. on the server and every connected client, including the machine where remoteExec originated.

* **2:** The function / command will only be executed on the server.

* **Other number:** The function / command will be executed on the machine where [clientOwner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/clientOwner) matches the given number.

* **Negative number:** The effect is inverted: -2 means every client but not the server, -12 means the server and every client, except for the client where [clientOwner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/clientOwner) returns 12.

* [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - The function / command will be executed where the given object is [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local).

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Interpreted as an [Identifier](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Identifier) (variable name). The function / command will be executed where the object or group identified by the variable with the provided name is [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local).

* [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) - The function / command will be executed on machines where the player is on the specified side.

* [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - The function / command will be executed on machines where the player is in the specified group.

* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array of any combination of the types listed above.
**JIP** (Optional, default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)):

* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - If [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), a unique JIP ID is generated and the remoteExec statement is added to the JIP queue from which it will be executed for every JIP.

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) -

* If the string is empty, it is interpreted as [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false).

* If the string is in format "[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number):[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)" (e.g. "0:0"), it is interpreted as a [netId](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/netId) (see below).

* Else the string is treated as a custom JIP ID and the remoteExec statement is added to the JIP queue, replacing statements that have the same JIP ID.

* [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [netId](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/netId) - The persistent execution of the remoteExec statement is attached to the given object or group.When the object / group is deleted, the remoteExec statement is automatically removed from the JIP queue.

The **JIP** parameter can only be used if the **targets** parameter is 0 or a negative number.See also [Example 3](https://community.bistudio.com#Example_3) on how to remove statements from the JIP queue.
syntaxArray.Return:
* [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil) - In case of error.

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - In case of success.

* If the **JIP** parameter was [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) or an empty string, the return value is "".

* If the **JIP** parameter was [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) or a custom JIP ID, the JIP ID is returned.

* If the **JIP** parameter was an [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), a [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or a [netId](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/netId), the (corresponding) [netId](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/netId) is returned.

syntaxArray.Params:
**functionName**: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - See the main syntax above for more details.
**targets** (Optional, default: 0): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number), [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String), [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - See the main syntax above for more details.
**JIP** (Optional, default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String), [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [netId](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/netId) - See the main syntax above for more details.
syntaxArray.Return: [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - See the main syntax above for more details.

examples:
Execute 
```sqf
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "Example 1";
```
 on various machines:

```sqf
"Example 1" remoteExec ["hint"]; *// Executed on all machines.*
"Example 1" remoteExec ["hint", 3]; *// Executed only on the first connected client.*
"Example 1" remoteExec ["hint", -2]; *// Executed everywhere except on the server.*
```
Execute 
```sqf
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "Example 2";
```
 on various machines and add it to the JIP queue:

```sqf
_result = "Example 2" remoteExec ["hint", -2, [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)]; *// _result is a unique JIP ID, e.g. "3_1".*
_result = "Example 2" remoteExec ["hint", -2, "My_JIP_ID"]; *// _result is "My_JIP_ID".*
_result = "Example 2" remoteExec ["hint", 0, MyObject]; *// _result is the unique [netId](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/netId) of MyObject, e.g. "2:3".*
```

Note that if there already was a statement with the JIP ID "My_JIP_ID" in the JIP queue, that statement has now been overwritten.
Remove statements from the JIP queue:

```sqf
remoteExec ["", "My_JIP_ID"]; *// The persistent statement with the JIP ID "My_JIP_ID" is removed from the JIP queue.*
remoteExec ["", MyObject]; *// The persistent statement attached to MyObject is removed from the JIP queue.*
```
Some more complex examples:

```sqf
["Open", [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)] remoteExec ["BIS_fnc_arsenal", MyTargetPlayer];
[MyCurator, [[MyObject1, MyObject2], [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)]] remoteExec ["addCuratorEditableObjects", 2];
```
A tricky example: Trying to execute 
```sqf
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [setAmmo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setAmmo) [[primaryWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/primaryWeapon) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), 1];
```
 (on machines where the player is in MyGroup). Consider the following statements:

```sqf
{[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [setAmmo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setAmmo) [[primaryWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/primaryWeapon) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), 1];} remoteExec ["call", MyGroup]; *// Statement 1*
[[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), [[primaryWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/primaryWeapon) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), 1]] remoteExec ["setAmmo", MyGroup]; *// Statement 2*
```

Both statements look very similar, but only Statement 1 has the intended effect. This is because in Statement 2, the arguments 
```sqf
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)
```
 and 
```sqf
[primaryWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/primaryWeapon) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)
```
 are not resolved on the target machine(s), but on the machine executing remoteExec.

lnbaddarray.name: lnbAddArray
lnbaddarray.description: Adds list of rows of strings.

shownscoretable.name: shownScoretable
shownscoretable.description:
Returns the state of the score table set with [showScoretable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/showScoretable) command. 
> ⚠Since Arma 3 v1.64, the previous functionality of this command (score table visibility check) is moved to [visibleScoretable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/visibleScoretable) command. Please update your scripts and sorry for any inconvinience.

ctrowcount.name: ctRowCount
ctrowcount.description: Returns number of rows (headers not included) in the RscControlsTable.

ongroupiconclick.name: onGroupIconClick
ongroupiconclick.description:
Defines an action performed when player clicked on group marker (3D or in a map). The code executed once. This EH, unlike [onGroupIconOverEnter](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onGroupIconOverEnter) and [onGroupIconOverLeave](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onGroupIconOverLeave), has one more param which returns 1 if RMB was pressed, 0 otherwise. 
> ⓘSince **Arma 3** *v1.57* a stackable version of this EH is available: [GroupIconClick](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers/addMissionEventHandler#GroupIconClick)

setwantedrpmrtd.name: setWantedRPMRTD
setwantedrpmrtd.description:
Tell the helicopter engine RPMs to reach the given value within a period of time. The simulation will try to reach the RPMs, but it does not guarantee it will reach the precise value!

* engine index 0: engine #1

* engine index 1: engine #2

* engine index 2: engine #3

* engine index -1: all engines
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

syntaxArray.Params:
helicopterRTD : [ObjectRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ObjectRTD) - helicopter
value : [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - engine RPMs
time : [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - time to reach desired RPMs (seconds)
engineIndex : [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - engine index

weaponinertia.name: weaponInertia
weaponinertia.description: Returns current rate of how much the weapon view is distorted because of quick aiming.

tvsetpicturerightcolordisabled.name: tvSetPictureRightColorDisabled
tvsetpicturerightcolordisabled.description: Sets the color of the right picture of a tree item defined by path when item is disabled

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
[path, color]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - path to tree view item
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - color in format [r,g,b,a]

drawlink.name: drawLink
drawlink.description:
The editor will draw a line between the two specified editor objects. Line type can be LINE or ARROW. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

datetonumber.name: dateToNumber
datetonumber.description:
Convert a date to a float number, based on Jan 1st 00:00:00 = 0 and Dec 31st  23:59:59 = 1. The same day and time in leap year will be different after 28th of February and 23:59 on 31st of December will be 1.00274 
This is how this command works. The 365 days of the year are presented in range 0...1. So each day will be:
1 / 365 =  0.00273973 
In a leap year there are 366 days, so the range will increase by 1 day:
1 / 365  *  366 = 1.00274
In short, in a normal year the command returns in range 0...1 in a leap year it will return in range 0...1.00274

setcombatbehaviour.name: setCombatBehaviour
setcombatbehaviour.description:
Sets unit behaviour (main syntax) or group behaviour (alternative syntax). To retrieve unit or group behaviour see [combatBehaviour](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/combatBehaviour). The behaviour is one of: 

* "CARELESS"

* "SAFE"

* "AWARE"

* "COMBAT"

* "STEALTH"
> ⓘSee [AI Behaviour](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/AI_Behaviour) for details of the effect of this command on AI units. Group behaviour usually is "CARELESS" or "SAFE"

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - AI unit
behaviour: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - see description

group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - AI group
behaviour: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - see description

getcontainermaxload.name: getContainerMaxLoad
getcontainermaxload.description: Returns max load value of given container. Currently works only with uniform, vest and backpack classes.

syntaxArray.Params: containerClass: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - uniform, vest or backpack class

getcalculateplayervisibilitybyfriendly.name: getCalculatePlayerVisibilityByFriendly
getcalculateplayervisibilitybyfriendly.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if visibility of [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) by friendly units is calculated.

isgroupdeletedwhenempty.name: isGroupDeletedWhenEmpty
isgroupdeletedwhenempty.description: Checks if the given group marked for auto-deletion when empty. See [deleteGroupWhenEmpty](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/deleteGroupWhenEmpty).

syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) the group is marked for auto-deletion when empty

terminate.name: terminate
terminate.description:
Terminates (aborts) [spawned](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) or [execVMed](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/execVM) script.
> ⚠The given script will not terminate immediately upon terminate command execution, it will do so the next time the script is processed by the [scheduler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler)

lbpictureright.name: lbPictureRight
lbpictureright.description: Returns the right picture name of the item with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user [dialog](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/dialog).

syntaxArray.Params:
[idc, index]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - idc of control
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

list.name: list
list.description:
List of units that would activate given [Trigger](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Triggers).

It returns nothing before the simulation started, i.e. in (undelayed) init.sqf files. Returns a **[pointer](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array#Array_references)** to the trigger's list after the simulation started.Since this is just a *reference* this means that the value in your local variable will change as the content of the trigger area changes. To permanently copy the returned list to a different variable, use _mylist = +(list triggerOne).

The second example can be used inside the trigger (in that case, no need to name your trigger).

The list returned for trigger of type "Not present" is the same as that returned for type "present". 

**NOTE:** While the command can query any trigger, local or remote, the result will be only for the trigger condition set on the local client. See [createTrigger](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createTrigger) for more info.

taskcustomdata.name: taskCustomData
taskcustomdata.description: Returns custom data attached to the local task or an empty array if there are no custom data attached.

getmissionlayerentities.name: getMissionLayerEntities
getmissionlayerentities.description:
Returns all entities within specific [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor) layer. To be used when the scenario is running, not in the editor workspace.

Useful for disabling / enabling whole parts of the scenario which you add to specific layer while editing.
> ⓘDefault layers are not returned.

syntaxArray.Params: layerName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Layer name in the editor. If multiple layers with the same name are present in the scenario, the first found one is used.
layerID: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Layer ID in the editor.

rankid.name: rankId
rankid.description:
Return the rank of the given unit for comparison.

Value may be :

* **0** - Private

* **1** - Corporal

* **2** - Sergeant

* **3** - Lieutenant

* **4** - Captain

* **5** - Major

* **6** - Colonel

hcremoveallgroups.name: hcRemoveAllGroups
hcremoveallgroups.description: Remove all groups from unit's [high command](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/High_Command) bar.

opendlcpage.name: openDLCPage
opendlcpage.description: Opens a Steam page of the app with given appId. Only works for known appId (game + linked DLCs)

isstreamfriendlyuienabled.name: isStreamFriendlyUIEnabled
isstreamfriendlyuienabled.description: Returns the status of STREAM FRIENDLY UI setting in UI (OPTIONS >> GAME >> GENERAL >> STREAM FRIENDLY UI).

getsoundcontrollerresult.name: getSoundControllerResult
getsoundcontrollerresult.description: Returns the calculated value of [simple expression](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/simple_expression) defined in config. Config could be any config entry, even [ mission config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionConfigFile) entry. It is more important that the vehicle is a transport and not any object. If the expression contains sound controllers, the controller values will be taken from the given vehicle.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - transport vehicle
config: [Config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config) - path to config entry containing the expression

isobjecthidden.name: isObjectHidden
isobjecthidden.description: Checks visibility of a given object on the local machine.

deletevehiclecrew.name: deleteVehicleCrew
deletevehiclecrew.description:
Deletes a member of the crew of a vehicle. Human players cannot be deleted.
> ⓘThis command attempts to move the given [crew](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/crew) member out before deleting it. Made especially for deleting dead crew members, as using conventional [deleteVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/deleteVehicle) leads to all sorts of bugs and ghost objects. While the argument is global, you should take extra steps and execute this where vehicle is [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) as moving units out of the vehicle happens where vehicle is [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) and you want this to always precede deletion.

lbpicture.name: lbPicture
lbpicture.description: Returns the picture name of the item with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user [dialog](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/dialog).

lbdelete.name: lbDelete
lbdelete.description: Removes the item with the given index from the [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTBOX), [CT_COMBO](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_COMBO) or [CT_TOOLBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_TOOLBOX).

lbsort.name: lbSort
lbsort.description: Sorts listbox entries alphabetically ascending by their [lbText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lbText).

lbsetpicturerightcolordisabled.name: lbSetPictureRightColorDisabled
lbsetpicturerightcolordisabled.description: Sets the disabled color of second (right aligned) picture of the item with the given index of the listbox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to the given color. Color is in format [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color). Color which consists from only zeros means disable this override.

syntaxArray.Params:
[idc, index, color]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) of control
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

iscollisionlighton.name: isCollisionLightOn
iscollisionlighton.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if vehicle collision lights are on otherwise [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false).

setobjectviewdistance.name: setObjectViewDistance
setobjectviewdistance.description: Sets the rendering distance of objects and shadows.

stop.name: stop
stop.description: Stop AI unit.Stopped unit will not be able to move, fire, or change its orientation to follow a watched object.It may still change the stance if deemed appropriate (e.g. under fire).Use [disableAI](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/disableAI) to disable specific AI capabilities.

items.name: items
items.description: Returns an array of names of all unit's stored items, including [weapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/weapons) but excluding [magazines](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/magazines) (see [itemsWithMagazines](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/itemsWithMagazines)) and [assignedItems](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/assignedItems).

selecteditorobject.name: selectEditorObject
selecteditorobject.description:
Select an editor object. Does not un-select previously selected objects. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

menusetpicture.name: menuSetPicture
menusetpicture.description: Sets new picture into menu entry on given path. The picture will be replaced by a tick if the entry was set to checkable with [menuSetCheck](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/menuSetCheck).

tvclear.name: tvClear
tvclear.description: Removes all items from Tree View with given idc.

gethidefrom.name: getHideFrom
gethidefrom.description: Returns the [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) where object believes the enemy to be. If there is no direct line of sight between the object and the enemy, this position is extrapolated based on the last known position and speed of the enemy. A returned position of [0,0,0] implies that object does not knowAbout enemy. If enemy is null it is some position in front of the object or enemy position.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [ASLToATL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ASLToATL) representation of the believed [aimPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/aimPos) of the enemy object

canstand.name: canStand
canstand.description: Returns if the given soldier is able to stand up.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) -  
[true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if he's still able to stand up, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if not. Automatically return [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if unit is vehicle.

gettextraw.name: getTextRaw
gettextraw.description: Returns raw text from config entry. If entry is subject to [ localization](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/localize), the translation key is returned. To obtain the [ localized](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isLocalized) text, see [getText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getText).

drawarrow.name: drawArrow
drawarrow.description: Draws a single line arrow on the map. To draw a color filled arrow of custom shape see [BIS_fnc_drawArrow](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_drawArrow)

syntaxArray.Params:
map: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
[from, to, color]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
from: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - arrow start position in format: [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
to: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - arrow end position in format: [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - arrow color in format [r,g,b,a]

setsimpletasktype.name: setSimpleTaskType
setsimpletasktype.description: Attach type to the simple task. See [Default Task Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Tasks_Overhaul#Default_Task_Types:_Actions).

needreload.name: needReload
needreload.description: Return how much vehicle wants to reload its weapons.

ctremoveheaders.name: ctRemoveHeaders
ctremoveheaders.description: Takes array of header indices as a parameter and removes headers with those indices. Indices of remaining headers will be recomputed.

fileexists.name: fileExists
fileexists.description: Checks if file on given path exists. Uses same path resolve code as [loadFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/loadFile).

save3deninventory.name: save3DENInventory
save3deninventory.description: Saves the current state of entities' inventory to the current mission's [Mission.sqm](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Mission.sqm).

velocitymodelspace.name: velocityModelSpace
velocitymodelspace.description: Returns the velocity (speed vector) of the vehicle as an array with format [x, y, z]. Vector is in model space.

setdestination.name: setDestination
setdestination.description:
Set the destination for path planning of the pilot.

Possible values for planningMode are:


* "DoNotPlan" - used when not moving

* "DoNotPlanFormation" - used in formation when simple path testing is used

* "LEADER PLANNED" - used for formation leader (full path finding used)

* "LEADER DIRECT" - used for DirectGo (like getin, supply)

* "FORMATION PLANNED" - used in formation when full path finding is used

* "VEHICLE PLANNED" - used for vehicle driver

Works best when used on [agents](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/agents). Using "LEADER PLANNED" will trigger "PathCalculated" [ Event Handler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers#PathCalculated)

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[position, planningMode, forceReplan]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position)
planningMode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
forceReplan: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) Specifies if replanning of the path should be forced.

assigncurator.name: assignCurator
assigncurator.description: Assign player as curator. Two players cannot act as one curator.

count.name: count
count.description:
Can be used to count:

* the number of elements in array (doesn’t actually count them per se but rather returns already known array size)

* the number of elements in array with condition

* the number of sub-entries in a config entry

* the number of characters in an ANSI string (*since Arma 3 v1.27.126674*). If Unicode support is desired, see [forceUnicode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forceUnicode).

syntaxArray.Params:
condition: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) that must return [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) for the tested element to be counted. The variable [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x) will contain the currently tested element.
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

examples:
```sqf
count [0, 0, 1, 2]; *// returns 4*
count [units](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/units) [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player); *// returns number of units in player group*
```

```sqf
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _cnt = { [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x) == 4 } count [1, 9, 8, 3, 4, 4, 4, 5, 6]; *// returns 3*
_cnt = { [alive](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/alive) [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x) } count [allUnits](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/allUnits); *// returns the number of alive units*
```

```sqf
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _cnt = count ([configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) [>>](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/config_greater_greater_name) "CfgVehicles");
```

```sqf
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) count "japa is the man!"; *// 16*
```

```sqf
[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) (count _myHashMap < 1) [then](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/then) { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "empty hashmap!"; };
```

ctclear.name: ctClear
ctclear.description: Removes all the lines from the RscControlsTable. Returns Nothing.

mapcenteroncamera.name: mapCenterOnCamera
mapcenteroncamera.description:
ctrl mapCenterOnCamera enable syntax enables/disables continuous centering of the main map type control on the camera position. Needs to be executed once.
mapCenterOnCamera ctrl syntax centers mini map type control on camera. The command returns world position of the camera. Needs to be executed each frame (preferably inside onDraw EH).

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [PositionWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionWorld) of the map center (camera focus object) in render scope

boundingcenter.name: boundingCenter
boundingcenter.description: Returns the position of original (loaded) center of object in model coordinates.

stopped.name: stopped
stopped.description: Check if unit is stopped by [stop](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/stop) command.

magazinesammocargo.name: magazinesAmmoCargo
magazinesammocargo.description: Returns an array of subarrays with the type names and ammo left of all the vehicle's cargo or container magazines.

kbremovetopic.name: kbRemoveTopic
kbremovetopic.description: Unregister conversation topic from given person. See [Conversations](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Conversations) for more details.

issensortargetconfirmed.name: isSensorTargetConfirmed
issensortargetconfirmed.description: Returns if given unit is confirmed target for given side.

tvsetselected.name: tvSetSelected
tvsetselected.description: Sets the selection state of given treeview item in multi-select control.

ctrlsetfonth2.name: ctrlSetFontH2
ctrlsetfonth2.description: Sets H2 font of given HTML control

markasfinishedonsteam.name: markAsFinishedOnSteam
markasfinishedonsteam.description: Marks current mission as finished on Steam. Returns true if Steam query is successfully started or false otherwise.

overcast.name: overcast
overcast.description: Return the current overcast level. Zero is clear skies, one is maximum cloud cover.

wind.name: wind
wind.description:
Returns the current wind vector (in m/s) as array [x, y, z].
**NOTE:** the last value (z, "up-down") always returns 0 – wind being only horizontal.

musicvolume.name: musicVolume
musicvolume.description: Returns the current music volume (set by [fadeMusic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/fadeMusic))

else.name: else
else.description: Executes else code when [if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) condition returns [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false).

setobjectmaterial.name: setObjectMaterial
setobjectmaterial.description: Sets material of object selection. The selection number is defined through the [ hiddenselection](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgVehicles_Config_Reference#hiddenSelections)[]={} array in the vehicle's config (starting with 0).

setlightcolor.name: setLightColor
setlightcolor.description: Set diffuse color of light. Illuminates surfaces that are facing the light.

commandchat.name: commandChat
commandchat.description: Types text to the command radio channel. Must have assigned "ItemRadio" to see or transmit the messages. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the message to show on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see [remoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExec))

syntaxArray.Params:
unitName: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit transmitting message
chatText: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - message to transmit

[side, identity]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
side: [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) - side to which the message will be seen
identity: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class name of one of the identities in CfgHQIdentities. Possible identities in Arma 3 are:

* "Base"

* "HQ"

* "PAPA_BEAR"

* "AirBase"

* "BLU"

* "OPF"

* "IND"

* "IND_G"
chatText: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - message to transmit

countside.name: countSide
countside.description: Returns how many units in the given array belong to given side.

syntaxArray.Params:
side: [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side)
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) and/or [Groups](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)
> ⓘIf the object in passed array is a [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group), the leader of the group will be counted.

scoreside.name: scoreSide
scoreside.description: Returns score for the given [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side). MP Only.

sideempty.name: sideEmpty
sideempty.description: Returns empty side, for example static buildings in [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor).

worldtomodel.name: worldToModel
worldtomodel.description: Converts position from world space to object model space.

syntaxArray.Params:
model: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - World position, format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) or [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D)

vehiclechat.name: vehicleChat
vehiclechat.description:
Types text to the vehicle radio channel. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the message to show on all computers, you have to execute it globally, see [remoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExec).


> ⓘ
> 
> * Object parameter must be a vehicle, not a player
> 
> * If you are in a crew seat (i.e. driver, gunner or commander), then it will include that role in the chat name output (Eg: Driver (you_name): "Message")

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicleName: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Vehicle unit is in
chatText: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Message to transmit

removeall3deneventhandlers.name: removeAll3DENEventHandlers
removeall3deneventhandlers.description:
Removes all [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor) event handlers of given type. 

See the list of all [Eden Editor Event Handlers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers:_Eden_Editor).

pixelgridnouiscale.name: pixelGridNoUIScale
pixelgridnouiscale.description: Returns grid size based on screen resolution and configs: uiScaleFactor, uiScaleMaxGrids. As mentioned in the name of this command, the **user interface scale is ignored**.

syntaxArray.Params:
marker: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
alpha: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Alpha value from 0 (invisible) to 1 (fully visible)

setowner.name: setOwner
setowner.description: From server machine, change the ownership of an object to a given client. Using command in an unintended way will log a message to .rpt file. To transfer ownership of all AI units in a group properly, use [setGroupOwner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setGroupOwner) instead.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Object to transfer
clientID: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The [ machine network ID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Machine_network_ID) of the new [owner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/owner).
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if ownership was successfully transferred, otherwise [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)

tvsetselectcolor.name: tvSetSelectColor
tvsetselectcolor.description: Sets the select color of given path.

syntaxArray.Params:
ctrl: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Path of the item
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Color RGBA

setforcegeneratorrtd.name: setForceGeneratorRTD
setforcegeneratorrtd.description:
*This article is a [Stub](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Stubs). You can help BI Community Wiki by [expanding it](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://community.bistudio.com/wiki?title=setForceGeneratorRTD&action=edit).*
 > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

tvcollapse.name: tvCollapse
tvcollapse.description: Collapses tree item pointed to by the path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

syntaxArray.Params:
[idc, path]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Item [Tree View Path](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Tree_View_Path). [] will collapse the whole tree and it will disappear

control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Item [Tree View Path](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Tree_View_Path). [] will collapse the whole tree and it will disappear

camsetdir.name: camSetDir
camsetdir.description: Sets the orientation of the given camera in the direction of the given vector. Needs [camCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCommit).

syntaxArray.Params:
camera: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object of type "camera"
direction:

* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (before [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[0.50](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_0.50)) - camera azimuth

* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [x,y,z] (since [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[0.50](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_0.50)) - direction of camera. Must be a valid vector.

enableai.name: enableAI
enableai.description:
Enables parts of the AI behavior that was disabled by [disableAI](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/disableAI). 

> ⚠When player switches and leaves behind AI unit, you need to enable "TeamSwitch" AI on it _unit enableAI "TeamSwitch" so that the unit continues with [waypoints](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/waypoints)
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Since Arma 3 v1.96 it is possible to return the state of the given AI flag via [checkAIFeature](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/checkAIFeature) or set it using alias command [enableAIFeature](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/enableAIFeature)

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
skilltype: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - See [disableAI](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/disableAI) for possible values.

movetime.name: moveTime
movetime.description: Returns the current time of the most important RTM animation currently being played on the soldier.

removecuratoraddons.name: removeCuratorAddons
removecuratoraddons.description: Restrict curator use of given addons.

set3denlogictype.name: set3DENLogicType
set3denlogictype.description: Sets the new type of Logic object(s). For other objects use [set3DENObjectType](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/set3DENObjectType)

syntaxArray.Params:
objects: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
classname: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the cfgVehicles class

setrank.name: setRank
setrank.description:
Sets rank of given unit.

Possible values: PRIVATE, CORPORAL, SERGEANT, LIEUTENANT, CAPTAIN, MAJOR or COLONEL. 

> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Since Arma 3 v1.67 this command is [LALocal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Locality) [GEGlobal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Locality)

someammo.name: someAmmo
someammo.description: Check if unit has some ammo.

savestatus.name: saveStatus
savestatus.description: Saves object's properties to [Objects.sav](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Objects.sav) file in campaign directory as entry name.

dialog.name: dialog
dialog.description: Tests whether any user dialog is open.

syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [True](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if a dialog is open, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if not

morale.name: morale
morale.description: Checks a current morale level of the unit (-1..+1).

ctcursel.name: ctCurSel
ctcursel.description: Returns index of the selected row. Will take only rows, but not headers into account.

set3denmissionattribute.name: set3DENMissionAttribute
set3denmissionattribute.description:
Set [scenario attribute](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Scenario_Atttributes).

An attribute is identified by its property (data when it is engine-drive attribute) value in config. For the list of all attributes with their properties, see [Setting Attributes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Setting_Attributes#Attributes).

> ⚠Attributes are available only within the Eden Editor workspace. You cannot access them in scenario preview or exported scenario!

syntaxArray.Params:
section: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - attribute section
class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - attribute name
