value: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - new attribute value

ctrlshown.name: ctrlShown
ctrlshown.description: Returns whether given control is shown.

creatediaryrecord.name: createDiaryRecord
creatediaryrecord.description:
Creates a [diary](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Diary) entry. Supported tags and their parameters: [Show text](https://community.bistudio.com#)



Tag

Options


img



* *image*: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - path to image. When present, any element with it will be displayed as image.

* *width*: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - image width in pixels.

* *height*: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - image height in pixels.


font



* *color*: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [HTML color](https://community.bistudio.comhttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML_color) in format #aarrggbb or #rrggbb

* *size*: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - font height in pixels.

* *face*: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - font type (class from CfgFontFamilies)


br

N/A


marker



* *name*: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - marker name


execute



* *expression*: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - executed code


executeClose



* *expression*: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - executed code, diary is closed afterwards


[log](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createDiaryLink)



* *subject*: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [subject](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createDiarySubject) name.

* *record*: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - record name (e.g. "Record6" or "Unit1059524")


gear



* *unit*: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - unit ID


teamSwitch



* *unit*: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - unit ID


kick



* *id*: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - unit ID


ban



* *id*: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - unit ID


mute



* *id*: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - unit ID


currentTask



* *id*: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - task ID






> ⓘIf the createDiaryRecord command fails, it returns a null record. Since there is no null record unary command, you can make a variable and compare against it.
> 
> ```sqf
> [private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _recordNull = [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) createDiaryRecord [];
> [if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) ([player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) createDiaryRecord ["Diary", ["Title", "Description"]] [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) _recordNull) [then](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/then) { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "Failed"; };
> ```
>

syntaxArray.Syntax: player createDiaryRecord [subject, text, task, taskState, showTitle]
syntaxArray.Params:
player: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
subject: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
task: (Optional, default 
```sqf
[taskNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/taskNull)
```
) - [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task)
taskState: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) (Optional, default 
```sqf
?
```
) - Changes the state of the given task. Can be "NONE", "CREATED", "ASSIGNED", "SUCCEEDED", "FAILED", "CANCELED"
showTitle: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Optional, default 
```sqf
[true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)
```
) - Whether or not to show title in the description section as well *Since Arma 3 v1.96*

syntaxArray.Syntax: player createDiaryRecord [subject, [title, text], task, taskState, showTitle]
syntaxArray.Params:
player : [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
subject: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
title: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
task: (Optional, default 
```sqf
[taskNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/taskNull)
```
) - [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task)
taskState: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) (Optional, default 
```sqf
?
```
) - Changes the state of the given task. Can be "NONE", "CREATED", "ASSIGNED", "SUCCEEDED", "FAILED", "CANCELED"
showTitle: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Optional, default 
```sqf
[true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)
```
) - Whether or not to show title in the description section as well *Since Arma 3 v1.96*

examples:
```sqf [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) createDiaryRecord ["Diary", ["Intel", "Enemy base is on grid 161170"]] ``` ```sqf [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) createDiaryRecord ["Diary", "Information gathered.
"] ``` ```sqf [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) createDiaryRecord ["Diary", ["No Title", "description"], [taskNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/taskNull), "", [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)]; ``` ```sqf [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) createDiaryRecord ["Diary", ["Font tag","This will changed text size, colour and font"], [taskNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/taskNull), "",[false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)]; ``` ```sqf [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) createDiaryRecord ["Diary", ["Image", ""], [taskNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/taskNull), "", [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)]; ``` ```sqf [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) createDiaryRecord ["Diary", ["Linebreak","Line1

Line2



Line4"], [taskNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/taskNull), "", [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)]; ``` ```sqf [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) createDiaryRecord ["Diary", ["Execute","Some text"], [taskNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/taskNull), "", [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)]; ``` ```sqf [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) createDiaryRecord ["Diary", ["ExecuteClose", "Close Diary"], [taskNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/taskNull), "", [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)]; ```

enablepersonturret.name: enablePersonTurret
enablepersonturret.description: Enables or disables firing from a vehicle cargo position. To get the turret path use [assignedVehicleRole](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/assignedVehicleRole) or [getCargoIndex](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getCargoIndex) command.

registertask.name: registerTask
registertask.description: Registers a new task type. Parameters are defined in the given config class (subclass of CfgTasks)

crew.name: crew
crew.description: Returns the crew (both dead and alive) of the given vehicle.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) -  An array with all units in the vehicle is returned.

setmarkertypelocal.name: setMarkerTypeLocal
setmarkertypelocal.description: Sets marker type locally. Marker type is a class name in [CfgMarkers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgMarkers).

customwaypointposition.name: customWaypointPosition
customwaypointposition.description: Returns player's custom waypoint (LShift + LMB) [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) or an empty array [] if no custom waypoint exists.

minedetectedby.name: mineDetectedBy
minedetectedby.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if mine has been detected by a given side

everycontainer.name: everyContainer
everycontainer.description: Returns array of all containers (uniforms, vests, backpacks) stored in given crate or vehicle. Used for accessing containers content stored in ammo box or ground holder.

enablestressdamage.name: enableStressDamage
enablestressdamage.description:
Toggles stress damage in [ Advanced Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#forceRotorLibSimulation), which otherwise could be manually toggles in game setting: Options - Game - Helicopter Flight Model - Advanced - Stress Damage.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

syntaxArray.Params: state: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to enable stress damage, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to disable it

ctrlremoveeventhandler.name: ctrlRemoveEventHandler
ctrlremoveeventhandler.description: Remove a given event handler from the given control.

addbackpack.name: addBackpack
addbackpack.description:
Adds a backpack for a unit. If a unit already has a backpack, the old backpack will be placed on the ground under the unit.
> ⓘClassname list of available backpacks:
> 
> * [Arma 2 OA backpacks](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_2_OA:_Backpacks)
> 
> * [Arma 3 backpacks](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgVehicles_EMPTY) - objects starting with "B_", starts with "*B_AssaultPack_khk*"

dotarget.name: doTarget
dotarget.description:
Order the given unit(s) to target the given target (without radio messages).Targeting can be stopped by 
```sqf
_unit [doWatch](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/doWatch) [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull);
```
 or
```sqf
_unit [commandWatch](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/commandWatch) [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull);
```

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - a single unit or array of units
target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

hideobject.name: hideObject
hideobject.description: Hide entity. Can be used on soldiers and vehicles, also on static objects.

addmagazines.name: addMagazines
addmagazines.description: Adds multiple magazines to the unit. For cargo containers use [addMagazineCargoGlobal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addMagazineCargoGlobal) command.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - a soldier
[magazineName, count]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
magazineName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Number of magazines.

gunner.name: gunner
gunner.description: Returns the gunner of a vehicle.

syntaxArray.Return: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - The person sitting in the gunner place is returned. If vehicle is not a vehicle but a person, the person is returned.

lbsetcolorright.name: lbSetColorRight
lbsetcolorright.description:
Sets the color of the item (right) with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user [dialog](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/dialog) to color.

Colour is in format [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color).

syntaxArray.Params:
[idc, index, color]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) of control
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
color: [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color)

getgraphvalues.name: getGraphValues
getgraphvalues.description: Generate graph y - coordinates of all input values within specific x and y range.

syntaxArray.Syntax: getGraphValues [[graphMinX, graphMaxX, graphMinY, graphMaxY, valueCount, randomOffset], x1, y1, x2, y2, ... xn, yn]
syntaxArray.Params:
graphMinX: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - minimum x-axis value
graphMaxX: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - maximum x-axis value
graphMinY: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - minimum y-axis value
graphMaxY: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - maximum y-axis value
valueCount: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - number of values the returned array should have
randomOffset: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - random range for returned y value
x1..n: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - nth x value
y1..n: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - nth y value

moveinany.name: moveInAny
moveinany.description:
Moves unit to the first available seat in a vehicle. The order of priorities is the same order used in squad command when you order subordinates to get in vehicle to any position and is the same order used in Zeus when you drag units to a vehicle. Seat assignment seems to use the following priority logic: 
driver ([moveInDriver](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveInDriver)) -> commander turret ([moveInCommander](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveInCommander)) -> gunner turret ([moveInGunner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveInGunner)) -> remaining turrets ([moveInTurret](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveInTurret)) -> cargo ([moveInCargo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveInCargo)).
**NOTE**: This command will move player into the [locked](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/locked) vehicle or seat just as well.

fadespeech.name: fadeSpeech
fadespeech.description:
Changes the master speech volume smoothly within the given time. The default volume is 1.0. Some of the sounds that play through speech channel are:

* [ Tactical Ping](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Difficulty_Settings) sound

* [playSound](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playSound) when *isSpeech* argument is [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)

* [say3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/say3D) when *isSpeech* argument is [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)

syntaxArray.Params:
time: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Fade interval in seconds
volume: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Speech volume range 0 to 2

createtrigger.name: createTrigger
createtrigger.description:
Creates a sensor ([trigger](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/trigger)) of the given type and at the given position. The type must be a class name in CfgNonAIVehicles or CfgVehicles with simulation = detector. An array containing all units that have activated the trigger is available via [list](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/list) *triggerobj*. Created triggers can be deleted using [deleteVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/deleteVehicle).

> ⓘSince Arma 3 v1.44 triggers can be created locally on clients setting optional param *makeGlobal* to [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)
> ⓘSince Arma 3 v1.54 triggers can be disabled/enabled using [enableSimulation](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/enableSimulation) command
Triggers are created with default params, which are:


* a: 50.0

* b: 50.0

* c: -1

* angle: 0

* rectangular: false

* activationBy: None

* activationType: Present

* repeating: false

* timeoutMin: 0

* timeoutMid: 0

* timeoutMax: 0

* interruptable: true

* type: None

* text: ""

* name: ""

* expCond: "this"

* expActiv: ""

* expDesactiv: ""

* interval: 0.5 (Cannot be accessed via editor, [ scripted only](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setTriggerInterval) since Arma 3 v1.98)

syntaxArray.Params:
[type, position, makeGlobal]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - usually "EmptyDetector"
position: [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
makeGlobal (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - locality flag  *(available since Arma 3 v1.44)*

* [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) (Default) - trigger is global [GEGlobal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Locality)

* [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) - trigger is local [LELocal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Locality)

effectivecommander.name: effectiveCommander
effectivecommander.description: Returns the effective commander of the vehicle. Effective commander is the player whom driver AI will listen to. So if in a tank there is a gunner and a commander and AI driver, if the effectiveCommander is gunner, then gunner pressing WASD will give AI orders to move. If gunner jumps out and then enters tank again, the effectiveCommander role most likely has changed to commander that remained in tank. Also the assignment seems to work on first come first served basis.

getspeed.name: getSpeed
getspeed.description:
Get the speed for the given speed mode.

SpeedMode can be:

* "AUTO"

* "SLOW"

* "NORMAL"

* "FAST"

formattext.name: formatText

syntaxArray.Params:
format: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - a string containing text and/or references to the variables listed below in the array. The references appear in the form of %1, %2 etc.
argument: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - use [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) where necessary (see [Example 2](https://community.bistudio.com#Example))

examples:
```sqf [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) formatText ["Image: %1", [image](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/image) "\a3\Data_f\Flags\flag_Altis_co.paa"]; ``` ```sqf [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) formatText ["%1%2%3", "line1", "
", "line2"]; *// result displayed in one line* [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) formatText ["%1%2%3", "line1", [lineBreak](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lineBreak), "line2"]; *// result displayed in two lines* ```

diag_activesqsscripts.name: diag_activeSQSScripts
diag_activesqsscripts.description: Returns array with active SQSs. To see number of all scripts currently in the scheduler use [diag_activeScripts](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_activeScripts).

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [[name, fileName, isRunning, currentLine],...]:

* name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - function- or filename

* fileName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) -

* isRunning: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) -

* currentLine: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - line currently executing

preloadtitlersc.name: preloadTitleRsc
preloadtitlersc.description:
Resource title - Preload data.

The resource can be defined in the [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext) file.

syntaxArray.Params:
[name, type]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) defined in [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext) for the mission
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) "PLAIN" e.g.

[name, type, speed, showInMap]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) defined in [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext) for the mission
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) "PLAIN" e.g.
speed (optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - IGNORED
showInMap: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

camerainterest.name: cameraInterest
camerainterest.description: Return camera interest for given entity, as set by [setCameraInterest](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setCameraInterest), or as autodetected.

inflamed.name: inflamed
inflamed.description: Checks if fireplace is inflamed (burning) or not. To check if a unit is receiving damage from fire, use [isBurning](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isBurning) command.

triggertype.name: triggerType
triggertype.description:
Returns trigger type (see [setTriggerType](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setTriggerType)). 

> ⚠The trigger could be [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) or remote but the result returned by this command will be for the trigger type set up locally on the client that executed the command. See [createTrigger](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createTrigger) for more info.

shownwatch.name: shownWatch
shownwatch.description: Checks if client has Watch enabled in [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext) (*showWatch* param) or force enabled with [showWatch](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/showWatch) command.

getpylonmagazines.name: getPylonMagazines
getpylonmagazines.description: Return array of magazines on pylons

removeallprimaryweaponitems.name: removeAllPrimaryWeaponItems
removeallprimaryweaponitems.description: Removes all items from [primaryWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/primaryWeapon), except magazine.

endmission.name: endMission
endmission.description:
Finish the mission.

The end type can be:

* "CONTINUE"

* "KILLED"

* "LOSER"

* "END1"

* "END2"

* "END3"

* "END4"

* "END5"

* "END6"

**Mission saves are deleted**. Use [failMission](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/failMission) if they should not.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)To maintain Arma 3 visual style, it is recommended to use [BIS_fnc_endMission](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_endMission) instead.

ctrlsetfontheighth2.name: ctrlSetFontHeightH2
ctrlsetfontheighth2.description: Sets H2 font size of given HTML control.

removesecondaryweaponitem.name: removeSecondaryWeaponItem
removesecondaryweaponitem.description: Removes given weapon item, including magazine, from the [secondaryWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/secondaryWeapon).

dogetout.name: doGetOut
dogetout.description:
Orders one or multiple units to get out from the vehicle (silently). Same as [commandGetOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/commandGetOut) with latter being shown via radio chat.

Notes:

* Works for both AI and player entities

* AI unit gets back in - unless is under player command or combined with other sqf commands ([orderGetIn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/orderGetIn) false, [allowGetIn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/allowGetIn) false or [leaveVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/leaveVehicle))

* Ignores vehicle's lock state - unlike [action "Eject"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Actions#Eject) and [moveOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveOut)

* AI waits for execution until vehicle has stopped/is no longer flying (unclear if any timeout exists for order to be discarded) - unlike [action "Eject"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Actions#Eject) and [moveOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveOut)

* Plays the vehicle's position's get out animation (same as [action "Eject"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Actions#Eject)) - unlike [moveOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveOut)

* When execute for multiple units, it waits till the action is completed, before the next to take his turn (same as [action "Eject"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Actions#Eject)) - unlike [moveOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveOut)

* AI gets back into formation afterwards

* Works only on alive units - unlike [action "Eject"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Actions#Eject) (one after another) or [moveOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveOut) (instantly)

* Does not work on [unconscious](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setUnconscious) - unless the AI is under player command. Unlike [moveOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveOut) or [action "Eject"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Actions#Eject) (but one after another))

getmissionconfigvalue.name: getMissionConfigValue
getmissionconfigvalue.description:
Returns value of the given scenario attribute from the 1st tier. Since only config properties have values, the attribute should be config property. If it is not found or config class is given, the return is [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil). If the attribute defined in multiple places, the command checks them in the following order:

* External *[Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext)* file

* [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Scenario_Atttributes) scenario attribute
So if attribute exists in both places, attribute from [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext) is used. Previously, scenario attributes were extracted from *Description.ext* using [missionConfigFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionConfigFile). That still works, but it ignores attributes set directly in the editor and it should not be used anymore.

> ⚠This command cannot force return type, it will return the value of the type given in config. Use [isEqualType](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualType) to additionally reaffirm the correct type if necessary to account for human error.

syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), depending on the attribute value type. [Nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil) when the attribute is undefined.

syntaxArray.Params:
attribute: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - attribute name
defaultValue: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - value used when the attribute is undefined
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), depending on the attribute value type. Default value when the attribute is undefined.

examples:
```sqf
_respawnDelay = getMissionConfigValue ["respawnDelay",0]
```

Returns respawn delay value. Replaces the previous approach which would scan only the external *Description.ext file*, but ignore the value set in the Eden Editor:

```sqf
_respawnDelay = [getNumber](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getNumber) ([missionConfigFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionConfigFile) >> "respawnDelay"); // Old approach
```

select.name: select
select.description:
Selects an element from an array, config entry from [Config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config) or substring from a string or a range from an array. 
> ⓘSubstring version of `select` operates with ANSI charset, if Unicode support is desired, see [forceUnicode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forceUnicode)

syntaxArray.Params:
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index 0 denotes the first element, 1 the second, etc. If index has decimal places it gets rounded down for fractions less than or equal .5, otherwise it gets rounded up.
syntaxArray.Return: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - a reference to array element given by its index
[Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - a reference to array element given by its index (false - 0, true - 1)

syntaxArray.Params:
config: [Config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config)
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index 0 denotes the first element, 1 the second, etc. If index has decimal places it gets rounded down for fractions less than or equal .5, otherwise it gets rounded up.

string: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
[start, length]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
start: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - String position to start selection from. 0 denotes the first character of the string, 1 the second, etc. If passed number has decimal places it gets rounded down for fractions less than or equal .5, otherwise it gets rounded up.
length (optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Number of the string characters to select. If "length" is omitted, selection will be made from "start" to the end of the string.

array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
[start, count]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
start: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Array index to start selection from.
count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Number of array elements to select. If the selected range exceeds source array boundaries, selection will be made up to the last element of the array.

array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
expression: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - expression that is expected to return [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) or [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing). If [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) is returned, the original array value of currently tested element [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x) will be added to the output array
syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - a new array of all elements from the original array that satisfied expression condition

examples:
```sqf
["a", "b", "c", "d"] select 2; *// result is "c"*
[position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/position) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) select 2; *// result is Z coordinate of player position*
```

```sqf
["", [currentWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/currentWeapon) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)] select [alive](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/alive) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player); *// if player is dead, "" is selected*
```

```sqf
([configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "cfgVehicles" >> [typeOf](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/typeOf) [vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) >> "Turrets") select 0 >> "gunnerAction";
```

```sqf
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) ("japa is the man!" select [8]); *// the man!*
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) ("japa is the man!" select [0,7]); *// japa is*
```

```sqf
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) ([1,2,3,4,5,6] select [1,4]); *// [2,3,4,5]*
```

```sqf
_even = [1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9,0] select { _x % 2 == 0 }; *// returns [2, 4, 6, 8, 0]*
```

lbsetcursel.name: lbSetCurSel
lbsetcursel.description:
Selects the item with the given index in the listbox, listnbox, combobox, xcombobox, xlistbox
> ⚠**The following only applies to the [Alternative Syntax](https://community.bistudio.com#Syntax_2) when used with [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTBOX) and [CT_LISTNBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTNBOX).**
> To deselect all entries, use -1: _ctrl lbSetCurSel -1; For listbox of style LB_MULTI use [lbSetSelected](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lbSetSelected) instead.
> [CT_COMBO](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_COMBO) does not allow deselecting entries, it will instead select the first one as it is not a combobox usual behaviour.
> 
> If you really need to deselect a combobox, see [DreadedEntity's note](https://community.bistudio.com#Notes).

tvselection.name: tvSelection
tvselection.description: Returns array of paths to selected items.

waypointformation.name: waypointFormation
waypointformation.description:
Gets the waypoint formation.

Possible values are: 

* "NO CHANGE"

* "COLUMN"

* "STAG COLUMN"

* "WEDGE"

* "ECH LEFT"

* "ECH RIGHT"

* "VEE"

* "LINE"

* "FILE"

* "DIAMOND"

waypointattachedobject.name: waypointAttachedObject
waypointattachedobject.description: Gets the object attached to the waypoint.

foreachmemberteam.name: forEachMemberTeam
foreachmemberteam.description: Executes the given command recursively for each team that is a member of the given team. For just agents use [forEachMemberAgent](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forEachMemberAgent). For both teams and agents use [forEachMember](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forEachMember).

visiblescoretable.name: visibleScoretable
visiblescoretable.description: Checks whether the score table is visible.

unitrecoilcoefficient.name: unitRecoilCoefficient
unitrecoilcoefficient.description: Returns recoil coefficient of a soldier.

clearallitemsfrombackpack.name: clearAllItemsFromBackpack
clearallitemsfrombackpack.description: Removes all items from backpack of a unit.

findnearestenemy.name: findNearestEnemy
findnearestenemy.description: Finds the nearest enemy to the specified position. Returns a null object if the object's group does not [know about](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/knowsAbout) any enemies. This command will return nearest object that is known to the unit and is considered enemy. An empty vehicle that is part of enemy group assets (see [addVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addVehicle)) can be returned as valid nearest target.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
position: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) or [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D)

commandingmenu.name: commandingMenu
commandingmenu.description: Returns the name of the topmost commanding menu or "" if the menu is closed. For action menu visibility check see [isActionMenuVisible](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isActionMenuVisible).

scriptname.name: scriptName
scriptname.description:
Assign a user friendly name to the [VM script](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Script_(Handle)) this command is executed from.

Once name is assigned, it cannot be changed.

getloadedmodsinfo.name: getLoadedModsInfo
getloadedmodsinfo.description:
Returns information about all loaded modifications.

> ⓘThe first 7 are equal to whats printed to RPT at game startup in the ======== mods ======= category.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Arrays](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [modname, modDir, isDefault, isOfficial, origin, hash, hashShort, itemID (Either DLC appid, or steam workshop itemid)]

examples:
```sqf
_loadedMods = getLoadedModsInfo;
/*

		["dummy","dummy",false,false,"NOT FOUND","","","0"],
```

syntaxArray.Params:
showScene: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - visibility in the scene
showMap : [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - visibility in the map

camcommitprepared.name: camCommitPrepared
camcommitprepared.description: Smoothly conducts the changes that were assigned to a camera within the given time. If the time is set to zero, the changes are done immediately. This command is for use with camPrepareXXX commands. For the normal cam command use [camCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCommit).

syntaxArray.Params:
camera: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Object of type "camera"
time: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Time in seconds during which the changes shall be done

point1: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [x,y,z] or [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) or [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)
point2: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [x,y,z] or [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) or [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

setposasl.name: setPosASL
setposasl.description: Sets the object position above sea level. Given position must be in [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) format.

getfriend.name: getFriend
getfriend.description: Returns if sides are friendly or hostile. For a value smaller than 0.6 it results in being enemy, otherwise it is friendly. See also [Side relations](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side_relations).

ctrlsetfontheighth4.name: ctrlSetFontHeightH4
ctrlsetfontheighth4.description: Sets H3 font size of given HTML control.

uniformitems.name: uniformItems
uniformitems.description: Get array with all items (of any kind, even weapons) from uniform.

magazineturretammo.name: magazineTurretAmmo
magazineturretammo.description:
Returns ammo count of given type from given turret 
> ⚠Broken when vehicle has multiple magazines of the same type

removedrawicon.name: removeDrawIcon
removedrawicon.description:
Removes an icon for an editor object. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

switchgesture.name: switchGesture
switchgesture.description: When used on a person,the given move is started immediately (without transition).

playaction.name: playAction
playaction.description:
When used on a person, a smooth transition to the given action will be initiated.

For Arma 3 actions see: [playAction/actions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playAction/actions).

lbsetpicturecolordisabled.name: lbSetPictureColorDisabled
lbsetpicturecolordisabled.description: Sets the disabled color of item's picture (left) with the given index of the listbox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to the given color. Color is in format [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color). Color which consists from only zeros means disable this override.

syntaxArray.Params:
[idc, index, color]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) of control
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

lbsetpictureright.name: lbSetPictureRight
lbsetpictureright.description:
Sets the second (right aligned) picture in the item with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user [dialog](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/dialog). Name is the picture name. The picture is searched for in the mission directory, the dtaExt subdirectory of the campaign directory and the dtaExt directory and the data bank (or directory).
In Arma 3 it might be necessary to set the color of the picture as well with [lbSetPictureRightColor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lbSetPictureRightColor) as default [0,0,0,0] color makes picture invisible. 

> ⓘWhen trying to select a listBox entry by clicking at the right picture, the control in the background is focused. It seems the width of the control is not extended by adding a right picture.

syntaxArray.Params:
[idc, index, name]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) of control
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

format.name: format
format.description:
Composes a string containing other variables or other variable types. Converts any variable type to a string. If you want to convert a string back to a number, use [parseNumber](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/parseNumber).
> ⚠The output of this command is limited to ~8Kb. [joinString](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/joinString) on the other hand doesn't have such limit and is a bit faster!

syntaxArray.Params:
formatString: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - a string containing text and/or references to the variables listed below in the array. The references appear in the form of %1, %2 etc.
var1: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - variable referenced by %1
var2: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - variable referenced by %2
syntaxArray.Return: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - The full string (up to 8kb, see above) is returned.

hintc.name: hintC
hintc.description:
Displays attractive hint in the center of the screen. Player control is taken away until "Continue" is pressed.

> ⓘIn Singleplayer, the game is paused as well.
After user confirmation, the content of the hintC is repeated again in a normal [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint). This type of hint can also have a title. It is also possible to drag this type of hint around the screen.

syntaxArray.Params:
title: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - message title
content: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String), [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text), [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text)

setposworld.name: setPosWorld
setposworld.description: Sets position of an object based on [PositionWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionWorld), which is [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) of the model centre [0,0,0].

isforcedwalk.name: isForcedWalk
isforcedwalk.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if player is forced to walk with [forceWalk](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forceWalk).

setinfopanel.name: setInfoPanel
setinfopanel.description: Opens given component or first component of given component type on specified info panel.

syntaxArray.Params:
infoPanelId: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - info panel classname, or "left" or "right"
componentClassOrType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if panel was successfully opened, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) otherwise (e.g. opening GPS on player without GPS item or setting panel to vehicle that doesn't have such capability configured)

examples:
```sqf
*// opens slingload assistant on right panel*
_result = setInfoPanel ["VehicleSystemsDisplayManagerComponentRight", "SlingLoadDisplayComponent"];
```

diag_lightnewload.name: diag_lightNewLoad
diag_lightnewload.description: Allows loading of lightning config during the gameplay (effectively changing the current scene lightning). Filename path can be either absolute or relative. The file must contain only the class LightningNew, which should contain lightning configuration.

syntaxArray.Params: path: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - The path to the config filename

ppeffectenabled.name: ppEffectEnabled

handgunweapon.name: handgunWeapon
handgunweapon.description: Returns the name of a unit's handgun (an empty string if there is none).

lnbgetcolumnsposition.name: lnbGetColumnsPosition
lnbgetcolumnsposition.description: Returns relative screen X of ListNBox control columns position [0.1,0.3,0.6...]. Use [lnbSetColumnsPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lnbSetColumnsPos) to set positions.

missionnamesource.name: missionNameSource
missionnamesource.description:
Return workshop-compatible currently loaded mission file (path to mission.pbo, relative to game exe).

> ⓘ
> 
> * [missionName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionName) will return the Workshop user-friendly mission name, whereas missionNameSource will take the information from [mission.sqm](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Mission.sqm).
> 
> * pre-v2.02 missions may return an empty string.

syntaxArray.Params:
vector1: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)
vector2: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

screenshot.name: screenshot
screenshot.description:
Captures a screenshot and stores it to given filename. PNG is the only available format and the file must have .png extension. 

The file is saved into *Screenshots* folder in the [Profile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Profile) directory. The folder is by default limited to 250 MB to prevent abuse.

To increase the limit, add the following line at the end of the profile file:

```sqf
maxScreenShotFolderSizeMB = 2000;
```

2000 can be replaced by any value in MB.

syntaxArray.Params: filename: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - desired path and name relative <USERDIR>\Screenshot\. If empty string "" used, the filename will be autogenerated in format: YYYY_MM_DD_hh_mm_ss.png

enginesrpmrtd.name: enginesRpmRTD
enginesrpmrtd.description: Returns all engines RPM.> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

publicvariable.name: publicVariable
publicvariable.description:
Reliably broadcasts [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace) variable and its **current** value to all computers (server/client).
Variables broadcast with publicVariable during a mission will be available to [JIP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Join_In_Progress) clients with the value they held at the time.
Such variables are persistent and sent to the JIP client before the first batch of client-side [Event Scripts](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Event_Scripts) (such as [init.sqf](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/init.sqf)) is run.
> ⚠Using publicVariable too frequently and/or with a lot of data can cause other aspects of the game to experience bandwidth problems.

The following [ Data Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Data_Types) are supported:



Type

[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

[Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

[Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

[Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)

[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

[Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Text)

[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

[Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code)

[Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) ([nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil))

[HashMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/HashMap)


Since

[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Operation_Flashpoint)[1.34](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Operation_Flashpoint_version_1.34)

[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Armed_Assault)[1.00](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Armed_Assault_version_1.00)

[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Armed_Assault)[1.09](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Armed_Assault_version_1.09)
