> ⚠It is not possible (and illogical) to transfer a local entity reference, such as [scripts](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Script), [displays](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display) or [local objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createVehicleLocal).
> Also, note that [Team Member](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Member) is not supported.

createmarkerlocal.name: createMarkerLocal
createmarkerlocal.description:
Creates a [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) marker at the given position. Marker exists only on PC that created it.  The marker name has to be unique, if a marker with the given name exists, the command will be ignored. Use [deleteMarkerLocal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/deleteMarkerLocal) to delete local marker.
If position is given in 3D format, z coordinate is stored with the marker and will be used when marker is passed to commands like [createVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createVehicle), [createUnit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createUnit), [createAgent](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createAgent), [createMine](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createMine), [setVehiclePosition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVehiclePosition) for example. However [getMarkerPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getMarkerPos) and [markerPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/markerPos) will always return 0 for z. 

> ⚠Local markers have own set of local commands "xxmarkerxxLocal" to work with. If you use global marker command on a local marker, the local marker will become global marker.

syntaxArray.Params:
[name, position, channel, creator]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - format position: [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) (object's [PositionWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionWorld) is used)
channel: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional)The marker side for MP. *since Arma 3 v2.01.146752*
creator: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - (Optional) The marker creator for MP. *since Arma 3 v2.01.146752*
syntaxArray.Return: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - The marker's name or empty string if the marker name is not unique.

listobjects.name: listObjects
listobjects.description:
Return the list of all objects of given type.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

menuhover.name: menuHover
menuhover.description: Returns path to menu entry mouse is currently hovering over.

deletestatus.name: deleteStatus
deletestatus.description: Deletes a status created with [saveStatus](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/saveStatus) from the campaign's progress file.

syntaxArray.Params: statusName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Name of the saved status

drawline3d.name: drawLine3D
drawline3d.description: Draws a line of a given color between two 3D positions. Command has to be executed each frame. Use [onEachFrame](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onEachFrame) or [addMissionEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addMissionEventHandler) "Draw3D".

productversion.name: productVersion
productversion.description: Returns the product's friendly name, identifier and version. In Arma 3 it also returns branch identifier, whether or not the game was launched using mods, and the platform.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Product Name

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Product Name Short

* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Product Version Number

* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Product Build Number

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) (Arma 3) - Product Branch

* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Arma 3) - Product is launched using mods [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) or vanilla [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) (Arma 3) - Platform (*"Windows"*, *"Linux"* or *"OSX"*)

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) (Arma 3) - Architecture - **x64** for 64bit or **x86** for 32bit **Since version 1.67**

examples:
```sqf
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) productVersion; *// would return ["Arma 2 OA", "arma2oa", 162, 95208] on Arma 2 OA 1.62.95208*
```

```sqf
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) productVersion; *// ["Arma 3","Arma3",137,128764,"Development",false,"Windows"]*
```

```sqf
[format](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/format) ["%1.%2",(productVersion[#](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/a_hash_b)2)/100 [toFixed](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/toFixed) 2,(productVersion[#](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/a_hash_b)3)]; *// returns version e.g.: "2.00.146773"*
```

setvehiclecargo.name: setVehicleCargo
setvehiclecargo.description: Load cargo vehicle inside vehicle if possible, returns bool based on whether the vehicle was able to be loaded.  Can also be used to unload a specific loaded vehicle or all loaded vehicles.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle carrying cargo
cargo: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - cargo to put in vehicle
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - whether the vehicle was able to be loaded

examples:
Blackfish with no vehicle cargo loaded

```sqf
_success = blackfish setVehicleCargo offroad; //true

```
Blackfish with full cargo already loaded

```sqf
_success = blackfish setVehicleCargo offroad; //false

```
Unload specific loaded vehicle

```sqf
_success = [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) setVehicleCargo offroad; 

```
Unload all vehicles

```sqf
_success = blackfish setVehicleCargo [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull);

```

setlightattenuation.name: setLightAttenuation
setlightattenuation.description: Sets attenuation of light. Standard method of attenuation (1 / (constant + linear*dist + quadratic*dist*dist)). *start* param represents distance, where the attenuation starts to take effects (dist = distance - start).

syntaxArray.Syntax: light setLightAttenuation [start, constant, linear, quadratic, hardlimitstart, hardlimitend]
syntaxArray.Params:
light: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[start, constant, linear, quadratic, hardlimitstart, hardlimitend]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
start: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - distance with 100% intensity, falloff starts here
constant: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - constant attenuation coef
linear: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - linear attenuation coef
quadratic: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - quadratic attenuation coef
hardlimitstart (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - max distance hard limit start (start of fading of intensity to 0) in m
hardlimitend (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - max distance hard limit end (end of fading of intensity to 0) in m

matrixtranspose.name: matrixTranspose
matrixtranspose.description:
Returns [transposed](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transpose) version of the given matrix. The matrix is an [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of rows. Each row is an [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of corresponding column values for the row. The minimum number of rows is 1.

[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:matrixTranspose.jpg)

lbsettext.name: lbSetText
lbsettext.description: Sets the text on the left side of the item with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user dialog.

syntaxArray.Params:
[idc, index, name]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) of control
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

nearestlocations.name: nearestLocations
nearestlocations.description:
Returns an array of locations of chosen type(s) within the given radius of the given position, sorted from nearest to farthest.
> ⓘAlthough locations can be placed in 3D with [setPosition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPosition), nearestLocations search result is sorted in 2D.

syntaxArray.Params:
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
locationTypeX: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [location type](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location#Location_Types) name, e.g "NameCity"
radius: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - maximum distance from the given position that returned locations may be, in meters.
sortPosition: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional) [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - results will be sorted from the distance to given *sortPosition* (nearest to farthest still)

swimindepth.name: swimInDepth
swimindepth.description: Sets the target depth level for swimming soldier. Depth should be a negative number.

random.name: random
random.description:
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:bellcurve.jpg) Random real (floating point) value from 0 (inclusive) to x (not inclusive).

Since Arma 3 v1.56 alternative syntax is added, allowing the definition of [Gaussian Distribution](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Normal_distribution)[[1]](https://community.bistudio.com#cite_note-1) params. Uses the same method as [setTriggerTimeout](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setTriggerTimeout) command. Quite useful for spawning loot for example, making more valuable items more rare (**Alternative Syntax 1**)
Since Arma 3 v1.68 two alternative syntaxes are available:


* allowing to generate semi-random number based on provided seed (**Alternative Syntax 2**)

* generating pseudo-random [noise texture](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perlin_noise) based on provided seed and returning a single number between 0 (included) and 1 (excluded) at supplied *x* and *y* coordinates (**Alternative Syntax 3**)

syntaxArray.Params:
seed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
[x, y]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) position on the [Perlin noise texture](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perlin_noise)
x: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
y: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

lockedcargo.name: lockedCargo
lockedcargo.description: Check whether cargo position of the vehicle is locked.

istuthintsenabled.name: isTutHintsEnabled
istuthintsenabled.description: Returns the status of TUTORIAL HINTS setting in UI (OPTIONS >> GAME >> GENERAL >> TUTORIAL HINTS).

setpilotlight.name: setPilotLight
setpilotlight.description: Switches headlights of a vehicle on/off. Note that the vehicle has to be [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local), for global variant use [Arma 3 Actions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Actions) "[LightOn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Actions#LightOn)"/"[LightOff](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Actions#LightOff)"

leaderboarddeinit.name: leaderboardDeInit
leaderboarddeinit.description: Deletes internal class for the leaderboard with given name. Returns true if the board has been found and deinitialized.

tofixed.name: toFixed

syntaxArray.Params:
number: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - number to convert
decimals: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - number of decimals to display (range 0-20)
decimals: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - number of decimals to display (range 0-20). -1 to reset to default number of decimals

examples:
```sqf
123 toFixed 2; *// "123.00"*
```

```sqf
2.34 toFixed 1; *// "2.3"*
2.35 toFixed 1; *// "2.4"*
```
Convert position to string preserving position precision: 
```sqf
fn_posToString = 
{
	[format](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/format) [
		"[%1,%2,%3]", 
		_this [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 0 toFixed 8, 
		_this [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 1 toFixed 8, 
		_this [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 2 toFixed 8
	]
};
[str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [getPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPos) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player);					*// "[3231.05,171.802,0.00143862]"*
[getPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPos) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) fn_posToString;	*// "[3231.04882813,171.80192566,0.00143862]"*
```
Same as **Example 3** only using new alternative syntax:
```sqf
[str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [getPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPos) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player); *// "[3231.05,171.802,0.00143862]"*
toFixed 8;
[str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [getPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPos) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player); *// "[3231.04882813,171.80192566,0.00143862]"*
```

servername.name: serverName
servername.description: Returns name of the hosting server in MP, "" in SP.

clear3deninventory.name: clear3DENInventory
clear3deninventory.description: Deletes inventory from mission.sqm of given units. Effect is not immediately visible, only when previewing the inventory resets to default.

canadditemtobackpack.name: canAddItemToBackpack
canadditemtobackpack.description: Checks if given object can be stored into soldier's backpack.

tvsetpicturecolordisabled.name: tvSetPictureColorDisabled
tvsetpicturecolordisabled.description: Sets the color of left picture of a tree item defined by path when item is disabled

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
[path, color]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - path to tree view item
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - color in format [r,g,b,a]

precision.name: precision
precision.description: Return the precision of the given entity, how is the entity able to be precise when moving to given target.

ctrlclassname.name: ctrlClassName
ctrlclassname.description:
Returns the class name of a [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) as it is defined in config. If you need config class of a game created [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display), it is stored on display itself:

```sqf
_className = [findDisplay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findDisplay) 12 [getVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getVariable) ["BIS_fnc_initDisplay_configClass", ""]; // "RscDiary"
```

removeweaponattachmentcargo.name: removeWeaponAttachmentCargo
removeweaponattachmentcargo.description:
Remove attachment linked to a weapon from the vehicle cargo space. 
> ⚠This is unofficial documentation. All Information here is as it exists in the Engine. It might not reflect the reality.

vectorupvisual.name: vectorUpVisual
vectorupvisual.description: Return object's up vector in world [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) coordinates ( [x, y, z] ) in render time scope.

menusetcheck.name: menuSetCheck
menusetcheck.description: Sets item on given path to be checked or not. By default menu strip entries are not checkable. Once this command was executed, an entry can be become checked and unchecked. If an entry is checked is indicated by a tick to the left of the entry's text. Setting an entry to be checkable will overwrite set picture with [menuSetPicture](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/menuSetPicture).

menusize.name: menuSize
menusize.description: Returns how many sub entries is in item on given path.

addforce.name: addForce
addforce.description:
Applies force to given object at given position. Force is defined as vector [x, y, z] in world space, position is vector [x, y, z] in model space. If you need to define force in model space, use [vectorModelToWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorModelToWorld) or [vectorModelToWorldVisual](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorModelToWorldVisual) commands first. The force applied as impulse. For more information see [NVIDIA docs](https://community.bistudio.comhttp://docs.nvidia.com/gameworks/content/gameworkslibrary/physx/apireference/files/classPxRigidBody.html#a22b0a1ef0b6c5656a6063c5c38f5679c)
> ⓘSince Arma 3 v2.04 this command can be used on units. It will send the unit into unconscious ragdoll state, similar to how [setUnconscious](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setUnconscious) does it (see example 3). In multiplayer, the unit has to be [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) [LALocal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Locality) on the computer that executed command.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - PhysX object
force: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Force vector (in world space) in format [x,y,z]
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Model [PositionRelative](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionRelative) to which force is applied in format [x,y,z]

setmarkerpolyline.name: setMarkerPolyline
setmarkerpolyline.description:
Sets a polyline marker's path.
> ⓘ**Multiplayer optimisation:** Global marker commands always broadcast the *entire* marker state over the network. As such, the number of network messages exchanged when creating or editing a marker can be reduced by performing all but the last operation using local marker commands, then using a global marker command for the last change (and subsequent global broadcast of all changes applied to the marker).

syntaxArray.Params:
marker: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [x1, y1, x2, y2, ... xn, yn]> ⚠Be aware that this command expects an array with a minimum array size of 4 and that the array count always needs to be dividable by 2 and return a whole number.
> Code: 
> ```sqf
> count **path** >= 4 && count **path** [mod](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/mod) 2 [==](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/%3D%3D) 0; *// [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) → valid path*
> ```
>

current3denoperation.name: current3DENOperation
current3denoperation.description: Returns the currently performed editing operation in [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor).

syntaxArray.Return:
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - operation name. Can be one of following:

* "" (no operation)

* "Move"

* "Rotate"

* "GroupTo"

* "Connect"

* "Create"

isnumber.name: isNumber
isnumber.description: Check if config entry represents number.

removeprimaryweaponitem.name: removePrimaryWeaponItem
removeprimaryweaponitem.description: Removes given weapon item, including magazine, from the [primaryWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/primaryWeapon).

enableenvironment.name: enableEnvironment
enableenvironment.description:
Enable/disable environmental effects: ambient life and/or ambient sound.

> ⓘThis command has to be executed after mission start: be sure to use e.g 
> ```sqf
> [sleep](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sleep) 0.1;
> ```
>  for it to take effect.

syntaxArray.Params: enable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Ambient life and ambient sounds setting

ambientLife: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Ambient life setting (bees, rabbits, birds, snakes, fish)
ambientSound: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Ambient sounds setting (cicadas, owls, etc)

assigneddriver.name: assignedDriver
assigneddriver.description: Returns the soldier assigned to the given vehicle as a driver.

isuavconnected.name: isUAVConnected
isuavconnected.description: Returns true if UAV is connected to some terminal.

servercommandexecutable.name: serverCommandExecutable
servercommandexecutable.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if the [serverCommand](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/serverCommand) can be performed on the machine and in this exact environment, otherwise [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false). serverCommand can be executed only from [User Interface Event Handlers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers), and this command also checks if that's the case.

syntaxArray.Params: command: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - see [Multiplayer Server Commands](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Server_Commands#Commands) for all available commands

ctsetheadertemplate.name: ctSetHeaderTemplate
ctsetheadertemplate.description: Takes config path to the new header template. Clears the whole RscControlsTable and sets the new header template.

currentthrowable.name: currentThrowable
currentthrowable.description:
Returns currently selected throwable, which will be launched if the user presses "G".
> ⓘThe weapon/magazine id system is W.I.P. and may change without notice.

getallhitpointsdamage.name: getAllHitPointsDamage
getallhitpointsdamage.description:
Returns 3 arrays for easy cross reference: 1st - array of hit point names, 2nd - array of hit selection names, 3rd - array of damage values. All values in all arrays are ordered accordingly to hit part index for convenience and for use in [setHitIndex](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setHitIndex) and [getHitIndex](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getHitIndex). Levels of damage are:

* 0: no damage

* 1: full damage

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [] if entity is null or has no shape, otherwise [hitpointsNamesArray, selectionsNamesArray, damageValuesArray]

backpackcontainer.name: backpackContainer
backpackcontainer.description: Returns a cargo container of a unit's backpack.

teamswitch.name: teamSwitch
teamswitch.description:
Invoke the [Team Switch](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Switch) dialog (force it even when conditions are not met).
There has to be at least one playable unit for team switch to work, and for this command to work in MP, respawn type in [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext) should be 5 (SIDE).
> ⓘWhen player switches and leaves behind AI unit, you need to enable "TeamSwitch" AI on it _unit [enableAI](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/enableAI) "TeamSwitch" so that the unit continues with [waypoints](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/waypoints).

ppeffectcommitted.name: ppEffectCommitted
ppeffectcommitted.description: Check whether given [post process effect](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Post_process_effects) is committed.

getcompatiblepylonmagazines.name: getCompatiblePylonMagazines
getcompatiblepylonmagazines.description: Get array of compatible pylon magazines

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - aircraft object
pylon: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - pylon id or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - pylon class name from TransportPylonsComponent >> pylons class (see Example 4). 0 or "" to return all compatible magazines from all pylons

vehicleClass: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - aircraft config class
pylon: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - pylon id or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - pylon class name from

examples:
```sqf
[vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) getCompatiblePylonMagazines 0; *// returns array of arrays containing all compatible magazines*
```

```sqf
"Plane_Fighter_01_Base_F" getCompatiblePylonMagazines 3; *// returns array of compatible magazines for the 3rd pylon*
```

```sqf
jet1 getCompatiblePylonMagazines "pylon1"; *// returns array of compatible magazines for the 1st pylon*
```

creategroup.name: createGroup
creategroup.description:
Creates a new [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) for the given [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side).

> ⚠
> 
> * Groups can only be created for the [west](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/west)/[blufor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/blufor), [opfor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/opfor)/[east](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/east), [independent](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/independent)/[resistance](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/resistance), [civilian](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/civilian) and [sideLogic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideLogic) sides.
> 
> * The default limit of groups per side is 288 since Arma 3 v1.67 (144 before and in previous titles).
> 
> * Using a wrong side or trying to create a group when the groups limit is reached will fail silently and return [grpNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/grpNull).
> 
> * Before Arma 3 a [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) [center](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createCenter) must exist before group creation (either by having editor-placed units or [createCenter](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createCenter) usage).
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)
> 
> * When the last unit leaves its group, the group usually gets immediately auto-deleted, regardless of its auto-deletion setting.
> 
> * Usage of [createCenter](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createCenter) in Arma 3 is not required anymore as all centers are automatically created.

syntaxArray.Params:
[side, deleteWhenEmpty]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
side: [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side)
deleteWhenEmpty: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to [delete the group when empty](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/deleteGroupWhenEmpty).

* If set to [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), *deleteWhenEmpty* forces a group to get deleted when empty - it does **not** prevent its deletion by other commands when set to [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false).

* Deletion may take up to a minute after the last unit is removed.

enableattack.name: enableAttack
enableattack.description: Set if leader can issue attack commands to the soldiers in his group.

tvdata.name: tvData
tvdata.description: Returns string data from item on given path. IDC means id of parent [CT_TREE](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_TREE).

displayparent.name: displayParent
displayparent.description: Returns parent display of the given display.

while.name: while
while.description: Repeats [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) while condition is [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true). A part of while [do](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/do) construct.

gusts.name: gusts
gusts.description: Return the current gusts value. Scale is 0 to 1.

onmapsingleclick.name: onMapSingleClick
onmapsingleclick.description:
Defines the action performed when user clicks in map by executing command string. The code is executed on every click, until the **command** is 

* removed via 
```sqf
onMapSingleClick ""
```
, or

* replaced by 
```sqf
onMapSingleClick "SomeOtherCommand(s)"
```


In Arma 3 the code should return [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) only if you wish to override default engine handling of the mouse click on map (see example #4) For older games, when click is processed, code should ultimately return [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) back to the engine. If [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) is returned, default processing by the game engine is done. Return value of any other type (including [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing)) is an error. In such case default processing by the game engine is done, and error message may be displayed.

> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Since **Arma 3** v1.58 a stackable MissionEventHandler is available and should be used instead: [MapSingleClick](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers/addMissionEventHandler#MapSingleClick).

syntaxArray.Params:
command: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - Code executed on click. The following variables are available:

* _pos: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Clicked position


* _units: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Units which were selected (via function keys) **before** opening the map (*may be non-functional in Arma*)


* _shift: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Whether Shift was pressed when clicking on the map


* _alt: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Whether Alt was pressed when clicking on the map

params: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything)
command: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - Code executed on click. The following variables are available:

* _this: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - Params passed to onMapSingleClick


* _pos: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Clicked position


* _units: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Units which were selected (via function keys) **before** opening the map (*may be non-functional in Arma*)


* _shift: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Whether Shift was pressed when clicking on the map


* _alt: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Whether Alt was pressed when clicking on the map

examples:
**Armed Assault:** Creates a soldier unit at the position clicked:

```sqf
onMapSingleClick "'SoldierWB' [createUnit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createUnit) [_pos, [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)]; true";
```
**Armed Assault:** Orders "grp1" to move to position clicked. Disables further map-click actions:

```sqf
onMapSingleClick "grp1 [move](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/move) _pos; onMapSingleClick ''; [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)";
```
**Operation Flashpoint:** Single quotes cannot be used for string definition, so two double-quotes have to be used instead:

```sqf
onMapSingleClick "'SoldierWB' [createUnit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createUnit) [_pos, [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)]; [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)";
```

```sqf
*// The following code will disable Shift+click waypoint marker creation*
onMapSingleClick {_shift};
```

```sqf
*// Pass params to onMapSingleClick code*
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) onMapSingleClick {[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) ("Hello " + [name](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/name) _this)}; *// Hello KK*
```

```sqf
*// Pass params to onMapSingleClick code **and** disable Shift+click waypoint marker creation*
 [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) onMapSingleClick "[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) (""Hello "" + [name](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/name) [_this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this)); _shift"; *// Hello KK*
```

deleterange.name: deleteRange
deleterange.description: Removes a range of array elements from the given array (modifies the original array, just like [resize](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/resize) or [set](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/set)).

syntaxArray.Params:
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
[from, count]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
from: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Array index to start selection from.
count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Number of array elements to remove. If the selected range exceeds source array boundaries, selection will be made up to the end of the array.

setmimic.name: setMimic
setmimic.description:
Sets person's facial expression. To set it back to default, use "".
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Prior to Arma 3 v2.01.146630 Mimics must be written in all lower case letters.

syntaxArray.Params:
person: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
mimic: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - can be one of:


Before Arma 2 OA v1.6x
Since Arma 2 OA v1.6x




* "Default"

* "Normal"

* "Smile"

* "Hurt"

* "Ironic"

* "Sad"

* "Cynic"

* "Surprised"

* "Agresive"[sic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Template:sic)

* "Angry"



* "neutral"

* "dead"

* "danger"

* "hurt"

* "aware"

* "safe"

* "combat"

* "unconscious"

clearweaponcargo.name: clearWeaponCargo
clearweaponcargo.description: Remove all weapons from the given vehicle's weapon cargo space.

ctrlenabled.name: ctrlEnabled
ctrlenabled.description: Returns if a control on the currently active user dialog is enabled. Disabled controls cannot be focused. Read [Arma: GUI Configuration](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma:_GUI_Configuration) for more information about user dialogs and controls.

syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [True](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if the control is enabled, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if not
[Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [True](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if the control is enabled, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if not

animationnames.name: animationNames
animationnames.description: Returns [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Strings) where elements are the names of model animations, which should theoretically be available for use with [animate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animate) command. However in practice this depends on whether animation is also made available for use in scripts via config.

forceflagtexture.name: forceFlagTexture
forceflagtexture.description:
Forces a flag texture onto a flag carrier (unit, vehicle or flag pole). No flag holder is required. If "" is used as texture, the texture is removed. This will override regularly owned flags. This type of flag texture cannot be retrieved using [flagTexture](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/flagTexture), but [getForcedFlagTexture](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getForcedFlagTexture).
> ⓘForced flag texture is an additional flag texture, which visually overrides original flag texture and therefore is very expensive to simulate, so use the functionality sparingly.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle, unit of flag pole
texture: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

missiletargetpos.name: missileTargetPos
missiletargetpos.description: Returns a guided missile's target position.

tvsortbyvalueall.name: tvSortByValueAll
tvsortbyvalueall.description: Sorts all children, including trees deriving from given path.  Value of [Tree View](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_TREE) entries is used for sorting.

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Path to start sorting from
reversed: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to reverse sort it.

onhcgroupselectionchanged.name: onHCGroupSelectionChanged
onhcgroupselectionchanged.description:
Defines an action performed when [high command](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/High_Command) group selection has been changed.

Command receives 2 variables:

* _group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - last selected/deselected group

* _isSelected: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - new selection state of the specific group

The code is executed on every [hc](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/High_Command) group selection change until it is

* removed via 
```sqf
onHCGroupSelectionChanged "";
```
 or 
```sqf
onHCGroupSelectionChanged {};
```


* or replaced by 
```sqf
onHCGroupSelectionChanged "SomeOtherCommand(s)";
```
 or 
```sqf
onHCGroupSelectionChanged {SomeOtherCommand(s)};
```

> ⓘSince **Arma 3** *v1.57* a stackable version of this EH is available: [HCGroupSelectionChanged](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers/addMissionEventHandler#HCGroupSelectionChanged)

getvariable.name: getVariable
getvariable.description:
Returns the value of variable in the variable space assigned to various data types.
All available data types combinations:


Primary syntax ([String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String))
Alternative syntax ([Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array))


**Code**

**Since**

**Code**

**Since**


[Namespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace) getVariable [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
-
[Namespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace) getVariable [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
Arma 2: Operation Arrowhead v1.60


[Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) getVariable [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
-
[Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) getVariable [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
-


[Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) getVariable [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
-
[Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) getVariable [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
-


[Team Member](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Member) getVariable [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
-
[Team Member](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Member) getVariable [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
-


[Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task) getVariable [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
-
[Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task) getVariable [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
Arma 3 v1.68


[Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location) getVariable [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
-
[Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location) getVariable [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
Arma 3 v1.68


[Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) getVariable [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
-
[Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) getVariable [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
Arma 3 v1.56


[Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display) getVariable [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
Arma 3 v1.56
[Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display) getVariable [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
Arma 3 v1.56

> ⚠When variable is [set](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVariable) on a [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task), it is not actually set on the task itself, but on the FSM attached to the task.
> If there is no FSM, getVariable will not work.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)In the case of Alt Syntax usage in Arma 3, *defaultValue* will be returned if:
> 
> * Requested variable is either undefined or [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil)
> 
> * Variable namespace is null ([objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull), [grpNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/grpNull), etc.)

syntaxArray.Params:
varspace: [Namespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace), [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display), [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group), [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location), [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task), [Team Member](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Member), [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display), [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Variable name in given namespace
syntaxArray.Return: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) or [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) if the variable doesn't exist

syntaxArray.Params:
varspace: [Namespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace), [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display), [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group), [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location), [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task), [Team Member](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Member), [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display), [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Variable name in given namespace
defaultValue: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - Value to return if variable doesn't exist > ⚠A dynamic *defaultValue* e.g. 
> ```sqf
> [random](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/random) 500
> ```
>  will always be executed, even if the variable is defined.
syntaxArray.Return: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - Current value of the variable or *defaultValue* if the variable doesn't exist.

menushortcuttext.name: menuShortcutText
menushortcuttext.description: Returns a string containing shortcut text for menu item on the given path. > ⚠This command is currently broken in Arma 3 2.00. It only returns shortcuts which do not use a modifier key (CTRL, ALT and SHIFT).

lifestate.name: lifeState
lifestate.description:
Returns the life state of the given unit.


Arma 2

Arma 3




* "ALIVE"

* "DEAD"

* "DEAD-RESPAWN"

* "DEAD-SWITCHING"

* "ASLEEP"

* "UNCONSCIOUS"



* "HEALTHY"

* "DEAD"

* "DEAD-RESPAWN"

* "DEAD-SWITCHING"

* "INCAPACITATED"

* "INJURED"

> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)In Arma 3, lifeState seems to change to "INJURED" when 
> ```sqf
>  [damage](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/damage) aliveUnit >= 0.1
> ```
>  (0.1 seeming to be the value defined in config under "InjuredTreshold"[sic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Template:sic)). When the state is "INCAPACITATED", a sub-state is available via [incapacitatedState](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/incapacitatedState) command.

setdynamicsimulationdistance.name: setDynamicSimulationDistance
setdynamicsimulationdistance.description: Sets activation distance of [Arma 3: Dynamic Simulation](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Dynamic_Simulation) for given category

syntaxArray.Params:
category: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - one of:

* "Group" - Infantry units. Set to a reasonable distance, player should not see disabled infantry units. Default: 500m

* "Vehicle" - Vehicles with crew. Set to a reasonable distance, player should not see disabled vehicles. Default: 350m

* "EmptyVehicle" - All vehicles without crew. Separated from Props as Empty Vehicles have often more complex damage states and selective destruction. Their activation distance should by larger that the one used for Props. Default: 250m

* "Prop" - Static objects. Anything from a small tin can to a building. Default: 50m
distance: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

setmouseposition.description: Moves mouse pointer to specified position on the screen. **x** and **y** could be any number, but will be clipped so mouse never leaves the screen area.

y: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - y in screen coordinates

enableropeattach.description: Enables or disables the ability to be attached to a rope end for the given entity.

enable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to disable rope attachment

true if the last camCommit already finished, false if not

addmenu.name: addMenu
addmenu.description:
Adds a new menu button. Priority is optional.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

turretowner.name: turretOwner
turretowner.description:
Returns id of the [owner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/owner) of the turret. Server only. Returns 0 on non-server and SP. 
**Some info on turrets:** A vehicle turret will change locality when player gunner gets in it, just like vehicle changes locality when player driver gets in it. Many commands for turrets work only where turret is [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local). When gunner leaves turret it is supposed to change locality to the locality of the vehicle. A vehicle can have one [owner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/owner) while turrets have different [owners](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/owner).

alldisplays.name: allDisplays
alldisplays.description:
Returns a list of all opened GUI displays. Other displays, such as IGUI displays could be accessed via [uiNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/uiNamespace) variable, which is updated every time display is opened or closed. For example, to access IGUI displays:

```sqf
[uiNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/uiNamespace) [getVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getVariable) ["IGUI_displays", []];
```
. Other display variables:

* 3DENDisplays_displays

* 3DENDisplaysTemp_displays

* GUI_displays

* IGUI_displays

* Loading_displays

* CuratorDisplays_displays

* BootcampDisplays_displays

* CuratorTitles_displays

* BootcampTitles_displays

* KartDisplays_displays

param.name: param
param.description:
Extracts a single value with given index from input argument, similar to [BIS_fnc_param](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_param).  When used without argument, as shown in main syntax, internal variable [_this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this), which is usually available inside functions and event handlers, is used as argument. If input argument is not an array, it will be converted to 1 element array.

If extracted item of input with given index is undefined, of the wrong type or of the wrong length (if the item is an array), default value is used instead. Since Arma 3 v1.54, onscreen errors are displayed for when the input is of the wrong type or size.

syntaxArray.Params:
[index, defaultValue, expectedDataTypes, expectedArrayCount]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - index of required item in the input array.
defaultValue (Optional): [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - a default value to return if input is undefined, of the wrong type or of the wrong length (if the item is an array).
expectedDataTypes (Optional): [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of direct [ Data Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Data_Types) - checks if passed value is one of listed [ Data Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Data_Types). If not, default value is used instead. Empty array [] means every data type is accepted.
expectedArrayCount (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - a single size or array of sizes. If passed input value is an array, checks that it has a certain number of elements. If not, default value is used instead. Empty array [] means any size is accepted.
syntaxArray.Return: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - extracted value on success or default value otherwise. [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) if syntax error occurred.

syntaxArray.Params:
argument: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - A usual array of params is expected. If a non-array value is passed, it will be converted to 1 element array
[index, defaultValue, expectedDataTypes, expectedArrayCount]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - index of required item in the input array.
defaultValue (Optional): [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - a default value to return if input is undefined, of the wrong type or of the wrong length (if the item is an array).
expectedDataTypes (Optional): [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of direct [ Data Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Data_Types) - checks if passed value is one of listed [ Data Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Data_Types). If not, default value is used instead. Empty array [] means every data type is accepted.
expectedArrayCount (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - a single size or array of sizes. If passed input value is an array, checks that it has a certain number of elements. If not, default value is used instead. Empty array [] means any size is accepted.
syntaxArray.Return: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - extracted value on success or default value otherwise. [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) if syntax error occurred.

enableuavconnectability.name: enableUAVConnectability
enableuavconnectability.description: Enables unit's AV terminal(s) connecting to UAV.

syntaxArray.Params:

uav: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
checkAllItems: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - True for enabling of all terminals in unit's inventory, false for enabling of terminal assigned to proper slot only.

[text, type, speed]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
speed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - optional, default 1.

side.name: side
side.description:
Returns the side of a unit, vehicle, object or location.

* side of a renegade soldier is [sideEnemy](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideEnemy)

* side of an empty vehicle is [civilian](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/civilian)

* side of a crewed vehicle is, if present, commander's > gunner's > driver's or > cargo's side, in this order

* side of a captive or dead unit is [civilian](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/civilian). Use 
```sqf
side [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) _unit
```
 to get the underlying side (see **Example 2**)

* you can use [playerSide](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playerSide) to know the real player's side

> ⓘConverting a side to string will **not** always return the side command text: e.g 
> ```sqf
> [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [resistance](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/resistance) *// returns "GUER"*
> ```
> .
> See [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) page to see the return value of all side commands.
examples:
```sqf
[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) (side [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) == [west](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/west)) [then](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/then) { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "Player is on the West side" };
```

```sqf
_sideAlsoWorkingForDead = side [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) _deadUnit;
```

```sqf
_sideLocation = side myLocation;
```

```sqf
[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) (side [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) != [playerSide](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playerSide)) [then](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/then) { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "player is renegade or dead"; };
```
Check the side of the vehicle: 
```sqf
_vehicleSide = side [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) _vehicle; *// [sideUnknown](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideUnknown) (CIV for Arma 3) if empty or dead [crew](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/crew), otherwise the appropriate side*
```

isactionmenuvisible.name: isActionMenuVisible
isactionmenuvisible.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if scroll menu is visible.

ctrltextwidth.name: ctrlTextWidth
ctrltextwidth.description:
Returns the width of the control text including left and right margins (0.008 each). Supported control [types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlType) are:

* [CT_STATIC](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DialogControls-Text) 0

* [CT_EDIT](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_EDIT) 2

* [CT_STRUCTURED_TEXT](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DialogControls-Text) 13
> ⓘFor control-independent text width estimate see [getTextWidth](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getTextWidth)

ingameuiseteventhandler.name: inGameUISetEventHandler
ingameuiseteventhandler.description:
Sets given event handler of in-game UI. If EH function returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), performed action is overridden. Event handlers available are:

* "PrevAction" - mouse scroll up

* "Action" - action key press

* "NextAction" - mouse scroll down
This is "set" type EH, which means it will replace previously set EH of the same type. So to remove EH, set another one with empty string "" for the function.

Since Arma 3 v1.50 this EH returns array of params for selected/activated action in *_this* variable:

* 0: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - target object to which action is attached

* 1: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - caller object, basically [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)

* 2: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - index of the action in action menu (0 - top most)

* 3: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - engine based action name ("User" for user added actions)

* 4: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [localized](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/localize) action plain text as seen by the caller

* 5: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - action *priority* value

* 6: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - action *showWindow* value

* 7: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - action *hideOnUse* value

* 8: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - action *shortcut* name or ""

* 9: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - action menu visibility (on first scroll or action press the menu is still invisible, so no action is performed, only menu is shown). See also: [isActionMenuVisible](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isActionMenuVisible)

* 10: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - EH event name

setunconscious.name: setUnconscious
setunconscious.description:
In Arma 2 and since Arma 3 v1.64, this command sets unit into incapacitated state.
[lifeState](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lifeState) results:

* Arma 2: "UNCONSCIOUS"

* Arma 3: "INCAPACITATED"

> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)The unit goes in ragdoll mode and animation played while incapacitated depends on the injuries received.

parsenumber.name: parseNumber
parsenumber.description:
An SQF equivalent of C++ [atof](https://community.bistudio.comhttp://www.cplusplus.com/reference/cstdlib/atof/) function. Parses the string, interpreting its content as a floating point number.
The command first discards as many whitespace characters as necessary until the first non-whitespace character is found. Then, starting from this character, takes as many characters as possible that are valid following a syntax resembling that of [floating point literals](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Floating_Point_Number#Floating_Point_Literals), and interprets them as a numerical value. The rest of the string after the last valid character is ignored and has no effect on the behavior of this command.
If the first sequence of non-whitespace characters in string does not form a valid floating-point number, or if no such sequence exists because either string is empty or contains only whitespace characters, no conversion is performed and the command returns 0.

setlocalwindparams.name: setLocalWindParams
setlocalwindparams.description:
Sets parameters for helicopter rotor wash. Visually it affects how much the grass, bushes and trees bend and how much the particles blown under a helicopter and how big is the area of the effect. Default [1.0, 1.0].
> ⓘBoth parameters can't take 0, it'll just be ignored. If you need to disable effects, put very small values.

syntaxArray.Params:
[strength, diameter]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
strength: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - down-force wind strength
diameter: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)  - area affected

getshotparents.name: getShotParents
getshotparents.description: Returns shot information for the given projectile. If shot was fired by a soldier on foot or in FFV position in vehicle, the soldier is returned for the vehicle.

execfsm.name: execFSM
execfsm.description:
Execute scripted [FSM](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/FSM) and return the FSM handle or 0 when failed. The FSM file is first searched in the mission folder, then in the campaign scripts folder and finally in the global scripts folder. Argument (if any) are available in _this variable inside FSM. Variables set inside FSMs can be read/modified externally, using [setFSMVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setFSMVariable) and [getFSMVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getFSMVariable) commands.

The return value is the FSM handle; it can be used to determine (via [completedFSM](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/completedFSM)) when the FSM has finished.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)In Arma 3, the FSM handle is also available within the FSM through the _thisFSM variable.

Scripted FSMs are added into the scheduler just like [exec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/exec) scripts, [execVM](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/execVM) scripts and [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) scripts.
To see what FSMs are currently in the scheduler, use [diag_activeMissionFSMs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_activeMissionFSMs) command.

> ⚠While the code placed into any of the sections of FSM cannot be suspended ([canSuspend](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/canSuspend) is false), the FSM itself is suspended every simulation between the state's init and precondition (exception is the **init state**). This is the only place where scripted FSM is suspended/resumed.
> The usual difference between the state's init and precondition is 1 frame but if the scheduler is busy it can take longer. See [FSM](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/FSM) for more information about FSM's structure.

syntaxArray.Params:
arguments: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - Arguments accessible as _this in the FSM
fsmFilePath: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - file with FSM code

hcshownbar.name: hcShownBar
hcshownbar.description: Return true if the [high command](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/High_Command) bar is shown/active.

targetsquery.name: targetsQuery
targetsquery.description: Returns sorted array of targets, **known** to the enquirer (including own troops), where the accuracy coefficient reflects how close the result matches the query. This command could be CPU intensive.

syntaxArray.Params:
enquirer: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - For whom the query will be made
[targetIgnore, targetSide, targetType, targetPosition, targetMaxAge]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Query
targetIgnore: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object to exclude from results. [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) - return every target
targetSide: [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) - Desired side of the target. [sideUnknown](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideUnknown) - any side
targetType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Desired target [typeOf](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/typeOf). "" - any type
targetPosition: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Desired target position in format of [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) or [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) (only [x,y] is considered). Position tolerance is 200m from the actual position of the target. [] - any position
targetMaxAge: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Desired max age of the target. This will limit returned results to the targets younger than specified age. 0 - any age
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - **sorted** array of returned targets in the following format: 
[[accuracy, target, targetSide, targetType, targetPosition, targetAge],...] where:

* accuracy: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - a coefficient, which reflects how close the returned result to the query filter. Range: 0 - 1 (1 - best match)

* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the actual target object

* targetSide: [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) - side of the target

* targetType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - target [typeOf](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/typeOf)

* targetPosition: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [x,y] of the target

* targetAge: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - the actual target age in seconds (can be negative)

examples:
Return all known targets for player:
```sqf
_targets = [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) targetsQuery [[objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull), [sideUnknown](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideUnknown), "", [], 0];
```
Prioritise all known OPFOR targets and return targets less than 10 seconds old:
```sqf
_targets = [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) targetsQuery [[objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull), [east](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/east), "", [], 10];
```

isequaltype.name: isEqualType
isequaltype.description: Compares 2 values by their type. A much faster alternative to [typeName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/typeName) a == [typeName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/typeName) b.

binocularmagazine.name: binocularMagazine
binocularmagazine.description: Collects all loaded [magazines](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/magazines) from all [binocular](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/binocular) muzzles and returns them in [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), otherwise it returns []. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

createsite.name: createSite
createsite.description:
Create a new site. 
> ⚠This command is considered deprecated and is no longer supported

setvisibleiftreecollapsed.name: setVisibleIfTreeCollapsed
setvisibleiftreecollapsed.description:
Sets whether or not the object is visible even if the tree is collapsed.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

flagowner.name: flagOwner
flagowner.description: Returns the global owner of a flag. A getter for [setFlagOwner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setFlagOwner). Note that owner of a flag is [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) rather than [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number), as how it is usually with other [owner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/owner) commands

syntaxArray.Return: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) -  The person or vehicle that owns the flag is returned. If used on anything else than a flag, the returned value is [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull). If the flag is on its pole, the return value is NULL. If the flagowner is dead, the return value is the name of the soldier model.

lbsetselectcolor.name: lbSetSelectColor
lbsetselectcolor.description:
Sets the select color of the item with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user [dialog](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/dialog) to color.

Colour is in format [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color).

syntaxArray.Params:
[idc, index, color]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) of control
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
color: [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color)

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) to format [ambientLightColor, ambientLightBrightness, lightDirection, starsVisibility]:

* ambientLightColor: [Color (RGB)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color)

* ambientLightBrightness: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* lightDirection: [Vector3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Vector3D)

* starsVisibility: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

entities.name: entities
entities.description:
Returns a list of all alive and dead entities of the given type or deriving from the given type. Units in vehicles are ignored with the primary syntax.
> ⓘ**Optimisation tip**: Keep number of types in both *includeTypes* and *excludeTypes* arrays to a minimum by possibly using parent/base classes.If you have to use several types, arrange them in order so that the more common types go at the beginning of the array.

syntaxArray.Params: type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - if an empty string "" is provided, all entities are returned

syntaxArray.Syntax: entities [typesInclude, typesExclude, includeCrews, excludeDead] *Since Arma 3 v1.65.138685*
syntaxArray.Params:
typesInclude: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - in format [type1, type2, ...typeN], where type is a [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String). Empty array [] means include every entity. Method used for filtering - [isKindOf](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isKindOf)
typesExclude: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - in format [type1, type2, ...typeN], where type is a [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String). Empty array [] means exclude no entity. Method used for filtering - [isKindOf](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isKindOf)
includeCrews: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) include crews currently in vehicles
excludeDead: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) exclude dead entities

examples:
```sqf
_allcars = entities "Car";
```
Return all alive entities on the map:
```sqf
_allalive = entities [[], [], [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)];
```
Return dead and alive entities but logic:
```sqf
_notlogic = entities [[], ["Logic"], [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)];
```
Return all alive [west](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/west) soldiers on foot:
```sqf
_footsoldiers = entities [["SoldierWB"], [], [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)];
```

ctrlsetpositionx.name: ctrlSetPositionX
ctrlsetpositionx.description: Sets horizontal position (x) of the 2D control. [ctrlCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlCommit) is required to complete the operation.

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - 2D control
x: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Horizontal position of the control

progressloadingscreen.name: progressLoadingScreen

examples:
```sqf
[startLoadingScreen](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/startLoadingScreen) ["Loading My Mission"];
*// *
*// batch of code*
*// *
progressLoadingScreen 0.25;
*// *
*// batch of code*
*// *
progressLoadingScreen 0.50;
*// *
*// batch of code*
*// *
progressLoadingScreen 0.95;
*// *
*// batch of code*
*// *
[endLoadingScreen](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/endLoadingScreen);
```

addwaypoint.name: addWaypoint
addwaypoint.description:
Adds (or inserts when index is given) a new waypoint to a group.

The waypoint is placed randomly within a circle with the given center and radius.

The function returns a waypoint with format [group, index]. 
> ⓘPrior to Arma 3 v1.90, if you need exact waypoint placement, use [setWaypointPosition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setWaypointPosition)

syntaxArray.Params:
groupName: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)
center: [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) ([PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) if *radius* is negative!) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
radius: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - random waypoint placement within *radius* from *center* > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Since Arma 3 v1.90, -1 may be used for exact waypoint placement
index (optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - can be used to insert a waypoint in between existing waypoints
name (optional): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [waypointName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/waypointName)

step.name: step
step.description: Optionally can set step. If you want to count down, step must be specified, and set negative. Default value is 1.

waypointcompletionradius.name: waypointCompletionRadius
waypointcompletionradius.description: Gets the radius around the waypoint where the waypoint is completed.

loaduniform.name: loadUniform
loaduniform.description:
Returns current percentage of mass from items stored in a uniform relative to the maximum capacity of the uniform. 
It is equivalent to this formula:

```sqf
_loadUniform = massOfAllItemsInUniform / [getContainerMaxLoad](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getContainerMaxLoad) [uniform](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/uniform) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player); 
```

connectterminaltouav.name: connectTerminalToUAV
connectterminaltouav.description:
Connect person with UAV terminal to UAV unit. UAV Terminal item needs to be assigned to GPS slot.
If UAV is already connected to another terminal, this new connection will fail.

waypoints: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Waypoints](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Waypoint)

]
*/

createmarker.name: createMarker
createmarker.description:
Creates a new map marker at the given position. The marker will be created for every connected player as well as all JIP players. The marker name has to be unique; the command will be ignored if a marker with the given name already exists.

> ⚠The marker will be visible only once at least [markerType](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/markerType) has been defined:
> 
> ```sqf
> _marker = createMarker ["markername", [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)]; *// Not visible yet.*
> _marker [setMarkerType](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setMarkerType) "hd_dot"; *// Visible.*
> ```
> 
> ⓘIf the marker position is given in 3D format, the z-coordinate is stored with the marker and will be used when the marker is passed to commands such as [createVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createVehicle), [createUnit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createUnit), [createAgent](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createAgent), [createMine](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createMine) or [setVehiclePosition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVehiclePosition).When a marker is manually placed in the editor, z is always 0, which means the marker is placed on the ground. But when the player places a marker on the map in game, it is placed at sea level, so the z-coordinate of that marker is 
> ```sqf
> [-](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/-)[getTerrainHeightASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getTerrainHeightASL) [markerPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/markerPos) <USERMARKER>
> ```
> .

syntaxArray.Params:
**name**: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - The marker's name, used to reference the marker in scripts.
**position**: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object). In case of object, the object's [PositionWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionWorld) is used.
**channel** (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (See also [Channel IDs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Channel_IDs)) - The marker channel for MP [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[2.02](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_2.02)
**creator** (Optional): [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - The marker creator for MP [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[2.02](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_2.02)
syntaxArray.Return: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - The marker's name or empty string if the marker name is not unique.

getmissionlayers.name: getMissionLayers
getmissionlayers.description: Returns a list of all layers created in [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor). Designed to be used during a scenario. Default layers (BLUFOR, OPFOR...) are not returned.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array of strings with names of layers

cbsetchecked.name: cbSetChecked
cbsetchecked.description: Sets the current state of a [CT_CHECKBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CHECKBOX) control. Use "CheckedChanged" control event handler with it.

add3denconnection.name: add3DENConnection

syntaxArray.Params:
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - connection class from *Cfg3DEN >> Connections*
from: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Eden Entities](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Entity) - entities which are being connected

examples:
```sqf

```

Set random start on marker "marker_0" for all selected objects.

addmagazineammocargo.name: addMagazineAmmoCargo
addmagazineammocargo.description: Adds magazines with specified ammo count to the cargo space of a vehicle or a container.

syntaxArray.Params:
cargospace: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle or container or weaponholder
[magazine, quantity, ammocount]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
magazine: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - magazine class name
quantity: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - number of magazines to add

createtask.name: createTask
createtask.description: Create a new AI task (subtask of parentTask). Type is name of registered task type.

syntaxArray.Params:
teamMember: [Team Member](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Member)
[type, parentTask]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

setcompassoscillation.name: setCompassOscillation
setcompassoscillation.description:
This command sets random heading on the player's compass (both, in map and in 3D view) with given frequency, which is also randomised. To reset the compass back to defaults, execute: 
```sqf
setCompassOscillation [-1, 0, 0];
```
.

syntaxArray.Params:
[angle, frequencyMin, frequencyMax]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
angle: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - heading deviation angle in [radians](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/rad); the random angle will be picked up from [-angle...+angle] range.
frequencyMin: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - lower bound of heading change in seconds
frequencyMax: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - higher bound of heading change in seconds. The actual frequency is calculated similar to: 
```sqf
_frequencyMin + [random](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/random)(_frequencyMax - _frequencyMin);
```

examples:
Set compass to oscillate every second within -90/+90 degrees: 
```sqf
setCompassOscillation [[rad](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/rad) 90, 1, 1];

```
Change heading every 60 to 90 seconds: 
```sqf
setCompassOscillation [[rad](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/rad) 180, 60, 90];

```
Make compass go crazy: 
```sqf
setCompassOscillation [[rad](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/rad) 360, 0.1, 0.2];

```

setunitposweak.name: setUnitPosWeak
setunitposweak.description:
Set unit position rules. This command is the lowest level of priority for setting unit position and to be used in scripted	
FSM's. Priorities are:

* Unit pos commanded (from the commanding menu, higher priority).

* Unit pos scripted (from [setUnitPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setUnitPos) scripting command, medium priority).

* Unit pos FSM / **setUnitPosWeak** (used in the formation FSM, lowest priority).

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Can be:

* "DOWN" - Unit goes prone and stays prone.

* "UP" - Unit stands and stays standing.

* "MIDDLE" - Kneel Position. [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Armed_Assault)[1.04](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Armed_Assault_version_1.04) - Unit will not kneel if it is unarmed

* "AUTO" - Unit chooses mode according to circumstances.

triggerattachobject.name: triggerAttachObject
triggerattachobject.description: Assigns a static object to the trigger. The activation source is changed to "STATIC".

allowgetin.name: allowGetIn
allowgetin.description: Set if the units given in the list are allowed to enter vehicles.

allow: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true allows the [units](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/units) to enter, false denies them
