formation.name: formation
formation.description: Returns the current formation of a group.

unassignteam.name: unassignTeam
unassignteam.description: Unassigns the unit (in the case of a vehicle its commander unit) from his team. This is equal to unit [assignTeam](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/assignTeam) "MAIN".

camsetdive.name: camSetDive
camsetdive.description:
Sets camera dive angle. Does not commit changes. 
> ⚠This command is **non-functional**!

editorseteventhandler.name: editorSetEventHandler
editorseteventhandler.description:
Sets given event handler of given editor.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

removeaction.name: removeAction
removeaction.description: Removes user added action with given ID. This only removes actions added with the [addAction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addAction) command. You cannot remove default game actions, such as reload.

actionID: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Action ID returned by [addAction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addAction)

magazinesdetail.name: magazinesDetail
magazinesdetail.description:
Returns an array of strings with description of all vehicle's magazines, their ammo count (current/default) and their ids. 

When applied to a unit (soldier), the command behaves differently and will omit magazines already loaded into unit's weapons. Use [currentMagazineDetail](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/currentMagazineDetail) to get this information for a currently loaded magazine.

syntaxArray.Params:

includeEmpty: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to include empty magazines

examples:
```sqf
_magazinesDetail = magazinesDetail [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player);
/*
[
	"6.5mm 30Rnd STANAG Mag(30/30)[id:3]",
	"6.5mm 30Rnd STANAG Mag(30/30)[id:9]",
	"9mm 16Rnd Mag(16/16)[id:12]",
	"Smoke Grenade (Green)(1/1)[id:14]",
	"Chemlight (Green)(1/1)[id:16]",
	"RGO Frag Grenade(1/1)[id:18]"
]
*/
```

```sqf
_magazinesDetail = magazinesDetail Mi_48;
{{codecomment/*
[
	"30mm APDS shells(250/250)[id:20]",
	"30mm HE Shells(250/250)[id:21]",
	"Scalpel E2(8/8)[id:22]",
	"Skyfire(38/38)[id:23]"
]
*/}}
```

removecuratoreditingarea.name: removeCuratorEditingArea
removecuratoreditingarea.description: Removes editing area for given curator.

setpylonloadout.name: setPylonLoadout
setpylonloadout.description: Adds/overrides loadout to a vehicle pylon. TransportPylonsComponent in vehicle config and pylonWeapon in the magazine config are required to run.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[pylon, magazine, forced, turret] : [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
pylon: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - pylon index (index starts from 1) or pylon name (see [getCompatiblePylonMagazines](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getCompatiblePylonMagazines) Example 4)

turret (Optional): [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - turret path. Default: []

setparticleparams.name: setParticleParams
setparticleparams.description:
Set parameters to particle source. Array is in format [ParticleArray](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ParticleArray). 

Since Arma 3 version 1.11.114706 you can use this command to overwrite many values set by [setParticleClass](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setParticleClass), particularity those defined in [ParticleArray](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ParticleArray). Correspondence between CfgCloudlets class param names and command array of params:

```sqf
particleSource setParticleParams
[
	/* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - If string then the name of the particleShape. And following default values are used:
		particleFSNtieth = 1
		particleFSIndex = 0
		particleFSFrameCount = 1
		particleFSLoop = 1
	*/
	[
		particleShape, /*[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)*/
		particleFSNtieth, /*[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)*/
		particleFSIndex, /*[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)*/
		particleFSFrameCount, /*[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)*/
		particleFSLoop /*Optional - [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number). Default: 1*/
	],
	animationName, /*[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)*/
	particleType, /*[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Enum: Billboard, SpaceObject*/
	timerPeriod, /*[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)*/
	lifeTime, /*[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)*/
	position, /*3D [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of numbers as relative position to particleSource or (if object at index 18 is set) object. 
			Or (if object at index 18 is set) [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) as memoryPoint of object.*/
	moveVelocity, /*3D [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of numbers.*/
	rotationVelocity, /*[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)*/
	weight, /*[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)*/
	volume, /*[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)*/
	rubbing, /*[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)*/
	size, /*[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)*/
	color, /*[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of RGBA [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)*/
	animationSpeed, /*[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)*/
	randomDirectionPeriod, /*[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)*/
	randomDirectionIntensity, /*[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)*/
	onTimerScript, /*[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)*/
	beforeDestroyScript, /*[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)*/
	[this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this_2), /*[Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)*/
	angle, /*Optional [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Default: 0*/
	onSurface, /*Optional [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)*/
	bounceOnSurface, /*Optional [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)*/
	emissiveColor, /*Optional [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of RGBA [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)*/
	vectorDir /*Optional 3D [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) Vector dir. Since Arma 3 v1.92 it is possible to set the initial direction of the SpaceObject */
];
```

agents.name: agents
agents.description: Return a list of agents in the current mission.

getassignedcuratorunit.name: getAssignedCuratorUnit
getassignedcuratorunit.description: Returns unit assigned to curator logic.

onteamswitch.name: onTeamSwitch
onteamswitch.description:
Defines an action performed when the team switch is finished.
Commandset receives the following special variables: *_from* object previous unit, *_to* object current unit.
Consecutive use of onTeamSwitch command will overwrite previously set commandset. 
> ⓘSince **Arma 3** *v1.57* a stackable version of this EH is available: [TeamSwitch](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers/addMissionEventHandler#TeamSwitch)


> ⓘWhen player switches and leaves behind AI unit, you need to enable "TeamSwitch" AI on it (with 
> ```sqf
> onTeamSwitch { _from [enableAI](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/enableAI) "TeamSwitch" };
> ```
> ) so that the unit continues with [waypoints](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/waypoints).

gethitpointdamage.name: getHitPointDamage
gethitpointdamage.description:
Return current level of damage for a specific Hit Point (specified by its config class). If you need to get damage of a selection instead of hit point, use [getHit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getHit).

* 0: no damage

* 1: full damage

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle : [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle to be queried
hitPointName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the Hit Point class
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (or, prior to Arma 3 v1.94, [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) when invalid input is given)

inflame.name: inflame
inflame.description: Sets the state of a fireplace.

syntaxArray.Params:
fireplace: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
burn: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [True](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to let it burn, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to extinguish it.

dosuppressivefire.name: doSuppressiveFire
dosuppressivefire.description:
Orders the given unit or a group of units to suppress the given position or target (without radio messages, see [commandSuppressiveFire](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/commandSuppressiveFire) is you need messages). 

* When an [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of units is passed as param, only units from the same [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) as the first unit in array are considered.

* The unit (units) starts firing at the given target or position random amount of shots (exact formula unknown, but seems to depend on amount of ammo unit has) after which it stops.

* [currentCommand](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/currentCommand) shows "Suppress" and there is no way of stopping unit before it completes random amount of rounds.

* If position is passed as target param, it stays fixed.

* If object is passed as target param, it depends on what kind of object. If it is considered a proper target by the unit, it is tracked by the unit dynamically. If it is not, the position gets obtained via [getPosWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPosWorld), which could be different from [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) of the object, and it is fixed even if the target is able to change position later.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - A single unit or array of units
target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Actual target or position of the target in format [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL)

west.name: west

setbehaviour.name: setBehaviour
setbehaviour.description:
Sets individual unit behaviour **on every unit in a group**.
> ⚠This command doesn't set AI [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) behaviour, see [setCombatBehaviour](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setCombatBehaviour) or [setBehaviourStrong](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setBehaviourStrong) for this.
> ⓘSee [AI Behaviour](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/AI_Behaviour) for details of the effect of this command on AI units.

syntaxArray.Params:
groupOrUnit : [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit or a [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group)
behaviour: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Can be one of:

* "CARELESS"

* "SAFE"

* "AWARE"

* "COMBAT"

* "STEALTH"

pitch.name: pitch
pitch.description: Returns the pitch of a persons voice.

column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of the column

* CT_LISTBOX

deg.name: deg
deg.description:
Converts given value in radians to degrees. 1 degree equals 0.01745 radians or [pi](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/pi) / 180.

> ⓘ
> ```sqf
>  2 * [pi](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/pi) ≙ 360°
> → 1 [rad](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/rad) = 2 * [pi](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/pi) / 360°
> ```
>

newoverlay.name: newOverlay
newoverlay.description:
Creates the new overlay dialog for the specified type of overlay. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

removeallbinocularitems.name: removeAllBinocularItems
removeallbinocularitems.description: Removes all items from [binocular](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/binocular) weapon, except magazine.

ctrlsetfontheighth5.name: ctrlSetFontHeightH5
ctrlsetfontheighth5.description: Sets H5 font size of given HTML control.

animatesource.name: animateSource
animatesource.description:
Process an animation of the object. If [animate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animate) uses class name from [CfgModels](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgModels) *Animations*, animateSource uses name defined by the *source* property. AnimationSources can animate multiple [animate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animate) Animations. AnimationSource is defined in [CfgVehicles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:CfgVehicles)' [AnimationSources](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Model_Config#AnimationSources) (see [Arma 3: createVehicle/vehicles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_createVehicle/vehicles)).

> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)It is recommended that animateSource command is used instead of [animate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animate) whenever is possible, as it is more efficient and optimized for MP
> ⚠Mixing animateSource command with [animate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animate) command to animate the same part may produce some undefined behaviour.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[source, phase, speed]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
source: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - common source
phase: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - wanted animation phase
speed: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) or [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - when set to [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), animation is instant.

* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) > 0 is treated as config speed value multiplier *Since Arma 3 v1.65.138459*

exit.name: exit

Stops the execution of a [SQS script](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQS_Syntax).

It is ignored in [SQF Scripts](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQF_Syntax).

leaderboardsrequestuploadscorekeepbest.name: leaderboardsRequestUploadScoreKeepBest
leaderboardsrequestuploadscorekeepbest.description: Starts async. operation to upload score to board with given name, value is only stored to board if it is better than one already in the board. The details array is optional. The board has to be initialized before the call.

addweaponitem.name: addWeaponItem
addweaponitem.description:
Adds a weapon item to the specified weapon. The item can be weapon magazine, in which case the amount of ammo and target muzzle could also be specified.

* Since Arma 3 v1.95 it is possible to add item instantly skipping the animation by providing optional boolean

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[weaponName, itemName, instant]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
weaponName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the weapon to add magazine to
itemName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class name of the item to add (if magazine, muzzle will be autodetected)
instant (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to skip animation. Default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)

unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[weaponName, [magazineName, ammoCount, muzzleName], instant]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
weaponName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the weapon to add magazine to
[itemName, ammoCount, muzzleName]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
itemName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class name of the item to add (if magazine, muzzle will be autodetected unless specified)
ammoCount (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - optional amount of ammo in magazine
muzzleName (Optional): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - optional target muzzle to add magazine to
instant (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to skip animation. Default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)

setposatl.name: setPosATL
setposatl.description: Sets the position of an object relative to the terrain.

triggerattachvehicle.name: triggerAttachVehicle
triggerattachvehicle.description:
Specifies the entity which will activate the selected trigger.

* If **[]** is given, the trigger is decoupled from the assigned vehicle (example 2).

* If the activation source is **"VEHICLE"**, **"GROUP"**, **"LEADER"** or **"MEMBER"**, it is changed to **"NONE"**.

* If **[vehicle]** is given, the trigger is coupled to the vehicle or its group.

* When the source is **"GROUP"**, **"LEADER"** or **"MEMBER"**, it is coupled to the group, otherwise it is coupled to the vehicle and the source is changed to **"VEHICLE"**.

enabledynamicsimulationsystem.name: enableDynamicSimulationSystem
enabledynamicsimulationsystem.description: Enables or disables the whole [Arma 3: Dynamic Simulation](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Dynamic_Simulation) system

addweaponcargoglobal.name: addWeaponCargoGlobal
addweaponcargoglobal.description:
Add weapons to the cargo space of vehicles, which can be taken out by infantry units. 

MP Synchronized

syntaxArray.Params:

[weaponName, count]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
weaponName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - weapon name. See the topic [Category:Weapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Weapons) for reference about possible values.
count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - number of weapons to add.

queryitemspool.name: queryItemsPool
queryitemspool.description: Returns the number of items of type in the weapon pool (used in campaigns to transfer weapons to the next mission).

waituntil.name: waitUntil
waituntil.description:
Suspends execution of [scheduled](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler) script until the given condition satisfied. 

* This command will loop and call the code inside {} **mostly every frame**, depends on complexity of the condition and the overall engine load, until the [code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)


* If the very first execution of the code returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) the command will exit immediately, therefore it will not produce any "Suspending not allowed in this context" error when used inside [non-scheduled](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler#Unscheduled_Environment) script. For all other uses it must be executed in environment that allows [suspension](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler#Suspension) ([canSuspend](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/canSuspend)), such as [spawned](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) or [execVMed](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/execVM) code


* Avoid doing 
```sqf
waitUntil {[time](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/time) > 20};
```
 and use 
```sqf
[sleep](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sleep) 20;
```
 instead!


* If you can, add a [sleep](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sleep) to the condition to save some cpu cycles 
```sqf
waitUntil {[sleep](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sleep) 1; ![alive](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/alive) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)};
```


> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Since Arma 3 v1.94, a *condition* returning anything other than [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) or [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) **will** result in an appropriate type error.

syntaxArray.Params: condition: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - The expression that **must** return a [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean), [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to finish waiting or [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to continue waiting
syntaxArray.Return: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - The value the condition evaluates to when the wait is over (normally [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true))

lockwp.name: lockWP

istouchingground.description: Returns true if object is touching the ground.

showscoretable.description: Forces the score table to be shown, hidden or reset to default functionality. Forcing score table will make it show even in SP. When score table is forced opened it cannot be  closed manually, when it is force closed, it cannot be opened manually.

setlightambient.name: setLightAmbient
setlightambient.description: Set ambient color of light. This includes surfaces that **face away** from the light, unlike [setLightColor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setLightColor).
examples:
```sqf
myLight setLightAmbient [0.5,0,0]; *// produces red light around the origin source*
```

moveinturret.name: moveInTurret
moveinturret.description:
Moves the soldier into the vehicle's turret. (Immediately, without animation). *turret path* is an array of positions inside a turret, or positions inside a turret of a turret.

[0] means first turret.
[1] means second turret.
[0,0] means first turret of first turret.
[0,1] means second turret of first turret.
[1,0] means first turret of the second turret.
And so on.

setunitcombatmode.name: setUnitCombatMode
setunitcombatmode.description:
Sets **unit's** combat mode (engagement rules). For AI group combat mode see [setCombatMode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setCombatMode). Mode may be one of the following: 

* "BLUE" : Never fire, keep formation

* "GREEN" : Hold fire, keep formation

* "WHITE" : Hold fire, engage at will/loose formation

* "YELLOW" : Fire at will, keep formation

* "RED" : Fire at will, engage at will/loose formation
See [Combat Modes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Combat_Modes) for more information on combat modes.

distance.name: distance
distance.description:
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:distance2D.jpg)
Returns a distance in meters between [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Positions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) or [Locations](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location).

> ⚠If positions are supplied as arguments, the coordinates are treated as [PositionATL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionATL) if over the land and as [PositionASLW](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASLW) if over the sea. If [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) is supplied, z is assumed 0. If you need distance between two [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) coordinates, use [vectorDistance](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorDistance).

syntaxArray.Params:
param1: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) or [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D)
param2: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) or [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D)
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) -  Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated

syntaxArray.Params:
location1: [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) or [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D)
location2: [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) or [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D)
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated

winddir.name: windDir

syntaxArray.Return:
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Can return:

* "NEVER" - Never show

* "ALWAYS" - Always show

* "ERROR" - When set to any different string

lbadd.name: lbAdd
lbadd.description: Adds an item with the given text to the [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTBOX) or [CT_COMBO](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_COMBO).

syntaxArray.Params:

unassignvehicle.name: unassignVehicle
unassignvehicle.description:
Unassigns individual unit from a vehicle, i.e removes [assignedVehicleRole](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/assignedVehicleRole) of the unit.
If the unit is currently in that vehicle, the group leader will issue an order to disembark.

Notes:

* Important is to understand the basic system first:

* [addVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addVehicle) creates a vehicle pool for the AI group to use.

* [leaveVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/leaveVehicle) removes a vehicle from the pool (and makes AI disembark when in that vehicle).

* However there is also [assignedVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/assignedVehicle). This is about the *current vehicle in use* essentially. The assignment happens via the various assignAsXXX/moveInXXX commands, or player/AI GL getIn radio commands, getIn waypoint, or when units start in vehicles or get moved in to a vehicle by Zeus/via Eden.

* So the idea of unassignVehicle is to remove the *current vehicle in use*.

* However as long as the vehicle is still part of the vehicle pool of the group the AI GL may order the AI to re-enter the vehicle immediately.

* To stop this from happening, one can use [orderGetIn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/orderGetIn)/[allowGetIn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/allowGetIn) [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to (temporarily) disallow the AI from entering any vehicle.

* If you use [leaveVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/leaveVehicle) on an AI group not in the vehicle, only the AI GL will get the vehicle removed from [assignedVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/assignedVehicle). However when you now apply unassignVehicle on the whole group, it will stick/the AI GL not order to re-enter immediately - as the AI GL no longer has the vehicle in his pool for the group.

* For player GL lead AI, the command removes the assignment. However it won't make the AI disembark the vehicle.
examples:
```sqf
{ unassignVehicle [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables) } [forEach](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forEach) [crew](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/crew) _vehiclenNme;
```
 Will make all the occupants of a vehicle disembark

```sqf
{ unassignVehicle [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables) } [forEach](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forEach) [crew](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/crew) _vehicleName; [crew](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/crew) _vehiclename [allowGetIn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/allowGetIn) [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false);
```
 Will make all the occupants of a vehicle disembark and stop them from getting back in

getforcedflagtexture.name: getForcedFlagTexture
getforcedflagtexture.description: A getter for [forceFlagTexture](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forceFlagTexture). Forced texture is different from your normal flag texture, which can be retrieved with [flagTexture](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/flagTexture)

syntaxArray.Params: object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle, unit of flag pole

setbleedingremaining.name: setBleedingRemaining
setbleedingremaining.description: Sets for how many seconds injured unit leaves blood trail. The unit damage must be >= 0.1 for this command to have an effect, otherwise, the [getBleedingRemaining](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getBleedingRemaining) will return 0 and no blood trail is left behind.

fromeditor.name: fromEditor
fromeditor.description:
Return if given team was inserted directly from mission editor.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

settrafficdistance.name: setTrafficDistance
settrafficdistance.description: Set maximum ambient traffic draw distance (in 2D). > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)This command does nothing in Arma 3.

weaponcargo.name: weaponCargo
weaponcargo.description: Get array with weapons from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

textlogformat.name: textLogFormat
textlogformat.description:
Debugging output. 
> ⚠This command is non-functional in the retail version

saveoverlay.name: saveOverlay
saveoverlay.description:
Save the current overlay.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

settargetage.name: setTargetAge
settargetage.description:
Sets how the target is known to the other centers. They behave like the target was seen age seconds ago.

Possible age values are: "ACTUAL", "5 MIN", "10 MIN", "15 MIN", "30 MIN", "60 MIN", "120 MIN" or "UNKNOWN".

magazines.name: magazines
magazines.description: Returns array of type names of all vehicle's magazines. When applied to a unit, the command behaves differently and will omit magazines already loaded into unit's weapons. Use [currentMagazine](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/currentMagazine) to get this information for a currently loaded magazine.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit or vehicle
includeEmpty: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [True](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to include empty magazines

vectormagnitude.name: vectorMagnitude

syntaxArray.Params: vector: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

examples:
```sqf
_size = vectorMagnitude [0,3,4]; *// returns 5*
```

```sqf
_speed = vectorMagnitude [velocity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/velocity) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player);				*// return velocity of player in m/s*
_speed = (vectorMagnitude [velocity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/velocity) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)) * 3.6;		*// return velocity of player in km/h*
_speed = (vectorMagnitude [velocity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/velocity) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)) * 2.23694;	*// return velocity of player in mph*
```

configproperties.name: configProperties
configproperties.description:
Returns an array of config entries which meet criteria in condition code. Command iterates through available classes and config properties for given config entry. If 3rd param is [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) the search also includes inherited properties. Current looked at config is stored in _x variable (similar to alternative [count](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/count) command implementation). Condition has to return [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) in order for the looked at property to be added to the resulting array. A bit slower than [configClasses](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configClasses) but allows to access inherited entries.
> ⚠The condition code passed to configProperties should only be used for **simple filter expressions** and nothing more
> ⓘWith Arma 3 2.01.147002 the following conditions were optimised inside the engine:
> 
> * "true"  (condition omitted)
> 
> * isClass _x
> 
> * isClass _x &&

syntaxArray.Params:
[config, condition, inherit]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
config: [Config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config) - config entry to search
condition (Optional): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - expression, which if returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), adds current property to result. Default: "[true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)"
inherit (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - include inherited properties. Default: [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)

currentmagazine.name: currentMagazine
currentmagazine.description: Returns class name of currently loaded vehicle's / unit's magazine.

deletegroupwhenempty.name: deleteGroupWhenEmpty
deletegroupwhenempty.description:
Marks given group for auto-deletion when group is empty. [True](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) will mark the group for auto-deletion, however [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) will only unmark the group that was marked previously. Other engine group auto-deletion mechanisms in place are not affected by this.

> ⓘIt might take up to a minute for the groups marked for auto-deletion when empty to get deleted when they become empty.

syntaxArray.Params:
group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)
delete: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to mark for auto-deletion

nmenuitems.name: nMenuItems
nmenuitems.description: Returns the total number of user-added menu items belonging to the given menu. > ⓘSome Old Editor Command

playableslotsnumber.name: playableSlotsNumber
playableslotsnumber.description: Returns the number of available slots in mission per [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) (both empty and taken). In singleplayer mission, it returns number of playable units per side.

removeallassigneditems.name: removeAllAssignedItems
removeallassigneditems.description: Unassigns and deletes all linked items from inventory. The commands operates on [assignedItems](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/assignedItems) array, which doesnt include goggles or headgear. Use [removeGoggles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/removeGoggles) and [removeHeadgear](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/removeHeadgear) for those.

confignull.name: configNull
confignull.description:
A non-existing [Config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config).

> ⚠Unlike other null values ([objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull), [grpNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/grpNull), etc), configNull returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) when compared to itself.
> 
> * configNull == configNull; *// returns true*
> 
> * [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) configNull; *// returns true*
> 
> * configNull [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) configNull; *// returns true*
> 
> * configNull == [configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "ANonExistentEntry"; *// returns true*

teams.name: teams
teams.description: Return a list of teams in the current mission.

getmarkertype.name: getMarkerType
getmarkertype.description: Gets type of marker. See [CfgMarkers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgMarkers) for a list of standard markers.

taskchildren.name: taskChildren
taskchildren.description: Return the child tasks of the specified task.

settype.name: setType
settype.description: Changes a location to the specified class. Location classes are defined in CfgLocationTypes.

ismultiplayersolo.name: isMultiplayerSolo
ismultiplayersolo.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) when playing a game in **solo multiplayer** (for example Apex coop campaign PLAY SOLO option).

clearbackpackcargo.name: clearBackpackCargo
clearbackpackcargo.description: Removes all backpacks from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

setmarkertext.name: setMarkerText
setmarkertext.description:
Sets the text label of an existing marker.
> ⓘ**Multiplayer optimisation:** Global marker commands always broadcast the *entire* marker state over the network. As such, the number of network messages exchanged when creating or editing a marker can be reduced by performing all but the last operation using local marker commands, then using a global marker command for the last change (and subsequent global broadcast of all changes applied to the marker).

execeditorscript.name: execEditorScript
execeditorscript.description:
Execute an editor script for the specified object.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

assignasgunner.name: assignAsGunner
assignasgunner.description: Assign a unit as gunner of a vehicle. Used together with [orderGetIn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/orderGetIn) to order subordinate units to get in as gunner of a specific vehicle. Before usage of this command a subordinate unit has not got the option to get into the gunner place of the vehicle.

setgroupiconsvisible.name: setGroupIconsVisible
setgroupiconsvisible.description:
Sets if group icons added with [addGroupIcon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addGroupIcon) are visible on map and in the HUD.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Since Arma 3 v1.94 this command returns [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) as it should

syntaxArray.Params:
[showOnMap, showOnHUD]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
showOnMap: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to show on map. Default - [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)
showOnHUD: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to show on HUD. Default - [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)
syntaxArray.Return: [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) (prior to Arma 3 v1.94 this command returned [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) of [ null](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) value)

getreldir.name: getRelDir
getreldir.description: Returns direction, which is relative to object's current direction, from given object to another object or position in the range from 0 to 360, the equivalent of [BIS_fnc_relativeDirTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_relativeDirTo). Taking the current [direction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/direction) of the object into account.

moveingunner.name: moveInGunner
moveingunner.description: Move soldier into vehicle gunner position (Immediate, no animation).

removeweaponglobal.name: removeWeaponGlobal
removeweaponglobal.description: Remove a weapon from a unit. An attempt to remove a weapon, which is not in unit's possession, is simply ignored.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit or vehicle
weapon: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - weapon class name

addmagazinepool.name: addMagazinePool
addmagazinepool.description: Adds magazines to the magazine pool, of which the player may choose in the following mission. Available in campaigns only.

syntaxArray.Params:
magazineName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Magazine class name. See the topic [Category:Weapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Weapons) for reference about possible values.
count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Number of magazines to add

splitstring.name: splitString
splitstring.description: An SQF version of C++ [strtok](https://community.bistudio.comhttp://www.cplusplus.com/reference/cstring/strtok/). Splits given ANSI string *str* into an array of tokens according to given *delimiters*. In addition, if empty string "" is used for *delimiters*, *str* is split by each character. If Unicode support is desired, see [forceUnicode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forceUnicode).

syntaxArray.Params:
str: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - A string to split
delimiters: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - one or more characters, each used as a separate delimiter.

examples:
```sqf
_str = "- This, is a sample string." splitString "-,. "; // ["This","is","a","sample","string"]
_str [joinString](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/joinString) " "; // "This is a sample string"
```

```sqf
"\A3\ui_f\data\map\vehicleicons\iconLogic_ca.paa" splitString "\."; 
// ["A3","ui_f","data","map","vehicleicons","iconLogic_ca","paa"]
```

```sqf
"1:2:3" splitString ":"; // ["1","2","3"]
```

```sqf
"Japa is the best!" splitString "" [joinString](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/joinString) " "; // "J a p a   i s   t h e   b e s t !"
```

```sqf
_cmd = [currentMagazineDetail](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/currentMagazineDetail) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player); //"9mm 16Rnd Mag(13/16)[id/cr:10000011/0]"
_cmd splitString "([ ]/:)"; //["9mm","16Rnd","Mag","13","16","id","cr","10000011","0"]
```
Remove all \r\n from file:
```sqf
[loadFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/loadFile) "somefile.txt" splitString [toString](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/toString) [13,10] [joinString](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/joinString) " "
```

ctrlfade.name: ctrlFade
ctrlfade.description: Returns the current fade factor of control.

setunitrecoilcoefficient.name: setUnitRecoilCoefficient
setunitrecoilcoefficient.description: Proportionaly increase/decrease unit's recoil. Drives muzzle up with every shot when supplied positive number and down when negative. 0 cancels recoil.

activateaddons.name: activateAddons
activateaddons.description: Activates the listed addons. The list of active addons is initialized during this function.

waypointposition.name: waypointPosition
waypointposition.description:
Returns [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) of the given waypoint. 
> ⓘThis command is identical to [getWPPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getWPPos)

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [ambientLife, ambientSound] where:

* ambientLife: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

* ambientSound: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

setcustomaimcoef.name: setCustomAimCoef
setcustomaimcoef.description: Set custom aim precision coefficient for weapon sway

currentpilot.name: currentPilot
currentpilot.description: Returns the person piloting the vehicle. If co-pilot is piloting, co-pilot is returned. If you need current pilot of a UAV or UGV, see [UAVControl](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/UAVControl) command.

formationtask.name: formationTask
formationtask.description: Return the current task of the unit in the formation. > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_2)This command is not available in Arma 2.

tvvalue.name: tvValue
tvvalue.description: Returns scalar data from item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

groupselectunit.name: groupSelectUnit
groupselectunit.description: Selects a unit from player's group. If player is the leader, the effect of this command is similar to player pressing F1, F2, F3... buttons to highlight units in his squad, after which the unit command menu is shown. If leader is AI, player will get usual communication menu to interact with the leader.

didjipowner.name: didJIPOwner
didjipowner.description: Checks if the current [owner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/owner) of supplied [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) Joined In Progress. Returns [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) on clients.

vectordirvisual.name: vectorDirVisual
vectordirvisual.description:
Return object's normalized direction vector in world space ([x,y,z]) in render time scope. 

* A unit facing North would return [0,1,0]

* A unit facing East would return [1,0,0]

* A unit facing South would return [0,-1,0]

* A unit facing West would return [-1,0,0]

ctrltext.name: ctrlText
ctrltext.description: Returns the text of a control of the currently active user dialog. This command can be used on static texts, buttons, edit lines and active texts as well as for images, where it returns the image path. Does not work on HTML control and returns empty string "".

syntaxArray.Return: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - The text or image path is returned, dependent on the control type
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - The text or image path is returned, dependent on the control type

positioncameratoworld.name: positionCameraToWorld
positioncameratoworld.description:
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:PositionCameraToWorld.jpg)Transforms position from camera coordinate space to world coordinate space. 
Camera axes are relative to camera orientation. x axis goes from left of the camera to right of the camera, z axis goes from underneath the camera to above the camera and y axis goes from back of the camera to where the camera is looking.

syntaxArray.Params:
cameraPos: [PositionRelative](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionRelative) - Relative camera position, format [x, z, y]
> ⚠Note that y and z for this command are swapped around, which is different from your usual model space coordinates format

ropeattachto.name: ropeAttachTo
ropeattachto.description: Attaches entity to the rope end with optional offset. For detach operation use [ropeDetach](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ropeDetach).

syntaxArray.Params:
[entity, toPoint, ropeEndDownVector]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
entity: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - entity to be attached to the end of rope
toPoint (Optional):  [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - position for the rope end, either a memory point [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or relative offset [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
ropeEndDownVector (Optional): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), either a memory point [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or relative vector [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array). If [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) is given, then ropeEndDownVector is calculated from toPoint towards ropeEndDownVector memory point. Default: [0,0,-1]
rope: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the rope to which entity will be attached to

ctrlsetangle.name: ctrlSetAngle
ctrlsetangle.description: Sets the rotation of an ST_PICTURE control. Rotation will be done within the control boundaries, so if the X and Y are given off center, the picture may get clipped by the control boundaries. Only requires [ctrlCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlCommit) when fourth parameter is set to [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false). Procedural textures filled controls do not rotate.

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - picture control
angle: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Rotation angle (clockwise)
centerX: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Rotation center X in range 0 to 1. Control center is 0.5
centerY: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Rotation center Y in range 0 to 1. Control center is 0.5
now: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) If [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), control will wait for [ctrlCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlCommit) input for result to apply *Since Arma 3 v1.78*

clearitemcargo.name: clearItemCargo
clearitemcargo.description: Removes all items from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

assignedtarget.name: assignedTarget
assignedtarget.description:
Returns the target assigned to an unit or the vehicle's [effectiveCommander](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/effectiveCommander). The target can be assigned by the group/vehicle/formation leader (as player via [quick command menu](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Field_Manual_-_Commanding#Target_Assignment) or ["target" complex command menu](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Operation_Flashpoint:_Commander_Guide#TARGET_.282.29)).
To unassign the target use [doWatch](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/doWatch) [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) or [commandWatch](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/commandWatch) [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) or as player and group leader order "no target" in the ["target" complex command menu](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Operation_Flashpoint:_Commander_Guide#TARGET_.282.29).
> ⓘ
> 
> * This command does not return the target a unit is actually engaging ("attack unit"). For this information, see [getAttackTarget](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getAttackTarget).
> 
> * If a player is inside a vehicle as the [effectiveCommander](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/effectiveCommander), the vehicle's crew assignedTarget will always be [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull).

isarray.name: isArray
isarray.description: Check if config entry represents array.

domove.name: doMove
domove.description: Order the given unit(s) to move to the given position (without radio messages). After reaching his destination, the unit will immediately return to formation (if in a group); or order his group to form around his new position (if a group leader). Use [doStop](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/doStop) to stop units returning to formation.

setwaypointscript.name: setWaypointScript
setwaypointscript.description:
Attaches a script to a scripted waypoint. In early versions of Arma, command consisted of a script name and additional script arguments and the script had to use [SQS](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQS_Syntax)-Syntax. The script receives the following arguments in [_this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this) variable: [group, position, target] + [the optional passed arguments]. The optional arguments are [appended](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/append) to the end of the arguments array.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)In Arma 3, *command* argument can be a reference to .sqf script (it will have to explicitly end with **.sqf**) or a reference to .sqs script.

setunitloadout.name: setUnitLoadout

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
loadout: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [Unit Loadout Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Unit_Loadout_Array)
fullMagazines: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Partially emptied magazines will be refilled when the loadout is applied

examples:
```sqf
player_2 setUnitLoadout ([getUnitLoadout](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getUnitLoadout) player_1); // Copies loadout from player_1 and applies it to player_2 
```

```sqf
player_2 setUnitLoadout [[getUnitLoadout](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getUnitLoadout) player_1, [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)]; // Copies loadout from player_1 and applies it to player_2 while topping up all magazines
```

```sqf
_unit setUnitLoadout "B_Soldier_F";
```

```sqf
_unit setUnitLoadout ([configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "CfgVehicles" >> "B_Soldier_F");
```

```sqf
_unit setUnitLoadout ([missionConfigFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionConfigFile) >> "MyLoadout");
```
Strip unit of everything *Since Arma 3 v1.94*
```sqf
_unit setUnitLoadout ([configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "EmptyLoadout");
```

settriggerinterval.name: setTriggerInterval
settriggerinterval.description:
Sets the interval in seconds for trigger condition check.

> ⓘTriggers are configured to check condition approx. every 0.5 second by default. This command allows either to slow down or to speed up default check interval per trigger. Setting interval to 0 will make the trigger check its condition every frame. However, when trigger is attached to some object, the trigger will inherit the simulation frequency of the object it is [ attached to](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/attachedTo). This command cannot change the interval of the attached trigger. The trigger can also be "frozen" with [enableSimulation](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/enableSimulation) command.

syntaxArray.Params:
trigger: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Trigger object
interval: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Interval in seconds with which trigger condition is checked

geteditormode.name: getEditorMode
geteditormode.description:
Returns the current mode of the editor.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

getposworldvisual.name: getPosWorldVisual
getposworldvisual.description: Returns render version of [PositionWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionWorld), which is [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) of the model centre [0,0,0] of an object in render scope, rather than transformed [boundingCenter](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/boundingCenter) or [LandContact](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Oxygen_2_-_Manual#LandContact) vertices.
examples:
```sqf
_obj [setPosWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPosWorld) getPosWorldVisual _obj;
```

```sqf
_groundObj [modelToWorldVisualWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/modelToWorldVisualWorld) [0,0,0] [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) getPosWorldVisual _groundObj; //true
```
Wave height under a boat:
```sqf
_h = ((boat [modelToWorldVisual](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/modelToWorldVisual) [0,0,0]) [vectorDiff](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorDiff) getPosWorldVisual boat) [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 2;
```

tostring.name: toString
tostring.description:
Converts the supplied [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) into a [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String). 
The numbers in the array to be converted are the decimal [Unicode](https://community.bistudio.comhttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unicode) representations of characters.
> ⚠This command expects array of numbers. If array contains non-number values, the following error might appear in .rpt file: Bad conversion: scalar

seteffectcondition.name: setEffectCondition
seteffectcondition.description:
The statement is executed when the trigger or waypoint is activated and the effects are launched depending on the result.


* If the result is a [boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) and [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), the effect is launched.

* If the result is an [object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/object), the effect is launched if the result is the player or the player vehicle.

* If the result is an [array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), the effect is launched if the result contains the player or the player vehicle.

isnil.name: isNil
isnil.description:
Tests whether the variable given by its name is [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil) or undefined, or whether the given expression evaluates to [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil) or [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing).
> ⓘ[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Operation_Flashpoint)[1.00](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Operation_Flashpoint_version_1.00) This command doesn't exist in Operation Flashpoint but can be emulated (see **[Example 5](https://community.bistudio.com#Examples)**).

syntaxArray.Params: variableName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of a [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace) variable (e.g "someVar") or a local variable (e.g "_someVar")

code: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - code to evaluate:

* the code **will** be executed; 
```sqf
isNil { [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [setDamage](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setDamage) 1; };
```
 *will* kill the player

* the code will not be allowed [to suspend](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/canSuspend) while expression is evaluated, even if the parent scope allows it (see **[Example 4](https://community.bistudio.com#Examples)**).
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if code returns something other than [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing)

examples:
```sqf
[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) (isNil "pokus") [then](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/then) { pokus = 0; };
```

```sqf
isNil { [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [getVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getVariable) "someVar" };
```

```sqf
_myArray = [0, 1];
isNil { _myArray [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 0 }; *// returns [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)*
isNil { _myArray [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 1 }; *// returns [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)*
isNil { _myArray [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 2 }; *// returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)*
isNil { _myArray [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 3 }; *// throws a script error. only length+1 select is allowed*

```
You can do this trick to force execute something in [Unscheduled Environment](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler).
```sqf
[spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) {
	[systemChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/systemChat) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [canSuspend](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/canSuspend); *// chat shows [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)*
	isNil {[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [canSuspend](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/canSuspend)}; *// hint shows [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)*
};
```
Operation Flashpoint workaround:SQS syntax:

```sqf
_nil = [format](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/format) ["%1", _undefinedVariable]
? ([format](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/format) ["%1", foo] == _nil) : foo = "value"
```

SQF syntax:

```sqf
_nil = [format](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/format) ["%1", _undefinedVariable];
[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) ([format](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/format) ["%1", foo] == _nil) [then](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/then) { foo = "value"; };
```

radiovolume.name: radioVolume
radiovolume.description: Returns the current radio volume (set by [fadeRadio](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/fadeRadio)).

camdestroy.name: camDestroy
camdestroy.description:
Destroys camera object created with [camCreate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCreate). This command doesn't need [camCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCommit). 

> ⚠Destroying camera object does not terminate camera effect automatically, use [cameraEffect](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cameraEffect) prior to deleting the camera (see Example 2)

setmusiceffect.name: setMusicEffect
setmusiceffect.description:
Defines a music track played on activation. If another track is playing already, this will stop it and start the new track.

Track is a subclass name of CfgMusic. In addition, "$STOP$" (stops the current music track) or use [playMusic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playMusic) "".
When used in a trigger, the track starts on activation but does not automatically stop on deactivation.

unassignitem.name: unassignItem
unassignitem.description: Unassigns existing item and tries to put it into inventory. If there is no space in inventory the item simply disappears.

ctrlsetautoscrollspeed.name: ctrlSetAutoScrollSpeed
ctrlsetautoscrollspeed.description:
Sets number of second required to scroll to next line. If speed < 0, auto-scroll is disabled. Setter for [ctrlAutoScrollSpeed](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollSpeed).

Autorscroll is available for [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DialogControls-ListBoxes) and [CT_CONTROLS_GROUP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CONTROLS_GROUP) types of controls only. Autoscroll will wait [ctrlAutoScrollDelay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollDelay) seconds (must be  > 0) and then will scroll the scroll bar down to the bottom. [ctrlAutoScrollSpeed](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollSpeed) defines the speed with which scrollbar is scrolled. If [ctrlAutoScrollRewind](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollRewind) is [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), the control will fade out, immediately rewind to the top, then fade in, wait [ctrlAutoScrollDelay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollDelay) seconds and then repeat the scrolling in a loop. If user focuses on the control, autoscrolling is interrupted.

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DialogControls-ListBoxes) or [CT_CONTROLS_GROUP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CONTROLS_GROUP)
speed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - seconds to autoscroll to the next line

setsimpletaskcustomdata.name: setSimpleTaskCustomData
setsimpletaskcustomdata.description: Set custom data for the task. Tooltip will be drawn in task list on the right side. Description will be drawn in task description panel on the bottom.

syntaxArray.Params:
task: [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task) - task the custom data are being added to
iconPath: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - icon path
tooltip: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - text displayed next to the icon; max. 3 charactersc
description: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - text displayed on the task description panel; html format

setgusts.name: setGusts
setgusts.description: Changes the gusts value smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change. Value is 0 to 1.

tvsetpicture.name: tvSetPicture
tvsetpicture.description: Sets picture to item selected by path. IDC means id of parent Tree View. Name is picture name. The picture is searched in the mission directory.

setvehiclereceiveremotetargets.name: setVehicleReceiveRemoteTargets
setvehiclereceiveremotetargets.description: Sets that the vehicle will be able to receive targets acquired by someone else via datalink from the [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) center.

clearmagazinecargoglobal.name: clearMagazineCargoGlobal
clearmagazinecargoglobal.description: Removes all magazines from the vehicle cargo space. MP synchronized.

leaderboardrequestrowsfriends.name: leaderboardRequestRowsFriends
leaderboardrequestrowsfriends.description: Requests given leaderboard to download friends rows from the given leaderboard

parsingnamespace.name: parsingNamespace
parsingnamespace.description: Returns the global namespace attached to config parser.

controlsgroupctrl.name: controlsGroupCtrl
controlsgroupctrl.description: Returns a child control with specified idc from a controls group

setfuelcargo.name: setFuelCargo
setfuelcargo.description: Sets fuel amount in cargo space of refuel vehicles. Note that the carrying capacity of each side's refuel trucks differ.

ropes.name: ropes
ropes.description: Returns all ropes attached to a ropes owner transport in an [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), otherwise an empty array [] is returned.

syntaxArray.Params: ropesOwner: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - a transport from which the ropes originate
syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array of the actual rope objects

exportjipmessages.name: exportJIPMessages
exportjipmessages.description: Export list of JIP to a file. Special: BattlEye's RCON variant of this command is #exportJIPqueue (see also [Multiplayer_Server_Commands](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Server_Commands))

syntaxArray.Params: fileName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - File where to store the list

getmusicplayedtime.name: getMusicPlayedTime
getmusicplayedtime.description: Returns elapsed time in seconds for currently playing music track.

setlightflaresize.name: setLightFlareSize
setlightflaresize.description: Sets relative size of the flare for the light.

enableengineartillery.name: enableEngineArtillery
enableengineartillery.description: Enable/disable the artillery engine. This allows the user to use the artillery computer on mortar/artillery, and for AI to use it for indirect fire.

getallenvsoundcontrollers.name: getAllEnvSoundControllers
getallenvsoundcontrollers.description: Returns an array containing the names and values of environmental variables that can be used in simple expressions when configuring sounds.

preloadcamera.name: preloadCamera
preloadcamera.description:
Preload all textures and models around given [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) to avoid visual artifacts after camera is moved.

Should be used before any abrupt camera change/cut.

Returns true once all data is ready. See [camPreload](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camPreload) for alternative, more flexible camera preloading.

lnbtext.name: lnbText
lnbtext.description: Returns the shown text in the item with the given position of the given 2D listbox.

moveincargo.name: moveInCargo
moveincargo.description: Move soldier into vehicle cargo position (Immediate, no animation).

getenvsoundcontroller.name: getEnvSoundController
getenvsoundcontroller.description: Returns value of the specified controller.

syntaxArray.Params:
position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position)
controller: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of environmental variable like "trees" or "houses"

uniformmagazines.name: uniformMagazines
uniformmagazines.description: Get array with all magazines from uniform of the given unit.

moveindriver.name: moveInDriver
moveindriver.description:
Moves soldier into vehicle driver position (immediate, no animation).
> ⚠The unit must be [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) to the PC executing command, the vehicle could be [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) or remote.

case.name: case
case.description:
This command is used inside a [switch do](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/switch_do) construct. Although the syntax below states that this operator takes only one argument, that is most likely not true. It seems like it needs two arguments of which the left one is some sort of hidden variable that gets defined inside a [switch do](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/switch_do) construct. That is the reason why **this operator can not be used outside a [switch do](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/switch_do) construct**. (see [https://foxhound.international/arma-3-sqf-grammar.html](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://foxhound.international/arma-3-sqf-grammar.html) for further explaination)
Also note that it is not possible to store the returned [Switch Type](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Switch_Type) in a variable and use that variable in another [switch do](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/switch_do) construct. It will never lead to an execution of the corresponding code block.

getroadinfo.name: getRoadInfo
getroadinfo.description:
Returns road info in format [mapType, width, isPedestrian, texture, textureEnd, material, begPos, endPos, isBridge]

> ⓘThe bridges are special case. Only large bridges are part of Road Net. Small pedestrian bridges are not recognized as roads. Bridge `mapType` is "ROAD" so the best way to detect bridges is to check `isBridge` boolean. Bridges are not part of new roads and don't have the same info as other new roads, so only `mapType`, `texture` (maybe `textureEnd`), `begPos`, `endPos` and `isBridge` are  updated.
> ⓘPedestrian roads `mapType` is usually "TRAIL". They are part of Road Net but excluded from path finding. Use [roadsConnectedTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/roadsConnectedTo) with alternative flag to find the connections between pedestrian roads.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [mapType, width, isPedestrian, texture, textureEnd, material, begPos, endPos, isBridge], where:

* mapType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - road segment type, could be "ROAD", "MAIN ROAD", "TRACK", "TRAIL" (see [nearestTerrainObjects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nearestTerrainObjects))

* width: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - road segment width

* isPedestrian: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - when [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) road is for pedestrian use only

* texture: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - road segment surface texture

* textureEnd: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - road segment surface texture

* material: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - road segment surface material

* begPos: [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) - start of the road segment

* endPos: [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) - finish of the road segment

* isBridge: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - when [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) road segment is a bridge

examples:
```sqf
getRoadInfo _road
```
Get direction of the road segment:
```sqf
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _info = getRoadInfo _road;
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _dir = (_info [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 6) [getDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getDir) (_info [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 7);
```

knowsabout.name: knowsAbout
knowsabout.description:
Checks if a group or a side knows about target.

* Enemy knowledge is instantly shared among the group units

* Units in the same group always perfectly know about each others

* AI knowledge cannot check beyond current [viewDistance](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/viewDistance) and it resets to zero as soon as the target's distance is over itNote: neither fog nor daylight affect this behaviour

* Losing sight of a target for more than 120 seconds resets its knowsAbout to zero as well

* **Magic number** is the value that must be reached for a unit to shoot at an enemy (used by "Detected by" triggers as well):


Game

[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Operation_Flashpoint)[1.46](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Operation_Flashpoint_version_1.46)

[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Operation_Flashpoint:_Resistance)[1.96](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki?title=Category:Introduced_with_Operation_Flashpoint:_Resistance_version_1.96&action=edit&redlink=1)

[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Armed_Assault)[1.18](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki?title=Category:Introduced_with_Armed_Assault_version_1.18&action=edit&redlink=1)

[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_2)[1.11](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki?title=Category:Introduced_with_Arma_2_version_1.11&action=edit&redlink=1)

[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_2:_Operation_Arrowhead)[1.62](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_2:_Operation_Arrowhead_version_1.62)

[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.82](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.82)


Magic value

0.7

0.105

?

?

?

?

syntaxArray.Params:
who: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) - if a unit, unit's [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) is considered; if a vehicle, vehicle commander's [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) is used.
target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) in the range of 0..4, where 4 is maximum knowledge.

get3denlayerentities.name: get3DENLayerEntities
get3denlayerentities.description: Return all entities and sub-layer in [Eden Entity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Entity) layer.

syntaxArray.Params: layerID: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - layer ID as returned by [add3DENLayer](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/add3DENLayer) command

getslingload.name: getSlingLoad
getslingload.description: Return object which is sling loaded by vehicle

syntaxArray.Return: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the sling loaded vehicle. [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) if nothing is sling loaded.

secondaryweapon.name: secondaryWeapon
secondaryweapon.description: Returns the name of a unit's secondary weapon. To detect the weapon which is **currently** being used by the unit use [currentWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/currentWeapon).

syntaxArray.Return:
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) -  Class name of the secondary weapon or 
```sqf
""
```
 if none available

isagent.name: isAgent
isagent.description: Check if team member is an agent.

triggertimeout.name: triggerTimeout
triggertimeout.description:
Returns trigger timeout in the form [min, mid, max, interruptable].

> ⚠The trigger could be [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) or remote but the result returned by this command will be for the trigger timeout set up locally on the client that executed the command. See [createTrigger](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createTrigger) for more info.

createhashmapfromarray.name: createHashMapFromArray
createhashmapfromarray.description: Creates a new [HashMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/HashMap) and initializes it from a key-value pair array

syntaxArray.Params:
keys: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array of [HashMapKeys](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/HashMapKey)
values: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array of [anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything)
> ⓘSize of *keys* and size of *values* arrays do not need to be equal. Missing values will be filled with [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil).

civilian.name: civilian
civilian.description:
Pre-defined variable for the civilian [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side).

When used in a [format](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/format) statement (hint [format](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/format)["%1",civilian]), the string returned is "CIV".

onbriefinggroup.name: onBriefingGroup
onbriefinggroup.description: Select a sound declared in the [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#Sound) of the mission to be played the first time the [Group tab](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Briefing.html#Group) is selected in the [briefing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Briefing.html).

isrealtime.name: isRealTime
isrealtime.description:
Returns true if the mission editor is operating in real time mode. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

setrainbow.name: setRainbow
setrainbow.description: Changes the rainbow value smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.

setrotorbrakertd.name: setRotorBrakeRTD
setrotorbrakertd.description: Toggles a helicopter's rotor brake. > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

syntaxArray.Params:
helicopterRTD : [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Helicopter
enable : [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Can be:

* 0: off

* 1: on

enablesaving.name: enableSaving
enablesaving.description: Enable / disable saving of the game with an optional autosave.

syntaxArray.Params:
enable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - allow manual saving
save: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - create an autosave on command execution

examples:
```sqf
enableSaving [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false);		*// saving disabled, does autosave - same as [[false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)]*
enableSaving [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true);		*// saving enabled, doesn't autosave - same as [[true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)]*

enableSaving [[false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)];	*// saving disabled, doesn't autosave*
enableSaving [[false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)];		*// saving disabled, does autosave*
enableSaving [[true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)];		*// saving enabled, doesn't autosave*
enableSaving [[true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)];		*// saving enabled, does autosave*

```

distance2d.name: distance2D
distance2d.description:
Returns a 2D distance ([distance](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/distance) projected to X,Y plane) in meters between two [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or two [Positions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) and [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position).

[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:distance2D.jpg)

syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) -  Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated

allowdamage.name: allowDamage
allowdamage.description: Allow or prevent an object being damaged (or injured, or killed). The command does not prevent object from taking scripted damage such as [setHit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setHit), [setHitIndex](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setHitIndex), [setHitPointDamage](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setHitPointDamage) or [setDamage](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setDamage). To check if damage is allowed at current locality, see [isDamageAllowed](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isDamageAllowed).

text.name: text
text.description: Creates a structured text containing the given plain text if argument is [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String).
