Use [setAttributes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setAttributes) to set additional [ attributes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text#Attributes) on the text. If the argument is [location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/location), returns location's text value (see Alt Syntax).
examples:
```sqf
_stxt2 = text "Hello world.";
```

```sqf
_townName = text myTownLocation;
```

```sqf
_loc = text [nearestLocation](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nearestLocation) [[position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/position) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), "NameMarine"]; //"Marina Bay"
```

magazinecargo.name: magazineCargo
magazinecargo.description: Get array with magazines from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

isirlaseron.name: isIRLaserOn
isirlaseron.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if there is a linked and enabled IR on the given weapon.

cutobj.name: cutObj
cutobj.description:
Displays an object defined in the global config in CfgTitles.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)For greater efficiency and ease of modability it is recommended to use named layers with [Alternative Syntax 2](https://community.bistudio.com#Alternative_Syntax_2).

syntaxArray.Params:
[class, type, speed, showInMap]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - the className of the object defined in [configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "CfgTitles" >> class
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [Title Effect Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Title_Effect_Type) for more information about these values.
speed (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Time in seconds to fade in resource. Default: -1
showInMap (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to hide the text when the map is opened. Default: [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)

layer: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - layer number on which the effect is shown, where 0 is the back most. Layer number is rounded to the nearest integer and also cannot be negative. Layer 99.5 will be treated as layer 100.
[class, type, speed, showInMap]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - the className of the object defined in [configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "CfgTitles" >> class
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [Title Effect Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Title_Effect_Type) for more information about these values.
speed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default -1) Time in seconds to fade in resource.
showInMap: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to hide the text when the map is opened.

syntaxArray.Syntax: layerName cutObj [class, type, speed, showInMap] *Since Arma 3 v1.57.134673*
syntaxArray.Params:
layerName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - layer name on which the effect is shown. Layer names are CaSe SeNsItIvE
[class, type, speed, showInMap]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - the className of the object defined in [configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "CfgTitles" >> class
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [Title Effect Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Title_Effect_Type) for more information about these values.
speed (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Time in seconds to fade in resource. Default: -1
showInMap (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to hide the text when the map is opened. Default: [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)

combatmode.name: combatMode
combatmode.description: Returns the combat mode of the given AI [ group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group). See [setCombatMode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setCombatMode) for more information about combat modes.

syntaxArray.Params: group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object). If the argument is unit [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), unit's current group is used.

shownuavfeed.name: shownUAVFeed
shownuavfeed.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if video feed transmitted from UAV is shown. A getter for [showUAVFeed](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/showUAVFeed).

menuurl.name: menuURL
menuurl.description: Returns current URL set in entry on given path.

waypointhouseposition.name: waypointHousePosition
waypointhouseposition.description: Returns [buildingPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/buildingPos) index assigned to the waypoint.

waypointattachobject.name: waypointAttachObject
waypointattachobject.description:
Attaches a static object via it is numeric ID to the given waypoint.

> ⚠
> 
> * The [main syntax](https://community.bistudio.com#Syntax) doesn't work in Arma 3 anymore.
> 
> * The [alternative syntax](https://community.bistudio.com#Alternative_Syntax) is (at least) available since Arma 2.

iskindof.name: isKindOf
iskindof.description: Checks whether the object is (a subtype) of the given type. While main and alternative syntaxes support only **CfgVehicles**, **CfgAmmo** and **CfgNonAIVehicles**, alternative syntax 2 allows to specify any config, including [mission config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionConfigFile).

enableinfopanelcomponent.name: enableInfoPanelComponent
enableinfopanelcomponent.description: Controls availability of component to given object info panel.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the concerned vehicle
panelID: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - "left" or "right" can be used as panel names
componentClassOrType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
enable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if component was successfully enabled on the panel, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) otherwise (e.g. component is not available for the object)

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the concerned vehicle
turretPath: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - turret index
panelID: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - "left" or "right" can be used as panel names
componentClassOrType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
enable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if component was successfully enabled on the panel, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) otherwise (e.g. component is not available for the object)

examples:
```sqf
*// enables slingload assistant on player's vehicle right panel at driver position*
[[vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), [-1]] enableInfoPanelComponent ["VehicleSystemsDisplayManagerComponentRight", "SlingLoadDisplay", [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)];
```

lbsetvalue.name: lbSetValue
lbsetvalue.description: Sets the additional value in the row with the given index of a [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTBOX) or [CT_COMBO](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_COMBO) control.

syntaxArray.Params:
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Control IDC
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
value: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Only integer values are supported

control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) of control
value: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Only integer values are supported

animationphase.name: animationPhase
animationphase.description: Returns the phase of the given animation on the given object. Animation can be scripted ([animate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animate), [animateSource](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animateSource), [animateDoor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animateDoor)) or engine driven. Animation names for an object could be found out with [animationNames](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animationNames) command. When animation is rotation, like with "MainTurret" for example, the output is in radians, to convert to degrees use [deg](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/deg) command.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
animationName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Name of the animation. This is the class-name of the animation defined in the addon's config.cpp
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Range 0 (start point of the animation) to 1 (end point of the animation)

do.name: do
do.description: Executes *code*. Used as part of a construct, such as [while](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/while), [with](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/with), [for](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/for) and [switch](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/switch). The *code* is always executed in [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace) unless do is used with [with](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/with) as an argument.

getposaslw.name: getPosASLW
getposaslw.description: Returns the object position height above sea surface (waves included).

lbdata.name: lbData
lbdata.description: Returns the data set in given index of the [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTBOX) or [CT_COMBO](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_COMBO).

syntaxArray.Params:
from: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Origin of the sound
sound: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Class name of the sound to be played. Defined in CfgSounds including [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext)

from: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Origin of the sound
sound: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Class name of the sound to be played. Defined in CfgSounds including [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext)
maxTitlesDistance: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (Optional, default 100) - Max. distance in meters at which the sound can be heard
speed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (Optional, default 1) - Pitch of the sound

from: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Origin of the sound
to: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target
sound: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Class name of the sound to be played. Defined in CfgSounds including [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext)

from: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Origin of the sound
to: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target
sound: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Class name of the sound to be played. Defined in CfgSounds including [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext)
maxTitlesDistance: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (Optional, default 100) - Max. distance in meters at which the sound can be heard
speed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (Optional, default 1) - Pitch of the sound

lnbpictureright.name: lnbPictureRight
lnbpictureright.description: Returns the right picture of given row. The *column* parameter does not matter.

syntaxArray.Params:
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of the row
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of the column

ctrl: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of the row
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of the column

syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Screen width including multiple monitors in screen measurement units

shownradio.name: shownRadio
shownradio.description:
Check if player has Radio enabled.
> ⓘThis command exists in Arma 3 but doesn't do much

getremotesensorsdisabled.name: getRemoteSensorsDisabled
getremotesensorsdisabled.description: Get status of disabled raycasts for remote entities. See [disableRemoteSensors](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/disableRemoteSensors) for detailed description.

diarysubjectexists.name: diarySubjectExists
diarysubjectexists.description: Checks whether given subject is present in the [Diary](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Diary) of given player.

onpreloadstarted.name: onPreloadStarted
onpreloadstarted.description:
Defines an action performed just before the preload screen started. Preload event occurs after briefing screen on mission start.
> ⚠This event handler also fires on client after user closes the main map.
> ⓘSince **Arma 3** *v1.57* a stackable version of this EH is available: [PreloadStarted](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers/addMissionEventHandler#PreloadStarted)
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)In order to keep compatibility between official and community content the functions [BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler) and [BIS_fnc_removeStackedEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_removeStackedEventHandler) should be used instead.

private.name: private
private.description:
Sets a variable to the innermost scope as demonstrated in Example 3. See also [param](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/param) and [params](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/params).
> ⓘprivate variables **must** start with an underscore: private **_**myVar1 = "myVar"; - see [Identifier](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Identifier).
> ⚠**Always** make your local variables **private** (through private or [params](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/params)) in order to avoid [overwriting a local variable of the same name](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Variables#Scopes).

syntaxArray.Params:
_identifier: underscored [variable name](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Identifier), for example *_myVar*
value: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything): value to assign to the variable

ismarkedforcollection.name: isMarkedForCollection
ismarkedforcollection.description: Checks whether the object is marked for weapons collection.

allsites.name: allSites
allsites.description:
Return all sites in map.
> ⚠This command is considered deprecated and is no longer supported

params.name: params
params.description:
Parses input argument into array of [private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) variables. When used without argument, as shown in main syntax, internal variable [_this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this), which is usually available inside functions and event handlers, is used as argument.

In addition to simple parsing directly into variables, input can be tested in case it is undefined, of the wrong type or of the wrong size (if array) and substituted if necessary with default values. Since Arma 3 v1.54, onscreen errors are displayed for when the input is of the wrong type or size.

> ⚠All variables names must start with underscore and be enclosed in quotes: params ["_myVar1", "_myVar2"];
> ⓘIt is a good practice to make your local variables **private** (through [private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) or params) in order to avoid overwriting a local variable of the same name.

syntaxArray.Params:
[element1, element2,...elementN]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format array
elementN: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
 If [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) then it is the name of a [private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) variable (must begin with underscore _, e.g. "_myVar")
 If [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) then it should be one of the following constructs:

* [variableName, defaultValue]

* [variableName, defaultValue, expectedDataTypes]

* [variableName, defaultValue, expectedDataTypes, expectedArrayCount]

*variableName*: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of a [private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) variable (must begin with underscore _, e.g. "_myVar")
*defaultValue*: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - default value to return if input element is undefined, of the wrong type or of the wrong size (if array).
*expectedDataTypes* (Optional): [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of direct [ Data Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Data_Types) -  checks if passed value is one of listed Data Types. If not, default value is used instead. Empty array [] means every data type is accepted.
*expectedArrayCount* (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)  - a single size or array of sizes. If passed input value is an array, checks that it has a certain number of elements. If not, default value is used instead. Empty array [] means any size is accepted.
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if error occurred or default value has been used, otherwise [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)

syntaxArray.Params:
argument: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - A usual array of params is expected. If a non-array argument is passed, it will be converted to 1 element array
[element1, element2,...elementN]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format array
elementN: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array):
 If [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) then it is the name of a [private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) variable (must begin with underscore _, e.g. "_myVar")
 If [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) then it should be one of the following constructs:

* [variableName, defaultValue]

* [variableName, defaultValue, expectedDataTypes]

* [variableName, defaultValue, expectedDataTypes, expectedArrayCount]

*variableName*: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of a [private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) variable (must begin with underscore _, e.g. "_myVar")
*defaultValue*: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - default value to return if input element is undefined, of the wrong type or of the wrong size (if array).
*expectedDataTypes* (Optional): [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of direct [ Data Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Data_Types) -  checks if passed value is one of listed Data Types. If not, default value is used instead. Empty array [] means every data type is accepted.
*expectedArrayCount* (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)  - a single size or array of sizes. If passed input value is an array, checks that it has a certain number of elements. If not, default value is used instead. Empty array [] means any size is accepted.
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if error occurred or default value has been used, otherwise [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)

dofsm.name: doFSM
dofsm.description:
Orders a unit to process command defined by [FSM](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/FSM) file (silently). 

Unlike with execFSM where *_this* is passed to the FSM, the following parameters are passed when using doFSM/commandFSM:


leader of subgroup with this command

command destination/position

command target

list of all persons in subgroup

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
fsmName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

emptypositions.name: emptyPositions
emptypositions.description:
Returns the number of given positions in the vehicle.

Positions can be *"Commander", "Driver", "Gunner"* or *"Cargo"*

getattacktarget.name: getAttackTarget
getattacktarget.description: Returns the target given unit is engaging.

camsetbank.name: camSetBank
camsetbank.description:
Sets camera bank angle. Does not commit changes.
> ⚠This command is **non-functional**!

flaganimationphase.name: flagAnimationPhase
flaganimationphase.description: Returns flag position on the flag pole in range of 0..1, where 0 is bottom of the flag pole, 1 is the top of the flag pole. The result is local to the PC on which command is executed

syntaxArray.Params: flag: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - flag pole of the type "FlagCarrier"

suppressfor.name: suppressFor
examples:
```sqf
 _soldier1 **suppressFor** 10 
```

Will force soldier1 to do suppressive fire to known enemies during 10 seconds

ctrlsetfonth4.name: ctrlSetFontH4
ctrlsetfonth4.description: Sets H4 font of given HTML control.

ctheadercount.name: ctHeaderCount
ctheadercount.description: Returns number of headers (rows not included) in the RscControlsTable.

synchronizedobjects.name: synchronizedObjects
synchronizedobjects.description: Return the list of objects synchronized with the given unit.

enginestorquertd.name: enginesTorqueRTD
enginestorquertd.description: Torque produced by engines in **N·m** (Newton*meter).> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

visiblegps.name: visibleGPS
visiblegps.description: Checks if the player has GPS receiver (minimap) opened and visible.

closeoverlay.name: closeOverlay
closeoverlay.description:
Closes the current overlay without committing. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

nearentities.name: nearEntities
nearentities.description:
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:sphere_radius.jpg)
Finds entities inside a sphere with the given radius. If the alternative syntax is used, only entities of given types or subtypes are listed. Entities returned are not sorted by distance. This command doesn't return dead entities or entities inside vehicles. If you need to return those, use [entities](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/entities) command.

> ⓘThis command is much [ faster](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code_Optimisation#nearEntities_and_nearestObjects) than [nearestObjects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nearestObjects) for on-foot soldier and vehicle detection.

syntaxArray.Params:
position: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) or [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) - center of the sphere
radius: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - radius of the sphere

position: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) or [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) - center of the sphere
[type, radius]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - type(s) to search for
radius: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - radius of the sphere

from.name: from
from.description: Continue sequence of [for](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/for) construct. It sets the start value of the index variable.

playactionnow.name: playActionNow
playactionnow.description:
When used on a person, a smooth transition to the given action will be initiated, but all previous playAction are discarded.

For Arma 3 actions see: [playAction/actions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playAction/actions).

nearobjects.name: nearObjects
nearobjects.description: Find objects (Units, Vehicles, Dead, Map Objects) in a sphere with given radius. The first object in the returned array is *not* necessarily the closest one. If you need returned objects to be sorted by distance, use [nearestObjects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nearestObjects). If typeName is given, only objects of given type (or its subtype) are listed.

allmines.name: allMines
allmines.description: Returns an array of all mines in the mission

triggerarea.name: triggerArea
triggerarea.description:
Returns currently monitored trigger area. Since Arma 3 v1.60, the command returns 3rd dimension for the monitored area. If height is not set, the value for it would be -1.
> ⚠The trigger could be [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) or remote but the result returned by this command will be for the trigger area set up locally on the client that executed the command. See [createTrigger](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createTrigger) for more info.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [a, b, angle, isRectangle, c], where:

* a - trigger area X size / 2

* b - trigger area Y size / 2

* angle

* isRectangle

* c - trigger area Z size / 2 *Since Arma 3 v1.59.135137*

lbsetpicturecolorselected.name: lbSetPictureColorSelected
lbsetpicturecolorselected.description: Sets the selected color of item's picture (left) with the given index of the listbox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to the given color. Color is in format [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color). Color which consists from only zeros means disable this override.

syntaxArray.Params:
[idc, index, color]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) of control
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

allmissionobjects.name: allMissionObjects
allmissionobjects.description:
Returns all mission objects which were created by and during the mission with given type or its subtype. In some cases allMissionObjects. Sometimes allMissionObjects could be replaced by the much faster [entities](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/entities) command.

Some of the unusual mission objects that can be detected with this command as well as with [nearestObject](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nearestObject):

* "" - returns everything like agents, bees, mosquitoes, foot prints (footstep), armed mines...

* "all" - more restrictive than "": no ambient insects, just agents like rabbits and snakes, no foot prints, tracks, no armed mines

* "#slop" - blood drop

* "#mark" - unit footprints

* "#track" - vehicle tracks

* "#crater" - explosion crater on the ground

* "#crateronvehicle" - bullet marks on vehicle

* "#explosion" - an explosion

* "#objectdestructed" - building, tree or bush destruction

* "#soundonvehicle" - sound created with [say3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/say3D) for example

* "#dynamicsound" - sound source created using [createSoundSource](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createSoundSource)

* "EmptyDetector" - All [triggers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/trigger)

* "Logic" - All game logics
> ⚠This command is quite performance heavy. Use with caution!

settrafficgap.name: setTrafficGap
settrafficgap.description: Set the average gap between ambient cars in a rectangle (in meters). > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)This command does nothing in Arma 3.

syntaxArray.Params:
gap: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - average gap between ambient cars (in meters)
xMin: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - western border of the affected rectangle
xMax: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - eastern border of the affected rectangle
zMin: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - southern border of the affected rectangle
zMax: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - northern border of the affected rectangle

islighton.name: isLightOn
islighton.description:
Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if vehicle headlights are on otherwise [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false).  
> ⓘSince Arma 3 v1.94 it is possible to get the status of a search light on a turret (see alt syntax).

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle with search light on a turret
turret: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - turret path

uniformcontainer.name: uniformContainer
uniformcontainer.description: Returns a cargo container of a unit's uniform.

visibleposition.name: visiblePosition
visibleposition.description: Returns an object's rendered position (z value above surface underneath) in render time scope. Same as [getPosVisual](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPosVisual)

getmarkerpos.name: getMarkerPos
getmarkerpos.description:
Returns marker position. See also [setMarkerPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setMarkerPos).
> ⓘThis command is identical to [markerPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/markerPos).

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) if *preserveElevation* is [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) or [x,y,0] if *preserveElevation* is [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)

get3denmouseover.name: get3DENMouseOver
get3denmouseover.description: Returns the [Eden Entity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Entity) the mouse is hovering over in [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor).

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format: [type,[Eden Entity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Entity)], where type can be: "Object", "Group", "Trigger", "Logic", "Waypoint" or "Marker"

targetsaggregate.name: targetsAggregate

syntaxArray.Params:
[speaker, side, unit, place, time]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
candidates: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) -  array of targets in the following format:
[[accuracy, target, targetSide, targetType, targetPosition, targetAge],...] where:

* accuracy: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - a coefficient, which reflects how close the returned result to the query filter. Range: 0 - 1 (1 - best match)

* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the actual target object

* targetSide: [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) - side of the target

* targetType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - target [typeOf](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/typeOf)

* targetPosition: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [x,y] of the target

* targetAge: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - the actual target age in seconds (can be negative)

examples:
_aggregation = [player, sideEnemy, "", [], 0] targetsAggregate (player targetsQuery [objNull, sideUnknown, "", [], 0])could return something like this: 
[[["COUNT0",1],["SIDE0",WEST],["UNIT0","B_Soldier_F"],["PLACE0",[[<null>,<null>],0,<null>]],["TIME0",[-0.9,-0.9]],["UCOUNT0",1],["UTYPE0","...

inareaarray.name: inAreaArray
inareaarray.description: Returns given list of [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) and/or [Positions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) that are in the given area, area defined by a trigger, marker, location or array.

syntaxArray.Params:
positions: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) and/or [Positions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position)
area: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - the defined area:

* [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - trigger

* [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location) - location

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - marker name

syntaxArray.Syntax: positions **inAreaArray** [center, a, b, angle, isRectangle, c]
syntaxArray.Params:
positions: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) and/or [Positions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) to check
center: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - center of the area in format [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D), [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D)
a: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - x axis (x / 2)
b: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - y axis (y / 2)
angle: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) rotation angle
isRectangle: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if rectangle, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if ellipse
c: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default -1: unlimited) z axis (z / 2)

particlesquality.name: particlesQuality
particlesquality.description: Returns current user settings for particles quality (configure->video->general->particles). 0-low, 1-normal, 2-high

menudata.name: menuData
menudata.description: Returns data stored in menu entry on given path.

ammoonpylon.name: ammoOnPylon
ammoonpylon.description:
Returns ammo count on given pylon.
Returns false ([Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)) on failure.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
pylon: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The name or the index of the pylon

setvariable.name: setVariable
setvariable.description:
Set variable to given value in the variable space of given element.

* To remove a variable, set it to [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil) (e.g. 
```sqf
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) setVariable ["varname", [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil)];
```
).

* When variable is set on [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task), it is not actually set on task itself, but on FSM attached to the task. So if there is no FSM setVariable will not work.

* When variable is set on [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location), it works only with locations created with [createLocation](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createLocation).

> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)In Arma 3 it is possible to broadcast [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil) value!

syntaxArray.Params:
varspace: [Namespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace), [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group), [Team Member](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Member), [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task), [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location), [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control), [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display) - Variable space in which variable can be set
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Since Arma 3 also [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) and [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display) are supported types.
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Variable name
value: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - Variable value

varspace: [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace), [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - Variable space in which variable can be set
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Variable name
value: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - Variable value (if public is [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), check [publicVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/publicVariable) for what types are supported for broadcast)
public: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean), [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - When [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), the variable broadcast is global and persistent [GEGlobal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Locality)


* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The variable is set only on the client of given [owner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/owner) ([clientOwner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/clientOwner)) id, or if id is negative, the variable is set on every client except the given one


* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Array of [owner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/owner) ([clientOwner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/clientOwner)) ids

vestcontainer.name: vestContainer
vestcontainer.description: Returns a cargo container of a unit's vest.

set3denmissionattributes.name: set3DENMissionAttributes
set3denmissionattributes.description:
Set [scenario attributes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Scenario_Atttributes).

An attribute is identified by its property (data when it is engine-drive attribute) value in config. For the list of all attributes with their properties, see [Mission Attributes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Setting_Attributes#Scenario).

> ⚠Attributes are available only within the Eden Editor workspace. You cannot access them in scenario preview or exported scenario!

syntaxArray.Params:
section: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - attribute section
class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - attribute name
value: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - new attribute value

examples:
```sqf
set3DENMissionAttributes [["Multiplayer","respawn",3],["Multiplayer","respawnDelay",10]];
```

Set respawn type to 3 and respawn delay to 10 seconds

surfaceiswater.name: surfaceIsWater
surfaceiswater.description: Returns whether water is at given position.

syntaxArray.Params: position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D)  or [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) in which case Z will be ignored

setsimpletaskdescription.name: setSimpleTaskDescription
setsimpletaskdescription.description: Attach descriptions to the simple task.

syntaxArray.Params:
task: [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task)
[description, descriptionShort, descriptionHUD]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
description: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Task description
descriptionShort: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Task title
descriptionHUD: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Task waypoint description

dostop.name: doStop
dostop.description: Order the given unit(s) to stop (without radio messages). The units stopped in this way will leave the groups formation. It will prevent them from moving around with their group (or formation leader), while still being able to turn around and even move to a new position if they see fit. The units will still respond to orders from their group leader (like engage, rearm, board a vehicle), but all of their actions will be separate from the group formation. To resume group default behaviour, use [doFollow](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/doFollow) command. For example: [units](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/units) _group [doFollow](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/doFollow) [leader](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/leader) _group;

itemswithmagazines.name: itemsWithMagazines
itemswithmagazines.description: Returns combined array including all unit's stored [items](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/items) and all unit's stored [magazines](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/magazines) and all unit's **stored** [weapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/weapons). Loaded magazines such as [currentMagazine](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/currentMagazine), [primaryWeaponMagazine](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/primaryWeaponMagazine), [secondaryWeaponMagazine](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/secondaryWeaponMagazine), [handgunMagazine](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/handgunMagazine), [binocularMagazine](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/binocularMagazine) as well as [assignedItems](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/assignedItems) are excluded.

servertime.name: serverTime
servertime.description:
Returns the time since last server restart, synced to all clients in MP. The syncing is happening every 5 minutes, but you can force the next sync earlier by executing [estimatedTimeLeft](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/estimatedTimeLeft) command. The time returned is also different to the time returned by [time](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/time) and [diag_tickTime](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_tickTime) commands on server. Returns 0 in SP.

> ⓘ**Known issues before Arma 3 v1.86**:  Both server and clients showed the same value when synced. The only time it was not synced was on the server, right after server restart and only for the first 300 seconds. Client side was synced from the start

attachedobject.name: attachedObject
attachedobject.description: Returns the object a location is attached to. If the location is unattached, then [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) is returned.

switchmove.name: switchMove
switchmove.description:
Applies given animation to a unit. When used on a person, the given move is started immediately (there is no transition). Use 
```sqf
_unit switchMove "";
```
 to reset animation. For a smooth transition use [playMove](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playMove).
> ⓘsee [Category:Moves](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Moves) for respective games animations.
examples:
Prone: 
```sqf
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) switchMove "AmovPpneMstpSrasWrflDnon";
```
Sit player immediately and globally: 
```sqf
[[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), "AmovPsitMstpSlowWrflDnon"] [remoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExec) ["switchMove", 0];
```

ctrlsettext.name: ctrlSetText
ctrlsettext.description:
Sets the text of a control of the currently active user dialog or display. This command can be used for static texts, buttons, edit lines and active texts as well as for images, where you can use it to set the image path.
Read [Arma: GUI Configuration](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma:_GUI_Configuration) for more information about user dialogs and controls.
Use [endl](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/endl) to insert line breaks.
> ⚠The main syntax 
> ```sqf
> ctrlSetText [idc, text]
> ```
>  does not support [CT_SHORTCUTBUTTON](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_SHORTCUTBUTTON), but the alternative syntax 
> ```sqf
> control ctrlSetText text
> ```
>  does.

syntaxArray.Params:
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Control IDC
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Text or image path, depending on the control type

examples:
```sqf
ctrlSetText [100, "Hello world"]; *// for Dialogs*
```

```sqf
_control ctrlSetText "Hello world."; *// for Displays*
```

getplayervonvolume.name: getPlayerVoNVolume
getplayervonvolume.description: Gets provided player's Voice over Network (VoN) volume.

syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) in range 0..1, -1 in case of error (e.g provided a non-human)

goto.name: goto
goto.description:
Break script flow and go to given label (defined by **#** - **NOT** to be confused with [SQF](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQF_Syntax)'s [hash sign](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/a_hash_b)!)
> ⚠This command only works in [SQS Syntax](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQS_Syntax).
> ⓘNote that labels are not case sensitive and are searched for from the top of the script, so multiple occurrences of a label will only result in the topmost one ever being found.

syntaxArray.Params:
feature: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Can be:

* "AwareFormationSoft"

* "CombatFormationSoft"
enable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [True](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to enable, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to disable

unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit to test AI feature for
feature: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - See [disableAI](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/disableAI) / [enableAI](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/enableAI) for possible values
enabled: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [True](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to enable, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to disable

setdrawicon.name: setDrawIcon
setdrawicon.description:
Set the icon to be shown in 2D editor for the specified editor object. If maintain size is false,icon will not scale depending on the scale,of the map. If maintain size is a number,the icon will maintain size,if map scale is below that number. is3D,show line and priority are,optional.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

preloadobject.name: preloadObject
preloadobject.description:
Preloads all textures, materials and proxies needed to render given object. Works with both class names and objects. Returns true once all data is loaded and ready.
> ⚠At least one object of the given classname has to be present in the current mission in order for alternative syntax version of the command to have any effect

syntaxArray.Params:
distance: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) -  distance at which preload the object
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - existing object

distance: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)  -  distance at which preload the object
classname: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - classname of the object

modparams.name: modParams
modparams.description:
Returns list of mod parameters according to given options, values are in same order as the given options. Available options are:


"name"
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
name to be shown (Arma 3 instead of A3, etc.)


"picture"
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
picture shown in Mod Launcher


"logo"
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
logo to be shown in Main Menu


"logoOver"
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
logo to be shown in Main Menu when mouse is over


"logoSmall"
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
small version of logo, prepared for drawing small icons


"tooltip"
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
tooltip to be shown on mouse over


"tooltipOwned"
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
tooltip to be shown on mouse over the icon when DLC is owned by player


"action"
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
url to be triggered when mod button is clicked


"actionName"
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
what to put on Action Button


"overview"
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
overview text visible in expansion menu


"hidePicture"
[Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)
do not show mod picture icon in the main menu mod list


"hideName"
[Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)
do not show mod name in the main menu mod list


"defaultMod"
[Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)
default mods cannot be moved or disabled by Mod Launcher


"serverOnly"
[Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)
mod doesn't have to be installed on client in order to play on server with this mod running


"active"
[Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)
active mod (activated through command line or stored in profile by mod launcher)

> ⓘPlease note that "active" does not actually tell you if a mod is running / pretends to be running.

syntaxArray.Params:
[modClass, options]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
modClass: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class name of the mod
options: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - see description
syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - retrieved requested data on success or empty array []

primaryweaponitems.name: primaryWeaponItems
primaryweaponitems.description: Returns array with all items assigned to the [primaryWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/primaryWeapon) except magazines. Use [primaryWeaponMagazine](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/primaryWeaponMagazine) command for the latter. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

loadgame.name: loadGame
loadgame.description:
Loads game from the last autosave made with [saveGame](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/saveGame). If no autosave exists, restarts the mission. When used in campaign it will also deduct 1 life, defined in:
[campaignConfigFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/campaignConfigFile) / "Campaign" / <battle> / <mission> / "lives"
> ⓘA [ mission event handler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addMissionEventHandler) [ "Loaded"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers/addMissionEventHandler#Loaded) is available and is important that it is added in preInit in order for it to fire on load from save

addmagazinecargo.name: addMagazineCargo
addmagazinecargo.description:
Add magazines to the cargo space of vehicles, which can be taken out by infantry units. Once the magazine cargo space is filled up, any further addMagazineCargo commands are ignored.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)In Arma 3, arguments for this command must be local ([LALocal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Locality)). For global variant see [addMagazineCargoGlobal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addMagazineCargoGlobal).

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicleName: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle to add the magazines to
[magazineName, count]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
magazineName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - magazine name. See [Category:Weapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Weapons) for reference about possible values.
count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - number of magazines to add

adduniform.name: addUniform
adduniform.description: Create a new uniform and try to link it into uniform slot (given uniform has to be supported by allowedUniforms list of target soldier). To check if uniform is allowed use [isUniformAllowed](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isUniformAllowed) and to force add incompatible uniform use [forceAddUniform](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forceAddUniform)

continuewith.name: continueWith
continuewith.description: Skips the current loop iteration, continues with the next one and returns the given value.

syntaxArray.Params: return: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - Value to be returned when iteration is skipped

waypointloiteraltitude.name: waypointLoiterAltitude
waypointloiteraltitude.description: Gets the waypoint loiter altitude. Waypoint uses format Waypoint.

syntaxArray.Syntax: **setCamShakeDefParams** [power, duration, frequency, minSpeed, minMass, caliberCoefHit, vehicleCoef]
syntaxArray.Params:
power: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
duration: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
frequency: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
minSpeed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
minMass: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
caliberCoefHit: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
vehicleCoef: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

onbriefingplan.name: onBriefingPlan
onbriefingplan.description: Select a sound declared in the [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#Sound) of the mission to be played the first time the [Plan tab](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Briefing.html#Plan) is selected in the [briefing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Briefing.html).

getdlcassetsusage.name: getDLCAssetsUsage
getdlcassetsusage.description: Returns an array of the DLC usage times.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array of DLC usage informations, containing DLC items in format:
[[name, dlcAppId, sessionTime, totalTime], [name, dlcAppId, sessionTime, totalTime], (…)]
**NOTE:** unused assets won't appear in the result (usage time = 0).

selectplayer.name: selectPlayer
selectplayer.description:
Move player into given unit. Some usage advices:

* Try avoiding selectPlayer on editor-placed units in multiplayer, as it may, on occasion, lead to some undefined behaviour.

* If you need to selectPlayer into another unit, consider [creatingUnit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createUnit) dynamically.
> ⓘBefore Arma 3 it was possible to selectPlayer another player-controlled unit, leading to control issues.
> ⚠Creating and immediately selecting player into newly created unit could cause all sort of problems due to possible delay in unit initialization. Give unit some time to propagate properly on network before selecting player into it.

ctrowcontrols.name: ctRowControls
ctrowcontrols.description: Returns array of controls on the row with the given index.

simpletasks.name: simpleTasks
simpletasks.description: Return all simple tasks assigned to given unit.

leaderboardsrequestuploadscore.name: leaderboardsRequestUploadScore
leaderboardsrequestuploadscore.description: Starts async. operation to upload score to board with given name, value always overwrite the current value in the board. The details array is optional. The board has to be initialized before the call.

doartilleryfire.name: doArtilleryFire
doartilleryfire.description: Orders an artillery unit to fire a burst on the given position (silently).

scriptnull.name: scriptNull
scriptnull.description:
A non-existing [Script](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Script) or script that has finished ([scriptDone](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/scriptDone)). To compare non-existent scripts use [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) or [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo):

* scriptNull == scriptNull; // ERROR! == cannot be used with script object

* [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) scriptNull; // true

* scriptNull [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) scriptNull; // true

ropecut.name: ropeCut
ropecut.description:
Cuts the given rope to the specified length. If some entity was attached to the end of the rope, it will be detached. The rope remains attached to its parent transport and if the length is set to 0 or even negative does not get destroyed. Use [ropeDestroy](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ropeDestroy) to remove it completely.
> ⓘThe rope could only be shortened. If the cut length is greater than current rope length, nothing happens

syntaxArray.Params:
rope: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - rope object obtained from [ropeCreate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ropeCreate)
length: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - length of the rope in meters after the cut

player.name: player
player.description: A person object controlled by user. In Intros and Outros this isn't set by default and must be assigned.

removedrawlinks.name: removeDrawLinks
removedrawlinks.description:
Remove all drawn links for the given editor object for the given editor,object type. Pass an empty string as param type to remove all draw,links for an object.  
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

locationposition.name: locationPosition
locationposition.description: Returns the [position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) of a location. If the location is attached to an object, that object's position is returned.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [x,y,z], where z is -1 * [getTerrainHeightASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getTerrainHeightASL) at the location

geteditorobjectscope.name: getEditorObjectScope
geteditorobjectscope.description:
Returns the editor object scope of the specified editor object.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

showcuratorcompass.name: showCuratorCompass
showcuratorcompass.description: Hides or shows compass in curator interface.

setwaypointvisible.name: setWaypointVisible
setwaypointvisible.description: Sets the visibility of the given waypoint in 3D HUD view (for map visibility see [showWaypoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/showWaypoint)).

loadabs.name: loadAbs
loadabs.description: Returns current sum of mass from items stored in all unit's containers, linked items and weapons.

isdamageallowed.name: isDamageAllowed
isdamageallowed.description: A getter for [allowDamage](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/allowDamage) command. The command indicates if damage is allowed at current [locality](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local), hence local effect of the command. For complete solution for being able to tell whether or not an object can be damaged at current locality see **Example 1**.

lineintersectswith.name: lineIntersectsWith
lineintersectswith.description: Returns objects intersecting with the virtual line from *begPos* to *endPos*. By default resulting array of intersecting objects is unsorted. To sort by distance set *sortByDistance* param to [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true). > ⚠Doesn't work under water. Max hardcoded distance is 1000m.

syntaxArray.Params:
[begPos, endPos, objIgnore1, objIgnore2, sortByDistance]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
begPos: [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) - virtual line start
endPos: [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) - virtual line end
objIgnore1: (optional) [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object to ignore. When testing intersection from an object/unit/vehicle, pass that object here to prevent intersection inside of the object.
objIgnore2: (optional) [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - another object to ignore. When testing intersection of a line between two objects, pass the second object here to prevent intersection inside of it being reported
sortByDistance: (optional) [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true): Sort by distance => furthermost object first, closest object last; [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false): unsorted

examples:
```sqf
_objects = lineIntersectsWith [[eyePos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/eyePos) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), [AGLtoASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/AGLtoASL) [screenToWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/screenToWorld) [0.5,0.5]];
```
Sort by distance: 
```sqf
_objects = lineIntersectsWith [[eyePos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/eyePos) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), [AGLtoASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/AGLtoASL) [screenToWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/screenToWorld) [0.5,0.5], [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull), [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull), [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)];
```
Ignore objects: 
```sqf
_objects = lineIntersectsWith [[eyePos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/eyePos) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), [aimPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/aimPos) chopper, [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), chopper];
```

setmarkerdirlocal.name: setMarkerDirLocal
setmarkerdirlocal.description: Sets the orientation of the marker.

syntaxArray.Params:
markerName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
angle: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Angle of the marker in degree

openyoutubevideo.name: openYoutubeVideo
openyoutubevideo.description: Opens Steam overlay with given YT video. Video URL is the end part of the YT URL, starting with **watch?v=...**. If the user has Steam overlay disabled, the command will display appropriate message to the user and return [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false).

removecuratoreditableobjects.name: removeCuratorEditableObjects
removecuratoreditableobjects.description: Unregister objects which can be edited by a curator.

camsetrelpos.name: camSetRelPos
camsetrelpos.description: Sets the position of the given camera relative to its target, set with [camSetTarget](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camSetTarget). Needs a call to [camCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCommit) to be conducted.> ⚠Since it sets relative position to the target, the [camSetTarget](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camSetTarget) command should be executed already, before camSetRelPos.

syntaxArray.Params:
camera: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object of type "camera"
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [PositionRelative](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionRelative)

comment.name: comment
comment.description:
Defines a comment. See [SQF Syntax - Comments](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQF_Syntax#Comments) to learn more about comments.
> ⚠This command is evaluated during execution, and as such is infinitely slower than other SQF comment methods (//comment or /*comment*/; which do not exist at runtime). See [SQF Syntax](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQF_Syntax) for additional documentation on comments.

not.name: not
not.description: **not** a is exactly the same as [!a](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/!)

diag_fps.name: diag_fps
diag_fps.description: Returns average framerate calculated over last 16 frames.

setaperture.name: setAperture
setaperture.description:
Sets custom eye accommodation camera aperture.

> ⓘIf HDR is enabled, when setAperture value is used it also forces [setApertureNew](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setApertureNew) to the following values: [value, value, value, 1]. Execute [setApertureNew](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setApertureNew) after setAperture to override this default mechanic.  
> ⚠The aperture is set to default by the engine at the mission start. If you set it before the mission started it will reset like it never happened. Make sure you set it at the right time (see Example 2)

syntaxArray.Params:
aperture: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Aperture value. If 
```sqf
-1
```
 is provided the engine will set the aperture automatically

tvsetcursel.name: tvSetCurSel
tvsetcursel.description: Sets cursor to given item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View. To deselect all items use [-1] for the path param (*available since Arma 3 v1.56*)

setrectangular.name: setRectangular
setrectangular.description: Set the shape of a location to be either rectangular or elliptical. Locations default shape is elliptical.

syntaxArray.Params:
location: [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location)
set: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) set rectangular, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) set elliptical

synchronizeobjectsadd.name: synchronizeObjectsAdd
synchronizeobjectsadd.description: Add given objects to the unit's list of synchronized objects.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
objects: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - An array of objects

eyepos.name: eyePos
eyepos.description: Returns the object's eyes / main turret position.

setmarkersize.name: setMarkerSize
setmarkersize.description:
Set marker size.
Size is in format [a-axis, b-axis].
> ⓘ**Multiplayer optimisation:** Global marker commands always broadcast the *entire* marker state over the network. As such, the number of network messages exchanged when creating or editing a marker can be reduced by performing all but the last operation using local marker commands, then using a global marker command for the last change (and subsequent global broadcast of all changes applied to the marker).

syntaxArray.Params:
markerName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
[a-axis, b-axis]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
a-axis: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number). 1/2 width of marker
b-axis: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number). 1/2 height of marker

ctrlmouseposition.name: ctrlMousePosition
ctrlmouseposition.description: Returns position of the mouse on the screen relative to UI Control in UI coordinates. Also works within [CT_CONTROLS_GROUPs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CONTROLS_GROUP). In that case, returned position is relative to the position of the group.

camsetfovrange.name: camSetFovRange
camsetfovrange.description:
Set the zoom level (**F**ield **O**f **V**iew) start and end values for automatical zooming. 

The default zoom level is *0.7* where *0* is the nearest and *1* is the most far zoom value.
 > ⚠This command is **non-functional**!

syntaxArray.Params:
camera: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object of type "camera"
fovRange: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - zoom level, range 0 to 1 (see description above)

flagside.name: flagSide
flagside.description: Returns [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) of the [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) instance of the flag. A getter for [setFlagSide](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setFlagSide).

onshownewobject.name: onShowNewObject
onshownewobject.description:
Defines an action performed when the user right clicks on the map and,selects New Object. Set to empty for default behavior. Command receives:,_pos array position, 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

attackenabled.name: attackEnabled
attackenabled.description: Return whether a group's leader can issue attack commands to soldiers under his command.

lbsortbyvalue.name: lbSortByValue
lbsortbyvalue.description: Sorts the ListBox entries by [lbValue](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lbValue). The entries are sorted in ascending order. Also note that this command will mix up the entries randomly if multiple entries have the same value.

buttonsetaction.name: buttonSetAction
buttonsetaction.description:
Set the action of a control of the currently active user dialog. The script statement is executed on button release and _this is available, but contains ""; See [Arma: GUI Configuration](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma:_GUI_Configuration) for more information about user dialogs. Works with:

* [CT_BUTTON](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_BUTTON)

* [CT_XBUTTON](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_XBUTTON)

* [CT_ACTIVETEXT](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_ACTIVETEXT)

* [CT_SHORTCUTBUTTON](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_SHORTCUTBUTTON)

syntaxArray.Params:
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Button IDC
action: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - **[SQS](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQS_Syntax)** code body that should be executed when the button/active text is clicked

control:  [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - Button control
action:  [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - **[SQS](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQS_Syntax)** code body that should be executed when the button/active text is clicked

examples:
```sqf
buttonSetAction [100, "[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [exec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/exec) ""reply.sqs"""];
```

```sqf
_ctrl buttonSetAction "[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) ([alive](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/alive) bob) [then](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/then) {[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) 'alive'} [else](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/else) {[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) 'dead'}"; // SQF but SQS compatible, see [SQS](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQS_Syntax)
```
Script is SQS
```sqf
_control buttonSetAction "[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [format](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/format) ['Is SQS: %1', ![isNil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNil) '_time']";
```

removeallitemswithmagazines.name: removeAllItemsWithMagazines
removeallitemswithmagazines.description: Removes all [itemsWithMagazines](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/itemsWithMagazines) from the uniform, vest and backpack. Command essentially clears all unit's containers.

iswalking.name: isWalking
iswalking.description:
Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if walk is **toggled** (default W+S in Arma 3).
> ⓘThis command can still return true when the unit is sprinting or stopped; it only returns the **toggle** value of walking, not if the unit is walking right now.

formationmembers.name: formationMembers
formationmembers.description: Return list of units (drivers) in the formation.

copyfromclipboard.name: copyFromClipboard
copyfromclipboard.description: Return ANSI content of the (text) clipboard. If Unicode support is desired, see [forceUnicode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forceUnicode).

setwind.name: setWind
setwind.description:
Set current (forced == false) or permanent (forced == true) wind vector.
**NOTE**: The effect is global only if command is executed on the server. Wind set locally will sync back to server value in a while.

syntaxArray.Params:
[x, y, forced]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
x: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) Easterly component (in m/s, positive = to the east)
y: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) Northerly component (in m/s, positive = to the north)
forced: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) true: wind constantly blows in set direction, false: wind can change direction (default)

idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of the row
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of the column
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Color RGBA

ctrl: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of the row
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of the column
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Color RGBA

removemusiceventhandler.name: removeMusicEventHandler
removemusiceventhandler.description: Removes specified music track event handler.

syntaxArray.Params:
[type, id]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - "MusicStart" or "MusicStop"
id: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - event handler id

diag_activemissionfsms.name: diag_activeMissionFSMs
diag_activemissionfsms.description: Returns array with active Mission FSMs. To see number of all scripts currently in the scheduler use [diag_activeScripts](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_activeScripts).

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [[name, state, timeout],...]:

* name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* state:

* timeout:

syntaxArray.Params:
helicopter: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Can be:

* "LAND" - Ccomplete stop

* "GET IN" - Hovering very low, for another unit to get in

* "GET OUT" - Hovering low, for another unit to get out

* "NONE" - Cancel a landing, **since Arma 2**

setdropinterval.name: setDropInterval
setdropinterval.description:
Set interval of emitting particles from particle source. In Arma 3 hardcoded limit of how many particles can exist at the same time is [18000](https://community.bistudio.comhttp://forums.bistudio.com/showthread.php?177797-Ruin-your-copy-of-Arma-and-your-PC#post2691090). Correspondence between CfgCloudlets class param name and command param:

```sqf
particleSource setDropInterval interval;
```

lnbsetcolor.name: lnbSetColor
lnbsetcolor.description: Sets the color of the item with the given position of the 2D listbox. Color is in format [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color).

syntaxArray.Params:
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [r,g,b,a]

ctrl: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [r,g,b,a]

configof.name: configOf
configof.description: Returns config path of the provided object.

setvectorup.name: setVectorUp
setvectorup.description:
Set object's up vector. Direction of the object remain unchanged. Default object's [vectorUp](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorUp) is [0,0,1].

In Multiplayer, setVectorUp must be executed on the machine where the object it applied to is [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local).
examples:
Turn object upside down:

```sqf
_obj setVectorUp [0,0,-1];
```
Align object with the terrain underneath:

```sqf
_obj setVectorUp [surfaceNormal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/surfaceNormal) [position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/position) _obj;
```

doorphase.name: doorPhase
doorphase.description: Return animation phase of door on vehicle.

cameraeffectenablehud.name: cameraEffectEnableHUD
cameraeffectenablehud.description: Enable / disable showing of in-game UI during currently active camera effect. By default the HUD is off, which will make results of [drawIcon3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/drawIcon3D) invisible, for example.

isautonomous.name: isAutonomous
isautonomous.description: Returns whether the UAV is in autonomous mode or not.

rotorsrpmrtd.name: rotorsRpmRTD
rotorsrpmrtd.description: Returns rotors RPM. > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

syntaxArray.Params:
taskID: [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task)
state: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [True](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) for always visible, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) for fade out

resources.name: resources
resources.description: Returns the resources of a team member. Results are local to the PC on which command was executed.

say.name: say
say.description:
Make unit say given sound. The sound is defined in [CfgSounds](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgSounds). If the [unit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object#Unit) is a [person](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object#Person), it will also perform corresponding lipsync effect provided an appropriate .lip file has been created for this sound.


* A dead or non-existent unit obviously cannot say anything.

* If the camera is not within given range, title is not shown and the sound will not be heard.

* See also [playSound](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playSound) in order to play a sound wherever the [camera/player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cameraOn) is.

> ⓘsay will mimic either [say2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/say2D) or [say3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/say3D) depending on whether it is there executed in a cutscene or in a game scene.

syntaxArray.Params:
from: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - origin of the sound
sound: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - sound classname

from: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - origin of the sound
sound: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - sound classname
maxTitlesDistance: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - max distance at which the sound can be heard. Default: 100 m.
speed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) pitch of the sound

from: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - origin of the sound
to: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - target
sound: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - sound classname

from: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - origin of the sound
to: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - target
