For teams only use [forEachMemberTeam](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forEachMemberTeam). For agents only use [forEachMemberAgent](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forEachMemberAgent).

setslingload.name: setSlingLoad
setslingload.description:
Creates a sling loading from a helicopter to an entity if possible. To unload cargo, pass [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) as second param. 
> ⓘFROM object has to be a helicoper, alive with [ rope attachment](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/enableRopeAttach) enabled, TO object has to be an entity, alive with [ rope attachment](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/enableRopeAttach) enabled.

syntaxArray.Params:
heli: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the helicopter slinging the load
cargo: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the cargo load entity

examples:
```sqf
_success = heli1 setSlingLoad veh1;
```
To unload cargo:
```sqf
_success = heli setSlingLoad [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull);
```

enablevehiclecargo.name: enableVehicleCargo
enablevehiclecargo.description: Enable/disable option to transport other vehicles (if configured) or be transported.

safezonew.name: safeZoneW
safezonew.description:
Returns the width of the screen in screen measurement units. Taken from top left corner of the default viewport (0,0) of the screen and going in the same direction as the X axis, the value will be positive but resulting X will end up beyond the right border. Therefore in order to calculate X of the right screen border, the length of [safeZoneX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/safeZoneX) must be subtracted from safeZoneW, but because it is negative, it must be added instead. _screenRightBorderX = safeZoneW + [safeZoneX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/safeZoneX). The measurement units depend on the current screen resolution [getResolution](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getResolution). See also [SafeZone](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SafeZone)
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:safezone.jpg)

syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Screen width in screen measurement units

lockinventory.name: lockInventory
lockinventory.description: Lock or unlock a vehicle's inventory access. This command can also lock backpack a unit is wearing to prevent access by a third party. If you set it [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) (locked), the inventory won't be accessed via hotkey or action menu.

setimportance.name: setImportance
setimportance.description: Sets the importance value of location.

forcespeed.name: forceSpeed
forcespeed.description: Force the speed limit on given object (object will never attempt to move faster than given by forceSpeed). Use negative value to return to default behaviour. Used unit is m/s.

setunitability.name: setUnitAbility
setunitability.description: Sets skill of given unit. Unlike [setSkill](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setSkill), setUnitAbility can set values > 1. Even though the [skill](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/skill) command will correctly return set value, the actual unit ability will be capped to max available.

matrixmultiply.name: matrixMultiply
matrixmultiply.description:
Returns resulting matrix from the [multiplication](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matrix_multiplication) of two matrices. First matrix must be of the size n ✕ **k**, while the second must be of the size **k** ✕ m, i.e columns matrix1 == rows matrix2. The resulting matrix will be of the size n ✕ m. If the shapes do not match, empty array [] will be returned.
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:matrixMultiply.jpg)

syntaxArray.Params:
matrix1: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - matrix of the size n*(rows)* ✕ k*(columns)*
matrix2: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - matrix of the size k*(rows)* ✕ m*(columns)*
syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - resulting matrix of the size n*(rows)* ✕ m*(columns)*

verifysignature.name: verifySignature
verifysignature.description: Check if file is signed by any key present in game keys folders. On clients, it does not check against the keys accepted by server.

set3denselected.name: set3DENSelected
set3denselected.description: Changes selection in 3den to what is inside entities array.

hintcadet.name: hintCadet
hintcadet.description:
Shows a text hint only when in [cadetMode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cadetMode).

The text can contain several lines. \n is used to indicate the end of a line.

getposvisual.name: getPosVisual
getposvisual.description: Returns an object's rendered [3D position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) (z value above sea when over sea, or above ground when over land) in render time scope. Alias of [visiblePosition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/visiblePosition).

vehiclereportownposition.name: vehicleReportOwnPosition
vehiclereportownposition.description: Gets whether the vehicle shares its own position via datalink with the [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) center.

savevar.name: saveVar
savevar.description: Save variable value into the campaign space. This variable is available to all following missions in the campaign.

settimemultiplier.name: setTimeMultiplier
settimemultiplier.description: Sets a time multiplier for in-game time. The command range is capped at 0.1 - 120 to avoid performance problems.

syntaxArray.Params: value: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - has to be in range from 0.1 to 120

set3denmodelsvisible.name: set3DENModelsVisible
set3denmodelsvisible.description: Enables or disables lines visibility in 3DEN

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[priority pylon 1, priority pylon 2,..., priority pylon n] : [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

setcuratorcoef.name: setCuratorCoef
setcuratorcoef.description: Sets coef for some action (coef have to be bigger than -1 000 000, anything lower is considered as disabled action).

syntaxArray.Params:
curatorObj: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Curator module.
action: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
coef: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

ctdata.name: ctData
ctdata.description: Returns metadata (string) associated with a particular row of RscControlsTable.

syntaxArray.Params:
ctrl: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - The respective control
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The row index

setplatenumber.name: setPlateNumber
setplatenumber.description: Change the license plates on any vehicle which has plates configured. Max 15 characters are allowed!

gethitindex.name: getHitIndex
gethitindex.description:
Return current level of damage for a specific Hit Point (specified by its hit part index). All hit points can be obtained with [getAllHitPointsDamage](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getAllHitPointsDamage) command.

* 0: no damage

* 1: full damage

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle : [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle to be queried
hitPartIndex: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - hit part index of the Hit Point
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (or, prior to Arma 3 v1.94, [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) when invalid input is given)

enableradio.name: enableRadio
enableradio.description: Enable and disable radio messages to be heard and shown in the left lower corner of the screen. This command can be helpful during cutscenes.

syntaxArray.Params: state: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true to enable the radio, false to disable it

distancesqr.name: distanceSqr
distancesqr.description: Computes the [squared distance](https://community.bistudio.comhttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euclidean_distance#Squared_Euclidean_distance) between two objects or positions.

syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated

lightattachobject.name: lightAttachObject
lightattachobject.description: Attach light to given object at given position on object.

driver.name: driver
driver.description: Returns the driver of a vehicle.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) -  
The unit sitting in the driver place is returned. If vehicle is not a vehicle but a person, the person is returned.

examples:
```sqf
(**driver** _tank) [action](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/action) ["getout", _tank];
```

```sqf
(**driver** ([vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player))) [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) //check if player is driver of current vehicle
```

face.name: face
face.description: Returns the face of a person.

deleteeditorobject.name: deleteEditorObject
deleteeditorobject.description:
Delete the editor object. Requires all editor object links to be removed prior. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

markertype.name: markerType
markertype.description: Gets type of marker. See [CfgMarkers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgMarkers) for a list of standard markers.

addmagazinecargoglobal.name: addMagazineCargoGlobal
addmagazinecargoglobal.description:
Add magazines to the cargo space of vehicles, which can be taken out by infantry units.

MP Synchronized

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicleName: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle to add the magazines to
[magazineName, count]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
magazineName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - magazine name. See [Category:Weapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Weapons) for reference about possible values.
count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - number of magazines to add

setspeaker.name: setSpeaker
setspeaker.description:
Sets the speaker of a person. In order to setSpeaker dynamically in MP, the command needs to run on every computer with exactly the same params otherwise the speaking unit could appear silent on other PCs. Run this on server: 

[bob, "Male02GRE"] [remoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExec) ["setSpeaker", 0, bob];

syntaxArray.Params:
person: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
speaker: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - The used voice type

issprintallowed.name: isSprintAllowed
issprintallowed.description: Returns true if player is allowed to sprint

kbtell.name: kbTell
kbtell.description: Make the person tell to the receiver the sentence. See [Conversations](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Conversations) for more details.

syntaxArray.Syntax: person kbTell [receiver, topicName, sentenceClass(, argumentArray1, argumentArray2, (…), forceRadio)]
syntaxArray.Params:
person: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[receiver, topicName, sentenceClass, argumentArray1, argumentArray2, (…), forceRadio]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
receiver: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
topicName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
sentenceClass: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
argumentArray1toN (Optional): [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [argumentName, argumentValue, argumentText, argumentSpeech]:

* argumentName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* argumentValue: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code)

* argumentText: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* argumentSpeech: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - each string is an already defined word in config.
forceRadio (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean), [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) (*last value of the array*)

* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) true/false to force use of radio

* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) 1-10 to force use of custom radio channel

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) name of radio channel to use, from: 'GLOBAL', 'SIDE', 'GROUP', 'VEHICLE', 'DIRECT', 'COMMAND'

playscriptedmission.name: playScriptedMission
playscriptedmission.description:
Load the given world, launch an empty mission, and execute the given expression.
Config (optional) can reference to the config entry, replacing [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext) for this mission.

insert.name: insert
insert.description:
Inserts multiple values into [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)/[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)/[HashMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/HashMap).
The [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) variant also supports [forceUnicode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forceUnicode).

syntaxArray.Params:
array : [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - index at which the values will be inserted, -1 for append.
[value1, value2, ...]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - Values to insert at the specified index
onlyIfUnique: [Bool](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Bool) - Only insert if the value is unique in the array, like [pushBackUnique](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/pushBackUnique)

string : [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - index at which the values will be inserted, -1 for append.
substring: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - String to insert

syntaxArray.Syntax: hashMap insert [[key1, value1], [key2, value2], ...] *Since Arma 3 v2.04*

syntaxArray.Params:
hashMap: [HashMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/HashMap)
splitArray: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - See *KeysAndValues*
KeysAndValues: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

* If *splitArray* is [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) then in format 
```sqf
[[key1, key2, ...], [value1, value2, ...]]
```


* If *splitArray* is [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) then 
```sqf
[[key1, value1], [key2, value2], ...]
```
 Same as alt. syntax 2

ctrlsetfonth3.name: ctrlSetFontH3
ctrlsetfonth3.description: Sets H3 font of given HTML control.

trim.name: trim

syntaxArray.Params: stringValue: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - string to be trimmed. spaces, tabs and line returns are removed from both ends of *stringValue*.

string: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - string to be trimmed
chars: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - list of characters to be trimmed
where: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Can be:

* 0 - trim at the beginning (left) and the end (right)

* 1 - trim at the beginning (left)

* 2 - trim at the end (right)

examples:
```sqf
trim "		hello, how are you?  "; *// returns "hello, how are you?"*
```

```sqf
"hewosentence!123" trim ["3e1o2hw", 0]; *// returns "sentence!"*
```

clearmagazinepool.name: clearMagazinePool
clearmagazinepool.description: Removes all magazines from the magazine pool, of which the player may choose in the following missions. Available in campaigns only.

radiochanneladd.name: radioChannelAdd
radiochanneladd.description: Add the units to the custom channel.

syntaxArray.Params:
customChannelID: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - [custom channel ID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Channel_IDs) returned by [radioChannelCreate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/radioChannelCreate) command
units: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - list of units

loadmagazine.name: loadMagazine
loadmagazine.description:
Initiates the loading action on given weapon of the turret of a transport. So the new magazine is not available instantly, yet according to the reloadTime.
The turret has to be manned. One can also change the magazine if its respective weapon is not selected.

taskparent.name: taskParent
taskparent.description: Returns the parent task of the specified task.

ctrltextsecondary.name: ctrlTextSecondary
ctrltextsecondary.description: Returns the secondary text of a text control.

setwaypointspeed.name: setWaypointSpeed
setwaypointspeed.description:
Switches the group speed mode when the waypoint becomes active.


Possible values are:

* "UNCHANGED"

* "LIMITED"

* "NORMAL"

* "FULL"

setaperturenew.name: setApertureNew
setaperturenew.description:
Sets custom camera aperture when HDR is enabled ([-1] to do it automatically). `minimum` should be <= `standard` and <= `maximum`.
> ⓘIf HDR is enabled (it is enabled by default), when [setAperture](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setAperture) value is used it also forces setApertureNew to the following values: [value, value, value, 1]. Execute setApertureNew after [setAperture](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setAperture) to override this default mechanic.

syntaxArray.Params:
minimum: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Minimum aperture
standard: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Standard aperture
maximum: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Maximum aperture
luminance: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Standard luminance

getfuelcargo.name: getFuelCargo
getfuelcargo.description:
Returns the fuel amount (1 is full) in the cargo space of a refueling vehicle.
> ⓘSince Arma 3 v1.96 the return value for vehicles that are not configured to have ability to refuel other vehicles is -1. (Prior to that the value was negative infinity)

syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - fuel cargo value, -1 if fuel cargo is not supported, 0 if the vehicle is ![alive](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/alive) or [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull)

setfaceanimation.name: setFaceAnimation
setfaceanimation.description:
Sets facial animation phase (eye blinking), blink is in the range from 0 to 1.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)This command is not functional in Arma 3

grpnull.name: grpNull
grpnull.description:
A non-existing [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group). To compare non-existent groups use [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) or [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo):

* grpNull == grpNull; // false

* [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) grpNull; // true

* grpNull [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) grpNull; // true

uinamespace.name: uiNamespace
uinamespace.description: Returns the global namespace attached to user interface.

setobjecttexture.name: setObjectTexture
setobjecttexture.description:
Applies given texture to object's selection. See [Retexturing with setObjectTexture](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Retexturing_with_setObjectTexture) for a short tutorial.
> ⓘ
> 
> * Not all objects can be textured this way. To find out, run [getObjectTextures](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getObjectTextures) command on an object. Empty array 
> ```sqf
> []
> ```
>  usually indicates it cannot be textured.
> 
> * All textures must have resolution 2^x / 2^y (16x16, 16x32, 64x256, 512x512, ...). The largest texture size commonly supported by graphics cards and RV engine is 4096x4096
> 
> * Supported formats: .pac, .paa, .jpg, .jpeg, .ogg, .ogv

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
selectionNumber: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of the selection. It is defined in the [hiddenselection](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgVehicles_Config_Reference#hiddenSelections)[]={} array in the vehicle's config (starting with 0).
texture: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Path to texture

magazinesdetailvest.name: magazinesDetailVest
magazinesdetailvest.description: Returns an array with the type names of all the unit's vest magazines.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit
includeEmpty: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to include empty magazines

cuttext.name: cutText
cuttext.description:
Displays a text message in the center of the screen. The text can be displayed on multiple lines by using "
" new line characters:cutText ["line1
line2
line3", "PLAIN"];. Since Arma 3 v1.74 this command supports [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) formatting.

> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)For greater efficiency and ease of modability it is recommended to use named layers available with alternative syntax since Arma 3 v1.58

syntaxArray.Params:
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - text to be displayed
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [Title Effect Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Title_Effect_Type) for more information about these values.
speed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default -1) time in seconds to fade in resource.
showInMap: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to hide the text when the map is opened. *since Arma 3*
isStructuredText: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to switch support for [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) formatting - see Example 4. *Since Arma 3 v1.73.142260*

layer: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) -  layer number on which the effect is shown, where 0 is the back most. Layer number is rounded to the nearest integer and also cannot be negative. Layer 99.5 will be treated as layer 100.
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - text to be displayed
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [Title Effect Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Title_Effect_Type) for more information about these values.
speed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default -1) time in seconds to fade in resource.
showInMap: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to hide the text when the map is opened.
isStructuredText: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to switch support for [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) formatting - see Example 4. *Since Arma 3 v1.73.142260*

syntaxArray.Syntax: layerName **cutText** [text, type, speed,  showInMap, isStructuredText] *Since Arma 3 v1.57.134673*
syntaxArray.Params:
layerName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - layer name on which the effect is shown. Layer names are CaSe SeNsItIvE
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - text to be displayed
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [Title Effect Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Title_Effect_Type) for more information about these values.
speed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default -1) Time in seconds to fade in resource.
showInMap: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to hide the text when the map is opened. *Since Arma 3*
isStructuredText: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to switch support for [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) formatting - see Example 4. *Since Arma 3 v1.73.142260*

onbriefingnotes.name: onBriefingNotes
onbriefingnotes.description: Select a sound declared in the [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#Sound) of the mission to be played the first time the [Notes tab](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Briefing.html#Notes) is selected in the [briefing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Briefing.html).

hcgroupparams.name: hcGroupParams
hcgroupparams.description:
Returns parameters describing group in [high command](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/High_Command) bar. Return value is array in format [groupName, teamName] or [] if error. Possible values for team name:

* "teammain" (default)

* "teamred"

* "teamgreen"

* "teamblue"

* "teamyellow"

createguardedpoint.name: createGuardedPoint
createguardedpoint.description:
Adds a point guarded by the given side (scripted way of adding equivalent of "GUARDED BY" trigger in [Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/3DEN)). A closest AI group in the given side with assigned "GUARD" waypoint will attempt to secure this guard point. The actual guarded position is determined via the following rules:

* Given "position" is always considered. It could be [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group), [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) or [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D). In every case, z coordinate will be ignored and point will be placed on nearest surface.

* If "objectMapID" is not negative, the position of the object with the given ID is used (Overrides "position"). -1 to ignore this argument. z of the object position will be intact.

* If the given "vehicle" is valid, the position of the vehicle is extracted and guarded (Overrides both "position" and "objectMapID"). [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) to ignore. z of the vehicle position will be intact.
For use with "GUARD" [waypoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setWaypointType). How does "GUARD" waypoint work: [Waypoint:Guard](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Waypoint:Guard)

syntaxArray.Params:
[side, position, idStatic, vehicle]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
side: [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) - The side which will be guarding
position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) - [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group), [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) or [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D)
objectMapID: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - static id of map object. -1 to ignore
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle to be used for position. [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) to ignore

mineactive.name: mineActive
mineactive.description: Checks if the given mine is active.

disableai.name: disableAI
disableai.description:
Disables parts of the AI behaviour to get a better control over the actions of a unit. If unit changes locality, it might need to be executed again at the new locality to maintain effect.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Since Arma 3 v1.96 it is possible to return the state of the given AI flag via [checkAIFeature](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/checkAIFeature) command or set it using alias command [enableAIFeature](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/enableAIFeature).
> ⚠This command might cause unexpected behaviour, when used on a [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) controlled unit.

syntaxArray.Params:
unitName: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - AI unit
section: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Possible values are:





Section
Description
Since


"TARGET"
Will prevent units from engaging the target. Units still move around for cover, but will not hunt down enemies. Works in groups as well. Excellent for keeping units inside bases or other areas without having them flank or engage anyone. They will still seek good cover if something is close by.
-


"AUTOTARGET"
Essentially makes single units without a group, "deaf". The unit still goes prone and combat ready if it hears gunfire. They will not turn around when gunfire comes from the behind, but if an enemy walks in front of it it will target the enemy and fire as normal. **Does not work for grouped units. The leader will assign targets to the units and effectively enables the AI back on.**
-


"MOVE"
This will stop units from turning and moving, including vehicles. Units will still change stance and fire at the enemy if the enemy happens to walk right in front of the barrel. Unit will watch enemies that are in their line of sight, but will not turn their bodies to face the enemy, only their head. Works for grouped units as well. Good for staging units and holding them completely still. Movement can't be controlled by a script either, you have to re-enable movement for that. Unit will still be able to aim within his cone of fire/ do not move.
-


"WEAPONAIM"
Disabled weapon aiming.
-


"TEAMSWITCH"
This will disable AI unit when teamswitching
-


"ANIM"
Disables all animations of the unit. Completely freezes the unit, including breathing. Won't even blink. No move command works until the unit is unfrozen.
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Operation_Flashpoint)[1.99](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Operation_Flashpoint_version_1.99)


"FSM"
Disables the attached FSM scripts which are responsible for the AI behaviour. Enemies react slower to enemy fire and the enemy stops using hand signals. Disabling FSM, can give the impression of untrained units as they react slower and are more disorganized than when FSM is enabled. Good for rebel fighters and when enabled better for professional armies
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_2:_Operation_Arrowhead)[1.60](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_2:_Operation_Arrowhead_version_1.60)


"AIMINGERROR"
Prevents AI's aiming from being distracted by its shooting, moving, turning, reloading, hit, injury, fatigue, suppression or concealed/lost target.
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.42](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.42)


"SUPPRESSION"
Prevents AI from being suppressed. See [Arma 3: Suppression](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Suppression).
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.42](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.42)


"CHECKVISIBLE"
Disables visibility raycasts. Useful in PvP missions where these raycasts are not needed.
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.54](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.54)


"COVER"
Disables usage of cover positions by the AI.
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.56](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.56)


"AUTOCOMBAT"
Disables autonomous switching to [COMBAT](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/2D_Editor:_Waypoints#Behaviour) when in [danger](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_2:_FSM_Danger_Causes)
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.56](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.56)


"PATH"
Stops the AI’s movement but not the target alignment.
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.62](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.62)


"MINEDETECTION"
Disable AI's mine detection.
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.76](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.76)


"NVG"
Stops AI from putting NVGs on but not taking them off.
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.92](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.92)


"LIGHTS"
Stops AI from operating vehicle headlights as well as collision lights.
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.92](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.92)


"RADIOPROTOCOL"
Stops AI from talking and texting while still being able to issue orders.
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.96](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.96)


"all"
Disables all the above sections.
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.66](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.66)

createcenter.name: createCenter
createcenter.description:
Instanciate a [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) center. A [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) center is required to be able to [create groups](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createGroup) of this side.
Centers can only be created for [east](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/east), [west](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/west), [resistance](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/resistance), [civilian](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/civilian) and [sideLogic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideLogic) [sides](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side).
Created sides must have their "side-friendship" defined with [setFriend](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setFriend).

> ⓘIn Armed Assault and Arma 2, only [Mission.sqm](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Mission.sqm)'s units side centers are created; e.g if no [resistance](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/resistance) unit has been placed in the editor you must use createCenter before being able to create a [resistance](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/resistance) group.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)In Arma 3, centers for all sides are all created by the engine.

additemtobackpack.name: addItemToBackpack
additemtobackpack.description: Create new item and store it to soldier's backpack. The item can also be a weapon or a magazine.

tvcount.name: tvCount
tvcount.description: Returns children count on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

fillweaponsfrompool.name: fillWeaponsFromPool
fillweaponsfrompool.description: Adds magazines from the campaign pool to the given unit, depending on his weapons. Available in campaigns only.

commandfollow.name: commandFollow
commandfollow.description: Order the given unit to follow the given other unit (via the radio).

playmove.name: playMove
playmove.description:
When used on a person, smooth transition to given move will be done.
The difference between playMove and [playMoveNow](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playMoveNow) is that playMove adds another move to the move queue, while [playMoveNow](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playMoveNow) replaces the whole move queue with new move (see [Example 2](https://community.bistudio.com#Examples)).
> ⓘsee [Category:Moves](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Moves) for respective games animations.

animatedoor.name: animateDoor

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[doorname, phase, instant]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
doorname: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
phase: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
instant: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (When [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) and phase is either 0 or 1, door will change phase instantaneously)

examples:
```sqf
Taru animateDoor ["Door_1_source", 1];
```
Open left front door on Ifrit instantly:
```sqf
Ifrit animateDoor ["Door_LF", 1, [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)];
```

moonphase.name: moonPhase
moonphase.description: Returns the phase of the in-game Moon on the given date in range 0...1, where 0 - new Moon, 1 - full Moon. According to this command the fullest Moon in Arma 3 at midnight is on [setDate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setDate) [4804,7,13,0,0]; Use [Moon Phase Utility](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Utilities#Moon_Phases) to find out date for a mission with desired moon.

setacctime.name: setAccTime
setacctime.description: Set simulation acceleration coefficient. May also be used to slow time in cutscenes.

syntaxArray.Params: accFactor: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Factor. Value is clamped to 1/128 - 4

commandgetout.name: commandGetOut
commandgetout.description:
Orders one or multiple units to get out from the vehicle (via the radio). Same as [doGetOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/doGetOut) with latter being silent. 

Notes:

* Works for both AI and player entities

* AI unit gets back in - unless is under player command or combined with other sqf commands ([orderGetIn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/orderGetIn) false, [allowGetIn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/allowGetIn) false or [leaveVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/leaveVehicle))

* Ignores vehicle's lock state - unlike [action "Eject"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Actions#Eject) and [moveOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveOut)

* AI waits for execution until vehicle has stopped/is no longer flying (unclear if any timeout exists for order to be discarded) - unlike [action "Eject"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Actions#Eject) and [moveOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveOut)

* Plays the vehicle's position's get out animation (same as [action "Eject"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Actions#Eject)) - unlike [moveOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveOut)

* When execute for multiple units, it waits till the action is completed, before the next to take his turn (same as [action "Eject"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Actions#Eject)) - unlike [moveOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveOut)

* AI gets back into formation afterwards

* Works only on alive units - unlike [action "Eject"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Actions#Eject) (one after another) or [moveOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveOut) (instantly)

* Does not work on [unconscious](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setUnconscious) - unless the AI is under player command. Unlike [moveOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveOut) or [action "Eject"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Actions#Eject) (but one after another))

halt.name: halt
halt.description: This command was meant to break the script into debugger, however currently **it does not do anything** except displaying and logging the following error: Error Debugger breakpoint hit.

lightison.name: lightIsOn
lightison.description:
Check if lampost is on (shining).
> ⓘA lamp state is **local** to each client (see [switchLight](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/switchLight)).
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)This command was originally designed to only work with CfgNonAIVehicles class "StreetLamp" only;
> since Arma 3 v1.92 this command was extended to work with street lights.

syntaxArray.Return:
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Can be one of:

* **"ON"** - light is on

* **"OFF"** - light is off

* **"AUTO"** - applicable only to the light of type "StreetLamp" and is only on during the night.

* **"ERROR"** - if command fails

actionkeysnames.name: actionKeysNames
actionkeysnames.description: Returns a list of button names assigned to the given user action. You can find the action names in config class ControllerSchemes or [user action names](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Key_Actions).

syntaxArray.Params:
userAction: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
maxKeys: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - maximum number of keys to return
inputDevicePriority: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - result sorted by inputDevicePriority with values: *Since Arma 3 v1.35.127928*

* "Mouse"

* "Keyboard"

* "Stick"

* "Gamepad"

* "Tracker"

* "Combo" (mouse and keyboard combinations)

* "Controler"[sic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Template:sic) (any controller other than mouse or keyboard)
Other values are considered as: 

* "Unsorted"

hint.name: hint
hint.description: Outputs a hint message to the right of the screen (left of the screen in Operation Flashpoint) with a sound (except in Armed Assault). Use [hintSilent](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hintSilent) for soundless hint. To split message in multiple lines either use [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) or \n (in lower case).

syntaxArray.Params: message: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) - the message to display.

diag_allmissioneventhandlers.name: diag_allMissionEventHandlers
diag_allmissioneventhandlers.description: Returns an array with all [mission event handlers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addMissionEventHandler).

pixelgrid.name: pixelGrid
pixelgrid.description: Returns grid size based on screen resolution, UI size and configs: uiScaleFactor, uiScaleMaxGrids.

settriggerarea.name: setTriggerArea
settriggerarea.description:
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:setTriggerArea.jpg)  [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:setTriggerArea.jpg)Trigger axis a, b and c (*half* of their x, y and z dimensions) Defines the area monitored by the given trigger. The area could be either rectangular or elliptical.
> ⓘJust like with a and b dimensions, c dimension will alter area in opposite directions from the trigger position along z axis. Therefore if the trigger position is on the surface, half of the trigger area will be above the surface and half below. To place the whole area above the surface, adjust trigger position (move it up c meters). If c is not specified or <= 0, the trigger's height is considered infinite like 2D triggers.

syntaxArray.Params:
trigger: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object of the type "EmptyDetector"
[a, b, angle, isRectangle, c]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
a: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - trigger area X size / 2, in meters
b: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - trigger area Y size / 2, in meters
angle: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - trigger area rotation in degrees
isRectangle: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if rectangle
c: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional) trigger area Z size / 2, in meters. -1 for infinite height *Since Arma 3 v1.59.135137*

setleader.name: setLeader
setleader.description: Set the leader of given team. Effect is local, unless both leader unit and team are local to PC on which command is executed, then effect is global.

drawicon3d.name: drawIcon3D
drawicon3d.description:
Draws an ingame icon at a given position. Command has to be executed each frame. Use [addMissionEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addMissionEventHandler) "Draw3D" which is executed each frame and if user can see the drawing. In order for the results of this command to be visible through a [ custom camera](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCreate), enable HUD with [cameraEffectEnableHUD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cameraEffectEnableHUD). [showHUD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/showHUD) [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) will hide icon drawing. In order for arrows to appear, the icon texture should exist. The arrows size is proportionate to icon size.
> ⓘThe values passed for the icon width and height are multipliers for "activeWidth" and "activeHeight" set in config. So for example, if one needs to create an icon half screen wide ([safeZoneW](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/safeZoneW) / 2) and half screen tall ([safeZoneH](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/safeZoneH) / 2), divide these by config values respectfully: 
> 
> ```sqf
> _iconWidth = ([safeZoneW](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/safeZoneW) / 2) / [getNumber](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getNumber) ([configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "CfgInGameUI" >> "Cursor" >> "activeWidth");
> ```
> 
> 
> 
> ```sqf
> _iconHeight = ([safeZoneH](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/safeZoneH) / 2) / [getNumber](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getNumber) ([configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "CfgInGameUI" >> "Cursor" >> "activeHeight");
> ```
> 
> ⓘThe visibility of the icon could be affected when some of the HUD properties are hidden. For more information see [showHUD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/showHUD) page.
> ⓘSince Arma 3 v2.03.147270 it is possible to further adjust horizontal and vertical position of the text with 'offsetX' and 'offsetY' params.
> Since Arma 3 v2.03.147275 icon and text color could be defined separately in [[r,g,b,a],[r,g,b,a]] format

syntaxArray.Syntax: **drawIcon3D** [texture, color, position, width, height, angle, text, shadow, textSize, font, textAlign, drawSideArrows, offsetX, offsetY]
syntaxArray.Params:
[texture, color, position, width, height, angle, text, shadow, textSize, font, textAlign, drawSideArrows, offsetX, offsetY]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
texture: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - icon image
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - icon color in [r,g,b,a] format or (Since Arma 3 v2.03.147275) icon and text color in [[r,g,b,a],[r,g,b,a]] format
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - icon world position in [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) format
width: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - icon width (see description note)
height: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - icon height (see description note)
angle: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - icon rotation angle
text (Optional, default: ""): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - text label to display next to icon.
shadow (Optional, default: 0): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

* 0 = none

* 1 = shadow (not used in this context, used in UI context)

* 2 = outline

* [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) - outline

* [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) - none.
textSize (Optional, default: size of system): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - the size of the text.
font (Optional, default: "RobotoCondensed"): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - font class name from CfgFontFamilies.
textAlign (Optional, default: "center"): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - "left", "center", "right".
drawSideArrows (Optional, default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to draw arrows and the text label at edge of screen when icon moves off screen.
offsetX (Optional, default: 0): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Since Arma 3 v2.03.147270) - x offset for the icon text.
offsetY (Optional, default: 0): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Since Arma 3 v2.03.147270) - y offset for the icon text.

ctrlmapcursor.name: ctrlMapCursor
ctrlmapcursor.description:
Changes the default cursor that appears when interacting with a map control to a custom one. Use an empty string to restore the default cursor. If the specified cursor does not exist, the default is used and no error is produced. ( NOT in case of Arma 3. Using an empty string will result in an error: "No entry 'bin\config.bin/CfgWrapperUI/Cursors.' ). The cursor is the name of a config entry from *CfgWrapperUI / Cursors*. This command has the following specifics:

* When used on Main Map ([findDisplay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findDisplay) 12 [displayCtrl](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/displayCtrl) 51) it is possible to override multiple default cursors. For example, while leaving default "Arrow" intact, it is possible to just override "Scroll" with lets say "Wait" (Example 3)

* When used on a custom map, for example user made Mini Map, there is only one single cursor "" for everything, therefore only this cursor can be overridden (see Example 4 on how to override it)
Some possible class names (for the whole list see [ctrlMapCursor/cursors](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlMapCursor/cursors)):

* Arrow

* Track

* Move

* Scroll

* Rotate

* Track3D

* Move3D

* Rotate3D

* Raise3D

* Wait

* HC_move

* HC_overFriendly

* HC_overEnemy

* HC_overMission

* HC_unsel
**NOTE1**: Cursor names are **case sensitive**.

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - Map control
defaultCursor: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Cursor class name
newCursor: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Cursor class name

setoxygenremaining.name: setOxygenRemaining
setoxygenremaining.description: Sets oxygen remaining. It has no effect when soldier is not diving. Oxygen remaining is a number between 0 and 1.

getallunittraits.name: getAllUnitTraits
getallunittraits.description: Returns unit traits, native or set by [setUnitTrait](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setUnitTrait).

useaiopermapobstructiontest.name: useAIOperMapObstructionTest
useaiopermapobstructiontest.description: Toggle secondary obstruction test on road paths. > ⓘThis command is most likely only available for **arma3diag_x64.exe**.

clearweaponpool.name: clearWeaponPool
clearweaponpool.description: Remove all weapons from the weapon pool, of which the player may choose in the following missions. Available in campaigns only.

str.name: str
str.description:
Converts any value into a string by placing " and " around the argument. When used on object, object debug name is returned.Since Arma 3 v1.64 this command will correctly escape all " inside a string:


```sqf
*// Before the fix:*
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) str "string "" string"; *// "string " string" <- invalid string*
[call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) [compile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/compile) str "string "" string"; *// ERROR*
```



```sqf
*// After the fix:*
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) str "string "" string"; *// "string "" string" <- valid string*
[call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) [compile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/compile) str "string "" string"; *// OK*

```

typename.name: typeName
typename.description:
Returns the [data type](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Data_Types) of an expression. 

The type is returned as on of the following all-uppercase strings:

* "[ARRAY](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)"

* "[BOOL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Bool)"

* "[CODE](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code)"

* "[CONFIG](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config)"

* "[CONTROL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)"

* "[DISPLAY](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display)"

* "[GROUP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)"

* "[LOCATION](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location)"

* "[OBJECT](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)"

* "[SCALAR](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scalar)"

* "[SCRIPT](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Script)"

* "[SIDE](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side)"

* "[STRING](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)"

* "[TEXT](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Text)"

* "[TEAM_MEMBER](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Member)"

* "[NAMESPACE](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace)"

* "[DIARY_RECORD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Diary_Record)"

* "[TASK](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task)"

* "[HASHMAP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/HashMap)"
They represent the available [data types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Data_Types) in Arma.
> ⓘFor comparing types, use [isEqualType](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualType) command instead in Arma 3
examples:
```sqf
_msg = "hello"; _result = typeName _msg;  //_result will be "STRING"
```

```sqf
_unit = [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player); _result = typeName _unit; //_result becomes "OBJECT"
```
Values representing direct [ Data Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Data_Types):
```sqf
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName 0; //SCALAR
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName ""; //STRING
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true); //BOOL
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName []; //ARRAY
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName {}; //CODE
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull); //OBJECT
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName [grpNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/grpNull); //GROUP
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName [controlNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/controlNull); //CONTROL
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName [teamMemberNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/teamMemberNull); //TEAM_MEMBER
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName [displayNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/displayNull); //DISPLAY
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName [taskNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/taskNull); //TASK
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName [locationNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/locationNull); //LOCATION
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName [sideUnknown](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideUnknown); //SIDE
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName [text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/text) ""; //TEXT
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName [configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile); //CONFIG
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName [configNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configNull); //CONFIG (Since Arma 3 v1.54)
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace); //NAMESPACE
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName [diaryRecordNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diaryRecordNull); //DIARY_RECORD (Since Arma 3 v2.00)
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) typeName [createHashMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createHashMap); //HASHMAP (Since Arma 3 v2.02)
```

```sqf
[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) (typeName _this [!=](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/!%3D) "ARRAY") [exitWith](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/exitWith) {
	[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "_this is not an array!"
}
//is the same as 
[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) (typeName _this [!=](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/!%3D) typeName []) [exitWith](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/exitWith) {
	[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "_this is not an array!"
}
//same result but faster in Arma 3
[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) !(_this [isEqualType](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualType) []) [exitWith](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/exitWith) {
	[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "_this is not an array!"

```

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format:
0: condition: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
1: code on activation: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
2: code on deactivation: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

setpitch.name: setPitch
setpitch.description: Sets the pitch of a persons voice.

removealleventhandlers.name: removeAllEventHandlers
removealleventhandlers.description: Removes all event handlers of given type that were added by [addEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addEventHandler) **and** resets event handler's creation index to 0.

assignedteam.name: assignedTeam
assignedteam.description:
Returns the team the unit belongs to. Possible values:


* "MAIN" (default and white)

* "RED"

* "GREEN"

* "BLUE"

* "YELLOW"

* "" if given unit is [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) or [remoteControling](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteControl) another unit(Since Arma 3 v1.94)

syntaxArray.Return: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) (or, prior to Arma 3 v1.94, [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) if given unit is [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) or [remoteControling](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteControl) another unit)

registeredtasks.name: registeredTasks
registeredtasks.description: Returns array with all registered task types for the given agent. The values are the names set in CfgTasks classes name property. The same names are used for [unregisterTask](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/unregisterTask)

uavcontrol.name: UAVControl
uavcontrol.description:
Returns array with current operator of UAV and his vehicle role in UAV. If nobody is controlling the UAV, the command tries to find any person with connected terminal to this UAV, in which case the vehicle role is an empty string. If command cannot find anyone, output is [[objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull), ""].

Since Arma 3 v1.96 this command returns both driver and gunner units if the UAV is controlled by 2 players. Here is the list of all expected outputs:

* [player1, "DRIVER"] - player1 is controlling the UAV and is the pilot

* [player2, "GUNNER"] - player2 is controlling the UAV and is the gunner

* [player1, "DRIVER", player2, "GUNNER"] - player1 is controlling the UAV and is the pilot, player2 is controlling UAV and is the gunner

* [player3, ""] - no one is controlling the UAV, player3 is connected to the UAV via terminal, but not controlling it yet

* [[objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull), ""] - nobody is controlling or connected to the UAV

> ⓘThis command works only for vehicles, to get a unit remote controlling a unit, see Example 3 on the [remoteControl](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteControl) page.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - in format [unit, vehicleRole] (or sometimes [unit1, vehicleRole, unit2, vehicleRole], see description), where:

* unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - UAV operator

* vehicleRole: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - vehicle role of the operator in UAV. Could be "DRIVER", "GUNNER" or "" (see description)

playgesture.name: playGesture
playgesture.description: When used on a person,a smooth transition to the given move will be initiated. **Command doesn't seem to be functional**

inheritsfrom.name: inheritsFrom
inheritsfrom.description: Returns base entry of config entry.
examples:
```sqf
_base = inheritsFrom ([configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) [>>](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/gtgt) "CfgVehicles" [>>](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/gtgt) "Car");
```
 Result is [Config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config) entry for class "LandVehicle"

lockturret.name: lockTurret
lockturret.description: Lock the gunner position of the vehicle turret. This command must be executed where vehicle is [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local). This command will remove user get in action (not get out) but will also stop player getting into vehicle via script commands unlike [lock](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lock) command

triggerinterval.name: triggerInterval
triggerinterval.description:
Returns trigger condition check frequency in seconds.  

> ⚠The trigger could be [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) or remote but the result returned by this command will be for the trigger interval set up locally on the client that executed the command. See [createTrigger](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createTrigger) for more info.

hasinterface.name: hasInterface
hasinterface.description: Returns true if the computer has an interface (a real player). False for a dedicated server or for a headless client.

vestmagazines.name: vestMagazines
vestmagazines.description: Get array with all magazines from vest of the given unit.
examples:
```sqf
vestMagazines [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player);
```



```sqf
[
	"6.5mm 30Rnd STANAG Mag(30/30)[id/cr:4/0](2x)",
	"9mm 16Rnd Mag(16/16)[id/cr:7/0](2x)",
	"RGO Frag Grenade(1/1)[id/cr:10/0](2x)",
	"Smoke Grenade (White)(1/1)[id/cr:12/0](1x)",
	"Smoke Grenade (Green)(1/1)[id/cr:13/0](1x)",
	"Chemlight (Green)(1/1)[id/cr:14/0](2x)"
]
```

getdiverstate.name: getDiverState
getdiverstate.description:
Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) when object is in diver state i.e. when unit would put diving [goggles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/goggles) on. 
> ⓘDiving [goggles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/goggles) remove blurriness underwater, however when assigned, they do not appear on the face of the unit until the unit steps into the water. This command allows to detect the moment when the goggles are visible. If the unit doesn't have diving goggles assigned, this command would still return [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) at appropriate time if the unit steps into the water.

captivenum.name: captiveNum
captivenum.description:
Checks whether the unit is a [captive](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/captive). If the unit is a vehicle, its commander is checked instead.
If a unit's captivity level was set as a [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean), then the returned number is either 0 (for [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) or 1 (for [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)).

syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - anything from 0 to value set by [setCaptive](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setCaptive) alt syntax. A non zero value means [captive](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/captive).

configsourcemod.name: configSourceMod
configsourcemod.description: Returns modDir of the mod that given config class was loaded from.

allowfleeing.name: allowFleeing
allowfleeing.description:
Sets the cowardice level (the lack of courage or bravery) of a group or unit. 

Notes:

* Fleeing only affects AI led groups.

* Only the group as a whole can flee (or not).

* The courage of the AI group is based on the group's leader [courage subskill](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_AI_Skill#Sub-Skills).

* Each group has a max strength (summed "armor" of all infantry units - plus armor when inside vehicles).

* If the group losses by injury/damage or death/destruction are higher than the max strength, multiplied by leader's courage or allowFleeing level , then the group will start fleeing.

* As result primarily the AI flees to a nearby "supply point" (some friendly units - preferably with medic or engineer, or a vehicle with repair/ammo/fuel cargo). Alternatively it will try to find a safe position within a 600m radius from the initial waypoint (danger, distance, amount of cover positions are taken into account).

* After the fleeing has been finished the group's initial strength is reset.

* Fleeing units in [combatMode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/combatMode) red, will be set to yellow when fleeing to avoid engaging enemies while doing so.

* While fleeing, the group leader will be set to green, to avoid giving engage or fire orders, unless in [combatMode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/combatMode) blue already. Also [speedMode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/speedMode) is set to full.

* When reaching their flee point/destination, they will change to [combatMode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/combatMode) yellow and [speedMode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/speedMode) normal.

* With allowFleeing one can make unit's flee earlier (or essentially never flee). Apply it, overrides the courage subskill influence.

syntaxArray.Params:
unitOrGroup: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)
cowardice: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 1 is maximum cowardice and 0 minimum. A value of 0 will disable fleeing all together

leader.name: leader
leader.description: Returns the group leader for the given **unit** or **group**. For dead units, [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) is returned.

set3dengrid.name: set3DENGrid
set3dengrid.description: Sets the grid increment for the given transformation type.

syntaxArray.Params:
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Name of transformation. Can be:

* "r" - Rotation

* "t" - Translation

* "s" - Scale
value: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Transformation increment

ctrladdeventhandler.name: ctrlAddEventHandler
ctrladdeventhandler.description:
Add an event handler to the given control.

> ⚠
> 
> * Control event handlers are processed in reversed order, i.e. last added: first, first added: last. So if you have an override it should be set up in the 1st added EH.
> 
> * When using the event names listed [here](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers) with the ctrlAddEventHandler, [ctrlSetEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlSetEventHandler), [displayAddEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/displayAddEventHandler) or [displaySetEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/displaySetEventHandler) commands, the prefix "on" in the event name must be removed (e.g. '**ButtonDown'** instead of '**onButtonDown'**).

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
handler: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Handler name, see [User Interface Event Handlers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers)
function: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String), since [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.06](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.06) also [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - Script

sethorizonparallaxcoef.name: setHorizonParallaxCoef
sethorizonparallaxcoef.description: Sets coef used to shift horizon position based on camera height (use 0 to disable shifting).

showhud.name: showHUD
showhud.description:
Enable / disable showing of HUD. Defines visibility of weapon crosshair and any informational tags that appear when pointing the weapon at an object as well as availability of the default action menu. Unfortunately, it also hides icons drawn with [drawIcon3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/drawIcon3D).
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)**Since Arma 3 v1.50** there is a Description.ext's [showHUD[]](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#showHUD) array param that is identical in format to the extended showHUD command. When present, it will disable showHUD command entirely, allowing mission makers to permanently alter visibility of some HUD elements.
> **Since Arma 3 v2.04** it is possible to force drawing of [drawIcon3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/drawIcon3D) icons when HUD is hidden. The icons will also show when custom camera is [ created](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCreate) and the view is switched to it via [switchCamera](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/switchCamera) or [cameraEffect](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cameraEffect) provided [cameraEffectEnableHUD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cameraEffectEnableHUD) is enabled. For more information see [drawIcon3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/drawIcon3D).

syntaxArray.Syntax: showHUD [scriptedHUD, info radar, compass, direction, menu, group, cursors, panels, kills, showIcon3D]
syntaxArray.Params:
scriptedHUD: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Show scripted HUD such as weapon crosshair, action menu and overlays created with [cutRsc](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cutRsc) and [titleRsc](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/titleRsc). Same as showHUD's first syntax
info: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) - Show vehicle, soldier and weapon info
radar: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) - Show vehicle radar
compass: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) - Show vehicle compass
direction: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) - Show tank direction indicator. Not present in vanilla Arma 3
menu: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) - Show commanding menu (HC related menus)
group: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) - Show group info bar (Squad leader info bar)
cursors: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) - Show HUD weapon cursors (connected with scripted HUD)
panels: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) - Show [Arma 3: Custom Info](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Custom_Info) *since Arma 3 v1.70*
kills: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) - Show "x killed by y" [systemChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/systemChat) messages
showIcon3D: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) - Show icons drawn with [drawIcon3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/drawIcon3D) even when the HUD is hidden *since Arma 3 v2.04*

examples:
```sqf
showHUD [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false);
```
Hide vehicle radar and compass:
```sqf
showHUD [
  true, *// scriptedHUD*
  true, *// info*
  true, *// radar*
  true, *// compass*
  true, *// direction*
  true, *// menu*
  true, *// group*
  true, *// cursors*
  true, *// panels*
  true, *// kills*
  true  *// showIcon3D*
];
```
Check if HUD visibility is hardcoded in mission config and showHUD command is overriden:
```sqf
_disabledShowHUD = [isArray](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isArray) ([missionConfigFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionConfigFile) >> "showHUD");
```

lbsetpicturerightcolor.name: lbSetPictureRightColor
lbsetpicturerightcolor.description: Sets the color of the second (right aligned) picture of the given index of the listbox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to the given color. Color is in format [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color). Color which consists from only zeros means disable this override.

syntaxArray.Params:
[idc, index, name]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) of control
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

animatepylon.name: animatePylon
animatepylon.description: Force animation of pylon to given state, -1 for reset to engine handling, can cause weapon inoperative, because weapon is released  when pylon state =1. Supports pylon name since Arma 3 v1.94

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[pylon, animphase, instant] : [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
pylon: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - pylon index (index starts from 1) or pylon name (see [getCompatiblePylonMagazines](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getCompatiblePylonMagazines) Example 4)
animphase: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - animation phase (0...1)
instant (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - animate immediately

acctime.name: accTime
acctime.description: Returns the current simulation acceleration factor.

getclientstate.name: getClientState
getclientstate.description:
Returns client state in network game. Works on both, client and dedicated server. The following states are possible:



[getClientStateNumber](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getClientStateNumber)

getClientState

Description


0
"NONE"
No client (or singleplayer)


1
"CREATED"
Client is created


2
"CONNECTED"
Client is connected to server, message formats are registered


3
"LOGGED IN"
Identity is created


4
"MISSION SELECTED"
Mission is selected


5
"MISSION ASKED"
Server was asked to send / not send mission


6
"ROLE ASSIGNED"
Role was assigned (and confirmed)


7
"MISSION RECEIVED"
Mission received


8
"GAME LOADED"
Island loaded, vehicles received


9
"BRIEFING SHOWN"
Briefing was displayed


10
"BRIEFING READ"
Ready to play mission


11
"GAME FINISHED"
Game was finished


12
"DEBRIEFING READ"
Debriefing read, ready to continue with next mission

find.name: find
find.description:
Searches for an array element within array or a ANSI string within a ANSI string.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)If Unicode support is desired, see [forceUnicode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forceUnicode).
> ⚠Search is cASe-seNsItiVE!

syntaxArray.Params:
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array to search in
element: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - Array element to find
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Zero based position of the first array element that matches x, -1 if not found

syntaxArray.Params:
string: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - String to search in
substring: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Substring to find
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Zero based position of the first sequence of characters that matches substring, -1 if not found

syntaxArray.Params:
string: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - String to search in
substring: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Substring to find
indexStart: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Zero based index which defines where find starts from
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Zero based position of the first sequence of characters that matches substring, -1 if not found

examples:
```sqf
["Apples", "Oranges", "Pears"] find "Oranges"; *// returns 1*
```

```sqf
[1, [2], [[3]]] find [[3]]; *// returns 2 - does not work in OFP*
```

```sqf
[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) ([magazines](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/magazines) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) find "Strela" != -1) [then](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/then) { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "You've got Strela!"; };
```

```sqf
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) ("japa is the man!" find "the man!"); *// returns 8*
```

```sqf
"abc" find ""; *// returns 0*
```

```sqf
"abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyz" find ["z", 20];
```

removemagazines.name: removeMagazines
removemagazines.description: Removes all magazines of given type from the unit. If magazine class does not exist, nothing happens, not even .rpt message, unlike with [addMagazine](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addMagazine) command.
