gearslotammocount.description: Returns ammo count of assigned magazine.

tvsetpicturecolorselected.name: tvSetPictureColorSelected
tvsetpicturecolorselected.description: Sets the color of the left picture of a tree item defined by path when item is selected

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
[path, color]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - path to tree view item
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - color in format [r,g,b,a]

curatoraddons.name: curatorAddons
curatoraddons.description: Returns list of addons allowed to given curator. The addon names are not guaranteed to be all lower case

clearmagazinecargo.name: clearMagazineCargo
clearmagazinecargo.description: Remove all magazines from the given vehicle's magazine cargo space.

daytime.name: dayTime
daytime.description: Returns the current in-game time in hours. For a formatted version of time, see [BIS_fnc_timeToString](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_timeToString).

syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Day time using a 24 hour clock, using fractions of hours.

examples:
```sqf
[daytime](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/daytime); *// returns 16.5 given it is 16:30 (4.30pm) in game*
```
Get hour, minute, seconds:

```sqf
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _daytime = [daytime](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/daytime); *// assuming [daytime](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/daytime) returns 1.66046*
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _hours = [floor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/floor) _daytime;											*// 1*
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _minutes = [floor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/floor) ((_daytime - _hours) * 60);						*// 39*
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _seconds = [floor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/floor) ((((_daytime - _hours) * 60) - _minutes) * 60);	*// 37*
```

gettextwidth.name: getTextWidth
gettextwidth.description:
Returns estimated width of the text based on font type and size. Similar to [ctrlTextWidth](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlTextWidth) but doesn't require a control and can be used to estimate text width for any control including buttons. Result does not include left and right margins (hardcoded at 0.008 each).
Always uses unicode (see [forceUnicode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forceUnicode)).

syntaxArray.Params:
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - text string to measure
[font, size]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
font: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - font type
size: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - font size

nil.name: nil
nil.description: Nil value. This value can be used to undefine existing [variables](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Variables).

targetknowledge.name: targetKnowledge
targetknowledge.description:
Returns unit's knowledge about target. The returned array includes information whether the target is 

* known by group

* known by the unit

* last time the target was seen by the unit

* last time the target endangered the unit

* target side

* position error

* target position

rating.name: rating
rating.description:
Check unit rating. Rating is increased for killing enemies, decreased for killing friendlies (see [Rating Values](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ArmA:_Rating_Values)). Can be changed via [addRating](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addRating) by the mission designer. 

The rating of the player is displayed as the "score" at the end of the mission. Via [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext) one can define how many points it takes to get a perfect score, as well as the number of stars.

flyinheightasl.name: flyInHeightASL
flyinheightasl.description:
Sets the minimal ASL height. Final height is 
```sqf
*flyInHeight* [max](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/max) *flyInHeightASL*
```
 - the higher altitude has priority.

syntaxArray.Params:
aircraft: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - helicopter, airplane
standardAltitude: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - base altitude used when [behaviour](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/behaviour) is neither "COMBAT" or "STEALTH"
combatAltitude: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) -  altitude used when [behaviour](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/behaviour) is "COMBAT"
stealthAltitude: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - altitude used when [behaviour](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/behaviour) is "STEALTH"

forceadduniform.name: forceAddUniform
forceadduniform.description: Create a new uniform and hard link it into slot (without any restrictions).

ppeffectenable.name: ppEffectEnable
ppeffectenable.description:
Enable / disable [Post process effects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Post_process_effects)
> ⚠If effect fails to get enabled (can check it with [ppEffectEnabled](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ppEffectEnabled)) try adding a little [sleep](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sleep) in front of it.

syntaxArray.Params:
effect: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the effect
enable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

effect: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - handle of the effect
enable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

effectArray: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - array of effect handles
enable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

debugfsm.name: debugFSM
debugfsm.description:
Dump (something about FSM) to debugging output. This command is (assumed to be) non-functional in the retail version.
> ⚠Non functional in retail

saveidentity.name: saveIdentity
saveidentity.description: Saves units's identity to [Objects.sav](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Objects.sav) file in campaign directory as entry name.

switchaction.name: switchAction
switchaction.description: When used on a person, the given action is started immediately (there is no transition). Use switchmove "" to switch back to the default movement if there is no transition back, otherwise the person may be stuck.

getposatl.name: getPosATL
getposatl.description: Returns the position of an object relative to the terrain.

ctrlsetfonth1.name: ctrlSetFontH1
ctrlsetfonth1.description: Sets H1 font of given HTML control.

removemagazinesturret.name: removeMagazinesTurret
removemagazinesturret.description: Removes all magazines of the given type from given vehicle. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

setobjectscale.name: setObjectScale

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Must be either an [attached object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/attachTo) or [Simple Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Simple_Objects)
scale: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Limited to 0.0001 to 65504, relative to the object model's normal scale

curatoreditableobjects.name: curatorEditableObjects
curatoreditableobjects.description: Returns all editable objects which belong to a curator.

shownmap.name: shownMap
shownmap.description: Checks if client has Map enabled in [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext) (*showMap* param) or force enabled with [showMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/showMap) command.

flag.name: flag
flag.description: Returns the original flag pole of the flag the unit is carrying.

syntaxArray.Return: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Flag pole object the flag belongs to. If the unit carries no flag, [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) is returned.

removebackpackglobal.name: removeBackpackGlobal
removebackpackglobal.description: Removes backpack from a unit. (even non-local)

ctrlhtmlloaded.name: ctrlHTMLLoaded
ctrlhtmlloaded.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) when HTML content was successfully loaded.

nearobjectsready.description: Check whether all data are loaded to nearObjects will return in reasonable time.

syntaxArray.Params:
position: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) or [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D)
radius: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) -

isstaminaenabled.name: isStaminaEnabled
isstaminaenabled.description: Check if stamina depletion is enabled.

exitwith.name: exitWith
exitwith.description: Exits current scope {...} it is executed from if condition evaluates [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), creates new scope {...code...} and executes the given code in it. Often used for exiting [do](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/do), [for](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/for), [count](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/count) or [forEach](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forEach). Simply exiting [waitUntil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/waitUntil) or [onEachFrame](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onEachFrame) scopes with exitWith will have no effect as these scopes are called repeatedly by the engine and require different handling to terminate (see Example 3).
examples:
```sqf
[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) (_x>5) exitWith {[echo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/echo) "_x is too big"; _x}
```


When _x is greater than 5, outputs message and terminates code in current level with value of _x.

deleteidentity.name: deleteIdentity
deleteidentity.description: Deletes an identity created with [saveIdentity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/saveIdentity) from the campaign's progress file.

syntaxArray.Params: identityName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Name of the saved identity

deletevehicle.name: deleteVehicle
deletevehicle.description:
Deletes an object. Only objects inserted in the mission editor and objects created during the game's progress can be deleted by this command. Island objects and player cannot be removed.
> ⓘThe actual object deletion, when object becomes [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull), happens on the next frame after command execution, but there are some object modifications that happen immediately. For example if the object is unit in a group, it immediately becomes groupless [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) _unit; //true
> ⚠Do not use this command for deletion of dead [crew](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/crew) members from a vehicle. Doing so may lead to all sorts of bugs and ghost objects left on the map. Instead use [deleteVehicleCrew](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/deleteVehicleCrew), which was designed with this functionality in mind

setcustomsoundcontroller.name: setCustomSoundController
setcustomsoundcontroller.description:
Sets value of the specified custom sound controller to be used in [simple expressions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/simple_expression) in config. Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if value was set to the controller, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if command fails, for example if vehicle is not a transport or controller name is not recognised.
> ⚠Custom sound controller name is case sensitive and of the following format:
> 
> ```sqf
> [format](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/format) ["CustomSoundController%1", _number]
> ```
> 
> 
> Where _number is a number from 1 to [getCustomSoundControllerCount](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getCustomSoundControllerCount) (currently 32)

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - A transport type vehicle. Does not work on characters or buildings
controller: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Name of the custom sound controller. Need to be full string like i.e. "CustomSoundController1". Currently you can pick from "CustomSoundController1" to "CustomSoundController32"
value: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Desired value

examples:
Change value of CustomSoundController1 to 12
```sqf
setCustomSoundController [[vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), "CustomSoundController1", 12];
```

getobjectargument.name: getObjectArgument
getobjectargument.description:
Return name of object argument in mission editor.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

forcewalk.description: Forces unit to walk even if run or sprint is selected.

ctrlsetmouseposition.name: ctrlSetMousePosition
ctrlsetmouseposition.description: Similar to [setMousePosition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setMousePosition) but relative to the given control.

syntaxArray.Params:

x: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Position in x

detectedmines.name: detectedMines
detectedmines.description: Returns an array of all mines detected by a given side

setmarkerbrush.name: setMarkerBrush
setmarkerbrush.description:
Selects the fill texture for the marker ("RECTANGLE" or "ELLIPSE"). Brush is the name of the subclass in CfgMarkerBrushes.


*brush* can be:

* "Solid"

* "SolidFull" (A3 only)

* "Horizontal"

* "Vertical"

* "Grid"

* "FDiagonal"

* "BDiagonal"

* "DiagGrid"

* "Cross"

* "Border"

* "SolidBorder"
> ⓘ**Multiplayer optimisation:** Global marker commands always broadcast the *entire* marker state over the network. As such, the number of network messages exchanged when creating or editing a marker can be reduced by performing all but the last operation using local marker commands, then using a global marker command for the last change (and subsequent global broadcast of all changes applied to the marker).

calculatepath.name: calculatePath
calculatepath.description:
Spawns an agent that will execute an AI path calculation and fire the "PathCalculated" [ event handler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers#PathCalculated). The vehicle type to simulate could be one of the following presets:

* "man" (will use "C_man_1")

* "car" (will use "C_Offroad_01_F")

* "tank" (will use "B_MBT_01_cannon_F")

* "wheeled_APC" (will use "B_APC_Tracked_01_rcws_F")

* "boat" (will use "C_Rubberboat")

* "plane" (will use "B_Plane_CAS_01_dynamicLoadout_F")

* "helicopter" (will use "B_Heli_Light_01_F")
If the given vehicle type is not one of the above presets, the exact given type is used.
> ⚠In order to guarantee that the event handler is added to the result of this command before the path is calculated, use [isNil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNil) to run the code in an [Unscheduled Environment](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler#Unscheduled_Environment):
> 
> ```sqf
> [isNil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNil) { calculatePath ["man", "safe", _startPos, _endPos] [addEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addEventHandler) ["PathCalculated", { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [_this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this) }] };
> ```
>

syntaxArray.Params:
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Vehicle type to simulate (see description)
behaviour: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - AI [behaviour](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/behaviour), one of "CARELESS", "SAFE", "AWARE", "COMBAT" or "STEALTH"
from: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Start position in format [x,y,z]
to: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - End position in format [x,y,z]
syntaxArray.Return: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - The agent to [add](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addEventHandler) the ["PathCalculated" Event Handler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers#PathCalculated) to.

removeweaponcargo.name: removeWeaponCargo
removeweaponcargo.description:
Remove weapon from the vehicle cargo space.
> ⚠This is unofficial documentation. All Information here is as it exists in the Engine. It might not reflect the reality.

menushortcut.name: menuShortcut
menushortcut.description: Returns shortcut related to menu entry on given path. Returns the shortcut in form of a bitflag. To get the shortcut text use [menuShortcutText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/menuShortcutText) command.

ctrlsetfontheightsecondary.name: ctrlSetFontHeightSecondary
ctrlsetfontheightsecondary.description: Sets the font size of the secondary text of given control.

addsecondaryweaponitem.name: addSecondaryWeaponItem
addsecondaryweaponitem.description: Adds weapon item, including magazine, directly to the [secondaryWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/secondaryWeapon). This is used for infantry weapons.

setvectordirandup.name: setVectorDirAndUp
setvectordirandup.description:
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:Vectordirandup.jpg) Sets orientation of an object.
The command takes 2 vector arrays, one for [vectorDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorDir) and one for [vectorUp](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorUp).
Default object orientation will always have [vectorDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorDir) pointing forward (North) along Y axis and [vectorUp](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorUp) pointing up along Z axis - [[0,1,0],[0,0,1]], as shown on the diagram below (see also [BIS_fnc_transformVectorDirAndUp](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_transformVectorDirAndUp)).
When attaching object to an object the axes are relative to the object that gets the attachment.
If it is player object for example, then X goes from left to right, Y goes from back to front, and Z goes from down up.
The [setDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setDir) command is incompatible with setVectorDirAndUp and should not be used together on the same object.

Using setVectorDirAndUp alone should be sufficient for any orientation.

syntaxArray.Syntax: vehicle setVectorDirAndUp [[x1, y1, z1], [x2, y2, z2]]
syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[[x1, y1, z1], [x2, y2, z2]]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
[x1, y1, z1]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [vectorDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorDir)
[x2, y2, z2]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [vectorUp](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorUp)

isfilepatchingenabled.name: isFilePatchingEnabled
isfilepatchingenabled.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if file patching is enabled otherwise [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)

diag_log.name: diag_log
diag_log.description: Dumps the argument's value to the [report file](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/arma.RPT). Each call creates a new line in the file.

weapons.name: weapons
weapons.description: Returns array of names of all unit's weapons.

setdetailmapblendpars.name: setDetailMapBlendPars
setdetailmapblendpars.description: Sets the detail texture map blend pars. Allows for smooth transition between detailed and undetailed terrain texture at distance. If noDetail > fullDetail, the texture detail will incur smooth transition in the area between the thresholds. If noDetail <= fullDetail there will be obvious visible edge between texture detail changes at fullDetail distance.

syntaxArray.Params:
[fullDetail, noDetail]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
fullDetail: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - threshold distance in metres up to which the terrain will have full texture detail
noDetail: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - threshold distance in metres after which the texture detail will be switched off

objectparent.name: objectParent
objectparent.description:
Returns parent of an object if the object is proxy, otherwise [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull). In case of backpack, the parent is a weaponholder or a cargo space of a vehicle or the unit carrying it. Unit in a vehicle will return the vehicle as parent.
Another good use of objectParent is when a static weapon is known and one needs to check if it is assembled or not. objectParent _staticWeapon will return [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) if weapon is unpacked, or backpack object if packed.
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:objectParent.jpg)

> ⓘWhen used on a soldier, if the soldier is in a vehicle, this command will return soldier's vehicle. Apart from being faster than [vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) command, it is also more reliable, as when used on dead [crew](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/crew) inside a vehicle, it returns the vehicle object, where as [vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) command may surprisingly return unit object instead. For example, to delete a unit which is in a vehicle, execute:
> 
> ```sqf
> objectParent _unit [deleteVehicleCrew](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/deleteVehicleCrew) _unit;
> ```
>

selectededitorobjects.name: selectedEditorObjects
selectededitorobjects.description:
Returns a list of currently selected editor objects. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

hideobjectglobal.name: hideObjectGlobal
hideobjectglobal.description: This command is designed for MP. Hides object on all connected clients as well as JIP. Call on the server only. Can be used on static objects. In SP this command behaves just like [hideObject](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hideObject).

removegroupicon.name: removeGroupIcon
removegroupicon.description: Remove icon with given ID from group.

animatebay.name: animateBay
animatebay.description:
Force animation of bay to given state, -1 for reset to engine handling, can cause weapon inoperative, because weapon is released when bay state =1.
> ⓘWhile there is no getter to read the animation phase of the given bay, [animationPhase](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animationPhase) command can be used with the individual bay door name from [animationNames](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animationNames) as a workaround. For example for UCAV Sentinel ucav animateBay [1, 1] could be checked with ucav [animationPhase](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animationPhase) "weapons_bay_l_1" or ucav [animationPhase](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animationPhase) "weapons_bay_l_2"

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[bay, animphase, instant] : [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
bay: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - bay index (index starts from 1 and different from pylon index)
animphase: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - animation phase (0...1)
instant (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - animate immediately

clearitemcargoglobal.name: clearItemCargoGlobal
clearitemcargoglobal.description: Removes all items from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

setdammage.name: setDammage
setdammage.description: Damages/hurts or repairs/heals object/unit. Damage 0 means fully functional, damage 1 means completely destroyed / dead. > ⚠Do **not** use this command. Use [setDamage](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setDamage) instead!

preprocessfilelinenumbers.name: preprocessFileLineNumbers
preprocessfilelinenumbers.description:
Returns the preprocessed content of the given file. The preprocessor is C-like, it supports comments using /* */ and [PreProcessor Commands](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PreProcessor_Commands). The preprocessor also adds a default debug entrypoint for compiler at the begining of script: #line 1 "aFilename"

The **#line** keyword can be used in any script that are not preprocess, or with preprocess script with extra macro to protect reserverd sharp character. The format is:
**#line** <number> "<name>"
followed by new line. <number> could be only positive integer and <name> could be any name. This will be used only if an error occurs in the script. The error will contain the line:
File <filename>, line <linenumber>
where <filename> will be the <name> you set and <linenumber> will be <number> + how many lines it is from the **#line** line. If the error happened on the line right under **#line** it will add 0 to <number>, if on second line, it will add 1 etc.
It is possible to use more than one **#line** keywords, but it seems having just one at the top for little script is enough to pinpoint position of the error easily. 

> ⚠If the file you are loading is not prepared using UTF-8 encoding and contains some characters [ with codes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/toArray) > 127, they might convert incorrectly

formleader.name: formLeader
formleader.description: Returns the formation leader of a given unit. This is often the same as the group leader, but not always, for example in cases when a unit is ordered to follow another unit.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) -  
the leader of the formation is returned. If used on a dead unit, the returned value is [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull)

examples:
? (formLeader player != leader player) :
 hint "The formation leader is different to the group leader!"
returns X

airdensitycurvertd.name: airDensityCurveRTD
airdensitycurvertd.description: Returns array with air density data.> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) with [arrays](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array): Returns air density graph 
Each array consists of:

* 0: Altitude (-60000 metres to 10^7 metres)

* 1: Air density

diag_activesqfscripts.name: diag_activeSQFScripts
diag_activesqfscripts.description: Returns information about active [SQF](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQF_Syntax) scripts. To see number of all scripts currently in the scheduler use [diag_activeScripts](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_activeScripts).

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Arrays](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - to format [[scriptName, fileName, isRunning, currentLine], ...]:

* scriptName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - function or filename. Custom name can be set with [scriptName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/scriptName)

* fileName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* isRunning: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

* currentLine: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - line currently executing

progresssetposition.name: progressSetPosition
progresssetposition.description: Sets progress position of a progress bar ([CT_PROGRESS](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_PROGRESS)).

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - progress bar control
pos: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 0: no progress; 1: full progress

forcefollowroad.name: forceFollowRoad
forcefollowroad.description: Forces the vehicle to stay on road.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle
state: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true: Force on road, false: default behaviour

connecttoserver.name: connectToServer
connecttoserver.description:
Connects the client to the provided server.
> ⓘ
> 
> * only works on the [Main Menu](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Main_Menu).
> 
> * must be executed from [ UI context](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isUIContext), such as *onButtonDown* or similar events (see [User Interface Event Handlers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers)).

syntaxArray.Params:
ip: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
port: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
password: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - "" if no password

tvsetvalue.name: tvSetValue
tvsetvalue.description: Sets scalar data to item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View. If the given value is not integer, it will be converted to integer

combatbehaviour.name: combatBehaviour
combatbehaviour.description:
Returns combat behaviour of unit or group. To set unit or group behaviour see [setCombatBehaviour](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setCombatBehaviour). The behaviour is one of:

* "CARELESS"

* "SAFE"

* "AWARE"

* "COMBAT"

* "STEALTH"

* "ERROR" - when not available
examples:
```sqf
unit1 [setCombatBehaviour](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setCombatBehaviour) "CARELESS";
combatBehaviour unit1; //"CARELESS"
```

```sqf
group unit1 [setCombatBehaviour](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setCombatBehaviour) "SAFE";
combatBehaviour group unit1; //"SAFE"
```

ctrlsetfontheighth1.name: ctrlSetFontHeightH1
ctrlsetfontheighth1.description: Sets H1 font size of given HTML control.

sizeof.name: sizeOf
sizeof.description:
Returns the diameter of bounding sphere of the object of given classname in meters. Size returned is usually bigger than the biggest size of the object along any of the axes. For example if object is 10 x 4 x 5 the sizeOf value returned expected to be around 10. If you need to estimate the size of the object more precisely, use [boundingBox](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/boundingBox) or [boundingBoxReal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/boundingBoxReal).

> ⚠At least one object of the given classname has to be present in the current mission otherwise zero will be returned

currentweapon.name: currentWeapon
currentweapon.description: Return the name of the currently selected weapon (on the primary turret for vehicles).

menuclear.name: menuClear
menuclear.description: Removes all entries from given menu strip.
examples:
```sqf
menuClear ([findDisplay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findDisplay) 313 [displayCtrl](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/displayCtrl) 120); *// Removes all entries from [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor). Restart the editor to reset the menu.*
```

ctrlsetfonth4b.name: ctrlSetFontH4B
ctrlsetfonth4b.description: Sets H4 bold font of given HTML control.

assignteam.name: assignTeam
assignteam.description:
Assigns the unit (in case of a vehicle, its commander) to the given team. Team is an option in group control (unit management) menu that allows to split player group in teams and then give bulk order to separate teams. In order to operate properly, the command requires specific conditions:

* The command requires [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) to be fully initialised

* The unit getting assigned must be either player himself or a unit in player's group

* Units in player's group as well as player himself can all have different teams assigned

* The colour of the assigned team for a unit is seen on the group management UI as well as squad radar
The possible team values (colours) are: 

* "MAIN" - (white)

* "RED" - (red)

* "GREEN" - (green)

* "BLUE" - (blue)

* "YELLOW"  - (yellow)
**NOTE**: In older version of the game the effect of this command is local [LELocal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Locality)
examples:
```sqf
_soldier2 assignTeam "RED";
```
In a unit's init script in the editor you should use the following. Or else you might experience [race conditions](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Race_condition). 

```sqf
0 = [this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this_2) [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) {_this assignTeam "RED"};
```

groupselectedunits.name: groupSelectedUnits
groupselectedunits.description: Returns selected units in source group for normal commanding mode (individual units). For the High Command equivalent, see [hcSelected](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hcSelected).

removemagazineglobal.name: removeMagazineGlobal
removemagazineglobal.description: Removes the magazine from the unit.

drawellipse.name: drawEllipse
drawellipse.description: Draws an ellipse on the map. Just like with marker or trigger area, negative a and b will result in hexagon.

syntaxArray.Syntax: map **drawEllipse** [c, a, b, angle, color, fill]
syntaxArray.Params:
map: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
[c, a, b, angle, color, fill]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
c: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - center of ellipse in format [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
a: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - horizontal(x) radius
b: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - vertical(y) radius
angle: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - angle of rotation in degrees
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - line color in format [r,g,b,a]
fill: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - fill texture file or [Procedural_Textures](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Procedural_Textures). Note that the file texture will not rotate with rectangle, use [drawIcon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/drawIcon) for that. If fill texture is not empty, set line color to white [1,1,1,1]

dowatch.name: doWatch
dowatch.description: Order the given unit(s) to watch the given position or target (without radio messages). Use [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) as the target to order a unit to stop watching a position/target.
examples:
```sqf
_soldierOne **doWatch** [markerPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/markerPos) "MarkerMoveOne"
```


The unit named "soldierOne" will watch the position where the marker "MarkerMoveOne" is placed.

```sqf
_soldierOne **doWatch** _eastSoldier
```


The unit named "soldierOne" will watch the unit named "eastSoldier".

setsimulweatherlayers.name: setSimulWeatherLayers
setsimulweatherlayers.description: Sets number of simul weather layers, affects quality of simul weather clouds.

onplayerconnected.name: onPlayerConnected
onplayerconnected.description:
This command will execute attached code whenever a player is connected to a MP session. The code will receive a number of special variables:

* **_id**: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - is the unique DirectPlay ID. Quite useless as the number is too big for in-built string representation and gets rounded. It is also the same id used for user placed markers.

* **_uid**: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - is [getPlayerUID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPlayerUID) of the joining player. In Arma 3 it is also the same as Steam ID.

* **_name**: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - is [profileName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/profileName) of the joining player.

* **_jip**: (*since Arma 3 v1.49*) [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - is a flag that indicates whether or not the player joined after the mission has started (**J**oined **I**n **P**rogress). [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) when the player is [JIP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Join_In_Progress), otherwise [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false).

* **_owner**: (*since Arma 3 v1.49*) [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - is [owner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/owner) id of the joining player. Can be used for kick or ban purposes or just for [publicVariableClient](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/publicVariableClient).

* **_idstr**: (*since Arma 3 v1.95*) [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - same as _id but in string format, so could be exactly compared to [ user marker](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/allMapMarkers) ids.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Since **Arma 3** *v1.57* a stackable MissionEventHandler is available and should be used: [PlayerConnected](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers/addMissionEventHandler#PlayerConnected).
> Before that, the functions [BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler) and [BIS_fnc_removeStackedEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_removeStackedEventHandler) should be used instead in order to keep compatibility between official and community content.

ctrlsetfonth6b.name: ctrlSetFontH6B
ctrlsetfonth6b.description: Sets H6 bold font of given HTML control.

radiochannelcreate.name: radioChannelCreate
radiochannelcreate.description: Create a custom radio channel with the given color, label, call sign and registered characters. The **[custom channel ID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Channel_IDs)** returned can be used to manipulate the created channel later. There are 10 slots for custom radio channels which would correspond to channels 6-15 (see [getPlayerChannel](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPlayerChannel)). The command will find an unused index in this range and create it when found.

syntaxArray.Params:
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - RGBA color values
label: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - label
callSign: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - call sign
units: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - list of units in the channel
sentenceType (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Default: [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) 

* [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) - use *Protocol* message color from [getArray](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getArray) ([configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "RscChatListDefault" >> "colorMessageProtocol")

* [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) - use *Normal* message color from [getArray](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getArray) ([configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "RscChatListDefault" >> "colorMessage")
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - created **[custom channel ID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Channel_IDs)** (used in [customChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/customChat) command), 0 if failed

getallsoundcontrollers.name: getAllSoundControllers
getallsoundcontrollers.description: Returns an array containing names and values of the sound controllers that can be used in simple expressions when configuring sounds.

syntaxArray.Params: vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - must be a vehicle (does not work on soldiers)

netobjnull.name: netObjNull
netobjnull.description: A non-existing network object. > ⓘ**NetObject** data type was never implemented in Arma 3 - this command always returns [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false).

lnbsetdata.name: lnbSetData
lnbsetdata.description: Sets the additional text (invisible) on the item with the given position of the 2D listbox.

syntaxArray.Params:
[idc, [row, column], data]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
[row, column]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
data: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - The invisible text to add

ctrl: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
[[row, column], data]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
[row, column]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
data: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - The invisible text to add

synchronizetrigger.name: synchronizeTrigger
synchronizetrigger.description: [Synchronizes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ArmA:_Mission_Editor#Synchronize_Mode_.28F5.29) the trigger with zero or more waypoints.

syntaxArray.Params:
trigger: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - trigger to synchronize
[waypoint1, waypoint2, ...]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of waypoints to synchronize with trigger. Array can be empty to unset.
waypoint1: [Waypoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Waypoint) - first waypoint
waypoint2: [Waypoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Waypoint) - second waypoint

groupradio.name: groupRadio
groupradio.description:
Sends the audio message to the group radio channel. Must have assigned "ItemRadio" to send or receive the transmission. The message is defined in CfgRadio in the [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext) file or config radio protocol. 
When transmitting unit gets killed, transmission will be interrupted, however when receiving unit gets killed, the transmission continues to play.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit to transmit
radioName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Class name from CfgRadio

group: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)
format: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - format template (e.g "%keyword1 - %keyword2 / %keyword4 (%keyword3)")
keyword1..n: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - keyword value

calculateplayervisibilitybyfriendly.name: calculatePlayerVisibilityByFriendly
calculateplayervisibilitybyfriendly.description: Friendly units will / will not calculate visibility of player. Default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false).

countunknown.name: countUnknown
countunknown.description: Count how many units in the array are unknown to the given unit.

reversedmousey.name: reversedMouseY
reversedmousey.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if mouse vertical axe is inverted.

lnbsortbyvalue.name: lnbSortByValue
lnbsortbyvalue.description: Sorts given multicolumn listbox by [lnbValue](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lnbValue) in given column in ascending or descending order.

syntaxArray.Params:
[idc, column, reversed]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
reversed (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false): descending / [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true): ascending. Default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)

control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
[column, reversed]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
reversed (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false): descending / [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true): ascending. Default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)

setsize.name: setSize
setsize.description:
Sets the size (radius)  of a location.

The width  is 2 * x, the height is 2 * y.

onplayerdisconnected.name: onPlayerDisconnected
onplayerdisconnected.description: This command will execute attached code whenever a player is leaving an MP session. The code will receive a number of special variables:

syntaxArray.Params:
code: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - Code executed. The code will receive a number of special variables:

* _id: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Is the unique DirectPlay ID. Quite useless as the number is too big for in-built string representation and gets rounded. It is also the same id used for user placed markers.


* _uid: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Is [getPlayerUID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPlayerUID) of the leaving player. In Arma 3 it is also the same as Steam ID.


* _name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Is [profileName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/profileName) of the leaving player.


* _jip: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Is a flag that indicated whether or not the player joined after the mission has started (**J**oined **I**n **P**rogress). [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) - if the player was JIP, otherwise [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false). *Since Arma 3 v1.50*


* _owner: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Is [owner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/owner) id of the leaving player. Can be used for kick or ban purposes or just for [publicVariableClient](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/publicVariableClient).  *Since Arma 3 v1.50*


* _idstr:  [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Same as _id but in string format, so could be exactly compared to [ user marker](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/allMapMarkers) ids.  *Since Arma 3 v1.96*

isremoteexecuted.name: isRemoteExecuted
isremoteexecuted.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if the code context is being remote executed by [remoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExec) or [remoteExecCall](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExecCall). In SP always returns [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false). See also [isRemoteExecutedJIP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isRemoteExecutedJIP)

lnbvalue.name: lnbValue
lnbvalue.description: Returns the additional integer value in the item with the given position of the 2D listbox.
examples:
```sqf
_ctrl lnbValue [0,0]; *// 1, default is 0 if value is [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) set by [lnbSetValue](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lnbSetValue)* 
```

tvsort.name: tvSort
tvsort.description: Sorts all children of given path. Text of [Tree View](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_TREE) entries is used for sorting.

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
[path, reversed]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [Tree View Path](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Tree_View_Path) of the parent item to sort
reversed (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to reverse sort it. Default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)

[idc, path, reversed]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - control idc
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [Tree View Path](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Tree_View_Path) of the parent item to sort
reversed (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to reverse sort it. Default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)

ctrltextselection.name: ctrlTextSelection
ctrltextselection.description:
Returns edit control text selection in format [start, length, selectedText]. 
> ⓘlength could be negative if text selection is made from right to left. Use [abs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/abs) with length or [count](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/count) with selectedText if string length is required. start always indicates at what position in text selection is started. The cursor position will always be at the end of the selection. So if selection is made from right to left the cursor position will be at the left end of the selection. In order to find cursor position add start and length together (see example 3)

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [start, length, selectedText] where:

* start: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - position in text selection started

* length: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - number of the highlighted characters (this number could be negative, see description)

* selectedText: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - selected text

examples:
Selection is made from left to right:
```sqf
ctrlTextSelection _control; //[0, 11, "Hello World"]
```
Selection is made from right to left:
```sqf
ctrlTextSelection _control; //[11, -11, "Hello World"]
```
Find cursor position:
```sqf
ctrlTextSelection _control [params](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/params) ["_start", "_length"];
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _cursorPos = _start + _length;
```

ctrlseteventhandler.name: ctrlSetEventHandler
ctrlseteventhandler.description:
Sets given event handler of given control.

The provided function should return true/false indicating that the event has handled this event fully or not and whether the engine should execute it is default code or not afterwards. 

See [User Interface Event Handlers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers) for the full list of handler names.

If applicable, see [DIK_KeyCodes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DIK_KeyCodes) for a list of key code constants, which are relevant to key related user interface events like: [KeyDown](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onKeyDown) & [KeyUp](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onKeyUp). 
> ⚠When using the event names listed [here](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers) with the [ctrlAddEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAddEventHandler), ctrlSetEventHandler, [displayAddEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/displayAddEventHandler) or [displaySetEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/displaySetEventHandler) commands, the prefix "on" in the event name must be removed (e.g. '**ButtonDown'** instead of '**onButtonDown'**).

setcuratorcameraareaceiling.name: setCuratorCameraAreaCeiling
setcuratorcameraareaceiling.description: Sets maximal ([ATL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position#PositionATL)) height to which curator camera can move.

markerpolyline.name: markerPolyline
markerpolyline.description: Returns a polyline marker's path data.
examples:
```sqf
markerPolyline "_USER_DEFINED #0/0/1"; *// Returns your first polyline's data in Singleplayer*
```

kbreact.name: kbReact
kbreact.description: Pass a non-verbal communication to the receiver. This command does **as if** the sentence was said and triggers the reaction scripts (AI FSM or player's conversation EH). See [Conversations](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Conversations) for more details.

syntaxArray.Syntax: person kbReact [receiver, topicName, sentenceID(, argumentArray1, argumentArray2, …)]
syntaxArray.Params:
person: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[receiver, topicName, sentenceID, argumentArray1, argumentArray2, …]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
receiver: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
topicName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
sentenceID: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
argumentArray1toN (Optional): [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [argumentName, argumentValue, argumentText, argumentSpeech]:

* argumentName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* argumentValue: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code)

* argumentText: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* argumentSpeech: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - each string is an already defined word in config.

vehicle.name: vehicle
vehicle.description: Vehicle in which given unit is mounted. If none, unit is returned. Alternatively, use [objectParent](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objectParent)
examples:
SQS 
```sqf
? **vehicle** [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) != [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) : [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "Player is in a vehicle"
```
SQF
```sqf
if (vehicle [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) != [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)) [then](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/then) {[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "Player is in a vehicle"};
```

createvehicle.name: createVehicle
createvehicle.description:
Creates an empty object of given classname type.
See [Arma 3 Assets](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Assets) / [Arma 3: createVehicle/vehicles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_createVehicle/vehicles), or [Category:CfgVehicles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:CfgVehicles) for earlier games.

> ⓘFor objects of type "Logic" use [createUnit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createUnit) instead.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)To avoid vehicle randomisation in Arma 3, set the *BIS_enableRandomization* variable immediately after creating the vehicle:
> 
> ```sqf
> [private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _vehicle = "C_Offroad_01_F" createVehicle [position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/position) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player);
> _vehicle [setVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVariable) ["BIS_enableRandomization", [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)];
> ```
> 
> 
> Check [Vehicle Customization (VhC)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Vehicle_Customization_(VhC)) page for more information and settings.

syntaxArray.Params:
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - vehicle/object className
position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) - Desired placement position. If the exact position is occupied, nearest empty position is used.

[type, position, markers, placement, special]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - vehicle/object className
position: [PositionATL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionATL) ([PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) if boat or amphibious), [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - desired placement position
markers: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default []) if the markers array contains any markers, the position is randomly picked from array of given markers plus desired placement position. If any of the markers were given z coordinate with [setMarkerPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setMarkerPos), the vehicle will also be created at given z coordinate.
placement: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) the vehicle is placed inside a circle with given position as center and placement as its radius.
special: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "NONE") can be one of the following:

* "NONE" - will look for suitable empty position near given position (subject to other placement params) before placing vehicle there.

* "CAN_COLLIDE" - places vehicle at given position (subject to other placement params), without checking if others objects can cross its 3D model.

* "FLY" - if vehicle is capable of flying and has crew, it will be made airborne at default height.
If *special* is "" or not specified, default "NONE" is used.

settriggeractivation.name: setTriggerActivation
settriggeractivation.description:
Defines the trigger activation type. 

See [ArmA:Mission Editor - Triggers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ArmA:_Mission_Editor#Triggers_Mode_.28F3.29) for a thorough overview of triggers and its fields for activation, effects, etc.   Since Arma 3 v1.67, "ANYPLAYER" activation can be used to detect any player.

syntaxArray.Params:
trigger: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Trigger object
by: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Who activates trigger. Can be "NONE" or

* Side: "EAST", "WEST", "GUER", "CIV", "LOGIC", "ANY", "ANYPLAYER" (*Since Arma 3 v1.67*)

* Radio: "ALPHA", "BRAVO", "CHARLIE", "DELTA", "ECHO", "FOXTROT", "GOLF", "HOTEL", "INDIA", "JULIET"

* Object: "STATIC", "VEHICLE", "GROUP", "LEADER", "MEMBER"

* Status: "WEST SEIZED", "EAST SEIZED" or "GUER SEIZED"
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) -  How trigger is it activated. Can be:

* Presence: "PRESENT", "NOT PRESENT"

* Detection: "WEST D", "EAST D", "GUER D" or "CIV D"
repeating: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Activation can happen repeatedly

isnotequalto.name: isNotEqualTo
isnotequalto.description: Performs strict comparison between var1 and var2 and returns [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if equal, otherwise true.

forcegeneratorrtd.name: forceGeneratorRTD
forcegeneratorrtd.description:
Adds force generator to world.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

allcutlayers.name: allCutLayers
allcutlayers.description:
Returns all named layers used by [cutRsc](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cutRsc), [cutText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cutText), [cutObj](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cutObj) or [cutFadeOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cutFadeOut).
The layer normally would be added on the first use of any of the aforementioned commands, however if a layer needs to be reserved it could be done like so: 
```sqf
_layerNum = "TAG_myLayerName" [cutFadeOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cutFadeOut) 0;
```
.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Strings): The index of the layer name in the array corresponds to the layer number the cut effect will be displayed on. If no layers were defined, the return is 
```sqf
[""]
```
, because 0 layer is reserved for usage in cut commands without layer param or when name of the layer given is empty 
```sqf
""
```
.

fullcrew.name: fullCrew
fullcrew.description:
Returns an array with all crew inside given vehicle, with or without empty seats.

> ⚠With the introduction of person turrets (FFV), the returned *cargoIndex* works with [moveInCargo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveInCargo) but does not with [actions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/action) such as "GetInCargo" and "MoveToCargo". To find out indexes for actions, use the "cargo" filter (See [Example 3](https://community.bistudio.com#Examples)).

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - list of arrays in format [unit, role, cargoIndex, turretPath, personTurret]:

* unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

* role: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - not always lowercase (from 2.03 always lower case)

* cargoIndex: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* turretPath: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

* personTurret: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - role filter (case-insensitive). An invalid value (e.g "") will return all positions. Available values:

* "driver"

* "commander"

* "gunner"

* "turret"

* "cargo"
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.56](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.56) includeEmpty: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) include empty crew seats *Since Arma 3 v1.55.133810*
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - list of arrays in format [unit, role, cargoIndex, turretPath, personTurret]:

* unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

* role: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - not always lowercase (from 2.03 always lower case)

* cargoIndex: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* turretPath: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

* personTurret: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)

gettotaldlcusagetime.name: getTotalDLCUsageTime
gettotaldlcusagetime.description: Returns total DLC usage time in this game session

lbsetpicturecolor.name: lbSetPictureColor
lbsetpicturecolor.description: Sets the color of item's picture (left) with the given index of the listbox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to the given color. Color is in format [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color). Color which consists from only zeros means disable this override.

syntaxArray.Params:
[idc, index, name]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) of control
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

ismanualfire.name: isManualFire
ismanualfire.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if manual fire is on. Manual fire could either be selected in vehicle action menu (if available) or with [action](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/action) "ManualFire" and "ManualFireCancel". Always returns [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) for a soldier.

locked.name: locked
locked.description: Check if [vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) is locked. If it is locked, [Persons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object#Person) cannot mount / dismount without order.

syntaxArray.Return:
* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - since [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[0.50](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_0.50)

* 0: Unlocked

* 1: Default - a subordinate player cannot enter without AI leader order

* 2: Locked

* 3: Locked for player

* -1: vehicle [is null](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull)

* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) for older games

isplayer.name: isPlayer
isplayer.description:
Checks if given person is a [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player). Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) for headless clients as well.
> ⚠In some cases, the identity of certain player units might fail to propagate to other clients and the server, which causes isPlayer and [getPlayerUID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPlayerUID) to incorrectly return [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) and "", respectively, where the affected units are [not](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/not) [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local).[[1]](https://community.bistudio.com#cite_note-1) Therefore, beware of false negatives.

waypointattachedvehicle.name: waypointAttachedVehicle
waypointattachedvehicle.description:
Gets the vehicle attached to the waypoint.
A vehicle can be attached to a waypoint by

* creating the waypoint on top of the vehicle in the [2D Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/2D_Editor)

* using [waypointAttachVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/waypointAttachVehicle)

resize.name: resize
resize.description: Changes the size of the given array. The command does not return new array, it resizes the source array to the desired number of elements. If the new size is bigger than the current size, the new places are filled with [nils](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil).

syntaxArray.Params:
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The new number of elements.

vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
componentName : [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - The component's name (can either be it is "real name" or it is className)
state: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - component state [on/off]

setparticlecircle.name: setParticleCircle
setparticlecircle.description:
Updates particle source, creates particles in circle with given radius. Velocity is transformed and added to total velocity. Correspondence between CfgCloudlets class param names and command array of params:

```sqf
particleSource setParticleCircle
[
	circleRadius,
	circleVelocity
];
```

currentweaponturret.name: currentWeaponTurret
currentweaponturret.description: Returns the name of the currently selected weapon on specified turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

settext.name: setText
settext.description: Sets the text associated with a location. This text will be displayed on the game map at the location's position.

unassigncurator.name: unassignCurator
unassigncurator.description: Unassign curator (will destroy both sides of connection).

decaygraphvalues.name: decayGraphValues
decaygraphvalues.description: Multiplies graph values by the given coefficient. The corresponding lower bound value is used instead if the product is smaller than the bound.

syntaxArray.Params:
[lowerBoundValues, graphValues, coef]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
lowerBoundValues: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Lower bound for the new graph
graphValues: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Graph values
coef: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The coefficient to be multiplied with

taskstate.name: taskState
taskstate.description:
Returns the current state of a task. 

**Possible return values are:**

* None

* Created

* Assigned

* Succeeded

* Failed

* Canceled

syntaxArray.Params: task: [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task) - the task you want to query

hostmission.name: hostMission
hostmission.description:
Host the mp mission described by config class. Should be called as reaction to some UI action in some dialog.
For example you can start a MP scenario from a button. It creates a host and takes you to the lobby with the scenario loaded.
You need to provide the display which is active when the hostMission command is called.

showuavfeed.name: showUAVFeed
showuavfeed.description: Shows/hides video feed transmitted from UAV in [its custom info panel](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Custom_Info).

setplayerrespawntime.name: setPlayerRespawnTime
setplayerrespawntime.description: Sets the time interval (in seconds) that the player must wait before respawn. It resets to mission default on mission start. In Single Player or when respawn type is GROUP or SIDE in Multiplayer, setting player respawn time has no effect, and [playerRespawnTime](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playerRespawnTime) will always return -1.

switchableunits.name: switchableUnits
switchableunits.description:
Returns a list of playable units available for switching to.
Command is relative to the client on which it is executed and will only show playable units for the same [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/side) as [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)'s [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) + [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) himself,
unless in singleplayer where playable units from all sides will be accessible via this command.
Dead and player-controlled units are automatically removed from the resulting array.
> ⓘIn Multiplayer, switchableUnits are only available when [respawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext#respawn) type is set to SIDE or GROUP, the mission contains units marked playable and [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) is able to switch to any of those units.
In order to get all *playable* units regardless of their [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/side), see the [playableUnits](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playableUnits) command.

setposasl2.name: setPosASL2
setposasl2.description:
Sets the object position. The pos array uses the [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) format. The version of the command does not offset based on object center. 
> ⚠This command was deactivated and has no effect. Use [setPosWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPosWorld) instead.

enableteamswitch.name: enableTeamSwitch
enableteamswitch.description: Enable / disable [Team Switch](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Switch). The default setting is enabled.

setparticleclass.name: setParticleClass
setparticleclass.description:
Sets particle source parameters using existing particle config from CfgCloudlets class. Use [setParticleParams](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setParticleParams) subsequently if you need to overwrite some values.
> ⚠If CfgCloudlets class contains [ simple expressions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Simple_Expression), they will not be evaluated by this command, which might make the whole class unusable in script.

syntaxArray.Params:
source: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - particle source
className: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - CfgCloudlets class

menusetshortcut.name: menuSetShortcut
menusetshortcut.description: Sets shortcut of given menu strip entry.

getfsmvariable.name: getFSMVariable
getfsmvariable.description: Return the value of variable in the variable space of given FSM. The FSM handle is the number returned by the [execFSM](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/execFSM) command.

syntaxArray.Params:
FSMhandle: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the variable

[name, defaultValue]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) -
FSMhandle: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the variable
defaultValue: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - value to return if variable is [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil)

setparticlefire.name: setParticleFire
setparticlefire.description:
Set fire parameters to particle effect.

Note: You need to create emitter at first. Basic parameters of particle effect must be defined too. You can use script commands [setParticleClass](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setParticleClass) or [setParticleParams](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setParticleParams) to do so (see example). Correspondence between CfgCloudlets class param names and command array of params:

```sqf
particleSource setParticleFire
[
	coreIntensity,
	coreDistance,
	damageTime
];
```

syntaxArray.Params:
source: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[coreIntensity, coreDistance, damageTime]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
coreIntensity: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - damage in the center of fire
coreDistance: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - how far can unit get damage
damageTime: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - how often is unit getting damage

assignascommander.name: assignAsCommander
assignascommander.description: Assign a unit as commander of a vehicle. Used together with [orderGetIn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/orderGetIn) to order subordinate units to get in as commander of a specific vehicle. Before usage of this command a subordinate unit has not got the option to get into the commander place of the vehicle.

joinsilent.name: joinSilent
joinsilent.description: Join all units in the array to given group silently (without radio message). To have a group member leave a group, join him with the [grpNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/grpNull) group (e.g. [guy1] joinSilent [grpNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/grpNull)), but **beware**, as brand new group is created for the leaving unit and this could result in the number of groups in a mission growing out of control.

syntaxArray.Params:
unitArray: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - units to join group
group: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)

islocalized.name: isLocalized

syntaxArray.Params: stringName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - String which leads to localisation. Casing does not matter. Since Arma 3 v2.04 a string starting with "$" is supported as well

savejoysticks.name: saveJoysticks
savejoysticks.description: Saves joysticks key mappings into the joysticks.cfg file. Engine add these joysticks to the Joystick Scheme mapping dialog in options controls section.

setsystemofunits.name: setSystemOfUnits
setsystemofunits.description:
Set system of units. This will only impact gauges from advanced flight model.
> ⚠This command is buggy: any value other than 0 (metric) will display both units at the same time.

syntaxArray.Params:
value: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - possible values are:
0 - metric
1 - mixed
2 - imperial

objectfromnetid.name: objectFromNetId
objectfromnetid.description: Get object with given unique ID. If object is a [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) use [groupFromNetId](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/groupFromNetId). As this command is MP only, you can use [BIS_fnc_objectFromNetId](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_objectFromNetId), which extends the use to SP as well.

getwingspositionrtd.name: getWingsPositionRTD
getwingspositionrtd.description: Returns position of stabilizers.> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

set3denobjecttype.name: set3DENObjectType
set3denobjecttype.description: Sets the classname of one or more given Eden Editor [objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Object). For Logic objects use [set3DENLogicType](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/set3DENLogicType)

syntaxArray.Params:
objects: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
classname: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the cfgVehicles class

foreach.name: forEach
foreach.description:
Executes the given command(s) on every item of an array.
The array items are represented by the [magic variable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables) **[_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x)**. The array indices are represented by **[_forEachIndex](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#forEachIndex)**.
In Arma 2 and later, the variable [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x) is always local to the forEach block so it is safe to nest them.
*Since Arma 3 v2.01* the [HashMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/HashMap) variant also provides a _y variable for the Value in the key-value pair.

syntaxArray.Params:
code:

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) (Operation Flashpoint / Armed Assault)

* [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) (Armed Assault and later)
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - the array to iterate
syntaxArray.Return: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - will return the value of last executed statement

syntaxArray.Params:
code: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code)
hashMap : [HashMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/HashMap) - The HashMap to iterate through
syntaxArray.Return: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - will return the value of last executed statement

examples:
```sqf
*// SQF*
{ [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x) [setDamage](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setDamage) 1 } forEach [units](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/units) [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player);
```


```sqf
; SQS
"[_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x) [setDammage](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setDammage) 1" forEach [units](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/units) [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)
```
This command can also easily be used to execute a single command multiple times without respect to the array items.

```sqf
{ [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [addMagazine](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addMagazine) "30Rnd_556x45_Stanag"; } forEach [1, 2, 3, 4];
```
You can also use multiple commands in the same block:

```sqf
{
    [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables) [setCaptive](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setCaptive) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true);
    [removeAllWeapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/removeAllWeapons) [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables);
    [doStop](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/doStop) [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables);
} forEach [units](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/units) [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) [this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this_2);
```
To get the index of a forEach loop, use [_forEachIndex](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#forEachIndex):

```sqf
{ [systemChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/systemChat) [format](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/format) ["%1", _forEachIndex]; } forEach [1,2,3]; *// will return: "0", "1", "2" in [systemChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/systemChat) messages*
```
Iterating a [HashMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/HashMap) [_forEachIndex](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#forEachIndex):

```sqf
{ [systemChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/systemChat) [format](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/format) ["%1-%2", _x, _y]; } forEach createHashMapFromArray [[1,"a"], [2,"b"]]; *// will return: "1-a", "2-b" in [systemChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/systemChat) messages*
```

selectmin.name: selectMin
selectmin.description:
Returns the array element with [minimum](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/min) numerical value.
