Engine solution to [BIS_fnc_lowestNum](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_lowestNum) and [BIS_fnc_findExtreme](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_findExtreme). Therefore it is expected that supplied array consists of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) only.  [Booleans](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) however are also supported and will be evaluated as [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number): [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) - 1, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) - 0. [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil) value treated as 0. 
> ⚠Other non [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) elements (not recommended) will be evaluated as 0 and **Bad conversion: scalar** message will be logged into .[rpt](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/rpt).

get3denentityid.name: get3DENEntityID
get3denentityid.description: Returns unique index of an [Eden Entity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Entity). This number remains the same even after saving and loading the scenario. > ⓘThis ID is only available in [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor).

syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - [Eden ID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_ID) If ID is not available, -1 is returned

enablesimulation.name: enableSimulation
enablesimulation.description: Enables / disables simulation for the given entity. This command will affect entity simulation only [locally](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local). For a global and JIP enabled alternative see [enableSimulationGlobal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/enableSimulationGlobal)

settaskresult.name: setTaskResult
settaskresult.description: Set a result of the task.

setgroupid.name: setGroupId
setgroupid.description:
Sets the group radio callsign, how it will be displayed in radio chat. Two groups on the same side **cannot** have the same callsign (different side is possible). When trying to apply the same callsign to two groups of the same side, the callsigns will simply be swapped, e.g:

```sqf
group1 setGroupId ["Active Group"];
group2 setGroupId ["Inactive Group"];
group2 setGroupId ["Active Group"]; *// group1 is "Inactive Group" now*
```


The identity setup can also consist of format keywords (marked with %) and param keywords taken from **CfgWorlds** config.
Basically it is like [format](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/format) command but with some special group keywords (See Example 2).

> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Possible Arma 3 values: [Show text](https://community.bistudio.com#)
> 
> **%GroupSquad**:
> 
> 
> * "Squad1" → 1
> 
> * "Squad2" → 2
> 
> * "Squad3" → 3
> 
> * "Squad4" → 4
> **%GroupPlatoon**:
> 
> 
> * "Platoon1" → 1
> 
> * "Platoon2" → 2
> 
> * "Platoon3" → 3
> 
> * "Platoon4" → 4
> **%GroupCompany**:
> 
> 
> * "CompanyAlpha" → Alpha
> 
> * "CompanyBravo" → Bravo
> 
> * "CompanyCharlie" → Charlie
> 
> * "CompanyDelta" → Delta
> 
> * "CompanyEcho" → Echo
> 
> * "CompanyFoxtrot" → Foxtrot
> 
> * "CompanyGolf" → Golf
> 
> * "CompanyHotel" → Hotel
> 
> * "CompanyIndia" → India
> 
> * "CompanyKilo" → Kilo
> 
> * "CompanyLima" → Lima
> 
> * "CompanyMike" → Mike
> 
> * "CompanyNovember" → November
> 
> * "CompanyOscar" → Oscar
> 
> * "CompanyPapa" → Papa
> 
> * "CompanyQuebec" → Quebec
> 
> * "CompanyRomeo" → Romeo
> 
> * "CompanySierra" → Sierra
> 
> * "CompanyTango" → Tango
> 
> * "CompanyUniform" → Uniform
> 
> * "CompanyVictor" → Victor
> 
> * "CompanyWhiskey" → Whiskey
> 
> * "CompanyXray" → X-Ray
> 
> * "CompanyYankee" → Yankee
> 
> * "CompanyZulu" → Zulu
> **%GroupNames**:
> 
> 
> * "Alpha" → Alpha
> 
> * "Bravo" → Bravo
> 
> * "Charlie" → Charlie
> 
> * "Delta" → Delta
> 
> * "Echo" → Echo
> 
> * "Foxtrot" → Foxtrot
> 
> * "Golf" → Golf
> 
> * "Hotel" → Hotel
> 
> * "November" → November
> 
> * "Kilo" → Kilo
> 
> * "Yankee" → Yankee
> 
> * "Zulu" → Zulu
> 
> * "Two" → Two
> 
> * "Three" → Three
> 
> * "Buffalo" → Buffalo
> 
> * "Guardian" → Guardian
> 
> * "Convoy" → Convoy
> 
> * "Fox" → Fox
> **%GroupColors**:
> 
> 
> * "GroupColor0" → (nothing)
> 
> * "GroupColor1" → Black
> 
> * "GroupColor2" → Red
> 
> * "GroupColor3" → Green
> 
> * "GroupColor4" → Blue
> 
> * "GroupColor5" → Yellow
> 
> * "GroupColor6" → Orange
> 
> * "GroupColor7" → Pink
> 
> * "Six" → Six
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ⓘSince **Armed Assault**, you can freely decide the callsign, e.g 
> ```sqf
>  [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) setGroupId ["First Assault Recon Team"];
> ```
> .
> ⓘIn **Operation Flashpoint**, group ID cannot be freely decided and format must be of [letter, colour, picture] or [letter, colour]. Possible values: [Show text](https://community.bistudio.com#)
> 
> **Letter:**
> 
> 
> * "Alpha"
> 
> * "Bravo"
> 
> * "Charlie"
> 
> * "Delta"
> 
> * "Echo"
> 
> * "Foxtrot"
> 
> * "Golf"
> 
> * "Hotel"
> 
> * "Kilo"
> 
> * "Yankee"
> 
> * "Zulu"
> 
> * "Buffalo"
> 
> * "Convoy"
> 
> * "Guardian"
> 
> * "November"
> 
> * "Two"
> 
> * "Three"
> 
> * "Fox"
> **Colour:**
> 
> 
> * "GroupColor0" → (nothing)
> 
> * "GroupColor1" → Black
> 
> * "GroupColor2" → Red
> 
> * "GroupColor3" → Green
> 
> * "GroupColor4" → Blue
> 
> * "GroupColor5" → Yellow
> 
> * "GroupColor6" → Orange
> 
> * "GroupColor7" → Pink
> 
> * "Six" → Six
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> The radio callsign strings can be overwritten in a mission by writing [Stringtable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Stringtable.csv) entries of the same name. Some entry names: [Show text](https://community.bistudio.com#)
> 
> 
> 
> * STR_CFG_*GRPNAMES*_**ALPHA**
> 
> * STR_CFG_*GRPNAMES*_**FOX**
> 
> * STR_CFG_*GRPCOL*_**BLACK**
> 
> * STR_CFG_*GRPNAMES*_**SIX** (unlike its name suggests, this is a "group colour")
> 
> * STR_CFG_FIREFLYBASE
> 
> * STR_CFG_PAPABEAR
> 
> * STR_CFG_HQ_BASE
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>

syntaxArray.Params:
group: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)
[nameFormat, nameParam1, ..., nameParamN]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
nameFormat: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - format template (%keyword1 - %keyword2...etc)
nameParam1: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - param keyword

examples:
**Arma 3**:
```sqf
[group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) setGroupId ["Some name for the group"];
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [groupId](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/groupId) [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player);	*// "Some name for the group"*
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [sideChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideChat) "lalala";	*// Some name for the group (KK): "lalala"*
```
**Arma 3**:
```sqf
[group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) setGroupId ["%GroupNames :=: %GroupColors", "Alpha", "GroupColor2"];
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [groupId](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/groupId) [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player);	*// "Alpha :=: Red"*
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [sideChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideChat) "lalala";	*// Alpha :=: Red (KK): "lalala"*
```
**Armed Assault / Arma 2 / Arma 3**: 
```sqf
_group1 setGroupId ["Assault Squad"];
```
**Operation Flashpoint**: 
```sqf
_group1 setGroupId ["Delta", "GroupColor4"]
```

ctrlsetfonth6.name: ctrlSetFontH6
ctrlsetfonth6.description: Sets H6 font of given HTML control.

lnbsettextright.name: lnbSetTextRight
lnbsettextright.description: Sets cell's right-aligned text. Does not replace [cell's text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lnbText).

syntaxArray.Params:
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 0-based index (first column is 0, second is 1, etc)
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 0-based index (first column is 0, second is 1, etc)
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

ctrl: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 0-based index (first column is 0, second is 1, etc)
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 0-based index (first column is 0, second is 1, etc)
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

setshotparents.name: setShotParents
setshotparents.description: Sets vehicle and instigator pair for the given projectile.

syntaxArray.Params:
projectile: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - The actual projectile shot
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Vehicle shooting projectile
instigator: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Person pulling the trigger

freelook.name: freeLook
freelook.description: Returns true if freelook is active.

unlockachievement.name: unlockAchievement
unlockachievement.description:
Unlocks the given achievement. The achievements are listed in CfgAchievements, however none of the currently listed achievements is used in Arma 3, hence the command always returns [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false).

> ⚠This command is obsolete and was used in the experimental (unreleased) Arma 2 Xbox 360 version as stated
> [here](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://forums.bohemia.net/forums/topic/187873-unlockachievment-command/?tab=comments#comment-2978436).
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)To unlock a [Steam Achievement](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Stat_Names) for Arma 3, see [setStatValue](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setStatValue).

camsetpos.name: camSetPos
camsetpos.description: Sets the position of the given camera or seagull (see [camCreate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCreate)). It is worth mentioning that camera position can also be set with [setPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPos), in which case it would be instant. With camSetPos it is possible to make smooth position transition in time, defined with [camCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCommit), which is required in this case.

syntaxArray.Params:
camera: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object of type "camera" or "seagull"
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) to set the object to

synchronizeobjectsremove.name: synchronizeObjectsRemove
synchronizeobjectsremove.description: Removes given objects from the unit's list of synchronized objects.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
objects: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - An array of objects

get3dencamera.name: get3DENCamera
get3dencamera.description: Returns the camera [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) used by the [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor).

underwater.name: underwater
underwater.description:
Returns whether the object is fully underwater
> ⓘThis command works well with Arma 3 mini-submarines, which was the primary design goal most likely

humidity.name: humidity
humidity.description: Returns the current humidity value. 0 is no humidity and 1 is 100% humidity. Humidity value quickly changes from 0 to 1 when rain starts, then slowly changes from 1 to 0 when rain stops.

lnbsize.name: lnbSize
lnbsize.description: Returns size of 2D listbox or combobox.

syntaxArray.Params: controlOrIDC: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) or [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Control or control's IDC

configclasses.name: configClasses
configclasses.description:
Returns an array of config entries which meet criteria in condition code. Command iterates through all available config sub classes of the given config class. Current looked at config is stored in _x variable (similar to alternative [count](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/count) command implementation). Condition has to return [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) in order for the looked at config to be added to the resulting array. Slightly faster than [configProperties](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configProperties), but doesn't account for config properties or inherited entries.
> ⚠
> 
> * The condition code passed to configClasses should only be used for **simple filter expressions** and nothing more
> 
> * Do not use "[isClass](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isClass) [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x)" in the condition. The engine does this check already
> 
> 
> 
> * With *Arma 3 v2.01* specific engine optimisations were added for the following conditions:
> 
> * "[true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)"
> 
> * "[getNumber](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getNumber) ([_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x) >> 'scope') > 0"
examples:
collect all CfgVehicles configs: 
```sqf
_configs = "[true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)" configClasses ([configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "CfgVehicles");
```
Return all classes that can transport 10 and more soldiers: 
```sqf
_transporters = "[getNumber](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getNumber) (_x >> 'transportSoldier') >= 10" configClasses ([configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "CfgVehicles");
```
Return all classes that inherit from 'RscText': 
```sqf
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) ("[inheritsFrom](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/inheritsFrom) _x == ([configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> 'RscText')" configClasses [configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile));
```

echo.name: echo
echo.description: Sends any text into the debugger console or the logfile. This command is only **present in internal version ** not in the retail version. Use [diag_log](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_log) instead!

ctrlsetfonth1b.name: ctrlSetFontH1B
ctrlsetfonth1b.description: Sets H1 bold font of given HTML control.

groupfromnetid.name: groupFromNetId
groupfromnetid.description: Get group with given unique ID. For objects use [objectFromNetId](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objectFromNetId). As this command is MP only, you can use [BIS_fnc_groupFromNetId](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_groupFromNetId), which extends the use to SP as well.

backpackmagazines.name: backpackMagazines
backpackmagazines.description: Get array with all magazines from backpack of the given unit.

setobjectproxy.name: setObjectProxy
setobjectproxy.description:
Set the proxy object associated with the given editor object.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

behaviour.name: behaviour
behaviour.description: Returns the behaviour of the individual unit, this is why it only accepts [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) as the argument. For Arma 3 behaviour explanation see [Arma_3_AI_Behavior](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_AI_Behavior)

syntaxArray.Return:
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) -  
One of:

* "CARELESS"

* "SAFE"

* "AWARE"

* "COMBAT"

* "STEALTH"

* "ERROR" (Since [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.78](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.78) when used on empty vehicles and such)

addownedmine.name: addOwnedMine
addownedmine.description: Sets ownership over a remotely detonatable mine to the unit.

runinitscript.name: runInitScript
runinitscript.description: Fades in mission screen and re-executes init.sqf and init.sqs scripts. In [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor) the code inside the "Init" mission attribute is executed.

playerrespawntime.name: playerRespawnTime
playerrespawntime.description: Return the player's remaining time before respawn, or -1 if it is not available (such as when the player is alive).

eyedirection.name: eyeDirection
eyedirection.description: Returns the direction object is watching (eyes, or a vehicle primary observer).

lockidentity.name: lockIdentity
lockidentity.description: Locks the identity of a person. This will disable default identity.

activatekey.name: activateKey
activatekey.description:
Activates the given keyname for the current user profile. The keys are used to unlock missions or campaigns.

See keys, keysLimit and doneKeys in the [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#keys) file of the missions.

isflatempty.name: isFlatEmpty
isflatempty.description:
Checks given position against given filter params. Filter includes checks for:

* If there are any objects closer than given distance from given position (in 2D)

* If the area around position is flat enough to match given gradient

* If the given position is over water or land

* If the given position is over shore line
The gradient seems to correlate with general hill steepness: 0.1 (10%) ~6°, 0.5 (50%) ~27°, 1.0 (100%) ~45°, etc.
> ⓘSee also [BIS_fnc_findSafePos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_findSafePos).

syntaxArray.Syntax: position isFlatEmpty [minDistance, mode, maxGradient, maxGradientRadius, overLandOrWater, shoreLine, ignoreObject]
syntaxArray.Params:
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - position in format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL)
[minDistance, mode, maxGradient, maxGradientRadius, overLandOrWater, shoreLine, ignoreObject]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
minDistance: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default -1) minimum (2D) distance from other objects (range 0..50). -1 to ignore proximity check
mode: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default -1) position check mode (**ALWAYS USE DEFAULT VALUE**)
maxGradient: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default -1) maximum terrain steepness allowed. -1 to ignore
maxGradientRadius: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) how far to extend gradient check
overLandOrWater: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0)

* 0: position cannot be over water

* 2: position cannot be over land

* -1 to ignore
shoreLine: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false))

* [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true): position is over shoreline (< ~25 m from water)

* [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to ignore
ignoreObject: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - (Optional, default [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull)) object to ignore in proximity checks. [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) to ignore
syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Empty array [] if check failed or [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) if succeded. Resulting position will be original [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) + [getTerrainHeightASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getTerrainHeightASL)

examples:
Check if player position is over land:

```sqf
_overLand = !([position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/position) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) isFlatEmpty [-1, -1, -1, -1, 0, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)] [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) []);
```
Check if player position is over shore line:

```sqf
_overShore = !([position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/position) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) isFlatEmpty  [-1, -1, -1, -1, 0, [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)] [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) []);
```
Check if player position is over water:

```sqf
_overWater = !([position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/position) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) isFlatEmpty  [-1, -1, -1, -1, 2, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)] [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) []);
```
Check if no object is closer than 5m to player position:

```sqf
_isEmpty = !([position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/position) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) isFlatEmpty  [5, -1, -1, -1, -1, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)] [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) []);
```
Check if area 10m around player position is relatively flat:

```sqf
_isFlat = !([position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/position) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) isFlatEmpty  [-1, -1, 0.3, 10, -1] [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) []);
```
Check if area 15m around player position is very flat and empty:

```sqf
_isFlatEmpty = !([position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/position) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) isFlatEmpty  [15, -1, 0.1, 15, -1, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)] [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) []);
```

setgroupiconsselectable.name: setGroupIconsSelectable
setgroupiconsselectable.description: Sets if group icons raise [onGroupIconClick](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onGroupIconClick), [onGroupIconOverEnter](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onGroupIconOverEnter) and [onGroupIconOverLeave](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onGroupIconOverLeave) events.

syntaxArray.Params: selectable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Setting to [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) makes the icon selectable

teamtype.name: teamType
teamtype.description: Returns a type of given team.

setfatigue.name: setFatigue
setfatigue.description: Sets the person's fatigue, from 0 to 1.

leaderboardinit.name: leaderboardInit
leaderboardinit.description: Initialize the leaderboard structure for board with given name. Returns true if board is already initialized.

lbsetselectcolorright.name: lbSetSelectColorRight
lbsetselectcolorright.description:
Sets the select color of the of the secondary text (right aligned) of the item with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user [dialog](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/dialog) to color.

Colour is in format [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color).

syntaxArray.Params:
[idc, index, color]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) of control
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
color: [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color)

clientowner.name: clientOwner
clientowner.description: Returns the [ machine network ID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Machine_network_ID) of the client executing the command.

vectorcrossproduct.name: vectorCrossProduct
vectorcrossproduct.description:
Cross product of two 3D vectors. 
In layman's terms, if you have a polygon (surface) defined by 3 points, you can find a normal to it (just like terrain [surfaceNormal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/surfaceNormal)). To invert direction of the normal, swap arguments around.

syntaxArray.Params:
vector1:  [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - in form [x, y, z] or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)
vector2:  [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - in form [x, y, z] or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

setusermfdvalue.name: setUserMFDValue

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - an vehicle with MFD
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - index of custom MFD user actions
value: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - value which should custom source return in MFD

examples:
```sqf
 BIS_Plane setUserMFDValue [0,1]; // user0 in MFD will return 1
```
Set MFD Red:
```sqf
Blackfoot setUserMFDValue [0, 1]; // "user0" - 1
Blackfoot setUserMFDValue [1, 0]; // "user1" - 0
Blackfoot setUserMFDValue [2, 0]; // "user2" - 0
Blackfoot setUserMFDValue [3, 1]; // "user3" - 1
```
Set MFD pale Blue:
```sqf
Blackfoot setUserMFDValue [0, 0]; // "user0" - 0
Blackfoot setUserMFDValue [1, 0]; // "user1" - 0
Blackfoot setUserMFDValue [2, 1]; // "user2" - 1
Blackfoot setUserMFDValue [3, 0.1]; // "user3" - 0.1
```
Hide MFD:
```sqf
Blackfoot setUserMFDValue [3, 0]; // "user3" - 0
```

isremoteexecutedjip.name: isRemoteExecutedJIP
isremoteexecutedjip.description:
Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if the code context is being remote executed from the JIP queue by [remoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExec) or [remoteExecCall](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExecCall) (when JIP param was set). It is a subset of [isRemoteExecuted](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isRemoteExecuted):

* Normal remote execution:

* [isRemoteExecuted](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isRemoteExecuted) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)

* isRemoteExecutedJIP - [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)

* Remote execution from JIP queue:

* [isRemoteExecuted](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isRemoteExecuted) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)

* isRemoteExecutedJIP - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)
In SP always returns [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false).

joinas.name: joinAs
joinas.description: Joins the unit to the given group, if position id is available, this one is used.

buldozer_isenabledroaddiag.name: buldozer_IsEnabledRoadDiag
buldozer_isenabledroaddiag.description: Returns if road diagnostics are enabled in buldozer.

setplayable.name: setPlayable
setplayable.description: Create MP role for the unit. The roles created this way are used for [Join In Progress](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Join_In_Progress) and [Team Switch](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Switch).

forgettarget.name: forgetTarget
forgettarget.description: Resets the info a group has about a target, forcing [knowsAbout](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/knowsAbout) value to 0.

syntaxArray.Params:
group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - group itself or unit in a group
target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - group target

examples:
```sqf
soldier1 forgetTarget soldier2;
```
Give enemyBob some amnesia:
```sqf
[onEachFrame](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onEachFrame) { enemyBob forgetTarget [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) };
```

isserver.name: isServer
isserver.description:
Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if the machine (executing the command) is the server in a multiplayer game or is running single player. It will return [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) for both dedicated and player-hosted server.
> ⓘSee also [Multiplayer Scripting/machines](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Different_machines_and_how_to_target_them).

ctrlsetpositiony.name: ctrlSetPositionY
ctrlsetpositiony.description: Sets vertical position (y) of a 2D control. [ctrlCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlCommit) is required to complete the operation.

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - 2D control
y: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Vertical position of the control

curatorselected.name: curatorSelected
curatorselected.description: Returns list of all curator selected items.

get3denattribute.name: get3DENAttribute
get3denattribute.description:
Returns the value of the given entity's [attribute](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Entity_Attributes) in [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor).

An attribute is identified by its property (data when it is engine-drive attribute) value in config. For the list of all attributes with their properties, see [Setting Attributes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Setting_Attributes#Attributes).

> ⚠Attributes are available only within the Eden Editor workspace. You cannot access them in scenario preview or exported scenario!

numbertodate.name: numberToDate
numbertodate.description: Convert float number to a date.

numberofenginesrtd.name: numberOfEnginesRTD
numberofenginesrtd.description: Returns the number of engines a helicopter has. > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

campreparedive.name: camPrepareDive
campreparedive.description:
Prepares the camera dive angle. 
> ⚠This command is **non-functional**!

ctaddheader.name: ctAddHeader
ctaddheader.description:
Adds a header line of controls according to the HeaderTemplate class. It returns an array containing header index and array of created controls in  format:
[<headerIndex>, [<control0>, <control1>...<control n>]].

Note that rows and headers are indexed separately.

rank.name: rank
rank.description:
Returns the rank of the given unit. Rank can be one of the following:

* "PRIVATE"

* "CORPORAL"

* "SERGEANT"

* "LIEUTENANT"

* "CAPTAIN"

* "MAJOR"

* "COLONEL"

date.name: date
date.description: Return the actual in-mission date and time.

lnbsetpicturecolorselectedright.name: lnbSetPictureColorSelectedRight
lnbsetpicturecolorselectedright.description: Sets the color of the right picture when it is selected.

syntaxArray.Params:
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of the row
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of the column
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Color RGBA

ctrl: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of the row
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of the column
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Color RGBA

getvehiclecargo.name: getVehicleCargo
getvehiclecargo.description: Get a list of vehicles loaded as cargo inside this vehicle. The returned array is in the order the cargo vehicles were added to containing vehicle.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - vehicles loaded in storingVehicle, in order of their loading

examples:
```sqf
_vehicleCargo = getVehicleCargo blackfish; // returns [] if empty
```

```sqf
_vehicleCargo = getVehicleCargo blackfish; // returns [quad_3, quad_1, quad_2] as they were loaded in this order
```

saveprofilenamespace.name: saveProfileNamespace
saveprofilenamespace.description:
Saves all variables stored in [profileNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/profileNamespace) to the active [Profile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Profile).

> ⚠
> 
> * This command triggers a file operation. As file operations are slow (even on SSDs), it is not recommended to use this command too frequently (i.e. several times per second).
> 
> * Do not save large amounts of data to the profile; the larger the profile file gets, the slower it loads!
> 
> * The [profileNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/profileNamespace) is also saved when the game is closed.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Take_On_Helicopters)Heliport status, used in the Career mode for example, is stored in the file that is modified by this command, so be mindful of this to avoid losing data and progress.
examples:
```sqf
[profileNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/profileNamespace) [setVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVariable) ["TAG_lastPlayerLocation", [getPosASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPosASL) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)];
saveProfileNamespace;*// Optional since namespace is saved when game is closed*
```

lognetwork.name: logNetwork
lognetwork.description:
Registers new log file recording a network traffic and returns handle of the log. The log file is saved inside the Arma 3 root folder.
> ⚠logNetwork can potentially create a large log file.

syntaxArray.Params:
logFile: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Where to store the log
filter: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - ????

setconvoyseparation.name: setConvoySeparation
setconvoyseparation.description:
Sets the distance to keep to the vehicle which is **in front**.

* This command has to be applied to all vehicles in a convoy in order to have a separation of, for example, 50 m.

* Vehicles in a convoy can also have different distances.

* It's recommended that small values (<10m) should only be used for slowly moving convoys, otherwise AI driven vehicles will leave the road frequently to avoid collisions

remove3deneventhandler.name: remove3DENEventHandler
remove3deneventhandler.description:
Removes Eden Editor event handler of given type and ID.

See the list of all [Eden Editor Event Handlers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers:_Eden_Editor).

syntaxArray.Params:
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of event handler
id: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - ID of event handler, returned by [add3DENEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/add3DENEventHandler)

addmagazine.name: addMagazine
addmagazine.description:
Adds a magazine to a person. Infantry units can only carry a specific number of magazines, once the magazine slots are filled (or uniform/vest/bagpack are full in Arma 3), any further addMagazine commands are ignored. If class of magazine does not exist, an error message is printed in .rpt:

```sqf
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) addMagazine "dasdsa"; *// .rpt: Given magazine[dasdsa] not found)*
```

> ⓘUse addMagazine *before* [addWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addWeapon) for the weapon to be loaded with magazine automatically.

syntaxArray.Params:
unitName: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - person to add the magazines to
magazineName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - magazine name. See the topic [Category:Weapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Weapons) for reference about possible values.

unitName: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - person to add the magazines to
magazineName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - magazine name. See the topic [Category:Weapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Weapons) for reference about possible values.
ammoCount: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Ammo quantity to be added to magazine. If it goes beyond maximum magazine capacity, the magazine will be given full and not overloaded.

examples:
```sqf
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) addMagazine "30Rnd_556x45_STANAG";
```

```sqf
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) addMagazine ["30Rnd_556x45_STANAG", 15]; *// since Arma 2 OA 1.62*
```

```sqf
nonLocalUnit addMagazine ["30Rnd_556x45_STANAG", 15]; *// global argument since Arma 3*
```

```sqf
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) addMagazine ["30Rnd_556x45_STANAG", 9999]; *// will give a 30 rounds magazine anyway*
```

setside.name: setSide
setside.description: Sets a location's [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side). The default side is Unknown.

backpackspacefor.name: backpackSpaceFor
backpackspacefor.description: Returns how much space is in backpack for given weapon or magazine

removemenuitem.name: removeMenuItem
removemenuitem.description:
Removes a previously added menu item. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

syntaxArray.Params:
map: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) -
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - index of menu item to delete

getmass.name: getMass
getmass.description: Returns mass of a PhysX object.

createmine.name: createMine
createmine.description:
Creates a mine of the given type (type is the name of the subclass of CfgVehicles). If the markers array contains several marker names, the position of a random one is used, otherwise, the given position is used. The mine is placed inside a circle with this position as its center and placement as its radius. 
> ⓘThe command creates object of the CfgAmmo class named in [configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "CfgVehicles" >> type >> "ammo". The following explosives used in Arma 3 could be created with this command:
> 
> * Mines: "ATMine", "APERSMine", "APERSBoundingMine", "SLAMDirectionalMine", "APERSTripMine", "UnderwaterMine", "UnderwaterMineAB", "UnderwaterMinePDM"
> 
> * Remote detonation charges: "SatchelCharge_F", "DemoCharge_F", "Claymore_F", "IEDUrbanBig_F", "IEDLandBig_F", "IEDUrbanSmall_F", "IEDLandSmall_F"

syntaxArray.Params:
[type, position, markers, placement]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - mine type from CfgVehicles
position: [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL)
markers: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
placement: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - radius

missionversion.name: missionVersion
missionversion.description:
Returns the version of the current mission.

* Mission from the [2D Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/2D_Editor): 12

* Mission from the [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor): 15 and higher (for example current version for [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor) mission in Arma 3 v1.57 is 51)

hudmovementlevels.name: HUDMovementLevels
hudmovementlevels.description: Returns movement borders for HUD [min speed, max speed, min alt, max alt, min dir, max dir, position[x,y,z] or target]

cursorobject.name: cursorObject
cursorobject.description: Returns the object under cursor. This command is quite different from [cursorTarget](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cursorTarget) as it is more precise in determining the boundaries of the pointed at object and can detect a larger variety of objects including map objects and trees.

allactivetitleeffects.name: allActiveTitleEffects
allactivetitleeffects.description:
Returns a list of all layers that have currently active title effect. Numbers equal to or greater than 0 represent cut layers, where as -1 represents title layer (see [Title Effect Type](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Title_Effect_Type)). Named layers are represented by their respective index.
> ⓘEffects created with [titleText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/titleText), [titleRsc](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/titleRsc) and [titleObj](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/titleObj) commands do not have a numbered layer, so they are represented as -1 layer in the result. Effects created with [cutText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cutText), [cutRsc](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cutRsc) and [cutObj](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cutObj) are created either on layer 0, if no layer is specified, or on the given layer, if the layer index is specified, so they are represented by the layer index.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number), where each number represents index of currently active effect layer.

titlefadeout.name: titleFadeOut
titlefadeout.description: Terminate the title effect and set duration of the fade out phase to the given time. Same as [cutFadeOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cutFadeOut) but for the title layer.

tvisselected.name: tvIsSelected
tvisselected.description: Returns true if given treeview item is selected.

lbclear.name: lbClear
lbclear.description: Clear all items from a [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTBOX) or [CT_COMBO](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_COMBO) control.

displayctrl.name: displayCtrl
displayctrl.description: Return child control with specified idc.

ctrlsetfonth2b.name: ctrlSetFontH2B
ctrlsetfonth2b.description: Sets H2 bold font of given HTML control.

setammocargo.name: setAmmoCargo
setammocargo.description:
Set amount of ammo resources in cargo space of a rearm vehicle. Ammo resource is used to resupply vehicles that take ammo. Soldiers use individual magazines instead. Amount: 1 is full cargo.

The actual **quantity** to work with is determined by the model's class in [CfgVehicles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgVehicles)

setpilotcamerarotation.name: setPilotCameraRotation
setpilotcamerarotation.description: Sets rotation (relative to the centered camera position) of the object airplane or helicopter [pilotCamera](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/A3_Targeting_config_reference#class_pilotCamera) .

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
rotation: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [x,y] - format [yaw (turn), pitch (elevation)]. Values are in radians, positive values are left yaw and down pitch from the center.

setobjectarguments.name: setObjectArguments
setobjectarguments.description:
Set object arguments in mission editor.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

querymagazinepool.name: queryMagazinePool
querymagazinepool.description: Return number of magazines of type name in magazine pool (used in campaign to transfer magazines into next mission).

creatediarylink.name: createDiaryLink
creatediarylink.description: Creates a link to the section of diary given by subject. Record is selected based on given object, diary record or task.
examples: Creates a link to the section of diary given by subject. Record is selected based on given object, diary record or task.

textlog.name: textLog
textlog.description:
Dump argument value to debugging output. 
> ⚠This command is non-functional in the retail version

debuglog.name: debugLog
debuglog.description:
Dump argument type and value to debugging output. 

> ⚠This command is non-functional in the retail version

ctrlanimatemodel.name: ctrlAnimateModel
ctrlanimatemodel.description: Process an animation of 3D [Arma: GUI Configuration](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma:_GUI_Configuration). Command uses name defined by source property and works similar like [animateSource](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animateSource) command.

syntaxArray.Params:
control : [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - 3D control
[source, phase]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
source: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - common source
phase: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - wanted animation phase

slidersetspeed.name: sliderSetSpeed
slidersetspeed.description:
Sets speed of [CT_SLIDER](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_SLIDER) or [CT_XSLIDER](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_XSLIDER) with given idc of topmost user [dialog](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/dialog). 

* Click to arrow - move by line

* Click to scale outside thumb - move by page.

syntaxArray.Params:
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Control's idc
line: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Value delta to move the slider when clicking on the outer arrows
page: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Value delta to move the slider when clicking inside the slider bar

control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
line: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Value delta to move the slider when clicking on the outer arrows
page: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Value delta to move the slider when clicking inside the slider bar

diag_deltatime.name: diag_deltaTime
diag_deltatime.description: Returns the duration of the previous frame in seconds

deleteat.name: deleteAt
deleteat.description: Removes array element at the given index and returns removed element (modifies the original array, just like [resize](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/resize) or [set](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/set)). Will not issue error when -1 index is passed making it ideal for using with [find](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/find)(see Example 2) or [findIf](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findIf)(see Example 3) command
examples:
```sqf
_arr = [1,2,3];
_rem = _arr deleteAt 1;
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [_rem, _arr]; //[2,[1,3]]
```

```sqf
_arr = [1,2,3];
_arr deleteAt (_arr [find](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/find) 0); // non existent item
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) _arr; // [1,2,3]
_arr deleteAt (_arr [find](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/find) 2); // existent item
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) _arr; // [1,3]
```

```sqf
_arr = [1,2,3];
_arr deleteAt (_arr [findIf](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findIf) {(_x [%](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/%25) 5) [==](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/%3D%3D) 0}); // Remove first number that's divisible by 5
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) _arr; // [1,2,3]
_arr deleteAt (_arr [findIf](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findIf) {(_x [%](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/%25) 2) [==](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/%3D%3D) 0}); // Remove first number that's divisible by 2
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) _arr; // [1,3]
```

checkaifeature.name: checkAIFeature
checkaifeature.description:
Checks if the given AI feature is currently enabled. Feature may be one of:

* "AwareFormationSoft"

* "CombatFormationSoft"

* [disableAI](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/disableAI)/[enableAI](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/enableAI) AI skill *Since Arma 3 v1.95.145843*

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit to test AI feature for
feature: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [disableAI](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/disableAI) / [enableAI](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/enableAI) feature

isobjectrtd.name: isObjectRTD
isobjectrtd.description: Returns true if RTD model is loaded.> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

dofollow.name: doFollow
dofollow.description: Order the given unit(s) to follow the given other unit or vehicle eg (without radio messages). Also is used to resume unit formation after [doStop](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/doStop), just doFollow leader even if it is the leader himself you want to resume (see Example 2).

ctrlstyle.name: ctrlStyle
ctrlstyle.description: Returns the provided control's style. See [Arma: GUI Configuration - Control Styles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma:_GUI_Configuration#Control_Styles).

clearoverlay.name: clearOverlay
clearoverlay.description:
Clear the current overlay.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

setdriveonpath.name: setDriveOnPath
setdriveonpath.description:
Sets the path to follow for AI driver. Note that [unitReady](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/unitReady) will return [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) even if AI is still driving through the points.
Using any other *move* command (e.g 
```sqf
vehicleName [move](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/move) [getPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPos) vehicleName
```
) or [doStop](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/doStop) will stop the effect of this command.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicleName: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
points: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - list of [Positions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) to format [x,y,z] OR to format [x,y,z, speed], speed being **in m/s**.

examples:
```sqf
myVehicle setDriveOnPath [[getMarkerPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getMarkerPos) "wp1", [getMarkerPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getMarkerPos) "wp2"];
```

```sqf
_points = [allMapMarkers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/allMapMarkers) [apply](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/apply) { [getMarkerPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getMarkerPos) _x; }; *// getting all marker positions*
{ [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x) [pushBack](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/pushBack) 15; } forEach _points; *// setting [speed](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/speed)*
myVehicle setDriveOnPath _points;
```

enableautotrimrtd.name: enableAutoTrimRTD
enableautotrimrtd.description:
Toggle auto-trim for RTD helicopters. 
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

syntaxArray.Params:
helicopterRTD: [ObjectRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ObjectRTD) - helicopter
enable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - enable or disable

setwaypointformation.name: setWaypointFormation
setwaypointformation.description:
Switches the group formation when the waypoint becomes active.


Possible values are: 

* "NO CHANGE"

* "COLUMN"

* "STAG COLUMN"

* "WEDGE"

* "ECH LEFT"

* "ECH RIGHT"

* "VEE"

* "LINE"

* "FILE"

* "DIAMOND"

diag_ticktime.name: diag_tickTime
diag_ticktime.description: Real time in seconds spent from the start of the game. On Windows the command uses [timeGetTime](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/timeapi/nf-timeapi-timegettime).

syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Time in seconds from game start

ppeffectcreate.name: ppEffectCreate
ppeffectcreate.description:
Creates [Post process effects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Post_process_effects) specified by effect name and priority. Supported effects are:


* ["RadialBlur"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Post_process_effects#RadialBlur)

* ["ChromAberration"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Post_process_effects#ChromAberration)

* ["WetDistortion"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Post_process_effects#WetDistortion)

* ["ColorCorrections"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Post_process_effects#ColorCorrections)

* ["DynamicBlur"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Post_process_effects#DynamicBlur)

* ["FilmGrain"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Post_process_effects#FilmGrain)

* ["ColorInversion"](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Post_process_effects#ColorInversion)

syntaxArray.Params:
[name, priority]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of effect type.
priority: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - unique priority, defines order of applying effect to the scene. If there is another effect using the same priority, creation will fail.

[name1, priority1]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of effect type.
priority: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - unique priority, defines order of applying effect to the scene. If there is another effect using the same priority, creation will fail.

nextweatherchange.name: nextWeatherChange
nextweatherchange.description:
Return the remaining time (in seconds) over which the current weather change will occur.

When a weather change finishes, the game engine will automatically generate a new random weather change over a realistic time period (minimum of 90 minutes).

lbcursel.name: lbCurSel
lbcursel.description: Returns the index of the selected item of the [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTBOX), [CT_COMBO](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_COMBO) or [CT_TOOLBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_TOOLBOX). For [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTBOX) with multi selection enabled use [lbSelection](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lbSelection).

syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Selected index (row) or -1 if nothing is selected
[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Selected index (row) or -1 if nothing is selected

parsetext.name: parseText
parsetext.description:
Creates a structured text by parsing the given XML description. Do not use parseText when displaying a localized text from [Stringtable.xml](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Stringtable.xml).
A detailed explanation of all formatting possibilities can be found at [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text).

nearestterrainobjects.name: nearestTerrainObjects
nearestterrainobjects.description:
Returns a list of nearest terrain objects of the given types to the given position or object, within the specified distance. If more than one object is found they will be ordered according to 3D distance to the object (i.e. the closest one will be first in the array). In contrast to [nearestObjects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nearestObjects) this command returns terrain placed objects like trees, rocks and buildings which don't necessarily need an associated config class. Possible type names:"TREE", "SMALL TREE", "BUSH", "BUILDING", "HOUSE", "FOREST BORDER", "FOREST TRIANGLE", "FOREST SQUARE", "CHURCH", "CHAPEL", "CROSS", "BUNKER", "FORTRESS", "FOUNTAIN", "VIEW-TOWER", "LIGHTHOUSE", "QUAY", "FUELSTATION", "HOSPITAL", "FENCE", "WALL", "HIDE", "BUSSTOP", "ROAD", "FOREST", "TRANSMITTER", "STACK", "RUIN", "TOURISM", "WATERTOWER", "TRACK", "MAIN ROAD", "ROCK", "ROCKS", "POWER LINES", "RAILWAY", "POWERSOLAR", "POWERWAVE", "POWERWIND", "SHIPWRECK", "TRAIL" Since Arma 3 v1.62 it is possible to switch the sorting algorithm off by providing optional param, which significantly increases the performance of this command, especially if the search is performed with large radius. Since Arma 3 v1.66 it is possible to switch search and sorting mode between 2D and 3D. Since Arma 3 v2.00 this command also returns missing roads: "ROAD", "MAIN ROAD", "TRACK", "TRAIL" [Terrain object counts](https://community.bistudio.com#) > ⓘTypes which are missing are not present in the given world. [Virtual Reality](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Virtual_Reality) has no terrain objects. Last updated [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[1.99](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki?title=Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_1.99&action=edit&redlink=1) * BUSH: 47974 * CHAPEL: 2 * CROSS: 1 * FENCE: 1728 * FUELSTATION: 3 * HIDE: 70975 * HOUSE: 684 * LIGHTHOUSE: 3 * ROAD: 143 * ROCK: 820 * SHIPWRECK: 11 * TRACK: 2063 * TRANSMITTER: 11 * TREE: 40110 * WALL: 1355 * WATERTOWER: 1 * BUSH: 747193 * CHAPEL: 165 * CHURCH: 54 * CROSS: 48 * FENCE: 47940 * FUELSTATION: 32 * HIDE: 655958 * HOSPITAL: 1 * HOUSE: 17472 * LIGHTHOUSE: 7 * MAIN ROAD: 2061 * POWER LINES: 2224 * POWERSOLAR: 10 * POWERWAVE: 51 * POWERWIND: 128 * ROAD: 4849 * ROCK: 5483 * RUIN: 3 * SHIPWRECK: 43 * TOURISM: 1 * TRACK: 26823 * TRANSMITTER: 23 * TREE: 263630 * WALL: 38943 * WATERTOWER: 10 * BUSH: 288461 * BUSSTOP: 45 * CHAPEL: 14 * CHURCH: 14 * CROSS: 16 * FENCE: 11189 * FUELSTATION: 24 * HIDE: 192553 * HOUSE: 4062 * LIGHTHOUSE: 15 * MAIN ROAD: 1050 * POWER LINES: 3427 * POWERSOLAR: 1 * ROAD: 1442 * ROCK: 3513 * SHIPWRECK: 23 * TRACK: 3489 * TRANSMITTER: 7 * TREE: 101960 * WALL: 14189 * WATERTOWER: 63 * BUSH: 754347 * CHURCH: 21 * FENCE: 2912 * FUELSTATION: 85 * HIDE: 356904 * HOUSE: 13389 * MAIN ROAD: 2921 * POWER LINES: 3985 * POWERSOLAR: 2 * POWERWIND: 19 * RAILWAY: 2138 * ROAD: 1485 * ROCK: 8909 * SHIPWRECK: 58 * TOURISM: 35 * TRACK: 9419 * TRAIL: 6936 * TRANSMITTER: 16 * TREE: 506993 * WALL: 20526 * WATERTOWER: 73 * BUILDING: 1262 * BUNKER: 40 * BUSH: 473543 * BUSSTOP: 73 * CHAPEL: 8 * CHURCH: 17 * FENCE: 48426 * FOUNTAIN: 36 * FUELSTATION: 7 * HIDE: 474123 * HOUSE: 6762 * MAIN ROAD: 2118 * POWER LINES: 2671 * POWERSOLAR: 2 * POWERWIND: 1 * RAILWAY: 843 * ROAD: 5378 * ROCK: 744 * SHIPWRECK: 4 * STACK: 11 * TRACK: 12834 * TRANSMITTER: 15 * TREE: 1881630 * VIEW-TOWER: 239 * WALL: 4418 * WATERTOWER: 7 * BUILDING: 5072 * BUSH: 731315 * BUSSTOP: 106 * CHAPEL: 13 * CHURCH: 21 * FENCE: 83908 * FUELSTATION: 9 * HIDE: 231818 * HOUSE: 4562 * MAIN ROAD: 1535 * POWER LINES: 1958 * RAILWAY: 2324 * ROAD: 8740 * STACK: 18 * TRACK: 24372 * TRANSMITTER: 1 * TREE: 829449 * VIEW-TOWER: 34 * BUILDING: 5072 * BUSH: 519827 * BUSSTOP: 106 * CHAPEL: 13 * CHURCH: 21 * FENCE: 83908 * FUELSTATION: 9 * HIDE: 229792 * HOUSE: 4562 * MAIN ROAD: 1535 * POWER LINES: 1958 * RAILWAY: 2324 * ROAD: 8740 * STACK: 18 * TRACK: 24372 * TRANSMITTER: 1 * TREE: 829449 * VIEW-TOWER: 34 [] spawn { private _types = ["TREE", "SMALL TREE", "BUSH", "BUILDING", "HOUSE", "FOREST BORDER", "FOREST TRIANGLE", "FOREST SQUARE", "CHURCH", "CHAPEL", "CROSS", "BUNKER", "FORTRESS", "FOUNTAIN", "VIEW-TOWER", "LIGHTHOUSE", "QUAY", "FUELSTATION", "HOSPITAL", "FENCE", "WALL", "HIDE", "BUSSTOP", "ROAD", "FOREST", "TRANSMITTER", "STACK", "RUIN", "TOURISM", "WATERTOWER", "TRACK", "MAIN ROAD", "ROCK", "ROCKS", "POWER LINES", "RAILWAY", "POWERSOLAR", "POWERWAVE", "POWERWIND", "SHIPWRECK", "TRAIL"]; _types sort true; private _counts = []; private _countTypes = count _types; ["R3vo_GetNearestTerrainObjects",""] call BIS_fnc_startLoadingScreen; { private _terrainObjects = nearestTerrainObjects [ [worldSize / 2, worldSize / 2], [_x], worldSize, false ]; if (count _terrainObjects > 0) then { _counts pushBack [_x,count _terrainObjects]; }; ((_forEachIndex + 1) / _countTypes) call BIS_fnc_progressLoadingScreen; } forEach _types; "R3vo_GetNearestTerrainObjects" call BIS_fnc_endLoadingScreen; private _export = "[[" + getText (configFile >> "CfgWorlds" >> worldName >> "description") + "]]" + endl + '
'; { _export = _export + endl + "* " + (_x # 0) + ": " + (str (_x # 1)); } forEach _counts; _export = _export + endl + "
"; copyToClipboard _export; };

syntaxArray.Params:
position:  [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) or [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) - where to find objects, center position
types: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - list of case-insensitive types of the objects to search for. [] to search without filters
radius: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - range from center position to search for objects
sort: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) sort objects by distance to the center or not *Since Arma 3 v1.61.136035*
2Dmode: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) the object search and sorting mode: [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) - 2D, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) - 3D *Since Arma 3 v1.65.138818*

deletegroup.name: deleteGroup
deletegroup.description:
Destroys the given group. Group must be empty and local to the machine executing command. 

> ⓘIn Arma 3 you can find out locality of the group with [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) command, unlike with previous games. However [owner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/owner) and [setOwner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setOwner) dont work with groups anywhere. The group will always be local to the client that created it, until the client disconnects, then the group becomes local to the server. So if you need to delete a group, delete all members first then execute deleteGroup where is it [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local).
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)In Arma 3 when last unit leaves a group, the group gets [auto deleted](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Talk:deleteGroup#group_auto_becoming_null). Manually deleting all units from a group however, does not auto delete the empty group. To force the group to get auto-deleted when empty use [deleteGroupWhenEmpty](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/deleteGroupWhenEmpty)

lnbsetcurselrow.name: lnbSetCurSelRow
lnbsetcurselrow.description: Selects the row with the given index of the 2D listbox.

unitsbelowheight.name: unitsBelowHeight
unitsbelowheight.description:
Returns units in group/array below given Above Terrain Level (ATL) height.
> ⓘunit's ATL height can be found with 
> ```sqf
> _height = ([getPosATL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPosATL) _unit) [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 2;
> ```
>

syntaxArray.Params:
units: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
height: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - height above terrain level ([PositionATL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionATL))

group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - AI group
height: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - height above terrain level ([PositionATL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionATL))

isautotest.name: isAutotest
isautotest.description: Returns true if game was started with autotest parameter

lbsetdata.name: lbSetData
lbsetdata.description:
Sets the additional text (invisible) in the item with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user [dialog](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/dialog) to the given data.

> ⓘSee more information on the [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTBOX) command family [here](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTBOX#Scripting_Example).

createvehiclelocal.name: createVehicleLocal
createvehiclelocal.description: Creates an object of the given type. Created object is not transferred through network in MP games. [netId](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/netId) of such vehicle in multiplayer will be "0:0". To disable local vehicle creation, use [CfgDisabledCommands](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgDisabledCommands) to blacklist this command. Alternatively, you can use [createSimpleObject](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createSimpleObject) with local option enabled where applicable.

markerchannel.name: markerChannel
markerchannel.description: Returns the channel that a marker belongs to.

onbriefingteamswitch.name: onBriefingTeamSwitch
onbriefingteamswitch.description: Select a sound defined in the [CfgSounds](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgSounds) of the mission to be played the first time the TeamSwitch tab is selected in the [briefing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Briefing.html).

round.name: round
round.description: Rounds **x** up or down to the closest integer.
examples:
```sqf
round 5.25; *// Result is 5*
```

```sqf
round [-](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/-)5.25; *// Result is -5*
```

useaisteeringcomponent.name: useAISteeringComponent
useaisteeringcomponent.description: Enable the new [AI driving](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://forums.bistudio.com/topic/191515-ai-driving-feedback-topic/), used to test the old and new AI driving.

forceweaponfire.name: forceWeaponFire
forceweaponfire.description: The unit will be forced to fire weapon from the given muzzle. The weapon will not fire if firemode passed as parameter is not supported by the given muzzle. The muzzle could belong to a vehicle weapon and unit in this case will be the unit operating this weapon. Doesnt't seem to work for units in FFV positions. Works on [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player). See also: [BIS_fnc_fire](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_fire)

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit alone or in vehicle
muzzle: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
firemode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Common options are "Single", "Burst", "FullAuto". For the full list of a weapon firemodes:


```sqf
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) ([getArray](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getArray) ([configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "CfgWeapons" >> [currentWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/currentWeapon) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) >> "modes"));
```
 If *modes[]* param in config for the weapon says *{"this"}*, then the same classname as for the weapon param ([currentWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/currentWeapon) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)) should be used as firemode param.

ctrlsetactivecolor.name: ctrlSetActiveColor
ctrlsetactivecolor.description: Sets text color of given control when control is selected.

allcurators.name: allCurators
allcurators.description: Returns list of all curator logic units, not the units assigned to the logic.

taskalwaysvisible.name: taskAlwaysVisible
taskalwaysvisible.description: Returns true if the task is flagged to be always visible or false if not.

pushback.name: pushBack
pushback.description: Insert an element to the back of the given array. This command modifies the original array. (see also: [pushBackUnique](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/pushBackUnique))

menuchecked.name: menuChecked
menuchecked.description: Returns if item on given path is checked or not.

time.name: time
time.description: Returns time elapsed since mission started (in seconds). The value is different on each client. If you need unified time, use [serverTime](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/serverTime).
examples:
```sqf
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _future = time + 30;
[waitUntil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/waitUntil) { time >= _future };  *// continue after 30 seconds*
```
Wait until mission fully started:

```sqf
[waitUntil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/waitUntil) { time > 0 };
```

lbvalue.name: lbValue
lbvalue.description: Returns the additional integer value of the item with the given index of the [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTBOX) or [CT_COMBO](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_COMBO).

seteffectivecommander.name: setEffectiveCommander
seteffectivecommander.description: Sets [effectiveCommander](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/effectiveCommander) of the given vehicle. Effective commander is the person who commands the vehicle, i.e. gives commands to the driver. Every time a person gets in or out of a vehicle, effective commander eligibility is recalculated by the engine based on the current [crew](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/crew). Use this command to force desired effective commander. In multiplayer, execute globally.

tvpicture.name: tvPicture
tvpicture.description: Returns name of picture from item pointed to by path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

removeallmpeventhandlers.name: removeAllMPEventHandlers
removeallmpeventhandlers.description: Removes all MP event handlers of the given type which were added by [addMPEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addMPEventHandler). Command needs to be executed only on one PC for MP event handler to be removed globally.

velocity.name: velocity
velocity.description: Returns the velocity of the object as vector in m/s.

loadoverlay.name: loadOverlay
loadoverlay.description:
Creates the load overlay dialog for the specified type of overlay.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

hmd.name: hmd
hmd.description: Returns class name of currently used Head Mounted Display. Returns an empty string if the slot is empty.

diag_dynamicsimulationend.name: diag_dynamicSimulationEnd
diag_dynamicsimulationend.description: Ends dynamic simulation stats gathering and writes it into given file.

moonintensity.name: moonIntensity
moonintensity.description: Returns the intensity of the moon's brightness in range 0...1.

in.name: in
in.description:
Checks whether value is in array, unit is in vehicle, position is inside location or ANSI string is part of other ANSI string. If Unicode support is desired, see [forceUnicode](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forceUnicode).
> ⓘ[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) comparison is case-sensitive (see Examples **2** and **6**).

syntaxArray.Params:
value: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - Any value (cannot  match [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) before Arma 3)
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array of values

unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Entity person
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Entity vehicle

needle: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - String to search **for**
haystack: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - String to search **in**

examples:
```sqf
1 in [0, 1, 2]; *// true*
```

```sqf
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _myArray = ["Aaa", "AAa", "AAA"];

"aaa" in _myArray; *// false*
"AAa" in _myArray; *// true*

*// case-insensitive alternatives*
_myArray [findIf](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findIf) { _x == "aaa"; } != -1;		*// true*

({
	[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) ([_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x) == "aaa") [exitWith](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/exitWith) { [_forEachIndex](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#forEachIndex) };
	-1
} [forEach](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forEach) _myArray) != -1;					*// true, less performant but valid before [findIf](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findIf)*

{ [if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) ([_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x) == "aaa") [exitWith](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/exitWith) {1} } [count](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/count) _myArray > 0;	*// true*

{ [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x) == "aaa"; } [count](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/count) _myArray > 0;		*// true, worst performance*
											*// only option available in OFP*
```

```sqf
[1,2,3] in [[1,2,3], [4,5,6]]; *// true - [Arma 3](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3) only*
```

```sqf
_isInCar = [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) in car;
```

```sqf
_isInside = [1000,2000,0] in myLocation;
```

```sqf
_isInString = "foo" in "foobar"; *// true*
_isInString = "Foo" in "foobar"; *// false*
```

```sqf
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _onFoot = _unit in _unit;
*// [vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) _unit == _unit works*
*// [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) [objectParent](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objectParent) _unit is even faster*
```

groupiconsvisible.name: groupIconsVisible
groupiconsvisible.description: Returns array with group icons visibility. A getter for [setGroupIconsVisible](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setGroupIconsVisible)

abs.name: abs
abs.description: Returns absolute (positive) value of a real number.

atan2.name: atan2
atan2.description:
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:atan.jpg) ArcTangent of *x/y*. Used to determine the angle of a vector *[x,y]*. Result in [Degrees](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number#Degrees) between -180 and 180.
> ⓘThis command can handle *y* being 0, unlike when using [atan](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/atan), and will return 90
> ⚠Even though this command is a binary operator just like [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) command, it has [ higher precedence](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQF_Syntax#Rules_of_Precedence) than [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) command, therefore the following expression: _pos select 0 atan2 (_pos select 1) will produce an error. The correct usage in this case will be: (_pos select 0) atan2 (_pos select 1)
examples:
```sqf
_xy = [5,3];
_degrees = (_xy [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 0) atan2 (_xy [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 1); *// 59.0362*
```
Get direction from _obj1 to _obj2:
```sqf
_vd = [getPosASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPosASL) _obj2 [vectorDiff](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorDiff) [getPosASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPosASL) _obj1;
_dir = (_vd [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 0) atan2 (_vd [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 1); *// _dir range from -180 to +180*
[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) (_dir < 0) [then](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/then) {_dir = 360 + _dir}; *// _dir range from 0 to 360*
```
Get relative direction from _obj1 to _obj2:
```sqf
_xy = _obj1 [worldToModel](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/worldToModel) [getPosASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPosASL) _obj2;
_dir = (_xy [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 0) atan2 (_xy [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 1); *// _dir range from -180 to +180*
[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) (_dir < 0) [then](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/then) {_dir = 360 + _dir}; *// _dir range from 0 to 360*
```

setmissiletarget.name: setMissileTarget
setmissiletarget.description: Sets a guided missile target. Doesn't work for all types of missiles. If target is dead, target is ignored. The target has to be inside configured missile targeting cone for command to work.

addeventhandler.name: addEventHandler
addeventhandler.description:
Adds an Event Handler to the given object.

* You can add as many Event Handlers of any type as you like to every unit. Existing Event Handlers do not get overwritten.

* Use [removeEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/removeEventHandler) to remove an Event Handler.
Read [Event Handlers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Event_Handlers) for more information and a list of all available Event Handlers.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - See [Event Handlers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Event_Handlers) for the full list of available options.
code: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Code that should be executed when the Event Handler is triggered; executed in [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace) by default.

* Event Handler parameters are accessible via the _this inside the code

* Since Arma 3 v.1.64 the Event Handler index is available as _thisEventHandler during Event Handler code execution
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The index of the added Event Handler. Indices start at 0 for each unit and increment with each added Event Handler.

disablecollisionwith.name: disableCollisionWith
disablecollisionwith.description:
Disable collision between vehicles. This command doesn't disable collision between PhysX objects.
> ⚠Command has to be executed where objects are [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local), and as long as they don't change locality, the effect of this command will be global.
> If the two objects are not local to the same computer, then it has to be executed on both computers to achieve the desired effect.
> 
> If one or both objects change locality, the command needs to be executed again on the new [owner](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/owner)'s machine(s) to maintain the effect.

removeweaponturret.name: removeWeaponTurret
removeweaponturret.description: Removes weapon from the turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

setpos.name: setPos
setpos.description: Sets object position. The position is clamped to the bound of minXYZ: [-50k,-50k,-50k]; maxXYZ: [500k,500k,500k] (See [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position))

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
pos: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - position in format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) or [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D)

respawnvehicle.name: respawnVehicle
respawnvehicle.description:
Sets vehicle as respawnable in MP game. The vehicle will be spawned at the locality and coordinates it was prior to destruction. If respawn type is set to base respawn (type 3) and vehicle respawn marker is provided (respawn_vehicle_XXXSIDEXXX), vehicle will spawn on the marker. 

> ⓘCommand has to be executed where vehicle is [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local)

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[delay, count]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
delay: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Delay in seconds between respawns. (-1 to use *respawnDelay* from [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext))
count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (Optional) - How many times to respawn vehicle in total. (0 - unlimited respawns)

examples:
```sqf
car respawnVehicle [5, 3];
```


'car' will respawn at the predefined marker for the [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/side) after 5 seconds. The unit will respawn 3 times.

```sqf
car respawnVehicle [30];
```


'car' will respawn at the predefined marker for the [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/side) after 30 seconds. The unit will respawn an unlimited number of times.

mapanimadd.name: mapAnimAdd
mapanimadd.description: Add next frame to map animation.

syntaxArray.Params:
[time, zoom, position]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
time: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - animation duration in seconds
zoom: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - range from 0.01 (max. zoom) to 1 (zoomed out)
position: [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

lookat.name: lookAt
