syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [False](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if the key is new to the hashmap, [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if a value got overwritten

examples:
```sqf
_arrayOne set [0, "Hello"];
```
Append "Bye" as last element to _arrayTwo:

```sqf
_arrayTwo set [[count](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/count) _arrayTwo, "Bye"];
```
Replace the last element of _arrayThree with 23:

```sqf
_arrayThree set [([count](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/count) _arrayThree) - 1, 23];
```
Using set with an index that is out of bounds:

```sqf
_array = ["A"];
_array set [2, "C"]; *// _array is now ["A", [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil), "C"]*
_array set [1, "B"]; *// _array is now ["A", "B", "C"]*

```

get3denentity.name: get3DENEntity
get3denentity.description: Returns [Eden Entity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Entity) based on its [Eden ID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_ID). If the ID points to a layer or a comment, the ID will be returned instead.

syntaxArray.Return: [Eden Entity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Entity) (when the target is [Eden Entity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Entity)) or [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (when the target is a layer or a comment)

getcameraviewdirection.name: getCameraViewDirection
getcameraviewdirection.description: Returns the direction unit is looking in render time scope. While for AI the origin for the view direction vector can be taken from [eyePos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/eyePos) unit, for human player the origin should be taken from player camera position [positionCameraToWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/positionCameraToWorld) [0,0,0]

briefingname.description: Returns the name of the current briefing/scenario name.

lnbsettooltip.name: lnbSetTooltip
lnbsettooltip.description:
Sets tooltip on the item with the given row and column of [CT_LISTNBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTNBOX).
> ⚠By default, tooltips are added for all columns no matter what column index is provided. This behaviour can be overwritten since [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)[2.02](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Arma_3_version_2.02) by setting the control's property 
> ```sqf
> tooltipPerColumn
> ```
>  to 
> ```sqf
> [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)
> ```
> . See [CT_LISTNBOX documentation](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTNBOX#tooltipPerColumn).

syntaxArray.Params:
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Control's IDC
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Row where the tooltip should be shown
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Column where tooltip should be shown. By default it is set for every column, see description
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Tooltip text

ctrl: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - Control
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Row where the tooltip should be shown
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Column where tooltip should be shown. By default it is set for every column, see description
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Tooltip text

distributionregion.name: distributionRegion
distributionregion.description:
Returns the numerical index for the distribution region of this copy of [Armed Assault](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Armed_Assault).

* USA

* Rest of the world

diag_localized.name: diag_localized
diag_localized.description: Returns array with all [localized](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/localize) keys from the given [ stringtable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Stringtable.xml) or the array of all stringtables names if empty string "" is given. Common stringtables are: "Global", "Mission", "Campaign".

iskeyactive.name: isKeyActive
iskeyactive.description:
Checks whether the given key is active in the current user profile.

See keys, keysLimit and doneKeys in the [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#keys) file of the missions.

revealmine.name: revealMine
revealmine.description: Sets given mine as known to the side. (Knowledge about a mine is always shared across all units in a side.)

setammo.name: setAmmo
setammo.description: Sets custom ammo count in the currently loaded magazine of the specified weapon or muzzle.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Gunner or vehicle.
weaponOrMuzzle: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Weapon name. Muzzle name in case the weapon has more than one muzzle, e.g. weapon with grenade launcher. See [CfgWeapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Weapons) for muzzle names
count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

supportinfo.name: supportInfo
supportinfo.description:
Creates a list of supported operators and type. Each field of array has the format: "x:name" Where x can be:

* 't' - type

* 'n' - [nullar](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQF_Syntax#Nular_Operators) operator

* 'u' - [unary](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQF_Syntax#Unary_Operators) operator

* 'b' - [binary](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQF_Syntax#Binary_Operators) operator.

'name' is the operator or type name (in case operator, type of input operands is included). 
*mask* parameter can be an empty string, or one of field. In this case, function returns empty array, if operator is not included in the list. Limited wildcard support is available. Type *x* may be replaced with ***, meaning all types. For the *mask* partial match may be used, like *abc**, meaning any operators starting with 'abc' are reported, for example: 

* "" - list all types and commands

* "t:*" - list all types

* "*:<command>*" - list all entries for script *<command>*

* "i:<command>" - extended information about script *<command>*, [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) in format:*Since Arma 3 v1.99146528*[type, lowerCaseName, camelCaseName, description, example, result, resultType, leftArgType, rightArgType, syntax (*since Arma 3 v2.01.146751*)]
> ⓘ"i:*" is not a wildcard but returns information about the [multiplication operator](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/a_*_b) instead.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array with requested info or empty array []

examples:
```sqf
supportInfo "b:select*"; *// returns ["b:ARRAY select SCALAR","b:ARRAY select BOOL","b:CONFIG select SCALAR"]*
```
Return all available commands: 
```sqf
_commands = supportInfo "";
```

setuseractiontext.name: setUserActionText
setuseractiontext.description:
Changes user added action (see [addAction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addAction)) menu item text. 

Since Arma 3 v1.62 it is possible to set 2 more optional texts, one for background and one for foreground when action is displayed on the screen (*showWindow* = [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true))
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:setUserActionText.jpg)

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object the action is added to
[actionIndex, textMenu, textWindowBackground, textWindowForeground] : [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
actionIndex: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - action id returned by [addAction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addAction)
textMenu: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) - Text title shown in scroll action menu
textWindowBackground (Optional): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) - Text displayed at background (*Since Arma 3 v1.62*)
textWindowForeground (Optional): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) - Text displayed at foreground (*Since Arma 3 v1.62*)

ctrlmapworldtoscreen.name: ctrlMapWorldToScreen
ctrlmapworldtoscreen.description: Converts world coordinates into map screen coordinates. This command is identical to [posWorldToScreen](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/posWorldToScreen).

syntaxArray.Params:
control : [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - map control
position : [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - world position in format [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) or [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D)

campreparefov.name: camPrepareFov
campreparefov.description: Prepares the camera field of view (zoom). The default zoom level is 0.75, 0.01 is the nearest and 2 the furthest zoom value. The angle of the field of view is *atan(FOV)*2* radians when in 4:3 aspect ratio. Needs the call of [camCommitPrepared](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCommitPrepared) to be conducted.

movetofailed.name: moveToFailed
movetofailed.description: Check if latest low level [moveTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveTo) command failed.

channelenabled.name: channelEnabled
channelenabled.description:
Returns [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Booleans](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) in format [enabledChat, enabledVoN] for the given channel. For more information about enabling/disabling of chat channels see [enableChannel](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/enableChannel).


[channel ID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Channel_IDs) number correspondence

examples:
```sqf
_isGlobalChatEnabled = (channelEnabled 0) [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 0; *// check if user can use text on global channel*
```

```sqf
_isGlobalVoiceEnabled = (channelEnabled 0) [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 1; *// check if user can use the VoN on global channel*
```

```sqf
(channelEnabled 0) [params](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/params) ["_isGlobalChatEnabled", "_isGlobalVoiceEnabled"]; *// sets both variables*
```

globalradio.name: globalRadio
globalradio.description:
Sends the audio message to the global radio channel. The message is defined in CfgRadio in the [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext) file or config radio protocol. The transmission will play only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the transmission to play on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see [remoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExec)).
Note:  When transmitting unit gets killed, transmission will be interrupted, however when receiving unit gets killed, the transmission continues to play.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit to transmit
radioName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class name from CfgRadio

damage.name: damage
damage.description: Return the damage value of an object.

lnbdeletecolumn.name: lnbDeleteColumn
lnbdeletecolumn.description: Removes column with given index from ListNBox control.

enablediaglegend.name: enableDiagLegend
enablediaglegend.description: Enable or disable the legend for diagnostics. **Internal dev only!**

processdiarylink.name: processDiaryLink
processdiarylink.description: Opens the [Diary](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Diary) screen on the subject/record specified by link. To get a valid link format, use [createDiaryLink](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createDiaryLink).
examples:
```sqf
processDiaryLink [createDiaryLink](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createDiaryLink) ["Tasks", ([simpleTasks](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/simpleTasks) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)) select 0, ""]; *// Select a task in the Task menu*
```

```sqf
*// To select various tabs in the map screen:*
processDiaryLink [createDiaryLink](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createDiaryLink) ["selected_tab", [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), ""];
*// ... where **"selected_tab"** can be **"Tasks"**, **"Diary"**, **"Units"**, **"Players"**, **"Statistics"**, other user created subjects*
```

allowfileoperations.name: allowFileOperations
allowfileoperations.description:
Allow/dissallow file ops (load/save etc).
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

getobjectviewdistance.name: getObjectViewDistance
getobjectviewdistance.description: Gets the values of rendering distances of objects and shadows.

diag_activescripts.name: diag_activeScripts
diag_activescripts.description: Returns 4 element array with numbers of currently running scripts in format: [[spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn)-ed, [execVM](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/execVM)-ed, [exec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/exec)-ed, [execFSM](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/execFSM)-ed]

getplatenumber.name: getPlateNumber
getplatenumber.description: Get the license plates from any vehicle which has plates configured.

removeallcontainers.name: removeAllContainers
removeallcontainers.description: Removes all containers from the unit.

lockeddriver.name: lockedDriver
lockeddriver.description: Check whether driver position of the vehicle turret is locked.

vectordir.name: vectorDir
vectordir.description:
Returns object's normalized direction vector in world space ([x,y,z]). 

* A unit facing North would return [0,1,0]

* A unit facing East would return [1,0,0]

* A unit facing South would return [0,-1,0]

* A unit facing West would return [-1,0,0]

ispipenabled.name: isPiPEnabled
ispipenabled.description: Returns whether Picture-In-Picture video option (Render to Texture) is enabled or not.

everybackpack.name: everyBackpack
everybackpack.description: Returns array of backpacks stored in given crate or vehicle. Used for accessing backpack content of a backpack on ground.

getpersonuseddlcs.name: getPersonUsedDLCs
getpersonuseddlcs.description: Returns a list of all DLCs objects the unit is currently using. For example if a unit is inside a vehicle from DLC, it will return the code of that DLC.

playsound.name: playSound
playsound.description: Plays a sound from CfgSounds. Sound can be defined in [missionConfigFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionConfigFile), [configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) or [campaignConfigFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/campaignConfigFile).

syntaxArray.Params:
soundName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
isSpeech: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [True](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to play it as speech, [fadeSpeech](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/fadeSpeech) applies. [False](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to play it as sound, [fadeSound](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/fadeSound) applies
offset: [Scalar](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scalar) - (Optional, default 0) Offset in seconds. Same as [playMusic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playMusic) *Since Arma 3 v2.00*

countfriendly.name: countFriendly
countfriendly.description: Count how many units in the array are considered friendly to the given unit.

syntaxArray.Params:
entity: [Eden Entity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Entity)
layerID: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - layer ID as returned by [add3DENLayer](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/add3DENLayer) command
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if the entity was moved succesfully

setmarkerposlocal.name: setMarkerPosLocal
setmarkerposlocal.description: Moves the marker. If position is given in 3D format, z coordinate is stored with the marker and will be used when marker is passed to commands like [createVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createVehicle), [createUnit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createUnit), [createAgent](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createAgent), [createMine](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createMine), [setVehiclePosition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVehiclePosition) for example. When [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) is used for position, [PositionWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionWorld) of the object is used.

syntaxArray.Params:
markerName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
pos: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) (since Arma 3 v1.94)

enableenddialog.name: enableEndDialog
enableenddialog.description: Enables the execution of a custom camera sequence after the players death, coded in the script onPlayerKilled.sqs.

sidefriendly.name: sideFriendly
sidefriendly.description: The Friendly side - friendly to all, see [Side relations](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side_relations).

addcuratorcameraarea.name: addCuratorCameraArea
addcuratorcameraarea.description: Adds or changes curator camera area (depends on if ID is already used).

syntaxArray.Params:
[cameraAreaID,position,radius]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
curatorObj: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Curator module.
cameraAreaID: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position)
radius: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

setdynamicsimulationdistancecoef.name: setDynamicSimulationDistanceCoef
setdynamicsimulationdistancecoef.description: Sets activation distance multiplier of [Arma 3: Dynamic Simulation](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Dynamic_Simulation) for the given class

addmagazineglobal.name: addMagazineGlobal
addmagazineglobal.description: Adds magazine to a unit regardless of locality. This command can also be used to add magazine to a vehicle, like a static gun, for example.

sidechat.name: sideChat
sidechat.description:
Types text to the side radio channel. Must have assigned "ItemRadio" to see or transmit the messages. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the message to show on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see [remoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExec)) 
> ⓘIn order to replace the group callsign with a fictional name, use [setGroupID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setGroupID) on the unit first.
> ```sqf
> unit [setGroupID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setGroupID) ["Cpt. Miller"]; unit sideChat "Hello ladies!";
> ```
> .

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit transmitting message
chatText: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Message to transmit

side: [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) - Side to which the message will be seen
identity: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Class name of one of the identities in CfgHQIdentities. Possible identities in Arma 3 are:

* "Base"

* "HQ"

* "PAPA_BEAR"

* "AirBase"

* "BLU"

* "OPF"

* "IND"

* "IND_G"
chatText: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Message to transmit

playsound3d.name: playSound3D
playsound3d.description: Plays positional sound with given *filename* on every computer on network.

syntaxArray.Syntax: playSound3D [filename, soundSource, isInside, soundPosition, volume, soundPitch, distance, offset]
syntaxArray.Params:
filename: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - See [Arma 3: Sound Files](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Sound_Files) for available file names or [Example 3](https://community.bistudio.com#Examples) to use mission files
soundSource: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - The object emitting the sound. If "sound position" is specified this parameter is ignored
isInside: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) - [True](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to simulate a sound played inside a building or similar
soundPosition: [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) - (Optional, default [0,0,0]) Position for sound emitter. Will override "soundSource" position.
volume: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) Sound volume. A value 
```sqf
>5
```
 get capped at 5
soundPitch: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1)

* 1 → Normal

* 0.5 → Darth Vader

* 2 → Chipmunks
distance: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) How far the sound is audible. 
```sqf
0
```
 means no maximum distance
offset: [Scalar](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scalar) - (Optional, default 0) Offset in seconds. Same as with [playMusic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playMusic) *Since Arma 3 v2.00*

examples:
```sqf
playSound3D ["A3\Sounds_F\sfx\blip1.wav", [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)]
```

```sqf
playSound3D ["A3\Sounds_F\sfx\blip1.wav", [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), [getPosASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPosASL) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), 1, 1, 0]
```

```sqf
playSound3D [[getMissionPath](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getMissionPath) "mySound.ogg", [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)]; *// to play a mission directory sound*
```
Sound file extension must be specified even if a config entry has none:

```sqf
playSound3D ["A3\Sounds_F\sfx\alarm_independent", [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)]; *// no sound*
playSound3D ["A3\Sounds_F\sfx\alarm_independent.wss", [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)]; *// alarm*
```

getobjectscale.name: getObjectScale
getobjectscale.description: Returns the render scale of the object relative to the original model.

syntaxArray.Params: object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Object to return scale of. Can also be a [terrain object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nearestTerrainObjects)
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Scale relative to the original model

showpad.name: showPad
showpad.description: Shows or hides the notebook on the map screen, if enabled for the mission. (default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)). It is no longer relevant to Arma 2.

sideunknown.name: sideUnknown
sideunknown.description:
The unknown [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side).
Used when the side of a unit is unknown, e.g. for spotted targets with insufficient information.

savingenabled.name: savingEnabled
savingenabled.description:
Check if saving the game is enabled.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)If saving is disabled by [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor) mission attribute, this command will still return [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true).

shownwarrant.name: shownWarrant
shownwarrant.description: Check if player has ID card enabled. Obsolete command.

periscopeelevation.name: periscopeElevation
periscopeelevation.description: Returns current periscope elevation value, see also [elevatePeriscope](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/elevatePeriscope).

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle with periscope tech
turretPath: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - turret path
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - in format [elevation, locked], where:

* elevation: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - current periscope elevation value. -1 in case of an invalid turret

* locked: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - whether or not user override is blocked

lbcolor.name: lbColor
lbcolor.description: Returns the text color of the item with the given index of the [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTBOX) or [CT_COMBO](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_COMBO) with IDC of the topmost user [dialog](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/dialog).

commandfsm.name: commandFSM
commandfsm.description: Orders a unit to process command defined by [FSM](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/FSM) file (via the radio).

camsettarget.name: camSetTarget
camsettarget.description: Set the target object or position where the given camera should point at. Needs the call of [camCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCommit) to be conducted. To reset the target use [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull).

syntaxArray.Params:
camera: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object of type "camera"
target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - target location

camera: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object of type "camera"
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - target location - [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position)

unitpos.name: unitPos
unitpos.description:
Return the unit position rules.

The return value is always "Auto" unless the unit has gotten a [setUnitPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setUnitPos) command. In that case the value is the last stance the unit was ordered to.
Available modes are listed at [setUnitPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setUnitPos).

missiondifficulty.name: missionDifficulty
missiondifficulty.description: Return difficulty that has been forced for this mission, returns -1 if difficulty is not forced and it is used one from player's options.

canfire.name: canFire
canfire.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if the given vehicle is still able to fire. For the command to return [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), vehicle must be alive, have weapon operator and the weapon cannot be damaged ≥ 0.9 but can be empty due to running out of ammo. If mission starts with vehicle having no ammo or [setVehicleAmmo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVehicleAmmo) 0 command is executed on the vehicle, then canFire will always report [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) for it.

tasknull.name: taskNull
tasknull.description:
A non-existing [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task). To compare non-existent tasks use [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) or [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo):

* taskNull == taskNull; // false

* [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) taskNull; // true

* taskNull [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) taskNull; // true

groupchat.name: groupChat
groupchat.description: Types text to the group radio channel. Must have assigned "ItemRadio" to see or transmit the messages. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the message to show on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see [remoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExec))

syntaxArray.Params:
unitName: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit transmitting message
chatText: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - message to transmit

get3denselected.name: get3DENSelected
get3denselected.description: Returns an array of all selected [Eden Editor Entities](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Entity) of the given type, or, if empty string "" is used, an array of 6 arrays in the following format: [[/*objects...*/],[/*groups...*/],[/*triggers...*/],[/*logics...*/],[/*waypoints...*/],[/*markers...*/]] Layers and comments are not included in the all types array return. In case a wrong type is used the command will return [[],[],[],[],[],[]] and an error message is displayed.

syntaxArray.Params:
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - entity type, can be:

* "object"

* "group"

* "trigger"

* "logic"

* "waypoint"

* "marker"

* "layer"

* "comment"

* "" - all types except "layer" and "comment"

setenginerpmrtd.name: setEngineRpmRTD
setenginerpmrtd.description: Sets the RPM of given engines. > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

syntaxArray.Params:
helicopter: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
rpm: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Wanted RPM
engineIndex: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of the engine

* engine index 0: engine #1

* engine index 1: engine #2

* engine index 2: engine #3

* engine index -1: all engines

addmusiceventhandler.name: addMusicEventHandler
addmusiceventhandler.description: Adds [playMusic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playMusic) event handler. Returns id of the handler or -1 when failed. Just like [addMissionEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addMissionEventHandler), music EH is also attached to the mission.

syntaxArray.Params:
[type, function]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - "MusicStart" or "MusicStop"
function: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code). Passed params array:

* 0: [CfgMusic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#Music) class name

* 1: this event handler id

visiblepositionasl.name: visiblePositionASL
visiblepositionasl.description: Returns an object's rendered [3D position ASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) (z value above sea level) in render time scope.

weaponsitems.name: weaponsItems
weaponsitems.description:
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:Weaponsitems.jpg)Returns an array with subarrays contains class names and also names of connected items of all the vehicle's weapons. 
> ⓘThis command will return weapon magazines as well in format [magazineName, ammoCount], or empty array [] if weapon has no magazine

* Since Arma 3 v1.22 it is possible to query weapon holders and ammo crates with this command. If the argument is a vehicle, the command will return vehicle's weapons. If the argument is a container, the command will act identical to [weaponsItemsCargo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/weaponsItemsCargo).

* Since Arma 3 v1.96 the returned array always contains secondary muzzle magazine info and consistent with [getUnitLoadout](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getUnitLoadout) format for weapon items.

* Since Arma 3 v2.02 the returned array can contains binocular weapon items.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array containing arrays of weapon items info in format [weapon:[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String), muzzle:[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String), flashlight:[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String), optics:[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String), primaryMuzzleMagazine:[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), secondaryMuzzleMagazine:[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), bipod:[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)], for example: ["hgun_P07_F","","","",["16Rnd_9x21_Mag",16],[],""]

lbsize.name: lbSize
lbsize.description: Returns the number of items in a [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_LISTBOX) or [CT_COMBO](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_COMBO) control.

isturnedout.name: isTurnedOut
isturnedout.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if given unit is turned out, otherwise [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false). The output changes to [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) after unit finished turning out, however will change to [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) almost immediately after unit is ordered to turn in.

syntaxArray.Params: unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit on turn(in/out) enabled turret

iscopilotenabled.name: isCopilotEnabled
iscopilotenabled.description: Returns true if copilots actions are enabled.

showwatch.name: showWatch
showwatch.description: Shows or hides the watch on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item. (default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true))

estimatedendservertime.name: estimatedEndServerTime
estimatedendservertime.description: Estimated end of MP game in seconds converted to [serverTime](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/serverTime).

ctrlsetfontsecondary.name: ctrlSetFontSecondary
ctrlsetfontsecondary.description: Sets the font size of the secondary text of given control.

setactualcollectivertd.name: setActualCollectiveRTD
setactualcollectivertd.description:
Sets the collective pitch control to a specific position, regardless of input devices (until those are changed).

* 0: collective fully down

* ~0.7: approximate stable hover position

* 1: collective fully up
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

slingloadassistantshown.name: slingLoadAssistantShown
slingloadassistantshown.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if Sling Load Assistant is open.

syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if sling load assistant is shown, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) otherwise

examples:
```sqf
[waitUntil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/waitUntil) { slingLoadAssistantShown };
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "You lack rudimentary motor skills and basic eye-hand coordination."; *// scold user for unethical practices*

```

ishidden.name: isHidden
ishidden.description: Return whether the person is hidden (reached the hiding position). For command that tests general visibility of an object use [isObjectHidden](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isObjectHidden)

setparticlerandom.name: setParticleRandom
setparticlerandom.description:
Sets randomization of particle source parameters. Correspondence between CfgCloudlets class param names and command array of params:

```sqf
particleSource setParticleRandom
[
	lifeTimeVar,
	positionVar,
	moveVelocityVar,
	rotationVelocityVar,
	sizeVar,
	colorVar,
	randomDirectionPeriodVar,
	randomDirectionIntensityVar,
	angleVar,
	bounceOnSurfaceVar
];
```

syntaxArray.Syntax: particleSource setParticleRandom [lifeTime, position, moveVelocity, rotationVelocity, size, color, directionPeriod, directionIntensity, angle, bounceOnSurface]
syntaxArray.Params:
particleSource: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
lifeTime: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [randomX, randomY, randomZ]
moveVelocity: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [randomX, randomY, randomZ]
rotationVelocity: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
size: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
color: [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color)
directionPeriod: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
directionIntensity: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
angle: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (Optional)
bounceOnSurface: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (Optional) *Since Arma 3 v0.74*

opensteamapp.name: openSteamApp
opensteamapp.description: Opens a Steam application, returns false if it was not possible to run the application.

collapseobjecttree.name: collapseObjectTree
collapseobjecttree.description:
Collapse the object tree.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

actionkeys.name: actionKeys
actionkeys.description:
Returns [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) containing [dikCodes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DIK_KeyCodes) of keys, buttons and combos assigned to the given user action. Action names could be found in config class ControllerSchemes or [user action names](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Key_Actions) or user profile, for example:
keyWatch[] = { 24 };

To retrieve the value, use the property name without 'key':

```sqf
actionKeys "Watch"; *// 24*
```


In addition, some of the actions are also listed in here: [inputAction/actions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/inputAction/actions)

diaryrecordnull.name: diaryRecordNull
diaryrecordnull.description:
A non-existent [Diary Record](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Diary_Record). To compare non-existent objects use [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) or [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo):

* diaryRecordNull == diaryRecordNull; *// false*

* [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) diaryRecordNull; *// true*

* diaryRecordNull [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) diaryRecordNull; *// true*

lineintersects.name: lineIntersects
lineintersects.description:
Checks for object intersection with a virtual line between two positions. Returns true if intersects with an object.

**NOTE:** Doesn't work under water. Max harcoded distance is 1000m.

syntaxArray.Params:
[begPos, endPos, objIgnore1, objIgnore2]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
begPos: [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL)
endPos: [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL)
objIgnore1: (optional) [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object to ignore. When testing intersection from an object/unit/vehicle, pass that object here to prevent intersection inside of the object.
objIgnore2: (optional) [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - another object to ignore. When testing intersection of a line between two objects, pass the second object here to prevent intersection inside of it being reported

vehicleradio.name: vehicleRadio
vehicleradio.description:
Sends the audio message to the vehicle radio channel. The message is defined in CfgRadio in the [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext) file or config radio protocol. The transmission will play only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the transmission to play on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see [remoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExec)).
Note:  When transmitting unit gets killed, transmission will be interrupted, however when receiving unit gets killed, the transmission continues to play.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit to transmit
radioName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class name from CfgRadio

removeeventhandler.name: removeEventHandler
removeeventhandler.description: Removes a given Event Handler that was added with [addEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addEventHandler).

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - See [Event Handlers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Event_Handlers) for the full list of available options
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The value originally returned by [addEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addEventHandler)

soundvolume.name: soundVolume
soundvolume.description: Returns the current sound volume (set by [fadeSound](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/fadeSound)).

lognetworkterminate.name: logNetworkTerminate
lognetworkterminate.description: Terminates a network log file started with [logNetwork](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/logNetwork) with the given handle

setposaslw.name: setPosASLW
setposaslw.description: Sets the object position above sea surface. The pos array uses the [PositionASLW](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASLW) format.

ctrlsetfonth5b.name: ctrlSetFontH5B
ctrlsetfonth5b.description: Sets H5 bold font of given HTML control.

infopanelcomponentenabled.name: infoPanelComponentEnabled
infopanelcomponentenabled.description: Controls availability of component to given object info panel.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the concerned vehicle
panelID: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - "left" or "right" can be used as panel names
componentClassOrType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if component was successfully enabled on the panel, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) otherwise (e.g. component is not available for the object)

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the concerned vehicle
turretPath: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - turret index
panelID: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - "left" or "right" can be used as panel names
componentClassOrType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

examples:
```sqf
*// returns true if specific component "SensorDisplay" is enabled on player vehicle's left panel*
_state = [[vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), [-1]] infoPanelComponentEnabled ["VehicleSystemsDisplayManagerComponentLeft", "SensorDisplay"];
```

```sqf
*// returns true if all "SensorsDisplayComponent" components are enabled on player vehicle's left panel, otherwise returns false*
_state = [[vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), [-1]] infoPanelComponentEnabled ["VehicleSystemsDisplayManagerComponentLeft", "SensorsDisplayComponent"];
```

sort.name: sort
sort.description: Attempts to sort given array either in ascending ([true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) or descending ([false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) order. > ⚠This will **modify** the original array!

syntaxArray.Params:
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array to be sorted, can also be a nested array.
All array elements should be one of the following types:

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Array of strings 
```sqf
["a","b","c"...]
```


* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Array of numbers 
```sqf
[1,2,3...]
```


* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array of subarrays 
```sqf
[["a",1,2],["b",3,4],["c",5,6]...]
```
. Subarrays should be of the same structure. Subarray elements other than [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) will be ignored during sorting.
Mixed arrays 
```sqf
["a",1,[true], ...]
```
 are not supported and results are undefined.
order: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Sorting order. 

* [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true): ascending

* [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false): descending

clearitempool.name: clearItemPool
clearitempool.description: Removes all items from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container)

ctrlautoscrollrewind.name: ctrlAutoScrollRewind
ctrlautoscrollrewind.description:
Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if auto-scroll should move back to start after it reaches the end.

Autorscroll is available for [CT_LISTBOX](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DialogControls-ListBoxes) and [CT_CONTROLS_GROUP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CONTROLS_GROUP) types of controls only. Autoscroll will wait [ctrlAutoScrollDelay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollDelay) seconds (must be  > 0) and then will scroll the scroll bar down to the bottom. [ctrlAutoScrollSpeed](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollSpeed) defines the speed with which scrollbar is scrolled. If ctrlAutoScrollRewind is [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), the control will fade out, immediately rewind to the top, then fade in, wait [ctrlAutoScrollDelay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAutoScrollDelay) seconds and then repeat the scrolling in a loop. If user focuses on the control, autoscrolling is interrupted.

ctrlsettextcolorsecondary.name: ctrlSetTextColorSecondary
ctrlsettextcolorsecondary.description: Sets the secondary text color of a text control.

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - Text control
color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Color in format RGBA

remotecontrol.name: remoteControl
remotecontrol.description:
Switches on remote control of the unit. Command needs to be executed locally to the player.
If driver is remote it will get transferred to players PC.
There is currently no getter command for remote control, but it is possible to use a trick described in Example 3.

syntaxArray.Params:
who: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - controlling unit
whom: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - controlled unit

getdlcassetsusagebyname.name: getDLCAssetsUsageByName
getdlcassetsusagebyname.description: Returns an array with the session and global time the asset has been used.

lookatpos.name: lookAtPos
lookatpos.description:
Point the camera and center the map on the position.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

type.name: type
type.description: Returns a string of a [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location)'s class name or [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task)'s name (same as [taskName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/taskName)).

goggles.name: goggles
goggles.description: Returns name of currently used goggles (for NVGoggles use [hmd](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hmd)).

setdamage.name: setDamage
setdamage.description:
Damages/hurts or repairs/heals object/unit. Damage 0 means fully functional, damage 1 means completely destroyed / dead.
The alternative syntax allows to switch off destruction effects.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
damage: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
useEffects: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) - To skip destruction effects set it to [false]]

nearestlocation.name: nearestLocation
nearestlocation.description: Return the closest location of specified class to a given position.Checked range is unlimited (i.e. covers the whole map).

syntaxArray.Params:
[position, locationClass]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
position: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) or [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D)
locationClass: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) of a location class name. If "" is supplied, any nearest location is returned. See [Location Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location#Location_Types)

setwaypointbehaviour.name: setWaypointBehaviour
setwaypointbehaviour.description:
Switches the unit behaviour when the waypoint becomes active.


Possible values are:

* "UNCHANGED"

* "CARELESS"

* "SAFE"

* "AWARE"

* "COMBAT"

* "STEALTH"

See the [AIBehaviour](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/AIBehaviour) page for details of the effect of this command on AI units.

worldtoscreen.name: worldToScreen
worldtoscreen.description: Converts position in world space into screen (UI) space. If a specified position is not within the current screen view, an empty array is returned.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Screen position [x,y] (see [SafeZone](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SafeZone) for more info) - [] if not on-screen

clearforcesrtd.name: clearForcesRTD
clearforcesrtd.description:
Removes all force generators from world.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

joinassilent.name: joinAsSilent
joinassilent.description: Joins the unit to the given group, if position id is available, this one is used. Avoid any radio communication related to joining.

modeltoworldworld.name: modelToWorldWorld
modeltoworldworld.description: Converts position from object model space to world space (usable by [setPosWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPosWorld) for example).

handgunitems.name: handgunItems
handgunitems.description: Returns array with all items assigned to the [handgunWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/handgunWeapon) except magazines. Use [handgunMagazine](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/handgunMagazine) command for the latter. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

editobject.name: editObject
editobject.description:
Show the edit object dialog for the given object. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

allunits.name: allUnits
allunits.description:
Returns a list of all units, **except agents, dead units or units waiting for respawn**, outside and inside vehicles that were created on the following sides [east](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/east), [west](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/west), [independent](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/independent) and [civilian](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/civilian). 
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)To get all units of given side, use [units](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/units) [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side).

removeswitchableunit.name: removeSwitchableUnit
removeswitchableunit.description: Remove a unit from the list of units available for [Team Switch](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Team_Switch).

currentweaponmode.name: currentWeaponMode
currentweaponmode.description:
Returns current weapon mode of unit's weapon. Result can be: "Single", "Burst", "FullAuto", "manual", "player"

> ⚠This command will return 0 [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) if given object is a vehicle instead of a person.
> You can alternatively use 
> ```sqf
> _muzzle = [weaponState](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/weaponState) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) select 2;
> ```
>

enablecamshake.name: enableCamShake
enablecamshake.description:
Allows camera shake effects via [addCamShake](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addCamShake). If set to [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), then a currently active shake effect will stop immediately.
By default, shake effects are enabled, but once they have been disabled by this command, they will have to be enabled first, in order to be visible.

syntaxArray.Params: value: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - If [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), shake effects are visible

debriefingtext.name: debriefingText
debriefingtext.description: Returns debriefing text of provided end.

syntaxArray.Return: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - *end* debriefing text. If it does not exist in config, empty string is returned.

settriggertype.name: setTriggerType
settriggertype.description:
Sets the type of action processed by the trigger after activation (no action, a waypoints switch or an end of mission):


* "NONE"

* "EAST G" - Guarded by OPFOR - (It is better to use [createGuardedPoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createGuardedPoint) instead)

* "WEST G" - Guarded by BLUFOR - (It is better to use [createGuardedPoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createGuardedPoint) instead)

* "GUER G" - Guarded by Independent - (It is better to use [createGuardedPoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createGuardedPoint) instead)

* "SWITCH" - Switch waypoints/break loop (see [Triggers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ArmA:_Mission_Editor#Triggers_Mode_.28F3.29))

* "END1" - End #1

* "END2" - End #2

* "END3" - End #3

* "END4" - End #4

* "END5" - End #5

* "END6" - End #6

* "LOOSE" - (Meant to say LOSE but is misspelt in the game engine).

* "WIN" - (Not in editor. Valid enum name but when set, defaults to "END1")

onpreloadfinished.name: onPreloadFinished
onpreloadfinished.description:
Defines an action performed after the preload screen finished. Preload event occurs after briefing screen on mission start.
> ⚠This event handler also fires on client after user closes the main map.
> ⓘSince **Arma 3** *v1.57* a stackable version of this EH is available: [PreloadFinished](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers/addMissionEventHandler#PreloadFinished)
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)In order to keep compatibility between official and community content the functions [BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler) and [BIS_fnc_removeStackedEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_removeStackedEventHandler) should be used instead.

ctrlchecked.name: ctrlChecked
ctrlchecked.description:
Returns the current state of given [CT_CHECKBOXES](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CHECKBOXES) control. Since Arma 3 v1.72 it is possible to query multiple checkboxes by providing checkbox index. For more information see [CT_CHECKBOXES](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CHECKBOXES).
> ⓘThe "CheckBoxesSelChanged" control EH returns the control, index of changed checkbox and its current checked state. The checked state however is not a [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) but [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) 0 or 1. To convert ctrlChecked command output into number as well, use [parseNumber](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/parseNumber) command

syntaxArray.Params: control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - [CT_CHECKBOXES](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CHECKBOXES) control. If control contain multiple checkboxes, only checkbox with index 0 is queried.

setcustomweightrtd.name: setCustomWeightRTD
setcustomweightrtd.description:
Add virtual custom weight to a helicopter's center of gravity. This can be used to simulate added internal payload for specific scenarios, and affects the flight model.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

showcompass.name: showCompass
showcompass.description: Shows or hides the compass on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item. (default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true))

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) to format [ambientLightColor, ambientLightBrightness, dynamicLightColor, dynamicLightBrightness]:

* ambientLightColor: [Color RGB](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color)

* ambientLightBrightness: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* dynamicLightColor: [Color (RGB)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color)

* dynamiclightBrightness: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

syntaxArray.Params: position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) or [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) in which case Z will be ignored

configsourceaddonlist.name: configSourceAddonList
configsourceaddonlist.description: Returns an array of addons ([CfgPatches](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgPatches)) in which the given config class is defined.

elevateperiscope.name: elevatePeriscope
elevateperiscope.description:
Elevates periscope of a vehicle. Vehicles in Arma 3 which are compatible with this tech are Strider, remote laser designators, the robot arm on Eddie, etc. Please note that SDV submarine has a different periscope, which is just an animated selection and could be raised and lowered with [animate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animate) command. 
> ⓘUser can immediately override any elevation in progress by using assigned keyboard keys. To block user input use blockuser param.
A [ PeriscopeElevationChanged](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers#PeriscopeElevationChanged) entity event handler is also provided.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle with periscope tech
[turret, elevation, speed, blockuser]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
turret: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - turret on which periscope is located
elevation: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - elevation range 0...1
speed (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - config anim speed multiplier, 2 - twice as fast, 0.5 - twice as slow, etc. -1 - default config speed. If [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) is used as param, the change in elevation is almost instant.
blockuser (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to disable user ability to control periscope with keyboard. The change is persistent unless you set it to [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) again.

lnbaddcolumn.name: lnbAddColumn
lnbaddcolumn.description: Adds a column at given position.

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
position: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Position of the new column where 0 means all the way to the left and 1 all the way to the right of the control
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil) - Returns the zero based index of the new column

syntaxArray.Params:
controlOrIdc: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control), [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Control or the idc of the control
position: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Position of the new column where 0 means all the way to the left and 1 all the way to the right of the control
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil) - Returns the zero based index of the new column

setskill.name: setSkill
setskill.description: Sets the skill level of given unit. The value of a [sub-skill](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/AI_Sub-skills) is interpolated into a range defined in [CfgAISkill](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgAISkill).

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
skill: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Skill in range from 0 to 1

syntaxArray.Syntax: unit setSkill [skillName, value] *Since Armed Assault v1.00*
syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
skillName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Available sub-skills are:

* "aimingAccuracy"

* "aimingShake"

* "aimingSpeed"

* "endurance"

* "spotDistance"

* "spotTime"

* "courage"

* "reloadSpeed"

* "commanding"

* "general"
skill: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Skill in range from 0 to 1

findeditorobject.name: findEditorObject
findeditorobject.description:
Return object that matches the provided reference. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

safezonex.name: safeZoneX
safezonex.description:
Returns the X of the left border of the screen, which is also a distance in screen measurement units from top left corner of the default viewport (0,0) of the screen to the left border of the screen. Since it is going in opposite way of the X axis, the value is negative. The measurement units depend on the current screen resolution [getResolution](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getResolution). See also [SafeZone](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SafeZone).
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:safezone.jpg)

ctaddrow.name: ctAddRow
ctaddrow.description:
Adds one row of controls according to the RowTemplate class. It returns an array containing row index and array of created controls in a format [<rowIndex>, [<control0>, <control1>...<control n>]].

Note that rows and headers are indexed separately.

titletext.name: titleText
titletext.description:
Displays text across the screen. If used along with [cutText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cutText) two different texts (in different type styles) can be shown at once. The text can be displayed on multiple lines by using "
" new line characters:
titleText ["line1
line2
line3", "PLAIN"];. Since Arma 3 v1.74 this command supports [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) formatting.

syntaxArray.Params:
[text, type, speed, showInMap, isStructuredText]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - text to be displayed
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [Title Effect Types](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Title_Effect_Type) for more information about these values.
speed (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Time in seconds to fade in resource. Default: -1
showInMap (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to hide the text when the map is opened. Default: [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)
isStructuredText (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to switch support for [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) formatting. Default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) (See Example 3. Available since Arma 3 v1.74)

setname.name: setName
setname.description: Sets the name of a location or a person. In Arma 3 this can be used to set [name](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/name) of a person but only in single player.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[name, firstName, lastName]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
firstName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
lastName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
location: [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location)
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

nearsupplies.name: nearSupplies
nearsupplies.description: Find supplies (weapon holders, ammo crates, fuel feeds, other units) in the sphere with given radius.

syntaxArray.Params:
origin: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) or [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D)
radius: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

setvehicleid.name: setVehicleId
setvehicleid.description:
Sets ID to vehicle. By this ID vehicle is referenced by triggers and waypoints.

> ⚠This command is **not** to be used.

setdirection.name: setDirection
setdirection.description: Set's the orientation of a location. It's area and map icon (if it is type uses an icon) will be rotated to this orientation.

setwindstr.name: setWindStr
setwindstr.description: Changes the wind strength smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.

syntaxArray.Params:
time: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
value: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - new value in range 1...0

examples:
```sqf
 60 **setWindStr** 0.8; // set the wind strength to 0.8 gradually over the next 60 seconds

```

setlightnings.name: setLightnings
setlightnings.description:
Changes the lightnings value smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.
**NOTE**: This command will have no effect (even though the value of [lightnings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lightnings) changes) unless Manual Override option is selected in the editor in the Intel, which is normally off.
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:setLightnings.jpg)

getdlcs.name: getDLCs
getdlcs.description: Returns array of app IDs of DLCs.

syntaxArray.Params:
filter: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - can be:

* 0 - all

* 1 - owned

* 2 - not owned

setdebriefingtext.name: setDebriefingText
setdebriefingtext.description:
Sets debriefing text for endType defined in [CfgDebriefing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Debriefing#Configuration).

> ⚠This command is broken. [https://feedback.bistudio.com/T85682](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://feedback.bistudio.com/T85682)

cadetmode.name: cadetMode
cadetmode.description: **Prior to Arma 3** it returns if the player is currently playing in cadet or veteran mode.

syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true when playing in cadet mode, false when playing in veteran mode

createdisplay.name: createDisplay
createdisplay.description:
Creates child display of given display and loads from "resourceName". The notable difference between createDisplay and [createDialog](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createDialog) is that with createDisplay the player would be able to move around while the display is shown.
Displays created with createDisplay or [createDialog](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createDialog) will take control of the mouse pointer and will close when user presses Escape.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Since Arma 3 v1.50 createDisplay returns [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display) and will first look in *description.ext* for resourceName config, if not found, it will then look in main config.
> ⓘIf an *overlay* is needed instead, use [cutRsc](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/cutRsc).

syntaxArray.Params:
parent: [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display)
resourceName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - custom display class defined in [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext) or existing display class from main config

examples:
```sqf
[findDisplay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findDisplay) 46 createDisplay "RscCredits";
```

```sqf
*// creates an empty display*
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _emptyDisplay = [findDisplay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findDisplay) 46 createDisplay "RscDisplayEmpty";
```

canvehiclecargo.name: canVehicleCargo
canvehiclecargo.description: Returns bool array if it is possible to load cargo inside vehicle and if possible to load cargo into empty vehicle

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle carrying cargo
cargo: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - cargo to put in vehicle

examples:
Blackfish with no vehicle cargo loaded

```sqf
_result = blackfish canVehicleCargo offroad; //[true, true]

```

Blackfish with one vehicle cargo called offroad already loaded

```sqf
_result = blackfish canVehicleCargo offroad; //[false, false]

```

Even if the Blackfish was empty offroad can't be loaded because it is already in a cargo space

Blackfish with one vehicle cargo called offroad already loaded

```sqf
_result = blackfish canVehicleCargo offroad2; //[false, true]

```

offroad2 can't be loaded because there isn't enough space in the Blackfish, but if there was space offroad2 could be loaded into the Blackfish

showwaypoint.name: showWaypoint
showwaypoint.description: Defines how waypoints are shown to the player in map view. For 3D HUD visibility see [setWaypointVisible](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setWaypointVisible).

syntaxArray.Params:
waypoint: [Waypoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Waypoint)
show: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Possible values are:

* "NEVER" - Never show

* "EASY" - Show only if showCadetWP is enabled in global [difficulty](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Difficulty_Settings).

* "ALWAYS" - Always show

lockdriver.name: lockDriver
lockdriver.description: Lock the driver position of the vehicle. This command must be executed where vehicle is [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local). This command will remove user get in action (not get out) but will also stop player getting into vehicle via script commands unlike [lock](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lock) command

settriggerstatements.name: setTriggerStatements
settriggerstatements.description: Defines trigger condition, activation and deactivation statements. Trigger condition has to return [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean). [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) will activate the trigger, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) will deactivate it (only if activation is set to repeat). [thisList](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/thisList) returns the same result as [list](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/list) command, which includes all entities in the trigger area that are capable of activating the trigger. Dead entities are excluded as well as crew in vehicles, vehicles themselves are included.

syntaxArray.Params:
trigger: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Trigger object
[condition, activation, deactivation]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
condition: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Code containing trigger condition. Special variables available here:

* [this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this_2) ([Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)) - detection event

* [thisTrigger](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/thisTrigger) ([Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)) - trigger instance

* [thisList](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/thisList) ([Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)) - array of all detected entities
activation: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Code that is executed when the trigger is activated. Special variables available here:

* [thisTrigger](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/thisTrigger) ([Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)) - trigger instance

* [thisList](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/thisList) ([Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)) - array of all detected entities
deactivation: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Code that is executed when the trigger is deactivated. Special variable available here:

* [thisTrigger](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/thisTrigger) ([Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)) - trigger instance

setvehicleradar.name: setVehicleRadar
setvehicleradar.description: Sets the AI rule of Radar usage (Emission Control). Automatic means Radar switched on only when in Combat. The command doesn't affect player-controlled vehicles.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - An AI-controlled vehicle
rule: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Can be one of the following:

* 0 - automatic

* 1 - forced on

* 2 - forced off

isshowing3dicons.name: isShowing3DIcons
isshowing3dicons.description:
Returns true if the editor is set to draw 3D icons.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

removeheadgear.name: removeHeadgear
removeheadgear.description: Removes headgear from a unit. If unit has no headgear command quietly fails.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [year, month, day, hour, minute, second, millisecond]

selectrandomweighted.name: selectRandomWeighted
selectrandomweighted.description:
Returns a random element from the given array according to assigned weights. Engine solution to [BIS_fnc_selectRandomWeighted](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_selectRandomWeighted). A few notes:

* Negative weights are not supported

* If an item's weight is 0, the item is ignored

* The weights don't have to total to 1

* If numbers of items and weights do not match, the shortest array is used

* A single array Syntax is slightly faster then Alt Syntax

syntaxArray.Params:
valuesAndWeights: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array in format [value1, weight1, value2, weight2...], where:

* value: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - weighted value

* weight: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - values relative weight
syntaxArray.Return: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - random weighted value or [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) if array is empty or all weights are 0

syntaxArray.Params:
values: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array of [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything)
weights: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
syntaxArray.Return: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - random weighted value or [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) if any of arrays is empty or all weights are 0

forcecadetdifficulty.name: forceCadetDifficulty
forcecadetdifficulty.description: Forces showCadetHints and showCadetWP global Cadet [Arma 3 difficulty](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Difficulty_Settings), returns previous settings.

syntaxArray.Params:
showCadetHints: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - showCadetHints difficulty
showCadetWP: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - showCadetWP difficulty

infopanelcomponents.name: infoPanelComponents
infopanelcomponents.description: Returns array of all components available to given object info panel.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the concerned vehicle
panelID: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - "left" or "right" can be used as panel names
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [className, componentType, isAccessible]:

* className: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - component classname as defined in object/vehicle config

* componentType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - componentType - component type

* isAccessible: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - boolean flag that shows if component is currently accessible (lack of required item can make it temporarily inaccessible)

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the concerned vehicle
turretPath: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - turret index
panelID: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - "left" or "right" can be used as panel names
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [className, componentType, isAccessible]:

* className: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - component classname as defined in object/vehicle config

* componentType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - componentType - component type

* isAccessible: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - boolean flag that shows if component is currently accessible (lack of required item can make it temporarily inaccessible)

examples:
```sqf
*// returns array of all components configured for _helicopter pilot seat*
_componentsData = [_helicopter, [-1]] infoPanelComponents "left";
```

sendaumessage.name: sendAUMessage
sendaumessage.description: Send the command to the list of clients.

infopanels.name: infoPanels
infopanels.description: Returns array all info panels configured for given object or object and turret path.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [[infoPanelId1, infoPanelShortcutId1], [infoPanelId2, infoPanelShortcutId2], …]:

* infoPanelId: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the info panel class as defined in vehicle config

* infopanelShortcutId: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - shortcut representation of *infopanelId*, currently are supported only shortcuts "left" and "right"

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the concerned vehicle
turretPath: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - turret index
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [[infoPanelId1, infoPanelShortcutId1], [infoPanelId2, infoPanelShortcutId2], …]:

* infoPanelId: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the info panel class as defined in vehicle config

* infopanelShortcutId: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - shortcut representation of *infopanelId*, currently are supported only shortcuts "left" and "right"

sethidebehind.name: setHideBehind
sethidebehind.description:
Sets the data for hiding. objectWhereHide can be taken using [findCover](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findCover). hidePosition can be taken using [getHideFrom](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getHideFrom). Command is not functional in Arma 2.
> ⚠This command is not implemented!

expecteddestination.name: expectedDestination
expecteddestination.description: Return expected destination of unit as an array.

leaderboardrequestrowsglobal.name: leaderboardRequestRowsGlobal
leaderboardrequestrowsglobal.description: Requests given leaderboard to download values from global table.

syntaxArray.Params:
leaderboard: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Name of the leaderboard
offset: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Defines how many rows are skipped
rows: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Defines how many rows are requested
