syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if request has been started

removeallownedmines.name: removeAllOwnedMines
removeallownedmines.description: Removes ownership of all owned mines/explosive devices of the given unit

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
min: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Minimal value
max: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Maximum value

vectornormalized.name: vectorNormalized
vectornormalized.description: Returns normalized vector (unit vector, [vectorMagnitude](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorMagnitude) == 1) of given vector. If given vector is 0 result is a 0 vector as well.

syntaxArray.Params: vector: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array of camera areas in format [cameraAreaID,position,radius]. See [addCuratorCameraArea](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addCuratorCameraArea).

ctrlsetfont.name: ctrlSetFont
ctrlsetfont.description:
Sets the font for given control (see [Fonts](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Fonts#Available_Fonts))
Available Arma 3 fonts

* "EtelkaMonospacePro"

* "EtelkaMonospaceProBold"

* "EtelkaNarrowMediumPro"

* "LCD14"

* "LucidaConsoleB"

* "PuristaBold"

* "PuristaLight"

* "PuristaMedium"

* "PuristaSemibold"

* "RobotoCondensed"

* "RobotoCondensedBold"

* "RobotoCondensedLight"

* "TahomaB"

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
fontName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - one of the fonts defined in CfgFontFamilies

vehiclereportremotetargets.name: vehicleReportRemoteTargets
vehiclereportremotetargets.description: Gets whether the vehicle shares acquired targets via datalink with the [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) center.

userinputdisabled.name: userInputDisabled
userinputdisabled.description: Returns true if user input is disabled

rad.name: rad
rad.description: Converts given value in degrees to radians. 1 radian equals 180 degrees divided by [pi](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/pi).

scriptdone.name: scriptDone
scriptdone.description: Check if a script is finished running using the [Script_(Handle)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Script_(Handle)) returned by [execVM](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/execVM) or [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn).

settaskmarkeroffset.name: setTaskMarkerOffset
settaskmarkeroffset.description: Sets the task marker position in model space.

seteditormode.name: setEditorMode
seteditormode.description:
Sets map mode to MAP,3D or PREVIEW. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

setweaponreloadingtime.name: setWeaponReloadingTime
setweaponreloadingtime.description: Sets reloading states and/or makes an action of/on weapon. Reload time is between 0 and 1 inclusive, where 1 is 100% of maximum reloading time.

syntaxArray.Params:
**vehicle**: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
**gunner**: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - alive and able gunner operating desired turret
**muzzleName**: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - muzzle on desired turret
**reloadTime**: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

nearestbuilding.name: nearestBuilding
nearestbuilding.description: Finds the nearest building to a given object or position. A "building" is defined as an object that is of class "House" and contains a path LOD.

selectweaponturret.name: selectWeaponTurret
selectweaponturret.description: Selects the given weapon on specified turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret. Since ver. 1.63.136864 this command supports both weapon name and muzzle name.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[weapon, turretPath]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
weapon: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - weapon class name or muzzle class name
turretPath: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

sliderposition.name: sliderPosition
sliderposition.description: Returns current thumb position of [CT_SLIDER](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_SLIDER) or [CT_XSLIDER](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_XSLIDER) with given idc of topmost user [dialog](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/dialog).

showwaypoints.name: showWaypoints
showwaypoints.description: Shows/Hides task HUD markers and waypoints that will fade out in time. Dependable on difficulty settings.

menuvalue.name: menuValue
menuvalue.description: Returns current value set in menu entry on given path.

evalobjectargument.name: evalObjectArgument
evalobjectargument.description:
Return argument in mission editor of a given object. 
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

getobjectproxy.name: getObjectProxy
getobjectproxy.description:
Return the proxy object associated with the given editor object.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

restarteditorcamera.name: restartEditorCamera
restarteditorcamera.description:
Restarts the mission editor camera (if it was deleted by a script,for example).
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

settaskstate.name: setTaskState
settaskstate.description: Set the state of a given task.

syntaxArray.Params:
task: [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task)
state: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - State value may be one of:

* "None"

* "Created"

* "Assigned"

* "Succeeded"

* "Failed"

* "Canceled"

setcamshakeparams.name: setCamShakeParams
setcamshakeparams.description: Sets camera shake parameters. Will not have any effect until shake is started via [addCamShake](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addCamShake).

syntaxArray.Params:
posCoef: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Strength of positional movement (how far the whole position can change in X,Y&Z). Should not be bigger than 
```sqf
0.1
```
 to prevent the camera from moving into or behind the player
vertCoef: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Strength of vertical camera pan (up/down), practical range: 0-10
horzCoef: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Strength of horizontal camera pan (left/right), practical range: 0-10
bankCoef: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Strength of camera tilt/bank, practical range: 0-20
interpolation: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - If [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), then transitions in the different shaking directions will be smoother

incapacitatedstate.name: incapacitatedState
incapacitatedstate.description:
Returns the incapacitated sub-state of the given unit, when the [lifeState](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lifeState) of the unit is "INCAPACITATED". Could be one of:

* "UNCONSCIOUS"

* "MOVING"

* "SHOOTING"

syntaxArray.Return: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - incapacitated sub-state (see description) or empty string ""

displayseteventhandler.name: displaySetEventHandler
displayseteventhandler.description:
Sets given event handler of given display.

The return code of the provided function should indicate whether this event was handled correctly. This implies telling the engine whether it is default code should be executed. 

See [User Interface Event Handlers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers) for the full list of handler names.

If applicable, see [DIK_KeyCodes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DIK_KeyCodes) for a list of key code constants, which are relevant to key related user interface events like: [KeyDown](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onKeyDown) & [KeyUp](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onKeyUp).

> ⚠When using the event names listed [here](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers) with the [ctrlAddEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAddEventHandler), [ctrlSetEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlSetEventHandler), [displayAddEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/displayAddEventHandler) or displaySetEventHandler commands, the prefix "on" in the event name must be removed (e.g. '**ButtonDown'** instead of '**onButtonDown'**).

setviewdistance.name: setViewDistance
setviewdistance.description:
Set rendering distance. Setting view distance to <= 0 resets the value to the client's options (set in Options → Video → General → Visibility → Overall).
> ⓘClient-side max view distance is limited by the server's view distance.
> ⚠View distance also defines the maximum distance between a unit and any other unit they can [know about](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/knowsAbout).
> Higher view distance will involve more AI simulation cycles for every unit, which causes low performance.


Game

min. scripted

min. UI

default

max. UI

max. scripted


Arma 3

200

500

**1600**

12000

40000


Arma 2: Operation Arrowhead

200

500

**2500**

10000

15000


Arma 2

200

500

**3000**

10000

15000


Armed Assault

200

500

**1200**

10000

?


Operation Flashpoint

500

500

**900**

5000

?
examples:
```sqf
setViewDistance 2250;
```

```sqf
setViewDistance -1; // reset view distance in Arma 3
```

units.name: units
units.description: Returns an array with all the units in the group or group of the unit.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - If *type* is a destroyed object, an empty array is returned

setovercast.name: setOvercast
setovercast.description: Set overcast to given value smoothly during given time (in seconds). Zero time means immediate change. An overcast setting of zero means clear (sunny) weather, and one means storms and rain are very likely. Higher overcast values also result in higher [wind](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/wind) speeds.

syntaxArray.Params:
time: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - In seconds
overcast: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Range 0 to 1

breakwith.name: breakWith
breakwith.description: Skips all loop iterations and immediately returns the given value.

syntaxArray.Params: return: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - Value to be returned when iterations are skipped

setobjecttextureglobal.name: setObjectTextureGlobal
setobjecttextureglobal.description:
Set the texture of the given selection on all computers in a network session.
Not all objects can be textured this way. See [getObjectTextures](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getObjectTextures) for supported texture selections.

> ⓘAll textures must have a resolution of 2^x / 2^y (e.g. 16x16, 16x32, 64x256, 512x32, etc). The largest texture size supported by the RV engine is 4096x4096.

scopename.name: scopeName
scopename.description: Defines name of current scope. Name is visible in debugger, and name is also used as reference in some commands like [breakOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/breakOut) and [breakTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/breakTo). Scope name should be defined only once per scope. Trying to set a different name on the scope that has already defined scope name will result in error.

ropeattachenabled.name: ropeAttachEnabled
ropeattachenabled.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if entity can be attached to a rope end.

getcargoindex.name: getCargoIndex
getcargoindex.description: Returns index of the unit in cargo. 0,1,2... or -1 if not in cargo.

setvehicleposition.name: setVehiclePosition
setvehicleposition.description:
Moves the object to a given position (same as [createVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createVehicle) placement algorithm). Uses either the position that's defined by the *position* param, or one of the marker positions from the markers array. The object is placed inside a circle with *position* as its center and *placement* as its radius. The type of placement could also be controlled with *special*. 

If position is in water and vehicle can float, it is placed on water surface, otherwise it is placed on the ground, even if ground is under water. If roof surfaces support walking, units will be placed on roofs if such position is given.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[position, markers, placement, special]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
position: [PositionATL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionATL) ([PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) if boat or amphibious), [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Desired placement position. If object is given, object position is used for *position*. Normally only *x* and *y* are considered, unless "CAN_COLLIDE" is used for special placement.
markers: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - If the markers array contains one or more marker names, the position is chosen randomly and could be one of the marker positions or just the supplied main position. If marker had z coordinate set with [setMarkerPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setMarkerPos), the vehicle will be placed on the nearest surface below this z coordinate
placement: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The vehicle is randomly placed inside a circle with given position as center and placement as its radius
special (Optional): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Could be one of the following: 

* "NONE" - will look for suitable empty position near given position (subject to other placement params) before placing vehicle there.

* "CAN_COLLIDE" places vehicle at given position (subject to other placement params), without checking if others objects can cross its 3D model.

* "FLY" - if vehicle is capable of flying and has crew, it will be made airborne at default height.
If *special* is "" or not specified, default "NONE" is used.

dissolveteam.name: dissolveTeam
dissolveteam.description: Dissolves the given team. All members become members of the main team. Possible team values are: "RED", "GREEN", "BLUE" or "YELLOW".

showneweditorobject.name: showNewEditorObject
showneweditorobject.description:
Show the add editor object dialog,type is editor object type,class is,class definition to automatically select,side filters by a certain,side,pos is position to create the object.  
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

removeallmissioneventhandlers.name: removeAllMissionEventHandlers
removeallmissioneventhandlers.description:
Removes all mission event handlers of the given type which were added by [addMissionEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addMissionEventHandler).

> ⚠This command also resets the Event Handler creation index to 0.

lasertarget.name: laserTarget
lasertarget.description: Returns laser target object created by given unit (vehicle or soldier) when using a laser targeting device.

syntaxArray.Return: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - laser target or [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) if no laser target exists

getusermfdvalue.name: getUserMFDValue
getusermfdvalue.description: Returns array of user text variables used in MFD.
examples:
```sqf
 getUserMFDValue [vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player); // user0 in MFD will return 1
```

sethitindex.name: setHitIndex
sethitindex.description: Sets the current level of damage for a specific Hit Point. All hit points can be obtained with [getAllHitPointsDamage](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getAllHitPointsDamage) command.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle : [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Vehicle to be damaged
hitPartIndex: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Hit part index of the Hit Point
damage: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Level of damage

* 0: no damage

* 1: full damage
useEffects: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) [False](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to skip destruction effects. *Since Arma 3 v1.68*

directsay.name: directSay
directsay.description:
Sends given audio message to the direct channel. Command operates just like xxxxRadio commands, but the sound is played over direct channel and is independent of [fadeSound](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/fadeSound). The message is defined in CfgRadio in the [description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/description.ext) file or config radio protocol or a kbAddTopic. The transmission will play only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the transmission to play on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see [remoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExec)). 
Note:  When transmitting unit gets killed, transmission will be interrupted, however when receiving unit gets killed, the transmission continues to play.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit to transmit
radioName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class name from CfgRadio

setformdir.name: setFormDir
setformdir.description: Sets group formation heading. Accepted heading range is 0 to 360. Formation is facing this direction unless enemy is seen. When group is moving, this value is overridden by movement direction. If the new direction is noticeably different from the old direction (approx +/- 15 degrees), units will change positions changing [formationDirection](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/formationDirection).

gettext.name: getText
gettext.description: Extracts [localized](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/localize) text from config entry, if entry is subject to [ localization](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/localize), otherwise returns text value. To obtain the translation key itself, see [getTextRaw](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getTextRaw).

setplayervonvolume.name: setPlayerVoNVolume
setplayervonvolume.description: Sets provided player's Voice over Network (VoN) volume.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the other player's unit
volume: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - the wanted volume

landat.name: landAt
landat.description:
Order an AI airplane to land at a given airport. **ID** is the number to identify which map airport you want the airplane to land at. See [Arma: Airport IDs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma:_Airport_IDs) for more information.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Since Arma 3 v1.68 it is possible to also make the airplane land at a [dynamic airport](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Dynamic_Airport_Configuration) [object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/object) (e.g. aircraft carrier, makeshift runway...) – see **Example 2**.
> ⚠To make a **helicopter** land see [land](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/land) command.

handgunmagazine.name: handgunMagazine
handgunmagazine.description: Collects all loaded [magazines](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/magazines) from all [handgunWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/handgunWeapon) muzzles and returns them in [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), otherwise it returns []. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

switch.name: switch
switch.description:
Creates a switch type that can be used inside a [switch-do](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/switch_do) block.

> ⚠When it comes to strings, switch case matching is **case-sensitive**

landresult.name: landResult
landresult.description: Return the result of helicopter landing position searching (performed, after land command).

syntaxArray.Return:
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Result, can be:

* "Found" (Position found)

* "NotFound" (Position not found)

* "NotReady" (Position searching is still in progess

* " " (Empty string when wrong was argument)

getstatvalue.name: getStatValue
getstatvalue.description:
Returns value of the given stat.
A list of possible StatNames can be found here: [Arma 3: Stat Names](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Stat_Names)
examples:
```sqf
getStatValue "ExpWarlockDown"; *// Checks if the "Warlock Down" Achivement was already aquired*
```

playerside.name: playerSide
playerside.description:
Returns the player's [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side). This is valid even when the player controlled person is dead (a difference from [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/side) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)).
> ⓘplayerSide will not change automatically if [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [joins](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/join) a [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) on different [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/side). However, [selectPlayer](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/selectPlayer) command can and does change playerSide - see **[Example 3](https://community.bistudio.com#Examples)** for information.

syntaxArray.Params:
hashMap1: [HashMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/HashMap) - This HashMap will be modified
hashMap2: [HashMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/HashMap) - All key-value pairs from this HashMap are added to *hashMap1*. If a key from *hashMap2* already exists in *hashMap1*, then its value is overwritten with the corresponding value from *hashMap2*

hashMap1: [HashMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/HashMap) - This HashMap will be modified
hashMap2: [HashMap](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/HashMap) - All key-value pairs from this HashMap are added to *hashMap1*
overwriteExisting (Optional, default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - If [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), keys from *hashMap1* that also exist in *hashMap2* are overwritten. When set to [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), merging is faster

createsoundsource.name: createSoundSource

syntaxArray.Params:
[type, position, markers, placement]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [CfgVehicles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgVehicles) class
position:  [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL), [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Desired placement position
markers: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - If the markers array contains any markers, the position is randomly picked from array of given markers plus desired placement position. If any of the markers were given z coordinate with [setMarkerPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setMarkerPos), the sound will also be created at given z coordinate
placement: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The sound is placed inside a circle with given position as center and placement as its radius

settriggertext.name: setTriggerText
settriggertext.description: Sets the text label attached to the trigger object. This is used for example as a radio slot label for radio activated triggers.

currentmagazinedetail.name: currentMagazineDetail
currentmagazinedetail.description: Returns description of vehicle's currently loaded magazine, its ammo count (current/default) and its id.
examples:
```sqf
_currentMagazineDetail = currentMagazineDetail [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player); *// "6.5mm 30Rnd STANAG Mag(30/30)[id:0]"*
```

```sqf
_currentMagazineDetail = currentMagazineDetail Mi_48; *// "30mm HE Shells(250/250)[id:21]*
```

```sqf
_cmd = currentMagazineDetail [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player); *// "9mm 16Rnd Mag(13/16)[id/cr:10000011/0]"*
_cmd [splitString](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/splitString) "([ ]/:)"; *// ["9mm","16Rnd","Mag","13","16","id","cr","10000011","0"]*
```

worldname.name: worldName
worldname.description: Return the name of the currently loaded world.

setmarkercolor.name: setMarkerColor
setmarkercolor.description:
Sets marker color. Marker color names and their corresponding RGBA values for Arma 3 could be found here: [CfgMarkerColors_Arma_3](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgMarkerColors_Arma_3)
> ⓘ**Multiplayer optimisation:** Global marker commands always broadcast the *entire* marker state over the network. As such, the number of network messages exchanged when creating or editing a marker can be reduced by performing all but the last operation using local marker commands, then using a global marker command for the last change (and subsequent global broadcast of all changes applied to the marker).

commandmove.name: commandMove
commandmove.description: Order the given unit(s) to move to the given location (via the radio). Exactly the same as [doMove](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/doMove), except this command displays a radio message. The command will not put a visible waypoint marker unlike when move command is given via commanding menu.

getobjectchildren.name: getObjectChildren
getobjectchildren.description:
Return a list of all the children of the specified object.
> ⓘSome Old Editor Command

gearidcammocount.name: gearIDCAmmoCount
gearidcammocount.description: Returns ammo count of assigned magazine.

syntaxArray.Params: idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - idc of control type CT_ITEMSLOT 103

setammoonpylon.name: setAmmoOnPylon
setammoonpylon.description: Set count of ammo in magazine on pylon (supports pylon name since Arma 3 v1.94)

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[pylon, ammocount]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
pylon: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - pylon index (index starts from 1) or pylon name (see [getCompatiblePylonMagazines](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getCompatiblePylonMagazines) Example 4)
ammocount: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - ammo count

surfacetexture.name: surfaceTexture
surfacetexture.description:
Same as [surfaceType](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/surfaceType), but returns texture path to ground texture as string. 
> ⓘThe texture returned is of the ground, even if there is a road at that position. To get road texture use [getRoadInfo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getRoadInfo) command

syntaxArray.Params: position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - in format [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) or [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) in which case Z is ignored

create3denentity.name: create3DENEntity
create3denentity.description:
Create new [Eden Entity](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Entity). Used for creating individual entities; to create a [composition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Composition) (e.g., infantry squad), use [create3DENComposition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/create3DENComposition).

This is the only way how to add new editable entities to [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor) scenario. Other 'create' commands like [createVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createVehicle) or [createUnit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createUnit) will still work, but the resulting entity won't be editable.

syntaxArray.Params:
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - can be "Object", "Trigger", "Waypoint", "Logic" or "Marker"
class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - entity class, defined in one of the following classes:

* *CfgVehicles* - objects and logic entities

* *CfgNonAIVehicles* - triggers

* *CfgWaypoint* - waypoints

* *CfgMarkers* - markers
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position)
isEmpty (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to create vehicle without crew (default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false))

group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - group in which an AI character or waypoint is created.

* When missing for AI characters, new group is created for them

* When missing for waypoints, an error is logged and nothing is created

* When used on any other mode, group is ignored and entity is created as usual
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - can be "Object", "Trigger", "Waypoint", "Logic" or "Marker"
class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - entity class
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position)
isEmpty (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to create vehicle without crew (default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false))

backpackitems.name: backpackItems
backpackitems.description: Get array with all items (of any kind, even weapons) in backpack of the given unit.

getmissionpath.name: getMissionPath
getmissionpath.description: Returns mission root plus the filename in a form of filepath to be used with commands requiring absolute path such as [playSound3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playSound3D), [drawIcon3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/drawIcon3D), [createSimpleObject](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createSimpleObject), etc. Any leading "\" in the filename will be stripped as the mission root includes one already.
examples:
```sqf
*// would return e.g "C:\Users\Username\Documents\Arma 3\missions\MissionName.Altis\icons\myIcon.paa"*
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _path = getMissionPath "icons\myIcon.paa";
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _path = getMissionPath "\icons\myIcon.paa"; *// leading \ is also fine*

```

```sqf
*// would return e.g "C:\Users\Username\Documents\Arma 3\missions\MissionName.Altis\" with the trailing \*
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _root = getMissionPath "";
```

closedialog.name: closeDialog
closedialog.description:
Close the currently active user dialog with exit code. Most common exit codes are:

```sqf
#define IDC_OK            1 //emulate "Ok" button
```


```sqf
#define IDC_CANCEL        2 //emulate "Cancel" button
```

simulinclouds.name: simulInClouds
simulinclouds.description: Returns if given position is in clouds.

syntaxArray.Return:
* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) -  [True](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if given position is in clouds

* [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) - If given arguments are incorrect

systemchat.name: systemChat
systemchat.description: Types text to the system radio channel. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the message to show on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see [remoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExec))

isinremainscollector.name: isInRemainsCollector
isinremainscollector.description: Checks if unit or vehicle is queued for disposal after death.

commandstop.name: commandStop
commandstop.description: Order the given unit(s) to stop via radio. A stop command will never finish, the unit(s) will never be ready.

getobjecttextures.name: getObjectTextures
getobjecttextures.description: Gets all custom textures (hiddenSelectionsTextures) associated with the object.  Doesn't work on [simple objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Simple_Objects)

missionnamespace.name: missionNamespace
missionnamespace.description: Returns the global namespace attached to mission.

vectormodeltoworld.name: vectorModelToWorld
vectormodeltoworld.description: Converts vector direction from model to world space.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
modelDir: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - vector direction in model space in format [x,y,z]
syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - vector direction in world space in format [x,y,z]

examples:
Convert model space vector [0,-10,4] to world space; vector gets rotated according to _airplane: 

```sqf
_airplane vectorModelToWorld [0,-10,4];
```

lnbsetpictureright.name: lnbSetPictureRight
lnbsetpictureright.description:
Sets the cell's right-picture. The picture is set to the end of the **row**, the *column* parameter does not matter.
> ⓘThe picture is searched in the mission, directory, the campaign directory's dtaExt subdirectory, and the data bank (or directory).

syntaxArray.Params:
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 0-based index (first row is 0, second is 1, etc)
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 0-based index (first column is 0, second is 1, etc)
path: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - the picture's file path

ctrl: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
row: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 0-based index (first row is 0, second is 1, etc)
column: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 0-based index (first column is 0, second is 1, etc)
path: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - the picture's file path

unitName: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
muzzleName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Name of the weapon or muzzle
> ⚠For weapons that have **more than one muzzle**, you have to input the **muzzleName** and not the **weaponName**.
> 
> * In Operation Flashpoint, in most cases, both names are the same. But check.
> 
> * In Armed Assault the weaponNames and muzzleNames are different.
> 
> * For muzzle names see [CfgWeapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Weapons).

infopanel.name: infoPanel
infopanel.description:
Returns information about what is currently displayed on given player's info panel.
Returns ["EmptyDisplay","EmptyDisplayComponent"] when no panel is open.

syntaxArray.Params: infoPanelId: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - info panel classname, or "left" or "right"

get3dengrid.name: get3DENGrid
get3dengrid.description:
Returns the grid increment for the given transformation type.
Transformation types:

* Rotation - "r"

* Translation - "t"

* Scale - "s"

removeallitems.name: removeAllItems
removeallitems.description: Removes all special items from the unit.

canmove.name: canMove
canmove.description:
Returns if the given vehicle is still able to move.
> ⓘ
> 
> * This command does not check for the amount of fuel the vehicle has, except for helicopters and airplanes.
> 
> * A helicopter with a damaged tail rotor may return that it cannot move, where a skilled pilot could use it.

syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if the vehicle is able to move, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if not

isgamepaused.name: isGamePaused
isgamepaused.description:
Returns the state of game simulation. Simulation can get paused by pressing ALT + TAB or a system dialog opening (e.g. ESC menu). Simulation will not get paused if -noPause [startup parameter](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Startup_Parameters) is used.
> ⓘ[onEachFrame](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onEachFrame) event and "EachFrame" event handler continue to execute when the simulation is paused, which could result in undesired backlog. Use isGamePaused to skip loop if needed.

syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if game simulation is paused, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if not

resetcamshake.name: resetCamShake
resetcamshake.description: Stops any ongoing camera shake effects. Does not prevent new effects from being created. To disallow new effects altogether, [enableCamShake](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/enableCamShake) should be used.

taskmarkeroffset.name: taskMarkerOffset
taskmarkeroffset.description: Returns model space position for the task marker

diag_frameno.name: diag_frameNo
diag_frameno.description: Returns number of frame currently displayed.

turretunit.name: turretUnit
turretunit.description: Returns the unit in the vehicle turret. Driver turret [-1] is supported since Arma 3 v1.58. To find turret path of known unit see [unitTurret](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/unitTurret)

lbsetcolor.name: lbSetColor
lbsetcolor.description: Sets the color of the item (left) with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user [Dialog](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki?title=Dialog&action=edit&redlink=1) to color.

syntaxArray.Params:

scalar: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

getrotorbrakertd.name: getRotorBrakeRTD
getrotorbrakertd.description:
Returns if rotor break is on.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

is3denpreview.name: is3DENPreview
is3denpreview.description: Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if the [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor) is currently in mission preview mode, single player or multiplayer. (see also [is3DEN](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/is3DEN), [is3DENMultiplayer](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/is3DENMultiplayer))

setcurrentwaypoint.name: setCurrentWaypoint
setcurrentwaypoint.description: Sets the currently active waypoint for a group.

reloadenabled.name: reloadEnabled
reloadenabled.description: Check whether magazine is reloaded whenever emptied.

modeltoworldvisual.name: modelToWorldVisual
modeltoworldvisual.description: Converts position from object model space to world space in render time scope. For ASL version see [modelToWorldVisualWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/modelToWorldVisualWorld).

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
modelPos: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - in format [PositionRelative](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionRelative) ([x,y,z] offset relative to the model centre)

getallpylonsinfo.name: getAllPylonsInfo
getallpylonsinfo.description: Return an array with the vehicle's all pylons info.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Arrays](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [Pylon index, Pylon name, Assigned turret, Magazine className, Magazine ammo count, [Magazine detail](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/currentMagazineDetail)]

examples:

```sqf
	Executed on an Mi-48 Kajman:

		[1,"PylonLeft1",[0],"PylonRack_4Rnd_LG_scalpel",4,"0:10000646"],
		[2,"PylonLeft2",[0],"PylonRack_19Rnd_Rocket_Skyfire",19,"0:10000648"],
		[3,"PylonRight2",[0],"PylonRack_19Rnd_Rocket_Skyfire",19,"0:10000649"],
		[4,"PylonRight1",[0],"PylonRack_4Rnd_LG_scalpel",4,"0:10000650"]
	]
*/
```

getaudiooptionvolumes.name: getAudioOptionVolumes
getaudiooptionvolumes.description: Returns profile audio volumes in format [effects, music, radio, von].

ppeffectdestroy.name: ppEffectDestroy
ppeffectdestroy.description: Destroy [Post process effects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Post_process_effects) given by handle or array of handles.

syntaxArray.Params:
[effect1,...]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array of effect handles -

get3denactionstate.name: get3DENActionState
get3denactionstate.description:
Returns state of given action in the [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor).

See the [list of all actions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor:_Actions).

findcover.name: findCover
findcover.description:
Returns the object around where the unit finds cover. The minDist, visibilityPosition and ignoreObject parameters are optional.
> ⚠Not implemented in Arma 2 or Arma 3, always returns [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull)

syntaxArray.Syntax: object **findCover** [position, hidePosition, maxDist, minDist, visibilityPosition, ignoreObject]
syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[position, hidePosition, maxDist, minDist, visibilityPosition, ignoreObject]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position)
hidePosition: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [getHideFrom](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getHideFrom). Position of that which the unit should hide from
maxDist: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
minDist: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (Optional)
visibilityPosition: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) (Optional) used to select cover that unit can see in that direction from
ignoreObject: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) (Optional) Ignore this object in visibility check

getitemcargo.name: getItemCargo
getitemcargo.description: Returns all items names and count from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

forceunicode.name: forceUnicode
forceunicode.description:
Sets the Unicode flag which forces some of the string manipulation commands to switch to Unicode. The Unicode flag is always set right after forceUnicode command execution, but is reset depending on the command mode: 

* 1 - the Unicode flag is reset right after any of the supported commands executed or the end of script, whichever comes earlier.

* 0 - the Unicode flag is reset at the end of the script.
When the flag is set it will also affect all scopes within the script including child scopes (see also: [diag_scope](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_scope)). There are many other string manipulation commands like [ctrlSetText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlSetText), [getTextWidth](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getTextWidth), etc. that support Unicode by design so no additional forcing is needed.
List of the commands that work with forceUnicode:


* [copyFromClipboard](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/copyFromClipboard)

* [copyToClipboard](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/copyToClipboard)

* [count](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/count)

* [find](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/find)

* [in](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/in)

* [insert](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/insert)

* [reverse](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/reverse)

* [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select)

* [splitString](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/splitString)

* [trim](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/trim)

syntaxArray.Params:
mode: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Mode of operation, can be: 

* -1 - resets previously set Unicode flag

*  0 - sets Unicode flag until the end of script

*  1 - sets Unicode flag until after next supported command or until the end of script, whichever comes earlier

initambientlife.name: initAmbientLife
initambientlife.description: Initialises the ambient life on [local](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/local) client from CfgWorlds >> worldName >> AmbientA3. Has no effect on dedicated server or headless client.

foreachmemberagent.name: forEachMemberAgent
foreachmemberagent.description: Executes the given command recursively for each agent that is a member of the given team. For just teams use [forEachMemberTeam](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forEachMemberTeam). For both teams and agents use [forEachMember](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forEachMember).

setmarkershape.name: setMarkerShape
setmarkershape.description: Selects shape (actual type) of the marker.

syntaxArray.Params:
markerName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
shape: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - The shape, can be one of:

* "ICON"

* "RECTANGLE"

* "ELLIPSE"

* "POLYLINE"

creatediarysubject.name: createDiarySubject
creatediarysubject.description: Creates a new subject in the [Diary](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Diary).

syntaxArray.Params:
player: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
subject: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
displayName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - The visible name
picture: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default 
```sqf
""
```
) Icon to display next to the subject. Can be set later with [setDiarySubjectPicture](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setDiarySubjectPicture). Similar to [lbSetPictureRight](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lbSetPictureRight).
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of the entry that was added

removeteammember.name: removeTeamMember
removeteammember.description: Remove given member from given team. Effect is local, unless both member and team are local to PC on which command is executed, then effect is global.

getusermfdtext.name: getUserMFDText
getusermfdtext.description: Returns array of user text variables used in MFD.

ctrlsetdisabledcolor.name: ctrlSetDisabledColor
ctrlsetdisabledcolor.description: Sets the colorDisabled attribute of a control.

formationdirection.name: formationDirection
formationdirection.description: Return the direction in degrees of the 'unit' watching in formation.

issteammission.name: isSteamMission
issteammission.description: Returns true if the current mission is a Steam Workshop mission.

switchcamera.name: switchCamera
switchcamera.description:
Switch camera to given vehicle / camera. Mode is one of:

* **"INTERNAL"**: 1st person

* **"GUNNER"**: optics / sights

* **"EXTERNAL"**: 3rd person

* **"GROUP"**: group

* **"CARGO"**: same as "INTERNAL"

If you switch to a unit in a vehicle, this command uses the correct turret.
> ⓘControl over the unit is not given to the player. Use [selectPlayer](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/selectPlayer) or a combination of switchCamera and [remoteControl](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteControl) to achieve this.

settrafficspeed.name: setTrafficSpeed
settrafficspeed.description: Set ambient traffic speed in a rectangle (in kilometers per hour). > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)This command does nothing in Arma 3.

syntaxArray.Params:
speed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - traffic speed (in kilometers per hour)
xMin: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - western border of the affected rectangle
xMax: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - eastern border of the affected rectangle
zMin: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - southern border of the affected rectangle
zMax: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - northern border of the affected rectangle

getenginetargetrpmrtd.name: getEngineTargetRPMRTD
getenginetargetrpmrtd.description: Returns RPM of all engines. > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model)For this command to have any effect, the [Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Advanced_Helicopter_Flight_Model) (AFM) has to be enabled. AFM status can be checked with [difficultyEnabledRTD](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/difficultyEnabledRTD).

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array of [numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) with the RPM of each engine

setattributes.name: setAttributes
setattributes.description:
Returns a [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) created from the given [structured](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) text and sets [ attributes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text#Attributes) to the given values.
> ⚠Even though command accepts plain [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) too, the argument should be [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) in order for the set attributes to have an effect. Additionally the result of the command should be fed to [composeText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/composeText) (See Example 1) or [formatText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/formatText)

syntaxArray.Params:
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) - only passing [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) has any effect
[name1, value1, name2, value2, ...]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - name of the attribute
value: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - value of the attribute

radiochannelinfo.name: radioChannelInfo
radiochannelinfo.description: Obtains custom radio channel's details, set by [radioChannelCreate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/radioChannelCreate).

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) to format  [colour, label, callSign, units, sentenceType, exists] (see [radioChannelCreate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/radioChannelCreate))

examples:
```sqf
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _channelID = [radioChannelCreate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/radioChannelCreate) [[1, 0, 0.5, 0.8], "Q-dance Radio", "%UNIT_NAME", [u1, u2], [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)];
radioChannelInfo _channelID; *// returns [[1,0,0.5,0.8], "Q-dance Radio", "%UNIT_NAME", [u1, u2], [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)]*
```

tvtext.name: tvText
tvtext.description: Returns shown text in the item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

syntaxArray.Params:
[idc, path]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
idc: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
path: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array containing numbers.

ctrlsetpositionw.name: ctrlSetPositionW
ctrlsetpositionw.description: Sets the width of a 2D control. [ctrlCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlCommit) is required to complete the operation.

syntaxArray.Params:

move.name: move
move.description: Let group move to given position. Active waypoints will be ignored when command is used.

addweaponcargo.name: addWeaponCargo
addweaponcargo.description:
Add weapons to the cargo space of vehicles, which can be taken out by infantry units. Ignores available cargo space.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)In Arma 3, arguments for this command must be local ([LALocal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Multiplayer_Scripting#Locality)). For global variant see [addWeaponCargoGlobal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addWeaponCargoGlobal).

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicleName: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle to add the weapons to
[weaponName, count]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
weaponName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - weapon name. See [Category:Weapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Weapons) for reference about possible values.
count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - number of weapons to add.

selectrandom.name: selectRandom
selectrandom.description: Returns a random element from the given array. Engine solution to [BIS_fnc_selectRandom](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_selectRandom)

syntaxArray.Return: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - random selected value or [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) if array is empty

parsesimplearray.name: parseSimpleArray
parsesimplearray.description:
Converts given, formatted as simple array, [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) into a valid [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array). Simple array is array consisting of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number), [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String), [Booleans](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) and [Arrays](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of all of the above. For example: [1,"2",true,[4,"five",false]]. The string representation of this array compatible with parseSimpleArray will be "[1,""2"",true,[4,""five"",false]]" accordingly. This command is almost **4x faster** than similar uncached [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) [compile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/compile) method. And because [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) [compile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/compile) is not required, it is also **more secure** and primarily intended for use with [callExtension](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/callExtension) to parse the [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) output into [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array).
Since Arma 3 v1.96 the command will tolerate extra spaces and supports single quotes. The only recognised keywords (case **in**sensitive) are:

* true - translates into [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)

* false - translates into [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)

* nil - translates into [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil)

* null - translates into [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil)

* <null> - translates into [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil)

* any - translates into [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil)

syntaxArray.Params: stringArray: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - string formatted as simple array

simulclouddensity.name: simulCloudDensity
simulclouddensity.description: Returns density of clouds at given position.

syntaxArray.Return:
* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) -  Density (0-1)

* [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) - If arguments are incorrect

* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Returns [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if simulWeather is disabled

lockcargo.name: lockCargo
lockcargo.description:
Lock all cargo positions of a vehicle or lock by index.
This command will remove user "get in" action (not get out) but will also stop player getting into vehicle via script commands (e.g [moveInCargo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveInCargo)) unlike [lock](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lock) command.

weaponlowered.name: weaponLowered
weaponlowered.description:
Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if given soldier's weapon is lowered. 
> ⚠This command will **always** return [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if player is sprinting, even without a weapon. Alternatively, the weapon raised state could be obtained via [animationState](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animationState) command ...slow... vs ...sras...

ctrlsetchecked.name: ctrlSetChecked
ctrlsetchecked.description: Sets checked state of a [CT_CHECKBOXES](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CHECKBOXES) control.

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - [CT_CHECKBOXES](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CHECKBOXES) control. If control contain multiple checkboxes, only checkbox with index 0 is queried.
checked: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to check, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to uncheck the checkbox

control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - [CT_CHECKBOXES](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CT_CHECKBOXES) control
[index, checked]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - checkbox index
checked: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean)- [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to check, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to uncheck the checkbox

playmovenow.name: playMoveNow
playmovenow.description:
When used on a person,a smooth transition to the given move will be initiated, but all previous playMove are discarded. 
The difference between [playMove](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playMove) and playMoveNow is that [playMove](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playMove) adds another move to the move queue, while playMoveNow replaces the whole move queue with new move (see [Example 2](https://community.bistudio.com#Examples)).
> ⓘsee [Category:Moves](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Moves) for respective games animations.

setflagtexture.name: setFlagTexture
setflagtexture.description:
Sets flag texture.

If texture is "", flag is not drawn.
Custom texture can be used, as long as it is in *.jpg format and has dimensions of 200×200px, or *.paa (Arma 3 standard: 512×256px).

> ⓘSee [Flag Textures](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Flag_Textures) for a list of all in-game flag textures.

isequaltypearray.name: isEqualTypeArray
isequaltypearray.description: Compares types of all elements of one array to types of all elements of another array.
examples:
```sqf
_arr = [1,true,"three"];
_arr isEqualTypeArray [0,objNull,""]; // false
_arr isEqualTypeArray [0,false,""]; // true
```

```sqf
_arr = [1,2];
_arr isEqualTypeArray [0]; // false
_arr isEqualTypeArray [0,0]; // true
_arr isEqualTypeArray [0,0,0]; // false
```

displayaddeventhandler.name: displayAddEventHandler
displayaddeventhandler.description:
Adds an event handler to the given display. Returns the ID of the event handler, or -1 when failed.

Returning [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) in EH code will override default engine handling for keyboard events.

See [User Interface Event Handlers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers) for the full list of event names.

If applicable, see [DIK_KeyCodes](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DIK_KeyCodes) for a list of key code constants, which are relevant to key related user interface events like: [KeyDown](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onKeyDown) & [KeyUp](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onKeyUp).
> ⚠Display EHs are processed in reversed order, i.e. last added: first, first added: last. So if you have an override it should be set up in the 1st added EH.


> ⚠When using the event names listed [here](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers) with the [ctrlAddEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlAddEventHandler), [ctrlSetEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlSetEventHandler), displayAddEventHandler or [displaySetEventHandler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/displaySetEventHandler) commands, the prefix "on" in the event name must be removed (e.g. '**ButtonDown'** instead of '**onButtonDown'**).

isflashlighton.name: isFlashlightOn
isflashlighton.description: Returns true if there is a linked and enabled flashlight on a given weapon.

setrepaircargo.name: setRepairCargo
setrepaircargo.description:
Set amount of repair resources in cargo space of repair vehicle.
Amount 1 is full cargo.

getplayerchannel.name: getPlayerChannel
getplayerchannel.description:
Returns channel number for given player, **provided that player is speaking**, otherwise -1. Having mic on is not enough, player has to make a sound. There are several limitations to this command:

* It does not work on dedicated server, the return is always -1, only client can detect other client talking.

* Prior to Arma 3 v2.01.146856 did not detect when someone talked on direct chat at all anywhere.

* The client on which command is executed has to able to receive transmission before the transmission channel can be detected. For example if a player is not in the same group as a speaker and the speaker speaks on Group Channel, the player cannot hear the speaker and therefore cannot detect what channel the speaker is on.
In short, this command mimics the speaking icon from the UI. Correspondence between channel and number:


[channel ID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Channel_IDs) number correspondence


N/A

Command

Vehicle

Custom4

Custom10

15

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Options in format [subtitles enabled, radio subtitles enabled]

assignedcargo.name: assignedCargo
assignedcargo.description: Returns the list of soldiers assigned to the given vehicle as a cargo.

enablechannel.name: enableChannel
enablechannel.description:
Enables/disables UI functionality which is responsible for sending text or voice chat to the given chat channel. If the channel was disabled in [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext) or [server.cfg](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/server.cfg), it can be enabled with this command, however the UI functionality changes will be local to the PC executing this command.
> ⓘThis command:
> 
> * cannot disable Global channel for the admin or server host, because Global channel is always available for the admin
> 
> * does not disable *incoming* text or voice
> 
> * Prior to Arma 3 v2.01.146856 did not interrupt own client's transmission in progress (but prevented any further ones)
> 
> * does not affect chat related scripting commands such as [vehicleChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicleChat), [globalRadio](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/globalRadio) etc.

syntaxArray.Params:

enable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to enable, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to disable (both VoN and chat)

channelID: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - [channel ID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Channel_IDs)


kbhastopic.name: kbHasTopic

showsubtitles.name: showSubtitles

getclientstatenumber.name: getClientStateNumber
getclientstatenumber.description:
Returns client state in network game. Works on both, client and dedicated server. The following states are possible:



getClientStateNumber

[getClientState](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getClientState)

Description


0
"NONE"
No client (or singleplayer)


1
"CREATED"
Client is created


2
"CONNECTED"
Client is connected to server, message formats are registered


3
"LOGGED IN"
Identity is created


4
"MISSION SELECTED"
Mission is selected


5
"MISSION ASKED"
Server was asked to send / not send mission


6
"ROLE ASSIGNED"
Role was assigned (and confirmed)


7
"MISSION RECEIVED"
Mission received


8
"GAME LOADED"
Island loaded, vehicles received


9
"BRIEFING SHOWN"
Briefing was displayed


10
"BRIEFING READ"
Ready to play mission


11
"GAME FINISHED"
Game was finished


12
"DEBRIEFING READ"
Debriefing read, ready to continue with next mission

sethit.name: setHit
sethit.description:
Set damage on a part of an object.
> ⓘSome part names are in Czech; see [translation table](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Translations).

syntaxArray.Params:

setmarkertextlocal.name: setMarkerTextLocal
setmarkertextlocal.description: Sets the text label of an existing marker.

getobjecttype.name: getObjectType
getobjecttype.description:
Returns object type as a number:

* 1 - Primary - Normal object placed in Visitor, part of landscape

* 2 - Network - Road placed in Visitor, part of landscape

* 4 - Temporary - Temporary object (like tracks)

* 8 - TypeVehicle - Some entity added by game

* 16 - TypeTempVehicle - Temporary entity

* 32 - LandDecal - Land decal

setformationtask.name: setFormationTask
setformationtask.description: Set the current task of the formation member. > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_2)This command is not available in Arma 2.

ctrlvisible.name: ctrlVisible
ctrlvisible.description: Returns if a control of the currently active user dialog is shown or not. Read [Arma: GUI Configuration](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma:_GUI_Configuration) for more information about user dialogs and controls.

syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [True](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if the control is shown, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if not

camsetfov.name: camSetFov
camsetfov.description:
Set the zoom level (**F**ield **O**f **V**iew) of the given camera.

The zoom level is from *0.01* for the nearest and *8.5* for the furthest zoom value, with a default zoom level of *0.75*

The angle of the field of view is *atan(FOV)*2* radians when in 4:3 aspect ratio. Needs the call of [camCommit](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCommit) to be conducted.

syntaxArray.Params:
camera: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object of type "camera"
level: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - zoom level, range 0.01 to 8.5 (see description above)

createunit.name: createUnit
createunit.description:
Create a unit of class that is defined in [CfgVehicles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:CfgVehicles).
> ⚠[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Operation_Flashpoint)[1.34](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Operation_Flashpoint_version_1.34) [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Armed_Assault)[1.00](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Armed_Assault_version_1.00)
> This command could be bugged in Operation Flashpoint or Armed Assault ; an additional [join](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/join) may solve the problem.
> 
> However, some commands such as [setUnitPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setUnitPos) only work if run before the [join](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/join).
> ⚠The unit will not be created if the passed group does not exist (a.k.a [grpNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/grpNull)); this can happen if [createGroup](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createGroup) fails because the **group limit has been reached** (see [createGroup](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createGroup) for respective game limits).

syntaxArray.Syntax: group createUnit [type, position, markers, placement, special]
syntaxArray.Params:
group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - Existing group new unit will join
[type, position, markers, placement, special]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Class name of unit to be created as per [CfgVehicles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgVehicles)
position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position), [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - Location unit is created at. In case of [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) position of the [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) [leader](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/leader) is used
markers: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Placement markers
placement: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Placement radius
special: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Unit placement special, one of:

* "NONE" - The unit will be created at the first available free position nearest to given position

* "FORM" - Not implemented, currently functions the same as "NONE".

* "CAN_COLLIDE" - The unit will be created exactly at passed position

* "CARGO" - The unit will be created in cargo of the group's vehicle, regardless of the passed position (see Example 5). If group has no vehicle or there is no cargo space available, the unit will be placed according to "NONE". To check available cargo space use: 
```sqf
_hasCargo = _veh [emptyPositions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/emptyPositions) "CARGO" > 0;
```

syntaxArray.Syntax: type createUnit [position, group, init, skill, rank]
syntaxArray.Params:
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Class name of unit to be created as per [CfgVehicles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgVehicles)
[position, group, init, skill, rank]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position), [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D), [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - Location unit is created at. In case of [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) position of the [group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/group) [leader](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/leader) is used
group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - Existing group new unit will join
init: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") Unit init statement, similar to unit init field in the editor. The code placed in unit init will run upon unit creation for every client on network, present and future. The code itself receives the reference to the created unit via local variable [this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this_2). Avoid using global commands in unit init statement as it already runs on every client.
skill: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0.5) Unit [skill](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/skill)
rank: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "PRIVATE") Unit [rank](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/rank)
syntaxArray.Return:
> ⚠**[Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing)** - This syntax does NOT return a unit reference! In order to reference this unit, you can use 
> ```sqf
> newUnit = this
> ```
>  in the *init* statement.
> If the target group is not local, the init script will only execute after a slight delay; see [Killzone_Kid](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User:Killzone_Kid)'s note below for more information and issues about this syntax.

progressposition.name: progressPosition
progressposition.description: Returns the current position in the progress bar.

safezoneh.name: safeZoneH
safezoneh.description:
Returns the height of the screen in screen measurement units. Taken from top left corner of the default viewport (0,0) of the screen and going in the same direction as the Y axis, the value will be positive but resulting Y will end up beyond the bottom border. Therefore in order to calculate Y of the bottom screen border, the length of [safeZoneY](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/safeZoneY) must be subtracted from safeZoneH, but because it is negative, it must be added instead. _screenBottomBorderY = safeZoneH + [safeZoneY](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/safeZoneY). The measurement units depend on the current screen resolution [getResolution](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getResolution). See also [SafeZone](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SafeZone)
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:safezone.jpg)

syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Height of the screen in screen measurement units

disableserialization.name: disableSerialization
disableserialization.description:
Disable saving of script containing this command. After this, the script can work with data types which do not support serialization (UI types). See [Namespace serialization](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace#Namespace_serialization) for more information.

> ⚠**In Arma 2** and up to a certain version of Arma 3, giving a [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display) or [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) to [spawned](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) code would raise an error due to the usage of the then non-serializable [_this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this) variable. Using disableSerialization or [uiNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/uiNamespace) wouldn't help; the trick here is to pass the argument inside an array:
> 
> ```sqf
> _display = [findDisplay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findDisplay) 46; _display  [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) _this; };				*// would raise a serialization error*[_display] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) (_this [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 0); };	*// OK*
> ```
>

For the actual name text of the location, use [text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/text) and [setText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setText)

endl.name: endl
endl.description:
Creates a string containing a line break, similar to [lineBreak](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/lineBreak) for [text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/text). The name is inspired by c++ std::endl (**end** **l**ine). The command returns "\r\n", which contains control characters rather than printable characters:  

* [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [count](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/count) "\r\n"; // 4

* [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [count](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/count) endl; // 2
The line break works for [diag_log](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_log) and [ctrlSetText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlSetText). It doesn't work with the [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) because [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) interprets printable "\n" as line break instead. Alternatively one can use [toString](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/toString) command to get other characters.
