leavevehicle.name: leaveVehicle
leavevehicle.description:
Ceases the using of the vehicle by a group and unassigns vehicle from the group. If the argument is a single unit, the vehicle will be unassigned from unit's group. After vehicle is unassigned from the group, each individual crew member then unassigned from the vehicle.
In short the command could be hypothetically presented as:
leaveVehicle = un-[addVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addVehicle) + [unassignVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/unassignVehicle) [forEach](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forEach) [crew](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/crew) 
However, to make it more reliable, it is best to move unit out of the vehicle manually with [moveOut](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveOut) command and force unassign the vehicle with [unassignVehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/unassignVehicle)

syntaxArray.Params:
group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), in which case, object's [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) is used
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

load.name: load
load.description:
Returns current sum of mass from items stored in all unit's containers. Load is calculated by the following formula:

```sqf
_loadPlayer = [loadAbs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/loadAbs) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) / [getNumber](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getNumber) ([configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "CfgInventoryGlobalVariable" >> "maxSoldierLoad");
```

tvcollapseall.name: tvCollapseAll
tvcollapseall.description: Collapses all tree items for the given Tree View.

visiblemap.name: visibleMap
visiblemap.description: Return true if the main map is shown (active).

disableuserinput.name: disableUserInput
disableuserinput.description:
Disables or enables the keyboard and mouse input. Usually used during cutscenes.
> ⚠Be careful and responsible with the usage of this command. Once the user input is disabled, the only option left is to restart the game. Make sure you provide scripted mechanics to resolve this, should you need to disable user input for any reason.

htmlload.name: htmlLoad
htmlload.description:
Load [HTML](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/HTML_File_Format) from file or Uri using given control. File path is relative to current mission dir or an absolute path (with drive letter etc.). The command is subject to restrictions, imposed by [CfgCommands](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgCommands) class.
> ⚠For unknown reasons, URL's length is limited to 255 characters.

syntaxArray.Params:
control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control)
filename: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - local file name or remote file URL

ctrlmodeldirandup.name: ctrlModelDirAndUp
ctrlmodeldirandup.description: Returns [vectorDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorDir) and [vectorUp](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorUp) of the model used in 3D-[Dialogs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma:_GUI_Configuration).

lbsettooltip.name: lbSetTooltip
lbsettooltip.description: Sets tooltip for item with given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to the given data.

getcustomsoundcontrollercount.name: getCustomSoundControllerCount
getcustomsoundcontrollercount.description: Returns current number of custom sound controllers supported by the engine for the given vehicle (currently 32)

syntaxArray.Params: vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - A transport type vehicle. Does not work on characters or buildings

setlightdaylight.name: setLightDayLight
setlightdaylight.description: Sets if light can be used during the day.

getdir.name: getDir
getdir.description:
Returns the object heading in the range 0..360.

> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)An alternative syntax was added that gets heading from one object or position to another object or position, the engine equivalent of [BIS_fnc_dirTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_dirTo).

syntaxArray.Params:
pos1: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) or [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) - from where
pos2: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) or [Position3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position3D) - to where

setdefaultcamera.name: setDefaultCamera
setdefaultcamera.description: Sets the position and direction for the camera used after camera is set on no object (log out view when leaving MP game for example)

syntaxArray.Params:
position: [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) - position of the camera
direction: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [Vector3D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Vector3D) - direction of the camera

examples:
```sqf
setDefaultCamera [[5000,5000,200],[1,1,-1]];
```
Lift camera 100m up above current player position and point downwards:

```sqf
setDefaultCamera [[ATLtoASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ATLtoASL) ([player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [modelToWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/modelToWorld) [0,0,100]),[0,0,-1]];
```

tvsettext.name: tvSetText
tvsettext.description: Sets string text to item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

showncuratorcompass.name: shownCuratorCompass
showncuratorcompass.description: Returns true if compass is shown.

addweapon.name: addWeapon
addweapon.description:
Add a weapon to a unit. For a global version of this command see [addWeaponGlobal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addWeaponGlobal).

Infantry units can only carry a specific number of weapons, once the weapon slots are filled, any further addWeapon commands are ignored.

> ⓘa **magazine** must be added first for the added weapon to be loaded. 
> ⚠In Arma 3 this command can also link items to the inventory slots, the functionality is identical to [linkItem](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/linkItem) command, which it global and thus differ in how it should be used.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit or vehicle to add the weapon to
weapon: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - weapon class name. See the topic [Category:Weapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Weapons) for reference about possible values.

profilename.name: profileName
profilename.description: Returns currently chosen user profile name. For Steam profile name see [profileNameSteam](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/profileNameSteam).

createsimpletask.name: createSimpleTask
createsimpletask.description:
Creates a new [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task) and adds it to the Diary.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Using the **[Arma 3: Task Framework](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Task_Framework)** instead is recommended
> ⓘWhen task is added as a child, it appears as subcategory to the parent task in the Tasks menu and can be parent to another child task. However this is cosmetic appearance as each task has own id and can be referenced directly via diary link.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) -  Unit to add this new task
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
parentTask: [Task](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Task) - (Optional, [taskNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/taskNull)) - The new task will be a sub task of the parent task

tvexpandall.name: tvExpandAll
tvexpandall.description: Expands all tree items for the given Tree View.

preloadtitleobj.name: preloadTitleObj
preloadtitleobj.description: Preloads data for the given resource object.

syntaxArray.Params:
[name, type, speed, showInMap]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - defined in [configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "CfgTitles" >> name
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - "PLAIN" e.g.
speed (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Default: -1
showInMap (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Default: [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)

synchronizedwaypoints.name: synchronizedWaypoints
synchronizedwaypoints.description: Returns the list of waypoints synchronized with a given trigger or waypoint.

setcaptive.name: setCaptive
setcaptive.description:
Mark a unit as captive. If unit is a vehicle, commander is marked. A captive unit:

* is seen as belonging to the [civilian](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/civilian) [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/side) (will not be fired upon)

* will still shoot at its real side's enemies

* will not get its weapons removed (see [removeAllWeapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/removeAllWeapons))

* will not trigger "detected by" conditions for its original [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/side).
> ⓘThe number used as status can be retrieved by [captiveNum](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/captiveNum) to keep track of the captivity status at a finer resolution (e.g. handcuffed, grouped, etc).

syntaxArray.Params:
unitName: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
statusNumber:  [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - zero means non-captive, a non-zero value means [captive](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/captive)

getmarkersize.name: getMarkerSize
getmarkersize.description: Returns the size of the given marker. A getter for [setMarkerSize](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setMarkerSize) and an alias of [markerSize](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/markerSize).

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - in format [a-axis, b-axis], where:

* a-axis: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 1/2 width of marker

* b-axis: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 1/2 height of marker

syntaxArray.Params:
vector1: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)
vector2: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

additemcargoglobal.name: addItemCargoGlobal
additemcargoglobal.description: Creates new items and stores them in the given container. Works with items, weapons and magazines.

animate.name: animate
animate.description:
Activates given object animation. Animation is defined in CfgModels [animations](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Model_Config#Animations) class. Class names listed in CfgVehicles [AnimationSources](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Model_Config#AnimationSources) bound to "Proxy" controller can also be animated with animate command (see [Arma 3: createVehicle/vehicles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_createVehicle/vehicles)).
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)
> 
> * It is recommended that [animateSource](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animateSource) command is used instead of animate whenever is possible, as it is more efficient and optimised for multiplayer
> 
> * Since Arma 3 v1.58 animation names can be obtained with [animationNames](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animationNames)
> ⚠Mixing [animateSource](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animateSource) command with animate command to animate the same part may produce some undefined behaviour.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
animationName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Name of the animation. This is the class-name of the animation defined in the config.
phase: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Range 0 (start point of the animation) to 1 (end point of the animation). The speed, in which the animation is processed, is defined in the addon's config.cpp and cannot be changed during running missions.
speed: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) or [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - When [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) animation is instant. Since Arma 3 v1.66 [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) > 0 is treated as config speed value multiplier

setradiomsg.name: setRadioMsg
setradiomsg.description: Sets radio trigger menu title text (0 -> 0 -> map radio). Use "NULL" to disable radio slot. Use "" to restore default title

syntaxArray.Params:
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - from 1 to 10


* 1 - Alpha (key 1)

* 2 - Bravo (key 2)

* 3 - Charlie (key 3)

* 4 - Delta (key 4)

* 5 - Echo (key 5)

* 6 - Foxtrot (key 6)

* 7 - Golf (key 7)

* 8 - Hotel (key 8)

* 9 - India (key 9)

* 10 - Juliet (key 0)
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

examples:
```sqf
1 setRadioMsg "Click meeeeeeeeee"; //changes title of radio Alpha
```

drop.name: drop
drop.description:
Creates a particle effect.
This command is used to create smoke, fire and similar effects.
The particles are single polygons with single textures that always face the player.
They can be set to dynamically change their position, size, direction, can be set to different weights and to be more or less dependent on the wind.

resistance.name: resistance
examples:
[SQS](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQS_Syntax):
```sqf
?([side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/side) _unit == resistance) : [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "This is a resistance unit!"
```
[SQF](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQF_Syntax):
```sqf
[if](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/if) ([side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/side) _unit == resistance) [then](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/then) 
{
    [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "This is a resistance unit!";
};
```
[SQF](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/SQF_Syntax): 
```sqf
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [format](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/format) ["%1", resistance]; *// Returns "GUER"*
```

librarycredits.name: libraryCredits
librarycredits.description: Returns the credits for the libraries used by the game.

syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [array1, array2, (..), arrayN] all under the form [libraryName, credits]

examples:
```sqf
[hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) **libraryCredits**; *// as of Arma 2 OA 1.62.95208*

/*
```

move3dencamera.name: move3DENCamera
move3dencamera.description: When useOffset is [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), camera will move to the position + defined offset in config and **target** the position. If useOffset is false, the camera will be moved exactly to the provided position without changing the rotation of the camera. Default camera offset: [0,-25,25]

syntaxArray.Params:
position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position)
useOffset: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true if camera should use offset (defined in [configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> "Cfg3DEN" >> "Camera" >> "moveOffset")

compilescript.name: compileScript
compilescript.description: This command is an alias for [compile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/compile)(Final) (prefixHeader + [preprocessFileLineNumbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/preprocessFileLineNumbers) path). See description of [preprocessFileLineNumbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/preprocessFileLineNumbers) for more details.

syntaxArray.Params:
path: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Path to script file
final: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) Compile final, see [compileFinal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/compileFinal)
prefixHeader: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") Value added at the beginning of the file

setunitpos.name: setUnitPos
setunitpos.description:
Set unit position rules. This command will not change the stance of the human player, even though it will change the output of [unitPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/unitPos) command. To change player stance use [playAction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playAction) or [playActionNow](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playActionNow):

```sqf
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [playAction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playAction) "PlayerProne"; // DOWN
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [playAction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playAction) "PlayerStand"; // UP
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [playAction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/playAction) "PlayerCrouch"; // MIDDLE
```

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Can be:

* "DOWN" - Unit goes prone and stays prone.

* "UP" - Unit stands and stays standing.

* "MIDDLE" - Kneel Position. [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Armed_Assault)[1.04](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Introduced_with_Armed_Assault_version_1.04) - Unit will not kneel if it is unarmed

* "AUTO" - Unit chooses mode according to circumstances.

setrandomlip.name: setRandomLip
setrandomlip.description: Enables/Disables random lip. When enabled, the unit continuously moves its lips as if it is talking.

allowcrewinimmobile.name: allowCrewInImmobile
allowcrewinimmobile.description: If true, units can be in a vehicle with broken tracks/wheels.

isformationleader.name: isFormationLeader
isformationleader.description: Returns true if the specified unit is subgroup leader.

mapanimdone.name: mapAnimDone
mapanimdone.description: Check if map animation is finished.

magazinesammofull.name: magazinesAmmoFull
magazinesammofull.description:
Returns array of arrays of all vehicle's magazines with extended information about them.
> ⚠This command does not return empty magazines from containers, only from the weapon. Use [magazinesAmmoCargo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/magazinesAmmoCargo) instead.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Arrays](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format:

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String): magazine class name

* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number): magazine ammo count

* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean): is magazine loaded

* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number): magazine type:

* -1 = n/a (default if magazine is not loaded)

* 0 - grenade

* 1 - primary weapon mag

* 2 - handgun mag

* 4 - secondary weapon mag

* 4096 - binocular weapon mag

* 65536 - vehicle mag

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String): magazine location: "Vest", "Uniform", "Backpack", "" or [currentMuzzle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/currentMuzzle) if the magazine is loaded

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit or vehicle
includeEmpty: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to include empty magazines

lnbdata.name: lnbData
lnbdata.description: Returns the additional text (invisible) in an item with the given position of the 2D listbox.

locationnull.name: locationNull
locationnull.description:
A non-existing [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location). To compare non-existent locations use [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) or [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo):

* locationNull == locationNull; // false

* [isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) locationNull; // true

* locationNull [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo) locationNull; // true
examples:
```sqf
![isNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull) locationNull; // false
```

```sqf
[str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) locationNull; // No location
```

```sqf
[position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/position) locationNull; // [0,0,0]
```

movetocompleted.name: moveToCompleted
movetocompleted.description: Check if latest low level moveTo command is finished.

taskresult.name: taskResult
taskresult.description: Send a result of the task to the task sender.

lnbsettext.name: lnbSetText
lnbsettext.description: Sets the text in the item with the given position of the 2D listbox.

getmodelinfo.name: getModelInfo
getmodelinfo.description: Returns object's model info. Model path is suitable for use with [createSimpleObject](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/createSimpleObject) command.

call.name: call
call.description: Adds given set of compiled instructions to the current stack and waits for it to finish and return, provides an option to pass arguments to the executed [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code). See [Scheduler](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler) to learn more about how the code is excuted and behaves.

syntaxArray.Params: code: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - [Compiled](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/compile) instructions. In Operation Flashpoint this command also accepts datatype [string](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
syntaxArray.Return: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - The last value given in the function is returned. See the topic [Function](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Function#Return_Values) for more information.

syntaxArray.Params:
args: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) -  Arguments that are passed to the function in the [_this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this) variable
code: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - [Compiled](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/compile) instructions. In Operation Flashpoint this command also accepts datatype [string](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
syntaxArray.Return: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - The last value given in the function is returned. See the topic [Function](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Function#Return_Values) for more information.

setcamuseti.name: setCamUseTI
setcamuseti.description: Sets thermal vision mode for currently used camera. This command only works with [camCreate](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCreate) created camera that is currently the main camera for the player (see Example 2).

syntaxArray.Params:
state: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [True](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to enable, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to disable the effect
modeIndex: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - TI mode. Can be:

* 0 - White Hot

* 1 - Black Hot

* 2 - Light Green Hot / Darker Green cold

* 3 - Black Hot / Darker Green cold

* 4 - Light Red Hot /Darker Red Cold

* 5 - Black Hot / Darker Red Cold

* 6 - White Hot . Darker Red Cold

* 7 - Thermal (Shade of Red and Green, Bodies are white)

getpilotcameratarget.name: getPilotCameraTarget
getpilotcameratarget.description: Returns the target of the object airplane or helicopter [pilotCamera](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/A3_Targeting_config_reference#class_pilotCamera) tracking.

syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [isTracking, targetPosition, targetObject]; returns [false,[0,0,0],<NULL-object>] if camera is not in a tracking mode or if object has no [pilotCamera](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/A3_Targeting_config_reference#class_pilotCamera). 

* isTracking: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - returns whether the camera is in a tracking mode

* targetPosition: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL), returns the position of the tracked area or object

* targetObject: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - returns the tracked object, [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) if camera is only tracking an area

triggerammo.name: triggerAmmo
triggerammo.description: Triggers a munition such as shells, bullets, missiles, rockets and bombs (*shotSubmunition/shotShell/shotBullet/shotMissile/shotRocket*) as if it did hit. If ammo uses submunition, then creation of submunition will be triggered.

reportremotetarget.name: reportRemoteTarget
reportremotetarget.description: Shares the target vehicle via datalink to the [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) center for a given time.

setwaypointposition.name: setWaypointPosition
setwaypointposition.description:
Attempts to move given waypoint to a random position inside a circle with the given center and radius. 
> ⓘIf you are looking for the command to set precise WP position, see [setWPPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setWPPos)
The waypoint will be placed similar to "NONE" attribute in [setVehiclePosition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVehiclePosition), even if the radius is 0, which means it could still be off center. In order to force waypoint to the exact position, similar to "CAN_COLLIDE" attribute, use negative radius, like -1 for example. You will probably laugh at this, but be warned:

> ⚠When using negative radius, the center position supplied must be [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL), only then the resulting [waypointPosition](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/waypointPosition) will be in format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) and not buried under the ground ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

syntaxArray.Params:
waypoint: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [Waypoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Waypoint)
[center, radius]: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
center: [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) (or [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) if the radius is negative)
radius: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - random placement radius in meters. Set it to -1 and convert center to [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL) for the exact center placement.

setvectordir.name: setVectorDir
setvectordir.description: Set object's direction vector. Up vector will remain unchanged.

sideenemy.name: sideEnemy
sideenemy.description:
The enemy [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) which is used for renegades. Units of this side are hostile to everyone.

* To join sideEnemy, you can attack members of your own side or use [addRating](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/addRating).

* When below a [rating](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/rating) of -2000 units switch automatically to this side.

displayremovealleventhandlers.name: displayRemoveAllEventHandlers
displayremovealleventhandlers.description: Remove all event handlers from the given display.

enableuavwaypoints.name: enableUAVWaypoints
enableuavwaypoints.description: Enables/disables the option for player to set waypoints for UAV in AV terminal.

ctfindheaderrows.name: ctFindHeaderRows
ctfindheaderrows.description: Takes index of a header as a parameter. Returns array of indices of rows under this header.

waypointtype.name: waypointType
waypointtype.description:
Gets the waypoint type.

Type can be:

* "MOVE"

* "DESTROY"

* "GETIN"

* "SAD"

* "JOIN"

* "LEADER"

* "GETOUT"

* "CYCLE"

* "LOAD"

* "UNLOAD"

* "TR UNLOAD"

* "HOLD"

* "SENTRY"

* "GUARD"

* "TALK"

* "SCRIPTED"

* "SUPPORT"

* "GETIN NEAREST"

* "DISMISS"

* "AND"

* "OR"

More details at [Waypoints](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Waypoints).

ctrltextcolor.name: ctrlTextColor
ctrltextcolor.description: Returns control's text color in [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color) format (see [ctrlSetTextColor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ctrlSetTextColor)).

waypoints.name: waypoints
waypoints.description: Returns an array of waypoints for the specified unit/group.

campreparefocus.name: camPrepareFocus
campreparefocus.description:
focusRange is in format [distance,blur]. Prepares the camera focus blur.

**[-1,1]** will reset default values (auto focusing), **[-1,-1]** will disable postprocessing (all is focused). Needs the call of [camCommitPrepared](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/camCommitPrepared) to be conducted.

enablecopilot.name: enableCopilot
enablecopilot.description: Enables copilot actions, toggles availability of the actions related to copilots, such as taking over controls, suspending controls, etc. This command triggers the "ControlsShifted" event handler.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle on which to toggle copilot actions
enable: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - enable or disable

wfsidetext.name: WFSideText
wfsidetext.description:
Returns the un[localized](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/localize) text value of an object's side / a group's side or a side as:


* [east](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/east), [opfor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/opfor) - "East"

* [west](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/west), [blufor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/blufor) - "West"

* [resistance](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/resistance), [independent](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/independent) - "Resistance"

* [civilian](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/civilian) - "Civilian"

* [sideUnknown](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideUnknown) - "Unknown"

* [sideEnemy](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideEnemy) - "Unknown"

* [sideFriendly](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideFriendly) - "Unknown"

* [sideLogic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideLogic) - "Unknown"

* [sideEmpty](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideEmpty) - "Unknown"

* [sideAmbientLife](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideAmbientLife) - "Unknown"

> ⓘ*WF* stands for **W**ar**f**are.

taskdescription.name: taskDescription
taskdescription.description: Returns the sub-parts of the task description. The returned Array is in format [Task description, Task title, Task waypoint description].

curatorpoints.name: curatorPoints
curatorpoints.description: Returns number of points that curator have. Points can be only in range from 0 to 1.

selectionnames.name: selectionNames
selectionnames.description: Returns the list of model selections

syntaxArray.Syntax: ropeCreate [fromObject, fromPoint, toObject, toPoint, segments, length]
syntaxArray.Params:
fromObject: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object where rope starts and which fly behavior will be affected
fromPoint: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - specifies where on the object the rope should start, either a string (name of memory point) or an array of three numbers (vector in model coordinates).
toObject: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object which is automatically attached to other side of rope (can be objNull, rope will stay with free end)
toPoint: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - specifies where on the object the rope should finish, either a string (name of memory point) or an array of three numbers (vector in model coordinates)
segments: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - define number of segments to be created
length (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - optional, rope length in meters

fromObject: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object where rope starts and which fly behavior will be affected
fromPoint: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - specifies where on the object the rope should start, either a string (name of memory point) or an array of three numbers (vector in model coordinates)
length (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - rope length
segments (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - define number of rope segments
unroll (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true if rope starts at one place and falls down unrolling itself, false to create it already in full length (default: false)

ammo.name: ammo
ammo.description: Check how many rounds are left in the currently loaded magazine in the given muzzle. Since Arma v1.56 the command also returns ammo for units in vehicles.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
muzzle: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - muzzle of a weapon. See the topic [Category:Weapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Weapons) for reference about possible values.

examples:
```sqf
_count = [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) ammo "M16"; //returns 30 in case of a full magazine
```

```sqf
_count = [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) ammo "M203Muzzle";
```

```sqf
_count = [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) ammo [primaryWeapon](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/primaryWeapon) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player);
```

openmap.name: openMap
openmap.description:
Opens or closes in-game map.
> ⚠If forced param is set to [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), when map is opened it cannot be closed manually and the user can get stuck requiring the game restart. Make sure you provide scripted mechanics to resolve this, should you need to force the map.

syntaxArray.Params: show: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - if [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) opens map, if [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) closes map, provided it is not *forced*

show: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - if [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) opens map, if [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) closes map, provided it is not *forced*.
forced: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - if [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) keeps map from closing when map is open.

findif.name: findIf
findif.description:
Searches for an element within array for which the code evaluates to true.
Returns the zero-based index on success or -1 if not found.
Code on the right side of the command is evaluated for each element of the array, processed element can be referenced in code as [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x).

> ⓘfindIf terminates as soon as it finds an element that fulfills the condition, thus it is more efficient than [count](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/count) in scenarios where you need to check for presence / absence of at least one element that evaluates to true.

syntaxArray.Params:
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array to search in
code: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - code defining an element to find, processed element can be referenced within the code as [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x)
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Zero-based position of the first array element for which the code evaluate to true, -1 if not found

examples:
```sqf
[unit1, unit2, unit3] findIf {[not](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/not) [alive](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/alive) [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x)}; *// return index of the first dead unit)*
```

```sqf
*// two ways how to 'wait for all units to be dead':*
[waitUntil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/waitUntil) { [unit1, unit2, unit3] findIf {[alive](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/alive) [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x)} == -1 }; *// fast, terminates as soon as it finds a living unit*
[waitUntil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/waitUntil) { {[alive](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/alive) [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x)} [count](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/count) [unit1, unit2, unit3] == 0 }; *// slow, always goes through all array elements*
```
